EEV415 System Reference (Pandoc Multiple File Conversion)

{width="8.692361111111111in” height="11.375in”}

EE Documentation Library

EE Documentation Library

The EE Documentation Library lists all available manuals that serve as references on the use of the EE system. The documents are categorized into three groups: Core System Manuals, EE Utility References, and Installation Guides.

Core System Manuals

The EE Core System manuals provide information on the setup and configuration of various EE parameters, as well as the implementation of supplementary functionalities supported by the system.

Archiving and Recovery

This manual is a reference to the Archive and Recovery functionality of the EE system. Discussions include the required parameter settings for configuring the relevant functions, as well as examples of how this functionality is used in transaction processes. The archiving functions discussed in this manual are Archive Data, Inquire Archived Data, Restore Archived Data, Delete Archived Data, and End of Month functions.

BIRT Report Engine

This manual discusses the requirements and processes involved in applying the built-in BIRT report engine of EE to build transaction functions that generate BIRT reports and documents. Other functionalities, such as configuring a report batch function and defining rules to attach documents to an outgoing e-mail, are covered as well.

Building a Module

This manual is designed to help new users of EE plan, organize, control, and successfully carry out the implementation of the system. It provides a general description of the different features of EE that enable every bank to build and design business modules according to its processing requirements. This manual discusses how a custom business module in EE can be built and adapted. It includes step-by-step procedures on how to build a module as well as an overview of runtime transaction processing.

Charges and Commissions Reference

This document provides extensive discussions on the setup and usage of the Charges and Commissions component of EE. Instructions include setting up parameters, defining the relevant standing data, and using charge-specific calculation methods.

Data Objects

This manual describes in detail the steps and procedures required in building and utilizing a data object, which is a logical object that has its own attributes and calculation rules. Instructions on customizing the DO screen interface, navigating the data object screen, and using data objects in transaction processes are also provided.

eLOAN Transaction Module

This document provides extensive discussions on EE’s eLOAN sub-system. Topics include eLOAN functions from the eLOAN Transaction Module and the EE Standing Data Module.

FAQs

This document addresses commonly asked questions about the EE system. This includes answers to issues related to browser-side processing, EE Utility, EE database, Security Manager, and other issues that may arise while operating and configuring settings within the EE environment. Some system features and capabilities are discussed as well.

GAPI Integration

This manual is a comprehensive reference guide on setting up the required parameters for sending and receiving GAPI messages. It includes instructions on the configuration of related functionalities and auxiliary operations, as well as discussions on actual transaction processing.

Limit Management Module

This document provides extensive discussions on the Limits sub-system of EE. The manual is divided into two parts:

  • The first part discusses all the browser functions of the Limit Management module.

  • The second part discusses the required parameter settings to integrate Limits settings and data with a business module.

Limit Transaction Module

This document provides extensive discussions on running and using the functions of the Limit Transaction module.

Log Settings

This manual provides instructions on defining EE log settings and configuring parameters to set up log functions. Generating logs on different modes and checking the different log directories are discussed as well.

Multi-Entity Reference

This manual is a guide to the multi-entity structure of the EE system. This includes a discussion on the composition of the system in relation to this structure. EE also supports the use of a single and default domain; a supplementary section is provided for this.

Multi-Language Reference

This manual provides instructions on defining language records and configuring the multi-language settings in the EE Utility and EE browser. With this multi-language functionality, users are able to access the EE system in their preferred language.

Payment Component Reference

This document provides extensive discussions on the setup and usage of the different Payment component types: Payment Terms, Payment Schedule, Payment Instruction Dealer, and Payment Dealer. Topics include parameter settings and Payment-specific calculation methods.

Security Manager

This manual is a comprehensive guide to security management in the EE system. As such, it includes instructions on the setup of user profiles, user functions, business units, business unit functions, user and business unit assignments, and other security-related operations.

Service Level Agreement Reference

This document is a reference to the Service Level Agreement (SLA) functionality of EE the system, which pertains to a group of settings that control the flow of transaction steps and processes. It is divided into two major sections: Basic Data, for the functions used in the creation and maintenance of SLA standing data; and System Operations, for the functions used in SLA enquiry, business task initialization, and end time adjustments. A sample SLA process is also provided.

Standing Data Module

This document discusses the functions for the standing data of the EE system. Among these are rate descriptions, exchange rates, interest rates, account numbers, currencies, weekend data, holiday data, clauses, reference number rules, authorization standing data, and time zone data. Descriptions, input details, and processing steps are included in the function discussions.

Supplementary Functions

This manual is a reference in configuring the parameter settings to define special or supplementary EE functionalities such as the Compliance Check and invoice uploading features.

SWIFT Configuration

This document provides extensive discussions on the primary components required in defining SWIFT messages: the SWIFT template and the SWIFT message rule. The complete parameter settings and external configurations required for enabling EE to exchange messages with the SWIFT network are detailed in comprehensive procedures. This manual is supplemented with sections on SWIFT-related system parameters and miscellaneous functions.

System Administration Functions

This manual is a reference for Super Administrator users of the EE Utility in the configuration and maintenance of the EE environment. Sections of this reference include instructions on the use of specific User Manage and Parameter Manage functions.

System Maintenance Module

This document discusses the functions provided in the System Maintenance module of the EE system. This includes sections on the maintenance processes for daily operations, authorization rule settings, EDI messages, SWIFT messages, XML messages, log files, and documents.

System Reference

This manual is a reference for the following elements provided in the EE Utility for parameterization: security parameters, system parameters, components, server side system methods, calculation methods, and XML Generator items.

Version Control

This manual discusses the settings in maintaining the different versions of parameters.

EE Utility References

The EE Utility set of reference manuals is a guide on the use of the EE Utility Workbench, or simply EE Utility. These references discuss every function or feature of the EE Utility and provide instructions on how to operate or use the function in relation to operating and maintaining the EE system and processing a business transaction.

A manual is provided for each major function group of the EE Utility: User Manage, Parameter Manage, System Function, Transaction Function, and Maintenance.

{width="0.3298611111111111in” height="0.3298611111111111in”}NOTE: The TSU Parameter Manage function group is comprised of functions used for configuring, managing and maintaining parameters for the TSU (or Open Account) module. For information on the TSU module, refer to the EE Baseline TSU documentation.

EE Utility Reference: User Manager Functions

This manual is a comprehensive guide for the Administrator and Operator user on the use and configuration of the functions belonging to the User Manage function group of the EE Utility. This includes functions for user profiles and audit logs.

EE Utility Reference: Parameter Manager Functions

This manual is a reference on the use and configuration of the functions that belong to the Parameter Manage function group of the EE Utility and that are accessible to Administrator and Operator users. These are system-wide functions used for creating and maintaining system parameters, components, and calculation rules, among others.

EE Utility Reference: System Functions

This manual includes information on the configuration of the functions belonging to the System Function group of the EE Utility. The functions in this group are used to maintain settings that facilitate system-wide tasks and operations; among these are function groups, output devices, protocol managers, and STP settings.

EE Utility Reference: Transaction Functions

This manual provides discussions on the configuration of the functions belonging to the Transaction Function group of the EE Utility. These functions are used for defining and setting up the actual business parameters of transaction functions.

EE Utility Reference: Maintenance Functions

This manual is a comprehensive guide on the use and configuration of the functions belonging to the Maintenance function group of the EE Utility. These functions are used for maintaining the tables, fields, and files that are used in the EE Utility.

Installation Guide

An EE installation guide is a reference on the installation and setup processes of the EE system on a specific application server and database.

Installation Guide WAS 9.0 - Oracle 12c

This is a reference for installing the EE system on WebSphere Application Server Version 9.0.5.5, with an Oracle 12c database. This includes detailed instructions on configuring the components that are required to successfully run EE.

Introduction

  • manual overview

Manual Overview

[Purpose]{.underline}

This manual is a reference for the following elements provided in the Eximbills Enterprise (EE) system for parameterization:

  • Security parameters

  • System parameters

  • Components

  • Server side system methods

  • Calculation methods

  • XML Generator items

[Audience]{.underline}

This document serves as a guide specifically for, but not limited to, the following users:

  • Users responsible for configuring system parameters, calculation rules, and server-side system methods

  • Consultants assigned with modifying function parameters that make use of the aforementioned elements

[Prerequisites]{.underline}

Sufficient knowledge of the system, as also presented and detailed in the following manuals, is recommended:

  • EE Core Manuals

  • EE Utility References

  • EE Installation Guides

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: Some features discussed in this manual have been tested and documented based on an older system version. Unless otherwise specified, the overall functionality is the same when recreated in the current version.

Security Parameters

Security Parameters

Security Parameters are global system parameters which settings are applied throughout the EE system. These parameters are defined through the Security Parameters function.

Although the parameters listed in the Security Parameters window are not normally modified or changed, the options for creating, modifying or deleting these are provided.

Figure 2. Security Parameters

{width="0.41597222222222224in” height="0.41597222222222224in”}WARNING!

Any change to any of the security parameters affects the performance of EE.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE:

i. The following security parameters are currently not used:

OS_ENVIONMENT

SWITCH_TO_MULTI_ENTITY_VIEW

USER_LICENSE

SWIFT_VERSION

ii. The following security parameters are currently used for special projects only:

BANK_MODE

BBVA-FLAG

BII-FLAG

CHANGE_INCOMING_OUTGOING_SWIFT_PROCESS

PRINT_MODE

SET_AC_NUMBER_TABLE_NAME

ACCESSLOG_FILE_BY

On the condition that the ACCESSLOG_WRITE_MODE security parameter is set to FILE, this parameter is used to control how the Access Log is defined. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • SESSION, in which the Access Log is defined by user session

  • USER, in which the Access Log is defined by user

  • SYSTEM, in which the Access Log is defined by system

The default value is SYSTEM.

ACCESSLOG_WRITE_MODE

This is used to define the mode of recording the Access Log. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • FILE, in which the Access Log is written into a file

  • DB, in which the Access Log is written into the TRX_SYS_ACESS_LOG table in the database

The default value is FILE.

ACTLOG_FILE_BY

On the condition that the Access Log Appender is defined in the EE_Log_Config.xml, which indicates that the generation of access log is set to File mode, this parameter is used to control how the Access Log is defined. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • SESSION, in which the Component Log is defined by user session

  • USER, in which the Component Log is defined by user

  • SYSTEM, in which the Component Log is defined by system

The default value is SYSTEM.

ALLOW_SIGN_MULTIPLE_WINDOW

This is used to control whether a user is allowed to log on the EE system using the same username more than once, provided that succeeding logons are made using the same machine or IP address. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which multiple logons, using one user account, on the same

    PC is allowed.

  • FALSE, in which multiple logons is not allowed.

If the value of this system parameter is NULL, multiple logons is restricted.

ALWAYS_GEN_DOCUMENT

This security parameter allows the system to check if there are any existing files on the designated path of the output document. This also controls whether the system is to overwrite the file or cancel the generation of the file. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system retrieves the data based on the defined document settings and generates the file accordingly.

  • FALSE or null, in which the system does not generate the file if it already exists in the output directory. If the file already exists, the system does not regenerate the file; instead, it uses the existing file as the final output document. Otherwise, the system retrieves the data based on the defined document settings and generates the file accordingly.

ARCHIVE_THREAD_NUMBER

If the Archiving log feature is enabled, this parameter is used to define the number of archiving threads to be processed before archiving logs are generated. A numeric value may be specified for this parameter.

The default value is 10.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: Refer to the EE Archiving and Recovery document for more details on the Archiving log.

ARCHIVE_THREAD_PROCESS_NUMBER

If the Archiving log feature is enabled, and a value is defined in the ARCHIVE_THREAD_NUMBER security parameter, this security parameter is used to define the number of archiving log records to be generated after each archiving thread is processed.

The default value is 10.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: Refer to the EE Archiving and Recovery document for more details on the Archiving log.

BARCODE_PATH

This is used to define the path where documents with barcodes are to be generated. If this parameter is not defined or its value is null, the documents are generated in the following path: \TRXDATA\QRcode

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: The following illegal characters, which are restricted in Windows and Linux operating systems for directory names, are also not allowed to be used in the report file directory: / \ : * ? " <> | [] + & #

BATCHCLUSTER_MODE

This is used to control whether or not the system executes tasks on a Cluster environment. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which tasks are executed on a Cluster environment

  • FALSE, in which the system functions as before. This is the default value.

BATCHCLUSTER_RMI_MODE

The BATCHCLUSTER_RMI_MODE security parameter is used to specify if the Batch Manager function of the EE Utility supports a cluster environment. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • FALSE, in which the Batch Manager function supports a non-cluster environment. This is the default value.

  • TRUE, in which the Batch Manager function supports a cluster environment.

BATCH_MAX_THREADNUM

This indicates the maximum number of records in a thread when running a user batch process. By setting a value in this parameter, the system, when running a user batch, the system locks and processes all transactions in a batch (the number of which depends on the value of this parameter) at one instead of processing the records one by one.

The default value is 10. The maximum total number of records to be processed in one run of a user batch process is 200.

BATCH_SUBMITNUM_PERTIME

This parameter is used for semi-automatic batch processing, which supports multi-thread functionality and improves the processing speed. This is used to define the number of transaction records to be submitted per time. For example, 10.

BATCH_ THREADNUM_PERUSER

This parameter is used for semi-automatic batch processing, which supports multi-thread functionality and improves the processing speed. This parameter is used to define the thread number per user. For example, 4.

BATCH_UPDATE_NULL

This is to control whether or not to change the value of fields with null values from null to empty string in the corresponding master table once batch tasks are run. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • FALSE, in which the value of fields with null values are changed from null to empty string in the corresponding master table once batch tasks are run. This process is also applied if this parameter is not set or if its value is blank.

  • TRUE, in which the value of fields with null values are not changed in the corresponding master table once batch tasks are run. Null values remain null, and empty string values remain as empty string.

The default value is FALSE.

BIRT_ENGINE

This security parameter is used for defining the BIRT URL, which determines the connection to the BIRT server.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

http://localhost:9080/birt/report/portal

Localhost pertains to the server name or IP, and 9080 the port number.

BIRT_ENGINE_TOKEN

This security parameter is used to enable the validation of BIRT reports. The value assigned to this parameter is sent on every request that is sent from the EE system, which is then validated by the BIRT application. This prevents users, which do not have rights, to access the report or the report function. Any value may be assigned to this parameter.

Refer to the EE BIRT Report Engine manual for more details regarding reports validation.

BIRT_ONLINE_REPORT_CUSTOMIZE

This is used to define whether the report is generated is viewed using the template defined in EE or the BIRT engine template. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • Y, in which the system’s JSP file is used to view the report

  • N, in which the BIRT engine template is used for viewing the report

If the value is null, the BIRT engine template is used.

BIRT_ONLINE_REPORT_ENGINE

This is used to define the relevant BIRT URL when generating documents and online reports on different BIRT applications.

Refer to the EE BIRT Report Engine documentation for more details on this parameter.

BLIND_STEAL_PASSWORDS

This security parameter is used to control whether the password is to be encrypted using the MD5 encryption algorithm when sent to the server during login. The available options for this parameter are:

  • TRUE, in which the password is encrypted using MD5 algorithm before

    the data is sent to the client. When this value is selected, the user may input the password manually or use the soft keyboard displayed on the screen.

  • FALSE, in which the password is not encrypted and the normal process

    logic for logging on to the system is applied.

The default value is FALSE.

CACHE_CLUSTER_COMM_MECHANISM

This is used to define the cache cluster mechanism. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • RMI, in which the point to point mechanism is used to inform the

    servers in a cluster environment to sync the cache

  • MULTICAST, in which multicast communication is used for

    communicating the cache synchronization to other servers.

If the value is null, multicast communication is used.

CCY_ORDER_PRIORITY

This security parameter is used to control the order – ascending or descending – by which the currencies are displayed on the browser. The order is defined in the Order Priority setting in the Currency Maintenance function of the Standing module. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • ASC, in which the currencies are displayed in ascending order

  • DES, in which the currencies are displayed in descending order

If several currencies have the same Order Priority setting, the system further sorts the currencies in alphabetical (A-Z) order, and displays these according to the value of the CCY_ORDER_PRIORITY.

If this parameter is not defined, the currencies are displayed in descending order.

CHANGE_BUTTON_IMAGES

This is used to control the button images to be used for the toolbar buttons in the transaction page. The filename of the button to be used may be specified as the value of this parameter. If the value is null, the system uses the default button images.

The default value is null.

CHECK_FUNCTION_PROCESS_FLOW

This security parameter is used to define the authorization rights of users in the specified process flow of transactions. This security parameter may have one of the two values: True or False.

  • TRUE, which indicates that the function is supported,

  • FALSE, which means a function is not supported. If a user attempts

    to perform an operation which he is not authorized, the system prompts an error.

COMMUNICATION_TYPE

This is used to define the connection type of the Web and Application servers. This can be blank or may have one of the following values:

  • MQ

  • HTTP

  • RMI

For EE Version 3.1.0 or higher, this must be set to HTTP.

COMM_LOCAL_REMOTE_TYPE

This is used to indicate whether the Web server and AP server are deployed on one server or machine. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • COMM_LOCAL_EJB_CALL, which indicates that the Web server and AP

    server are deployed on one machine and the local EJB communicator must be used.

  • COMM_REMOTE_EJB_CALL, which indicates that the Web server and AP

    server are deployed on separate machines and the remote EJB communicator must be utilized.

COMPLIANCE_CHECK

This is used to indicate whether or not the system performs a compliance check. This can have one of the following values:

  • Y, in which the system sends a request to a third party service for a compliance check; or

  • N, in which the system does not send a request to a third party service for a compliance check.

COMPLIANCE_ALWAYS_SEND_REQUEST

This is used to indicate whether or not the system sends a request for compliance check regardless if a check has been performed before for the same data. This can have one of the following values:

  • Y, in which the system always sends a new request for compliance check regardless if the same data has been checked before.

  • N or blank, in which the system does not send a request for compliance check on data that have been checked before. Results of previous compliance check are simply retrieved.

This parameter is used only when the COMPLIANCE_CHECK parameter is set to Y.

COMPONENTLOG_FILE_BY

On the condition that the COMPONENTLOG_WRITE_MODE security parameter is set to FILE, this parameter is used to control how the Component Log is defined. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • SESSION, in which the Component Log is defined by user session

  • USER, in which the Component Log is defined by user

  • SYSTEM, in which the Component Log is defined by system

The default value is SYSTEM.

COMPONENTLOG_WRITE_MODE

This is used to define the mode of recording the Component Log. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • FILE, in which the Component Log is written into a file

  • DB, in which the Component Log is written into the TRX_SYS_COMP_LOG table in the database

  • FALSE, in which no Component Log is written on either file or table

The default value is FILE.

CONTEXTFACTORY

This is used to define the context provider (i.e., a java class name containing the package path).

If the value is null, the system uses the default provider: com.ibm.websphere.naming.WsnInitialContextFactory

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

The context provider for Weblogic is weblogic.jndi.T3InitialContextFactory.

CONVERT_OUTWARD_TO_INWARD

This is used to control whether or not the system automatically converts internal outgoing messages to incoming messages. After a message is converted, the new format adopts the inward SWIFT rule wherein the values of tags B1 and B2 are changed. This security system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system automatically converts internal outgoing SWIFT messages to incoming SWIFT.

  • FALSE, in which internal outgoing messages are not converted.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE:

i. The outgoing SWIFT messages may be sent to a predefined folder, the MQ server, or FTP depending on the settings of the following: the SWIFT_TO_FOLDER and SWIFT_SEND_MODE system parameters and the SWIFT Send setting of the outgoing SWIFT queue in EE Utility (e.g., Queue, Folder, or FTP).

ii. For transactions involving an MT 103 message, the messages are combined when the COMBINE_SWIFT_MESSAGE system parameter is set to TRUE. The system does not override this parameter to convert the message into the standard incoming message format.

CRYSTAL_ENGINE

This is used to indicate whether the system uses the Crystal Developer or the Crystal Server. This may have one of the following values:

  • T, in which the Crystal Developer is used.

  • F, in which the Crystal Server is used.

CRYSTAL_JRC

This is used to specify the URL of the crystal engine. (e.g., http://IP:PORT/CRReportWeb/report/portal)

DEBUG_MODE

This parameter is used to control the preparation of the SQL statements in SQL logs. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the SQL statement in the SQL log is complete and contains the standard SQL statement.

  • FALSE, in which the SQL statements in SQL logs are incomplete (i.e., indicated by the character “?") and their values are transmitted as parameters.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DELETE FROM EXIMSYS.STD_TRX_REFUSING WHERE C_UNIT_CODE=? AND C_REF_NAME=? AND C_REF_NO=?;

Parameters: ['001001001', 'IMCO', 'IMCO001005']

The default value is FALSE.

DISABLE_PRINTBUTTON_INQUIRE

This is used to control whether or not the Print button is enabled when a user inquires on a document. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • Y, in which the Print button is disabled when the generated document in PDF format is inquired on

  • N, in which the Print button is made available to enable the user to print the document

The default value is N.

DMS_INQ_DATA_CLASS

This is used to define the class to be used for processing the DMS function. The java class, which contains the package path must be defined as the value of this parameter.

DO_NEW_LOAD_TYPE

This security system parameter is used to load a data object attached to a transaction page. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE,in which the system does DO JS loading through tag.

  • FALSE, in which the system does DO JS loading through page.

The default value is FALSE.

DST_CONTROL_BY_JDK

This system parameter is used to control whether the time zone DST details are automatically defined by JDK or defined by the user through the Time Zone Maintenance function. This may have one of the following options:

  • TRUE, in which the time zone DST details are defined by JDK. If this value is selected, the DST Changed flag in the Add Time Zone function is disabled and no DST setting may be defined by the user. If a time zone setting has been added before setting this parameter, the DST settings defined in the Add Time Zone function are disregarded.

  • FALSE, in which the time zone DST details are defined by the user through the Time Zone Maintenance function in the browser. If this value is selected, the DST Changed flag is enabled.

EELOG_FILE_BY

On the condition that the ERRORLOG_WRITE_MODE security parameter is set to FILE, this parameter is used to control how the Error Log is defined. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • SESSION, in which the Error Log is defined by user session

  • USER, in which the Error Log is defined by user

  • SYSTEM, in which the Error Log is defined by system

The default value is SYSTEM.

EE_BATCH_CACHE_CLUSTERED

This is parameter is used to indicate whether the system runs a cluster or a non-cluster environment. This further determines which Batch Cache Configuration XML file to use. This is only utilizied in a cluster environment wherein one of the following values may be selected:

  • TRUE, in which the system belongs to a Cluster Environment and uses the EE_Batch_Cache_Config.xml file for processing

  • FALSE, in which the system belongs to a non-cluster environment and uses the EEConfig\EE_Batch_Cache_Config_NonCluster.xml for processing

EE_ENABLE_SWIFT_LOG

This security parameter is used to define whether or not a SWIFT Log is to be generated by the system. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which case the system generates SWIFT logs

  • FALSE, in which case the generation of SWIFT logs is disabled

The default value is FALSE.

EE_ERROR_LOG_TO_DB

This security parameter is used to control whether EE Logs are to be generated on File and DB mode or File mode only – i.e., recorded in the database and into a file, or logs are only written into a file. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the EE logs are recorded both on File and DB mode (i.e., written into a File and also written in the corresponding database table)

  • FALSE, in which the EE logs are only written on File mode.

If the value is null, the logs are recorded on File and DB mode.

EE_LOG_DEBUG

This is used to control whether or not debug logs are to be generated. This may have one of the following values:

  • true, in which the system generates debug logs.

  • false, in which debug logs are not generated.

If the value is null, the system generates debug logs.

EE_SOD_ALLOW_BEFORE_DATE

This security parameter is used to control whether the system checks if Start of Day has been ran after every 24-hour interval. This may have one of the following values:

  • true, in which the system checks for the last execution of SOD and requires that SOD be run every after 24 hours.

  • false, in which the system does not check for the last date of executing SOD.

The default value is true.

EE_SOD_EVERYDAY_REQUIRED

This parameter is used to define whether the user must execute Start of Day everyday. This may have the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the user is required to run SOD everyday

  • FALSE, in which running SOD is not required on a daily basis.

The default value is TRUE.

ENABLE_CHANGES_TRACK

This parameter is used to control whether the system tracks the changes made by a user in the Fix Pending function. This may have one of the following options:

  • Y, in which the system tracks the changes made on a transaction. If this value is selected, the system marks or highlights the fields, which values have been changed, when the Release or Authorize function is run.

  • N, in which no tracking of changes is done by the system.

If the value is null, the system does not track the changes made.

ENABLE_MQ_CONNECTION

When a connection to the MQ server is established and this connection is later on terminated, the EE system has the capability to store the connection settings that may again be retrieved when reconnecting to MQ. Successful connections to the MQ server are held until the EE server is stopped. This parameter is used to specify whether or not to enable automatic reconnection to the MQ server when the server is started. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system initializes MQ connection pooling based on the parameters configured in the EE application server,

  • FALSE, in which MQ connection pooling is not initialized after the server is restarted.

The default value is FALSE. If no value is defined for this security system parameter, MQ pooling is not initialized.

ERRORLOG_WRITE_MODE

This is used to define the mode of recording the Error Log. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • FILE, in which the Error Log is written into a file

  • DB, in which the Error Log is written into the TRX_SYS_ERR_LOG table in the database

The default value is null.

ESB_APPEND_CONTENT_BEFORE_KP

This is used to control which voucher and SWIFT content are applied to the transaction record when it is processed through AP and KP functions. This can be set to one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which case the voucher and SWIFT content applied to the transaction record depend on the related component rules. If the component rules of the AP and KP functions are different, the voucher or SWIFT content of both functions is applied. If the component rules are the same, only the voucher or SWIFT content of the KP function is applied.

  • FALSE, in which case only the voucher or SWIFT content of the KP function is applied.

The default value is true.

EXTERNAL_DS_CLASS

This security parameter is used to define whether an external data source can be used for the generation of the data source class. An interface classname may be specified as the value of this parameter.

FLD_CHK_VERIFY

This is used to check the values of the protected fields during transaction processing. The value may be:

  • N or null, the values of the protected fields are not check

  • P, the system checks the values of protected fields.

FLOW_ACTIVE

This security parameter is used to activate the function flow processing logic. This parameter may have the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system activates the function flow processing logic

  • FALSE or null, in which the original processing logic is used

The default value is null.

GAPISEND_BY_ORDER

This is used to control whether GAPI messages are to be sent in the same order as the sequence of the GAPI rules. The values that may be defined for this parameter are:

  • TRUE, in which GAPI messages are sent in order

  • FALSE or null, in which GAPI messages are sent in no particular

    order

GAPI_RETRY_TIMES

If the eLoan batch interface returns a stop status, the value of this security parameter determines the number of GAPI re-connection re-tries. If the connection still fails, the re-connection process is then stopped.

GAPI_RETRY_WAITINTERVAL

Based on the number of GAPI_RETRY_TIMES, the value of this parameter determines the waiting interval time in between each GAPI connection re-try. The default value of this parameter is 1 (second).

GEN_OUTPUTS_BY_LAST_KP

This is used to control which transaction outputs are generated for records processed in AP and KP functions upon releasing the transaction record. This may have any of the following values:

  • true, in which only transaction outputs from the last KP function are generated upon releasing the pending record; or

  • false, in which transaction outputs in every function are accumulated and are all generated upon releasing the pending the record.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: If this parameter is set to True and the transaction record is processed without any output in the last KP function, no output is generated upon releasing the record regardless if outputs were generated in previous AP and/or KP functions.

GET_CUBK_LOWER

This is used to control whether or not the SQL condition in the Get CUBK window is case sensitive (i.e., specifying database column values). This may have any of the following values:

  • true, in which the SQL condition is not case sensitive

  • false or null, in which column values must be specified according to

    the correct case as the condition is case sensitive

HTTPS_AP_HOST_ADDR

If COMMUNICATION_TYPE is set to HTTP, the Application Server host address can be defined in this HTTPS_AP_HOST_ADDR security parameter.

For EE Version 3.1.0 or higher, this must be set to the AP server host address.

For EE Version 4.0.0, the value of this parameter may either be set to the AP server host address or, an operating system variable that contains the IP address of the machine. (i.e., $localhost)

HTTPS_AP_HOST_PORT

If COMMUNICATION_TYPE is set to HTTP, the Application Server port number can be defined in this HTTPS_AP_HOST_PORT security parameter. When EE is run on WebSphere, this is typically set to 9443.

For EE Version 3.1.0 or higher, this must be set to the server port number.

HTTPS_PROXY_HOST

If COMMUNICATION_TYPE is set to HTTPS, and a proxy host is to be used, the Ip address of the proxy host can be defined in this security system parameter.

HTTP_MAC_ALGORITHM

This is used to define which algorithm is used to do MAC’ing for the transaction data. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • HmacMD5

  • HmacSHA1

HTTP_MAC_KEYSTORE_FILE

This is used to define the path of the keystore file that contains the key used for generating MAC.

HTTP_MAC_KEYSTORE_PASSWORD

As the keystore file is normally encrypted and requires a password, this security parameter is used for defining the password to open the keystore file (e.g., 54321)

HTTP_MAC_KEY_ALIAS

This is used to specify the key’s alias in the keystore file that is used for retrieving the key (e.g., webtoapcert).

HTTP_MAC_KEY_PASSWORD

This is used to set the password for retrieving the key from the keystore file (e.g., 54321).

IS_MULTI_ENTITY

This indicates whether or not Multi-Entity is supported. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which case the system supports mu-ti entity functionality

  • FALSE, in which case multi-entity is not supported

IS_REFUSE_REFNO_FOR_LOGIN

This security parameter is used to control whether or not the reference number of an unconfirmed transaction is retrieved when the user who processed it logs on the system again. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • True (or blank), in which the reference number of the unconfirmed

    transaction is retrieved.

  • False, in which the system generates a new reference number when the

    function is run

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

User A logs on EE and runs the Issue LC One Step function with reference number IPLC001. The system unexpectedly crashes and the transaction is not confirmed. User A logs on the system again successfully.

If IS_REFUSE_REFNO_FOR_LOGIN = 'TRUE' or '':

  • When Issue LC One Step is run by any user, the system retrieves the reference number IPLC001, which has been generated during the previous Issue LC transaction.

If IS_REFUSE_REFNO_FOR_LOGIN = 'FALSE':

  • When Issue LC One Step is run by any user, the system generates a new reference number, e.g., IPLC002.

  • The IPLC001 reference, which has been generated during the previous Issue LC transaction, is treated as a used reference number.

IS_SECU_SCHEMA

This is used to control whether or not the EE system obtains the security schema details from the schema.xml file. This may have one of the following values:

  • T, which indicates that the security schema details are obtained from the \EE_SYS\SCHEMA\schema.xml file.

  • F, which means that the system connects to the security database as eximuser.

IS_SSO_LOGIN

This is used to control how the user accesses or logs on to the EE system. This parameter may have any of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the single sign-on feature is implemented. EE is integrated with the bank's system and the user is only required to log on to the system once. All standard log on procedures are blocked.

  • FALSE, in which the standard EE logon procedure is applied.

The default value is FALSE.

IS_THROW_AFTER_ALL_GAPI_FINISHU

This is used to control whether the system throws an exception if an error is encountered with one GAPI message during the send process. This parameter may have the follow values:

  • Y, wherein an exception is thrown only when all GAPI messages have been sent.

  • N or null, wherein the system throws an exception when an error is encountered when sending a GAPI message.

JNDI_JMS_COMMUNICATOR_FACTORY

This is used to set the Queue Connection Factory JNDI name.

JNDI_JMS_COMMUNICATOR_RECV_QUEUE

If COMMUNICATION_TYPE is set to MQ, the queue name for receiving messages can be defined in this security parameter.

JNDI_JMS_COMMUNICATOR_SEND_QUEUE

If COMMUNICATION_TYPE is set to MQ, the queue name for sending messages can be defined in this security parameter.

KERBEROS_LOGOFF_PAGE

This is used to specify the logoff URL.

LDOC

This is used to define the name of the local printer, which is mapped to a virtual printer that is used for scriptX, which is, in turn, use for printing documents. LDOC is defined in the Document Virtual printer in the Output Device function.

LIMIT_LOCAL_PATH

This is used to define the Limits receive file path.

LIMIT_SFTP_PRE

This is used to define the prefix of the configured Limits property.

LMTS_CONTROL_PARA_BY_UNIT

This is used to control whether the limit control parameter is to be retrieved by country code, or by unit code. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the limit control parameter value is retrieved by filtering C_BK_GROUP_ID + C_CNTY_CODE + C_UNIT_CODE

  • FALSE, in which the limit control parameter value is retrieved by filtering C_BK_GROUP_ID + C_CNTY_CODE

The default value is FALSE.

LOGGING_MODE

This is used to control if the EE instance is a Logging server or not. This may have one of the following values:

  • SERVER, in which the EE instance functions as the logging server. If there is already a logging server started by another EE instance, then the current EE instance switches to Client mode automatically.

  • CLIENT, in which the EE instance is the log client and the loggers in this EE instance read the settings from EE_Log_Client.xml to send log events to the logging server accordingly.

  • NORMAL, in which the system follows the original logic and the settings defined in the EE_Log_Config.xml file. This is the default value.

LOGGING_SERVER_PORT

This is used to define the log server listening port. The default value is 4712.

LOGIN_UNLOCK_SELF

This is used to control if an operator user can unlock his own account in cases when his account has been locked or is already logged on in another session. If this parameter is set to TRUE, a confirmation message is displayed containing the locked account details, and an option is provided for the user to unlock his own account. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the operator user can unlock his own locked account

  • FALSE, in which only the Administrator user can unlock the account of the related operator user.

The default value is FALSE.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE:

i. This unlock feature is also applied for Single Sign On (SSO) Logon

ii. Logon attempts details are recorded into the User Access Log.

ii. Logon details are recorded in the SEC_USER_INFO table, including the Session ID and Client ID.

LOOKUP_DS_BY_REF

This is used to define whether or not a prefix is to be appended to the JNDI name (e.g., java:comp/env/jdbc/). This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, a prefix must be appended to the JNDI name.

  • FALSE or null, appending a prefix to the JNDI name is not required.

LOWER_METHOD_LOCAL_NAME

This security parameter is supported only when the database used is DB2. It is used to control whether Swedish characters such as Å, Ä and Ö are to be supported and recognizable when specifying the filter criteria in the catalog. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which special characters (i.e., Swedish characters like Ö) are supported in the system. If this value is selected, these characters may be used as field values in catalog screens.

  • FALSE, in which special characters are not supported in the system

LSWIFT

This is used to define the name of the local printer (mapped to a virtual printer which used for scriptX) which to be used for printing SWIFT messages. This is defined in the Output Device function.

LVOUCHER

This is used to define the name of the local printer to be used for printing transaction-generated vouchers.

MAIL_SEND_INTERVAL

This security parameter may be used to define the interval in milliseconds when automatically sending mails. If this parameter is not set or if its value is null, the default interval in between mails is 1000 milliseconds.

MESSAGE_BROKER_LOG_RETAN_DAYS

This security parameter is used for defining the number of days the Message Broker logs are retained before these are archived. The value can be from 1 to 60; the default value is 30.

MESSAGE_BROKER_MONITOR

This is used to control whether or not the system is enabled to monitor the processing of the Message Broker. This may have one of the following values:

  • Y, in which case the system monitors the Message Broker processes

  • N, in which case the system does not monitor the Message Broker

    processes

The default value is N.

MSGBROKER_RETRIES

This security parameter is used for defining the number of times the system may attempt to receive messages on MQ mode.

MQ_CONN_HOLDNUM

This is used to specify the maximum number of connections to the MQ server that EE can establish at the same time. The default value is 50.

MQ_CONN_SELF_MANAGER

This is used to indicate whether the system can connect to the MQ server even without specifying the queue manager name. Tthis may have one of the following values:

  • true, in which the queue manager name is not required to connect to the MQ server; or

  • false, in which the queue manager name is required to connect to the MQ server.

The default value is false.

MQ_CONN_TIMEOUT

This is used to specify the length of time in milliseconds until the MQ connection is terminated. The default value is 3600000 milliseconds.

PENDING_AUTO_GEN_DOCUMENT

This is used to control whether or not documents are automatically generated after confirming a transaction. This security system parameter can have either of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system automatically generates the documents after a transaction is confirmed from the Add Pending or Add Master functions.

  • FALSE, in which the Document button must be clicked on to generate documents after a transaction is confirmed.

The default value is FALSE.

PENDING_IS_PRINT

This is used to control whether or not the Print button is disabled when the status of a transaction is Pending. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • Y, in which the Print button is made available for generated documents in PDF format

  • N, in which the Print button is disabled, and the user can only print the document when the transaction status is changed to Master.

The default value is Y.

PERFORMANCELOG_FILE_BY

On the condition that the PERFORMANCELOG_WRITE_MODE security parameter is set to FILE, this parameter is used to control how the Performance Log is defined. This may have the following value:

  • USER, in which the Performance Log is to be defined 'by user'.

The default value is null, in which the Performance Logs are generated by system.

PERFORMANCELOG_SEPARATED

This is used to control whether the Performance Log is to be written into separate files or one file. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the performance log details are written into 4 separate files

  • FALSE, in which all performance log details are written into one file

The default value is FALSE.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

If the PERFORMANCELOG_SEPARATED is TRUE, the system generates the following log files:

  • 2012-06-15[operator]_B2W_NONE_PERFORMANCE.log: IE-WS (web

    server receives request from browser and web server sends response to browser)

  • 2012-06-15[operator]_W2A_NONE_PERFORMANCE.log: WS-AP (web

    server sends request to AP server)

  • 2012-06-15[operator]_A2W_NONE_PERFORMANCE.log: AP-WS (AP server

    receives request from web server)

  • 2012-06-15[operator]_A2D_NONE_PERFORMANCE.log: AP-DB (AP server

    sends request to database)

If the PERFORMANCELOG_SEPARATED is FALSE, the system generates the following log file:

  • 2012-06-15_PERFORMANCELog.log (all performance logs IE-WS, WS-AP, AP-WS, AP-DB are generated in a single file)

PERFORMANCELOG_WRITE_MODE

This is used to define the mode of recording the Performance Log. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • FILE, in which the Performance Log is written into a file

  • DB, in which the Performance Log is written into the TRX_SYS_PERF_LOG table in the database

The default value is FILE.

PRECOMPILE_SERVER_JS

This is used to control how server side scripts are run in the system. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system uses a precompiled class (Rhino). The user

    can define the path for holding the server side JS. The server side scripts are generated into, and invoked from, this path.

  • FALSE, in which the system uses BSF in this path: [Parameter

    Drive]\[Bank Group]\[Country]\AP\ServerSideJS

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: BSF only runs in development and testing phases. Rhino, on the other hand, runs online and UAT.

PRINT_DAYS

This is used to define the number of days before a document is printed. This may have an numeric value from 0-31.

PRODUCT_DEPLOY_MODE

This security parameter is used in an environment where the Web and AP servers are deployed on separate machines. This is used to define the deployment mode of the system. The possible values are:

  • AP, wherein the deployment is on AP mode

  • WEB, wherein the deployment is on WEB mode

PROJECT_BATCH_ADP

This is used to define the batch class name. In the EE system, this is currently for the SCF model.

RELEASE_AUTO_GEN_DOCUMENT

This is used to control whether or not the EE system automatically generates documents after releasing a transaction. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system generates the documents automatically

    after releasing function.

  • FALSE, in which the DOCUMENT button must be clicked to generate

    documents after releasing a transaction from the Add Pending the Add Master functions.

The default value is FALSE.

RemoteSend_Log

This is used to define whether or not logs are to be written for remote print or remote send operations. Any of the following values may be used for this parameter:

  • TRUE, in which remote print and send logs are generated

  • FALSE, in which no logs are written for remote print and send

    operations

REPORT_SFTP_PRE

This is used to define the prefix for the parameter name in [WAS console] > Application servers > [server] > Process definition > Java Virtual Machine > Custom properties.

RMA_CHECK_ENABLED

This security parameter is used to control whether or not RMA checking is enabled for the system, and whether or not the system overrides the error if the RMA

check fails.

This may have one of the following values:

  • Y, in which case RMA checking is enabled;

  • N, or null, in which case RMA checking is disabled; or

  • O, in which a warning message is displayed if the RMA check fails. This warning message provides the user an option to override (i.e., continue and confirm the transaction despite) the error, or go back to the transaction screen to modify the information.

The default value is N.

RMI_IS_AUTO

This is used to control whether the RMIWebservice handles the data files automatically or manually when the service is started. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which when RMIWebservice is started, RMIWebservice handles

    the data files automatically

  • FALSE, in which when RMIWebservice is started, RMIWebservice

    receives files manually

The default value is TRUE.

RMI_IS_RENAME

This security parameter is used to control whether the corresponding tables ─ during the processing of the SWIFT reference data files by the RMIWebservice ─ are to be renamed or not.

  • TRUE, in which the RMI web service creates new tables, inserts new data, and renames the original tables.

  • FALSE, in which the RMI web service deletes the data from the original tables, and then inserts new data into these tables.

The default value is TRUE.

RMI_SEND_MAIL

This is used to control whether or not a mail notification is sent if a process fails when the RMIWebservice is run. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which a mail notification is sent when an error is

    encountered when the RMIWebservice is run. The settings used for sending the notification are based on the mailRule.xml file found in the \EEConfig folder.

  • FALSE, in which no mail notification is sent.

The default value is FALSE.

RMI_WEBSERVICE_URL

This security parameter indicates the URL of the RMI Web Service (e.g., http://localhost:9080/RMIWebservice/services/RMIWebService).

RUN_ENVIRONMENT

This is used to specify the type of running environment. One of the following pre-defined values may be selected:

  • DEVELOPMENT

  • TEST

  • PRODUCT

For certain transaction handling, the system reads from the parameter and executes differently according the running environment type (e.g., SOD GAPI handling).

The default value is TEST.

SEC_ADD_MASTER

This is used to control whether or not the Add User, Modify User, and Delete User security functions require Supervisor release. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which case these functions do not require the Supervisor release process

  • FALSE or null, in which case these functions require the Supervisor release process

SEC_GADM_PBOP

This is used to control the type of users that super officer users can create. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which case the super officer can create these types of

    users: Super Officer, Global Process Center Administrator, Global Administrator, Process Center Administrator, Branch Administrator, Global Process Center Operator, Global Operator, Process Center Operator, and Branch Operator.

  • FALSE or null, in which case the super officer can create these

    types of users: Super Officer, Global Administrator, Process Center Administrator, and Global Process Center Administrator.

SEC_MENU_TYPE

This is used to control whether the function list in the EE system menu is displayed by function group or by module (default). If this parameter is set to BYGROUP, the functions are displayed by function group following this hierarchy: function group > function. If no value is defined, the menu is displayed using the default setting which by module following this hierarchy: module and event > function group > function.

SEC_RELEASE_ALSO

This is used to control whether a user (e.g., Super Officer) can be given the Create/ Modify/ Delete and Release rights at the same time. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which case the user can be assigned with all of these rights at the same time

  • FALSE or null, in which case the standard assignment rules apply: a user that is assigned with the Create, Modify, and/or Delete right(s) cannot be given the Release right, and vice versa

SENDMAIL_HTMLTOPDF

This is used to control whether the generated SWIFT or Voucher is sent as a PDF or HTML file in an e-mail attachment. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the SWIFT or Voucher is attached as a PDF file in the

    e-mail message.

  • FALSE or null, in which the SWIFT or Voucher is attached as an HTML

    file in the e-mail message.

SEND_ONLINEREPORT_REDIRECT_MODE

This is used to define whether a user is to redirected or forwarded to the transaction page. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which a user is redirected to the page.

  • FALSE or null, in which a user is forwarded to the page.

SEND_SPECIAL_VOUCHER_GAPI

This is used to control whether the C_GL and C_SL details are to be sent separately along with any entry details as defined in the Accounting Rule setting. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • Y, in which the C_GL and C_SL details are merged into one piece of information in the Accounting Entry section of the GAPI message.

  • N (or null), in which the C_GL and C_SL details are separated or separately defined in the Accounting Entry section of the GAPI message.

SERVER_TYPE

This security parameter is used to define the server type on which the system runs. The available server types are: Jboss, WebLogic, WAS, SilverStream, OC4J.

SHOW_CATALOG_ON_TRX_LISTPAGE

This is used to control whether the catalog filter criteria are shown on the Transaction list page. This may have one of the following values:

  • true, in which the catalog filter is displayed on the screen

  • false, in which he catalog filter is not displayed

If the value is null, the catalog filter is displayed on the screen

SHOW_RECORD_BY_USER_FUNC

This is used to control whether or not pending records that are run through the Fix Pending function may be accessed only by the user that created the record, or by other users as well. The following values may be defined:

  • Y, in which pending records may only be accessed by the user that

    processed the records

  • N, in which pending records may be accessed by other users as well

SIMPLE_CATALOG

This is used to define the query method to be used for retrieving data from the database. This parameter may have the following values:

  • TRUE, wherein the DAOExec.executeQuery is used

  • FALSE or null, wherein the DAOExec.executeQuery_bak is utilized

SLA_ACTIVE

This security parameter is used to activate the SLA processing logic. This parameter may have the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system activates the SLA processing logic.

  • FALSE or blank, in which the original processing logic is used.

SLA_CUST_MODU

This security parameter is used to define the customer master table name from which to query customer details. This may have one of the following values:

  • CUST, in which the system queries customer details from the CUST_MASTER table.

  • STAT or blank, in which the system queries customer details from the STAT_MASTER table.

SLA_MAILRULE

To control the mail function in SLA, set the value to SLA_REPORT_MAIL.

Both FLOW_ACTIVE and SLA_ACTIVE must be set to TRUE to activate this security parameter.

SOD_RESET_REF_NO

This parameter is used to control whether the transaction reference number is reset after SOD is run. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • Y, in which the transaction reference number is reset every time SOD is run.

  • N, in which the transaction reference number is not reset even when Start of Day is executed.

The default value is N.

SQLLOG_FILE_BY

This security parameter is used to control how the SQL Log is defined. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • SESSION, in which the SQL Log is defined by user session

  • USER, in which the SQL Log is defined by user

  • SYSTEM, in which the SQL Log is defined by system

The default value is SYSTEM.

SSO_GRP_ID

This is used to define the field name that is to contain the business unit of the user accessing the system (e.g., C_BUSINESS_UNIT).

SSO_GRP_ID_REGEXP

This is used to retrieve match a unit code from the unit codes in a list.

SSO_LOGOFF_LOCATIOND

This is used to define the SSO login jsp file. (e.g., ../SYS_index.jsp)

SSO_USER_ID

This is used to define the field name that is to contain the User ID of the user logging on to the system (e.g., C_USER_ID).

STP_GAPI_UPDATE_NODEVAL

EE receives an incoming XML message via STP and inserts the data to the database directly. If the same record is resubmitted and sent to EE, some of the values may have been updated as null. This security parameter is used to control whether or not the original value of a field is updated in the database if the new field value is null; this may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system updates the node or field value to blank if the new field value is null

  • FALSE, in which the system retains the original field value if the new field value is null. This is the default setting of the security parameter.

SVR_TIME_FORMAT

This is used for defining the time zone. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • GMT, which pertains to the Greenwich Mean Time. The value of

    T_SVR_GMT and D_SVR_GMT is GMT+0.

  • Local, in which the value of T_SVR_GMT and D_SVR_GMT is the

    server time. If, for example, the server is located in China, the value is GMT+8.

The default value is GMT.

SWF_AUTOADD_108

This security parameter is used to control whether or not Tag 108 is to be generated in outgoing SWIFT messages. Tag 108 is a free-format field that is used for specifying a user’s own reference. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE

a. If tag 108 is defined in both the SWIFT template and mapping rule

-Tag 108 is generated in Block 3 of outgoing SWIFT messages based on the SWIFT template and mapping rule settings.

b. If tag 108 is defined in the SWIFT template but not defined in the mapping rule

-Tag 108 is generated in Block 3 of outgoing SWIFT messages, and set with random numbers.

c.If tag 108 is not defined in both the SWIFT template and mapping rule

-Tag 108 is generated in Block 3 of outgoing SWIFT messages, and set with random numbers.

  • FALSE

a. If tag 108 is defined in both the SWIFT template and mapping rule

-Tag 108 is generated in Block 3 of outgoing SWIFT messages based on the SWIFT template and mapping rule settings.

b. If tag 108 is defined in the SWIFT template but not defined in the mapping rule

-Tag 108 is not generated

c.If tag 108 is not defined in both the SWIFT template and mapping rule

-Tag 108 is not generated

SWIFT_ACK_PROCESS_INTERFACE_CLASS

This parameter is used to define a class name which implements the interface ACKMessageProcessInterface. The system uses the defined class to check the ACK message received in the interface.

SWIFT_FILEACT_FLAG

This is used to enable or disable the FileAct feature. Set this parameter to TRUE to enable FileAct. Otherwise, set it to FALSE or leave it blank.

SWIFT_FILEACT_TO_FOLDER

This is used to specify the folder for the FileAct feature, which stores the SWIFT message sent from EE and is retrieved by ESP for further processing.

SWIFT_TO_ESP

This parameter is used to control whether or not SWIFT messages are to be processed through the Eximbills Services Platform (ESP). This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which SWIFT messages are processed through ESP.

  • FALSE, in which the generated SWIFT message are not processed through ESP

The default value is FALSE.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE:

i. If SWIFT version 2018-2019 is to be applied, it is mandatory to set this parameter to TRUE to process all SWIFT messages through ESP. Refer to the ESP Deployment on Eximbills Enterprise manual for more details.

ii. If the SWIFT version 2017 or lower is to be used, this parameter may be initially set to FALSE. If the bank requires to use these versions [with]{.underline} MT798, this parameter must then be set to TRUE. Refer to the ESP Deployment on Eximbills Enterprise manual for more details.

SWT_ADD_BIC_INFO

This security system parameter is used to control whether the BIC details of the sending bank are to be appended to the received incoming SWIFT message. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which, apart from the sender’s BIC, the following BIC details are appended to the SWIFT message: receiver’s BIC, and the receive date and time

  • FALSE, in which the receiver details are not appended to the SWIFT message.

SYNC_BPO_TO_FADA

This security parameter is related to TSU and BPO transaction processes. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which records are inserted into the FADA-related tables regardless of the value of the Is BPO Flag (TSU_BK_BPO_FLG)

  • FALSE, in which the system functions as before: Records are inserted into the FADA-related tables according to the Is BPO Flag setting. This is the default value.

SYSREF_OVERFLOW_AUTO_RESET

This is used to control whether or not the system automatically resets the reference number sequence after the maximum sequence value is reached based on the reference number settings defined in the Reference Number Maintenance function of the Standing Data module. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system automatically resets the reference number sequence after the maximum sequence value is reached.

  • FALSE, in which a warning message is displayed once the reference number sequence has reached its maximum sequence value.

The default value is TRUE.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

  1. In the Reference Number Maintenance function, the Reference Sequence is set to 998, and the Sequence Length is set to 3.

{width="4.85in” height="2.525797244094488in”}

  1. Process the relevant transaction.

If the SYSREF_OVERFLOW_AUTO_RESET parameter is set to TRUE, the reference number generated is automatically reset to 001.

{width="4.85in” height="2.341781496062992in”}

  1. Otherwise, if the SYSREF_OVERFLOW_AUTO_RESET parameter is set to FALSE, the reference number is generated as empty/blank and a warning message is displayed. The user must then manually modify the reference number sequence in the Reference Number Maintenance function.

{width="4.8049748468941385in” height="2.209722222222222in”}

SYS_AMT_NOTROUNDED

This is used to properly calculate and round off decimals when running semi-auto batch functions. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • False (or blank), in which the system calculates and rounds off the decimal field accordingly

  • True, in which the system does not calculate and round of the decimal number.

SYS_CHECK_CHARACTER

This is used to control whether the system is to apply the settings defined in the EECheckCharacterFilter filter to block phishing attacks, or use the original process logic for data security. This parameter may have the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system uses the EECheckCharacterFilter which, when mapped to servlets, detects and blocks illegal details transmitted. The illegal characters to be filtered are defined in the characterfilter.xml file.

  • FALSE, in which the system uses the original logic for security.

When the value of this parameter is set to TRUE and an invalid character is detected, the system displays an error message.

SYS_CHECK_TAG45_TO_TAG47

This is used to control whether the system checks if tags 45, 46, and 47 exist in both an incoming MT700 and MT701 SWIFT message.

  • TRUE, in which the system checks for the existence of tags 45, 46, and 47 in incoming MT700 and MT701 messages.

  • FALSE, in which the system does not check whether the tags 45, 46, and 47 are present in incoming MT700 and MT701 messages.

The default value is FALSE. If no value is defined, the system does not run a validation.

TASK_CONTINUE_ON_ERROR

This is used to control whether or not the system continues to execute an auto batch job at the next scheduled time even after an exception occurs during job processing. This may have one of the following values:

  • True, when an exception is encountered during auto batch job processing, this job is still executed at the next scheduled time.

  • False, when an exception is encountered during auto batch job processing, this job is not executed at the next scheduled time.

The default value is False.

TASK_CONTINUE_ON_SSS_ERROR

This is used to control whether or not the system continues to run the succeeding records, if an exception occurs when running the batch task. This may have one of the following values:

  • True, the task disregards the current record and continues to run

    the subsequent records, if an exception occurs when running the task through Server Side JS.

  • False, the task stops if an exception occurs when running the task

    through Server Side JS.

The default value is False.

TRANSFERTO_CHK_LOCK_NOT_THROW_EXP

This is used to control whether or not the system throws an exception if there is no Transfer To record to update. This may have one of the following values:

  • Y, in which the system does not throw an exception if there is no Transfer To record to update.

  • N or blank, in which the system throws an exception if there is no Transfer To record to update.

USER_DEFINED_AUDITLOG_CLASS

This parameter is used to define the name of the class that implements the Busiintf interface. The defined class is used to process the audit log logic.

VER_FAP_REALTIME

This is used to determine whether or not the system must check the Function Access Permission (FAP) real-time. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system performs a real-time verification of FAP

  • FALSE or null, in which the system does not check the FAP

VOUCHER_TRANSMIT_CLASS

This is the system parameter that defines the class file used for transmitting vouchers.

WEB_AP_COMPRESS

This is used to indicate whether or not the transaction data is to be compressed when it is sent from the Web server to the Application server. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the transaction data is compressed before it is sent from the Web server to the AP server

  • FALSE, in which the transaction data is not compressed before it is sent from the Web server to the AP server

The default value is FALSE.

WEB_AP_HTTP_MAC

This is used to indicate whether MAC’ing is to be performed when transaction data is transferred between the Web and Application servers. This security parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which MAC’ing is performed

  • FALSE, in which MAC’ing is bypassed. This is the default value.

For EE Version 3.1.0 or higher, this must be set to FALSE.

WEB_AP_PARA_MODE

This is used to define the parameter type when components communicate with one another. Any of the following values may be used:

  • STRING or null, wherein the message type is string

  • OBJECT, in which the message type is object

The default value is STRING

WEB_CONFIRM_REFORMAT

This is used to define the reformat class that is used to reformat GAPIs, vouchers, and transaction documents. The class is implemented according to project requirements.

WEB_QUERY_DIRECTLY

This is used to control whether or not the EE system may connect to the database directly. This parameter may have the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the EE system may directly connect to the database

  • FALSE, in which the EE system may not connect to the database

    directly.

WORKFLOW

This security parameter is used to control whether the system uses the workflow or not. Any of the following values may be used:

  • Y, in which the system executes the workflow logic

  • N or null, in which the system does not execute the workflow logic

WORKFLOW_CLASS

This is used to define the workflow implementation class name.

System Parameters

  • overview

  • ap server system parameters

  • web server system parameters

  • web/ap server system parameters

  • utility workbench system parameters

Overview

The System Parameter function, which is run by an Administrator user or Operator user of the EE Utility, is used by programmers to identify programs or parameters to the system by designating the path to the program or parameter. System parameters are references or values that are defined to control the behavior of EE during transaction processing on the browser and in the EE Utility.

There are four types of parameter attributes:

  • AP Server

  • Web Server

  • Web/AP Server

  • Utility Workbench

+———————————————————————–+
—–
{width="4.85in” height="3.0840277777777776i
n”}
——————————————————————-
—–
+———————————————————————–+

Figure 3. System Parameters

{width="0.3298611111111111in” height="0.3298611111111111in”}NOTE: If the value of a system parameter is changed, restart the server for the modification to take effect.

AP Server System Parameters

Parameters with this attribute are those used by or run in the EE application server.

{width="0.3298611111111111in” height="0.3298611111111111in”}**NOTE: **

i. The SYST_SETTLEMENT_BUF system parameter is currently not used.

ii. The SWIFT_PAN_NAN_PROCESS_CLASS and VOUCHER_VALID_TYPE are reserved for special projects only.

APAR_COMMIT

This is used to control whether or not the corresponding APAR record in the EXIMTRX.TRX_APAR table is updated when the APAR record is updated through transaction processing. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the corresponding records in the table are updated. This is the default value.

  • FALSE, in which the corresponding records in the table are not updated.

AUTHORIZATION_MODE

This is used to control whether a transaction record is updated to M (master) directly after a positive authorization. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • THREE_STEP, in which a pending transaction record must first go through the supervisor release process. If the supervisor releases the transaction but his authorization class is not enough for the transaction amount, a user with a higher authorization class is required to authorize it. When the authorization passes, the status of the transaction record is updated to M. Thus, three steps are required for the pending record to become a master record: Create step, Supervisor Release step, and Authorize step.

  • FOUR_STEP, in which a pending transaction record must first go through supervisor release. If the supervisor releases the transaction but his authorization class is not enough for the transaction amount, a user with a higher authorization class is required to authorize it. When the authorization passes, the supervisor is required to run the supervisor release function again to update the transaction record to M. Thus, four steps are required for the pending record to become a master record: Create step, Supervisor Release step, Authorize step, and Supervisor Release step.

The default value is THREE_STEP.

AUTH_BY_SELF

This is used to control whether or not a user can authorize his own transactions. The value may be:

  • TRUE, in which the user who created the transaction can also authorize it

  • FALSE, in which the user who created the transaction is not allowed to authorize it

The default value is FALSE. The setting in this parameter is not applied if the IS_AUTH_MATRIX parameter is set to FALSE.

AUTH_GAPI_WHILE_RELEASE

This parameter is used to specify whether the authorization and release GAPI messages are to be generated separately, or not. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the authorization and release GAPI messages are generated and sent out separately once the transaction is completely authorized.

  • FALSE, in which only the release GAPI message is generated and sent out once the transaction is completely authorized.

This system parameter is only used if the RELEASE_WHILE_AUTHORIZE system parameter is set to TRUE.

AUTOPRCS_LOG_FLAG

This system parameter is used to control whether the log included in the AutoProcessing code is to be printed. This may have one of the following values:

  • FALSE, in which the log is not printed

  • TRUE, in which the log is printed.

The default value is FALSE.

CALL_VOUCHER_GAPI

This system parameter is used for defining the GAPI rule to be sent when a voucher is generated.

CANCELLATION_NEGATIVE_AMT_TODAY

On the condition that the REVERSE_DC_WHEN_CANCELLATION system parameter is set to FALSE, this is used to control whether the voucher entries should be displayed as negative amounts after a transaction is cancelled through the Cancellation function. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • Y, in which, given that the REVERSE_DC_WHEN_CANCELLATION parameter is set to FALSE, the D/C amounts are displayed as negative amounts

  • N, in which the D/C amounts are not displayed as negative but the debit and credit values are reversed given that the the REVERSE_DC_WHEN_CANCELLATION system parameter is set to TRUE

The default value is FALSE.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

If the parameter is set to Y, the voucher displays the following D/C values after transaction release

D 100 – 35200420 (Account Number)

C 100 – IMCOGL Account

After a transaction is cancelled through the Cancellation function, the values displayed in the generated voucher become:

D -100 – 35200420 (Account Number)

C -100 – IMCOGL Account

CHECK_SWIFT_TAG_LEN

This is used to control whether or not the length of the tags in an outgoing SWIFT message is to be checked by the system before the transaction is confirmed. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the tag length of the SWIFT message is checked before the transaction can be confirmed

  • FALSE, in which no tag length validation is performed

CHECK_VOUCHER_FLAG

This is used to indicate whether or not to check if the value of the account number and/or account title is null once the transaction is confirmed. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • ACCNO, in which the system checks if the account number is null once the transaction is confirmed. If null, an error message is displayed and the record is not submitted: "Voucher account number is empty, please check it!"
