  • ACCNM, in which the system checks if the account title is null once the transaction is confirmed. If null, an error message is displayed and the record is not submitted: - Voucher account title is empty, please check it!

  • TRUE, in which the system checks if both the account number and title are null once the transaction is confirmed. If null, an error message is displayed and the record is not submitted: Voucher account number and title are empty, please check it!

  • FALSE, in which the system does not check if the account number or title are null.

CLEAR_ZERO_AMT_FIELD_FLAG

This is used to control whether 0, or 0.00, etc. are shown in a generated document if the value of the corresponding amount field is zero. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the amount field in the generated document is empty if its value is 0

  • FALSE, in which the system displays 0 as the amount field value

The default value is FALSE.

COMBINE_SWIFT_MESSAGE

This system parameter controls whether or not the system combines the messages outgoing MT103 SWIFT messages into one MT102 message. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, wherein the system combines the MT103 SWIFT messages into one MT102 message, provided that the Combine Flag in the SWIFT Mapping rule for the MT103 message is ticked.

  • FALSE, in which the system does not combine the outgoing MT103 messages. If this value is selected, the system disregards the value of the Combine Flag in the SWIFT Mapping rule for the MT103 message.

The default value is FALSE.

COMMIT_VOUCHER_CLASS

This is used for defining a project-based Java class (e.g., com.cs.shb.intf.SHBCommitVoucher).

EDI_IN_CHECK

This is used for checking incoming EDI messages. This may have one of the following values:

  • Y, in which the system checks the validity of the incoming EDI message

  • N, in which the system does not check the validity of the incoming EDI message

The default value is N.

EDI_OUT_CHECK

This is used for checking outgoing EDI messages. This may have one of the following values:

  • Y, in which the system checks the validity of the outgoing EDI message

  • N, in which the system does not check the validity of the outgoing EDI message

The default value is N.

EDI_OUT_GOING_FOLDER

This system parameter is used for specifying the path to which the outgoing EDI messages are stored.

EE2CE_CHECK_RESULT_QUEUEID

This system parameter is used for specifying the source of the Queue Id to be used for SOA messages sent from EE to the Customer Enterprise system.

ELOAN_BATCH_GAPI_RULE

This is used to specify the GAPI rule for sending Eloan vouchers to other system using the Eloan User Batch.

GAPI_BY_FUNCTION

This AP server system parameter is used to control whether or not the relevant tag is listed in the generated GAPI message if the mapped field is not included in the transaction screen. This parameter may have any of the following values:

  • FALSE or null, in which the tag ─ with an empty value ─ is listed in the GAPI message if the mapped field is not included in the transaction screen.

  • TRUE, in which the tag ─ with an empty value ─ is not listed in the GAPI message if the mapped field is not included in the transaction screen.

The default value is null.

GET_MAXEVENTTIMES_RECORD

This is used for controlling the Inquire logic of the Trx Event Edit Rec component. It is for cases when the system cannot find and select a record from the Event table that is equivalent to the I_EVENT_TIMES of a specific Master record.

This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system selects the record with the maximum I_EVENT_TIMES in the Event table.

  • FALSE, in which the system selects the record in the Event table according to the I_EVENT_TIMES of the record in the Master table. This is the default value.

GET_RELEASE_PAGE_CLASS

This system parameter is used to specify the class name and allows the project-based class to run a special business logic.

IBP_ROOT_PATH

This system parameter is used to specify the path to the XML file for the IBPD (International Balance of Payment Declaration) interface (e.g., X:\TRXDATA\IBPD).

IN_IMG_MAX_UPLOAD_TIMES

When the system receives a message from another system via MQ or other JMS standard interface, it reads the index contained in the message body to determine the following:

  • The number of outputs that are sent as attachments with the message

  • What these attachments are (i.e., the outputs are taken as images in the interface)

The system then searches for each of these outputs in the defined image queue according to the index information.

This system parameter is used to set the maximum number of times that the system may attempt to retrieve each output or image from the image queue, before it disengages and searches for another output.

If this is left blank, the system defaults this to 3.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

When IN_IMG_MAX_UPLOAD_TIMES is set to 3, the system tries 3 times at most to retrieve each output from the image queue.

INCOMINGSWIFT_SEND_REJECT_MESSAGE

This is used to define the Id of the queue to which EE sends a message updating the status of an incoming SWIFT message rejected through the Incoming SWIFT Maintenance function in EE. The queue Id is configured through the Queue Manager tab of the Protocol Manager function in the EE Utility.

IS_AUTH_MATRIX

This is used to control whether or not the system applies the settings defined in the authorization matrix when processing transactions. The value may be:

  • TRUE, in which case the system uses the authorization matrix. If this value is selected, the transaction status is directly changed to ‘A’, which indicates that the transaction has started undergoing the authorization process; or

  • FALSE, in which case the system does not apply any defined authorization parameters and the status remains as ‘P’ after transaction confirmation

The default value is FALSE. If this parameter is set to FALSE, the PENDING_TO_AUTH_MATRIX, RELEASE_WHILE_AUTHORIZE and AUTH_BY_SELF system parameters are not used.

IS_SELF_RELEASE

On the condition that the IS_AUTH_MATRIX system parameter is set to TRUE, the IS_SELF_RELEASE system parameter is used to control whether a user is allowed to release his own transaction given that the transaction amount is within his self-release limit.

  • TRUE, in which a user is allowed to confirm and release his own transaction if the amount is within his self-release limit

  • FALSE, in which the same user is not allowed to release a transaction

If the parameter is set to TRUE and the amount is within the user’s self-release limit, the user is immediately directed to the Release screen for transaction releasing after the transaction is confirmed.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE:

i. The self-release limit refers to the maximum amount of a transaction that a user is allowed to release, given that he is the creator of the transaction. This is defined through the Add User Auth function of the Security Manager.

ii. In cases when the same authorization rule is attached to two or more Amount fields in the same transaction function, the user cannot release the record if the value of one of those Amount fields exceeds his own self-release limit.

MISREPORT_TRA_TYPE

This is used to control whether the system must roll back the transaction in cases of MIS Report data processing failure. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system will perform a rollback process on the transaction in case of MIS Report interface failure

  • FALSE, in which no rollback process is performed

The default value is FALSE.

MQ_CONNECTION_NUMBER

This is used to indicate the number of times that the EE system retries to connect with MQ.

  • If a value is specified in this system parameter, the specified value is the number of times the system attempts to connect with MQ. If the system still fails to connect with MQ after these attempts, the session is then terminated.

  • If no value is specified in this system parameter, the default number of times that the system attempts to connect with MQ is three. Otherwise, the session is then terminated.

MQ_CONNECTION_WAITINTERVAL

This parameter is used to indicate the time interval, in seconds, between connection attempts when the system fails connecting to the MQ server.

If the value of this system parameter is null, the system applies this default value: 30 seconds.

MQ_CONNECTION_CYCLE_WAITINTERVAL

When the system reaches the maximum number of failed MQ connection attempts defined in the MQ_CONNECTION_NUMBER system parameter, the system goes on sleep mode (i.e., the system stops attempting to connect to the MQ server). Sleep mode is deactivated after the time, in hours, specified in the MQ_CONNECTION_CYCLE_WAITINTERVAL system parameter.

OUTGOING_MQ_CORRELATION_ID

This is used to define the correlation Id of outgoing SWIFT messages.

  • If a value is specified in this system parameter, the specified value is the correlation Id for outgoing SWIFT messages from EE.

  • If no value is specified in this system parameter, the correlation Id of outgoing SWIFT messages from EE is blank.

OUTPUT_SEND_LOG

This is used to indicate whether the system should generate detailed processing logs in the EELog file when it executes the Output Sender operation. If the Output Sender is kept running, numerous logs that take up hard disk space are generated in the file. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • N, in which detailed logs are not generated

  • Y, in which detailed logs are generated

The default value is N.

PENDING_TO_AUTH

This parameter is used to control which authorization type is applied in the Level-by-Level authorization mode: Pending-Authorize or Pending-Release-Authorize. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which Pending-Authorize is applied. Once the transaction is

    confirmed, the system calculates the corresponding authorization level and directly designates this to the users with enough authorization level

  • FALSE, in which Pending-Release-Authorize is applied. The

    transaction record with a P status is released first, while the process of calculating and designating authorization levels is invoked in the Release function

The default value is FALSE.

PENDING_TO_AUTH_MATRIX

This is used to control whether or not the system performs the authorization process when a pending transaction is confirmed. The value may be:

  • TRUE, in which the authorization process is performed upon

    confirmation of the pending transaction. The status of the transaction is changed to A, which indicates that the transaction has started undergoing the authorization process.

  • FALSE, in which the authorization process is not performed upon

    confirmation of the pending transaction. The status of the confirmed pending transaction remains P (pending).

The default value is FALSE. The setting in this parameter is not applied if the IS_AUTH_MATRIX system parameter is set to FALSE.

PRINTING_PATTERN

This system parameter is used for specifying the printing pattern. The value is the Bank Group Name.

PRINT_LOG

This is used to control whether the system should write the log for remote printing execution. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system writes the printing log

  • FALSE, in which no log is written

The default value is FALSE.

PRINT_SERVER_IP

This is used for specifying the IP address of the print server.

PRINT_SERVER_PORT

This is used for specifying the port number of the print server.

RELEASE_WHILE_AUTHORIZE

This is used to control whether or not the status of a completely authorized transaction is automatically changed to M (master).

The value may be:

  • TRUE, in which the status of the completely authorized transaction

    is changed to M (master). The record is immediately saved in the Master file, and does not require the Release process.

  • FALSE, in which the status of the completely authorized transaction

    is P (pending). The transaction must be processed next in the Release function before it can be saved in the Master file.

The default value is FALSE. This setting in this parameter is not applied if the IS_AUTH_MATRIX parameter is set to FALSE.

REVERSE_DC_WHEN_CANCELLATION

This parameter is used to control whether the D/C or debit and credit amounts of the generated voucher are to be reversed after the Cancellation Release function is run. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the debit and credit amounts are reversed

  • FALSE, in which the debit and credit amounts are not reversed. If this value is selected and the CANCELLATION_NEGATIVE_AMOUNT_TODAY value is set to ‘Y’, the amounts are displayed as negative.

The default value is TRUE.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

If the parameter is set to TRUE, the voucher displays the following D/C values after transaction release

D 100 – 35200420 (Account Number)

C 100 – IMCOGL Account

After a transaction is cancelled through the Cancellation function, the values displayed in the generated voucher become:

C 100 – 35200420 (Account Number)

D 100 – IMCOGL Account

SIGNATURE_GRAPHICS_GEN_PATH

This AP Server system parameter is used to define the path where the uploaded signature graphic files are to be stored.

SVR_TIME_FORMAT

This is used for defining the time zone. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • GMT, which pertains to the Greenwich Mean Time. The value of

    T_SVR_GMT and D_SVR_GMT is GMT+0.

  • Local, in which the value of T_SVR_GMT and D_SVR_GMT is the

    server time. If, for example, the server is located in China, the value is GMT+8.

The default value is GMT.

SW_ADD

This is used to define the field name for the Head Office SWIFT Address in the BANK master table. If this is not defined, the system uses C_MAIN_REF of the BANK master table as the SWIFT address.

SWIFT_ADD_HO

This is used to set the field name for the SWIFT address of the head office in the BANK module BANK_MASTER table.

When this is defined, the system retrieves the bank Id value from the incoming SWIFT message, retrieves the SWIFT_ADD_HO field value of the Bank ID from the DB, and uses the value to reset the bank head office address of the record upon demerge.

If this is not defined, the system defaults to the SWIFT_ADD_HO field name. If the system fails to find the field in the BANK_MASTER table, it generates an error message and treats the attempt as an STP failure.

SWIFT_CHAR_SET_CHECK

This is checking the SWIFT tags in an outgoing SWIFT message. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system checks each tag value for invalid

    characters against its defined character set type

  • FALSE, in which the system ignores checking the character sets

The default value is TRUE.

SWIFT_CHAR_TRANSLATION_CLASS

This system parameter is used to control whether the system must apply the user-defined class to translate the character of every tag in SWIFT.

SWIFT_INCOMING_WITHDO

This system parameter is used to indicate the message type or types to be demerged into one transaction function with the data object. If two message types are defined, these must be separated by a “/” (e.g., 101/102). If only one message type is specified (e.g., 101), the MT101 message is demerged into one transaction, and the MT102 message is split into multiple transactions.

SWIFT_MERGE_MODE

This parameter is used to indicate whether the system can process an incoming SWIFT message with more than three extension messages. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • UNNORMAL, in which the system can process the SWIFT message with

    more than 3 extension messages

  • NORMAL, in which the system can process only 3 extension messages at

    most

The default value is NORMAL.

SWIFT_MESSAGES_DIRECTLY_DELETE_FLAG

This system parameter is used to control whether a SWIFT message is to be deleted even without supervisor release. This may have one of the following options:

  • Y, in which the SWIFT message is deleted and does not require supervisor release.

  • N, in which a SWIFT message is only deleted completely after supervisor release

SWIFT_OUTGOING_SHA256_KEY

This parameter is provided to generate the S:} (TRAILERS BLOCK) when producing the outgoing SWIFT message using an SHA-256 Encryption code. The value should be 32 digits consisting of, or a combination of, numbers from 0 to 9, letters from A to Z, or a to z, or the following special characters: – ! "# $ % & ' ( ) * + , - . / : ; < = > ? @ [ \ ] ^ _ `

If this parameter is defined, the system adds the encrypted key to the last position: S:{MDG:}; as TRAILERS BLOCK.

If this parameter is not defined, the system checks for and uses the SA2 encryption arithmetic if any is defined in the SWIFT_OUT_GOING_KEY system parameter. If the value of both parameters is null, the block is not generated.

SWIFT_OUT_GOING_FOLDER

This system parameter is used for specifying the path to which the SWIFT message is sent in case SWIFT_TO_FOLDER is set to TRUE (e.g., X:\TRXDATA\CSBANK\US\OUTSWIFT).

SWIFT_OUT_GOING_KEY

This parameter is provided to generate the S:} (TRAILERS BLOCK) when producing the outgoing SWIFT message using an SA2 Encryption arithmetic. The value should be 32 digits consisting of numbers from 0 to 9, letters from A to F, or a combination of both.

If this parameter is defined, the system adds the encrypted key to the last position: S:{LAU:}; as TRAILERS BLOCK.

If this parameter is not defined, the block is not generated. The encrypted key is applied to the case on FOLDER mode.

If a value is defined for this parameter and the SWIFT_OUTGOING_SHA256_KEY parameter, the system uses the encryption code defined in the SWIFT_OUTGOING_SHA256_KEY parameter.

SWIFT_PAN_NAN_PROCESS_CLASS

This system parameter allows the user-defined class to apply the project’s special business logic instead of EE’s.

SWIFT_PRINT_VIEW

This is used to control whether or not the outgoing SWIFT message to be printed follows the same format as the message view displayed within the EE system.

  • TRUE, in which the outgoing SWIFT message to be printed follows the same format as the message view displayed within the EE system based on the project level requirement.

  • FALSE, in which the original logic is applied by the system for all regions.

The default value is FALSE.

SWIFT_REFORMAT_COMPONENT

This system parameter is used for defining the project-based Java class, which is used to reformat the outgoing SWIFT message content according to the project’s requirement (e.g., com.cs.stbank.SwiftReformater).

SWIFT_SEND_MODE

This is used to control the mode of sending the SWIFT message. The value may be:

  • ONLINE, in which the SWIFT message is sent along with the transaction data

  • OFFLINE, in which the SWIFT message is not sent immediately. The user has to run the Outgoing SWIFT Transmit function in the System Maintenance module to send it out manually.

The default value is OFFLINE.

SWIFT_TO_FOLDER

This is used for sending the generated SWIFT message to MQ or a physical folder. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the SWIFT message is sent to a physical folder. This

    folder is defined in the SWIFT_OUT_GOING_FOLDER system parameter

  • FALSE, in which the SWIFT message is sent to MQ according to the

    SWIFT Send Setting configuration in the SWIFT function

The default value is FALSE.

SWIFT_VALIDATION_FLAG

This is used to indicate whether the SWIFT Validation mechanism is to be used for verifying the outgoing SWIFT messages before it is sent to SWIFT Alliance. The validation strictly follows the rules defined in SWIFT Handbook. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the SWIFT validation is applied. If this value is

    selected, the system validates the values of the fields that are mapped to SWIFT tags against the SWIFT standards (i.e., message type, message format, tag length) defined in the [Parameter Drive]\mfvr parameter folder.

  • FALSE, in which SWIFT validation is not performed.

The default value is FALSE.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: If the value of this parameter is TRUE, the following default setting defined in the sysconf.properties file saved in the \mfvr\conf folder, is used:

# sqlite datafile name, if not exist, then check with EE DB EXIMT

swift.db.name=smms_null

# check bic, ccy, cnty against DB. Default is true

swift.db.check=true

SYS_INTF_VOUCHER_CLASS

This is used for specifying a project-based class. If a value is defined for this system parameter, the system runs the special business logic.

SYS_SWIFT_MANAGER_CLASS

If the value of this system parameter is not null, the system runs a special business logic.

TELEX_TRANSMIT_PATH

This is used to define the Telex path to which messages (e.g., SWIFT) are to be sent. If no value is defined for this parameter, the SWIFT message is sent to the default Telex path (i.e., <ee.output.dir>\TRXDATA\BankGroup\CountryCode\TELEX). This AP Server system parameter is used only if the SWIFT_TO_FOLDER parameter is set to TRUE.

TRXDATA_ATTACH_IMAGE

This is used to control whether or not the attachment data is to be sent together with the transaction data. The value true indicates that the attachment data is to be sent together with the transaction data.

TSU_SEND_MODE

This is used to control the mode of sending the TSU (Trade Services Utility) message. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • ONLINE, in which the TSU message is sent along with the transaction data

  • OFFLINE, in which the TSU message is not sent immediately. The user has to run the transmission function to send it out (manually).

The default value is OFFLINE.

VCH_PRT_ENTRY_NUMS

This system parameter is used to define the number of voucher entries to be shown on each page while printing.

VOUCHER_ACCOUNT_CHECK

This is used for checking the account numbers in a voucher generated from a transaction. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system checks if the account numbers in the

    voucher exist in the STAN data (STD_AC_NUMBER table)

  • FALSE, in which the system does not perform any checks

The default value is TRUE.

VOUCHER_BALANCE_CHECK

This is used for checking credit balances. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system performs balance check by voucher entry based on the value of the DC_VALID_TYPE field defined in each voucher rule XML

  • FALSE, in which the system does not perform any balance checks

If no value is specified for this parameter, the system performs a credit balance check.

The default value is TRUE.

VOUCHER_NEGATIVE_CHECK

This is used for checking the vouchers generated with a transaction for negative values. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system checks and controls that the voucher does not have a negative D/C amount

  • FALSE, in which the system does not perform any negative balance checks

If no value is specified, the system checks for negative values in the transaction. If the value of the VOUCHER_BALANCE_CHECK is also null, the system performs a check for negative values before it performs a balance check on the transaction.

The default value is TRUE.

WIDGET

This controls whether or not the system uses the Dashboard widget. This value may be:

  • TRUE, in which case the EE shows the Dashboard Widget composed of the Quick Launch, Bar and Pie graphs, Calendar, Transaction List, and Filter sub-widgets.

  • FALSE (or blank), in which case EE shows the Quick Launch.

  • NEW_WIDGET, in which case the EE displayes the new SCF Dashboard. This option requires a seies of configuration.

[NOTE:]{.underline}

For more details on widgets, refer to the EE FAQs documentation.

{#section .CS-head1}

Web Server System Parameters

Parameters with this attribute are those used by or run in the EE web server.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: The RATE_CHECK_PRICEDATE and SYS_STD_BLOC_REFUSE system parameters are currently not used.

ACCESSLOGIN_LOG_ForDB

This is used to control whether the Access Login Log is to be recorded into the database. The system login and logoff details are recorded into the EXIMUSER.SEC_LOGIN_ACESS_LOG table.

The default value of this field is blank.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: This system parameter is for a hierarchical deployment system. For a normal deployment system, access login log is still record according to the settings defined in the EE_Log_Config.xml.

ARC_DELRESTORE_PROTECT

This is used to control whether the Delete Restored Data flag from the Restore Archived Data function catalog is protected or enabled for modification by the user. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the Delete Restored Data flag is marked and protected by default. In this case, a user is not able to unmark the flag.

  • FALSE, in which the Delete Restored Data flag is enabled and marked by default. In this case, a user is able to mark or unmark this flag as required.

CATALOG_ALPHABETIC_NON_CASESENSITIVE

This is used to specify whether entries in a catalog column are sorted alphabetically with case sensitivity or without case sensitivity. This parameter may have the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system is not case-sensitive.

  • FALSE, in which the system is case-sensitive.

The default value of this parameter is FALSE.

CATALOG_CHECKDATA

This is used to control whether or not the catalog criteria is to be invoked again after a record is selected from the catalog transactions list. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the original logic is applied. The catalog criteria is invoked before the catalog transactions list is displayed. Once a record is selected and the Next button is clicked on, the catalog criteria is again invoked before the transaction screen is shown.

  • FALSE, in which the catalog criteria is invoked before the catalog transactions list is displayed.

The default value is TRUE.

CATALOG_DEL_ARCHIVED_CHECKBOX_HIDDEN

This is used to control whether the Delete Archived Data and the Restore Delete Restored flags are hidden in the catalog page of the archiving function.

  • TRUE, in which the Delete Archived Data and the Deleted Restored Data flags are hidden.

  • FALSE, in which the Delete Archived Data and the Deleted Restored Data flags are displayed on the catalog page.

CATALOG_ IGNORE_CASE

This is used to control the default setting of the Ignore Case flag in function catalogs. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE or blank, in which the Ignore Case flag in function catalogs is unmarked by default. The system ignores the case when filtering records.

  • FALSE, in which the Ignore Case flag in function catalogs is selected by default. The system does not ignore the case when filtering records.

The default value is blank.

CHANGE_PSW_CHECK

This method is used to control whether a user is automatically logged out when the maximum number of unsuccessful logons due to incorrect password has been reached. The available options for this parameter are:

  • TRUE, in which a user is logged out of the system if the user

    reaches the maximum number of times allowed for incorrect password input.

  • FALSE, in which the user is not logged out of the system even if the

    maximum number of logon retries as has been reached.

CONFIRM_PREVIEW_VOUCHER

This is used to control wheteher or not the system automatically displays the voucher upon confirmation, release, or authorization of transaction. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system automatically displays the voucher.

  • FALSE, in which the system does not automatically display the voucher.

The default value is FALSE.

CROSS_CCY

This system parameter is used during rate conversion applying the parameters of the system method SYS_GetExchangeRateAMT_S(sFromCcy,sToCcy,sRateType,strAmt,sFieldNameOrVarName,byReciprocal,sToleField,sToleTableName,sSQLWhere,sucFn,failedFn,decimal). This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which, during rate conversion, the system executes the

    conversion process by using the exchange rates obtained through the SYS_GetExchangeRateAMT_S() system method. The order of obtaining exchange rates is: FromCCY_ToCCY>ToCCY_FromCCY>Local CCY. That is, if the FromCCY_ToCCY is not available, the system proceeds to getting the value of ToCCY_FromCCY and so on

  • FALSE, in which the system executes the conversion using the local

    currency

  • NOLOCAL, in which the system does not auto-convert using the local

    currency and, throws an exception if the FromCCY_ToCCY and ToCCY_FromCCY are not available.

C_USE_REFNO_POOL

This is used to control whether the system retrieves the reference number from the reference number pool or through the old reference processing logic. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the reference number is retrieved from the reference

    pool, where reference numbers are stored.

  • FALSE, in which the system uses the old logic which involves

    retrieving the reference number through a rule defined in the Reference Number Maintenance function group in the Standing Data module.

The default value is TRUE.

DEBUG_MODE

This is used for defining the Web browser mode of the running environment.

This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the internet toolbar and the IE hot menu are still made available when the user logs on the EE system via browser. The parameter files are loaded and parsed each time a transaction is run.

  • FALSE, in which the user is prevented from righ-clicking on the browser and using certain keys (i.e., Esc, F5, F6, F11, and F12).

The default value is FALSE.

[NOTE:]{.underline}

Regardless of the DEBUG_MODE setting, the Backspace key is:

  • disabled for protected fields; and

  • enabled for other field types

For blank areas on the screen where transaction fields may be expected, the Backspace key is disabled if the DEBUG_MODE setting is FALSE.

EC_PROCESS_INITIALSSS

This is used to control whether the initial Servser-side Script (SSS) is invoked in the Fix Pending function. The possible values for this parameter are:

  • TRUE, in which the intial SSS is invoked in the Fix Pending function

  • FALSE, in which the initial SSS is not invoked in the Fix Pending

    function

If this parameter is not set, the system follows the rule for the FALSE value.

ERR_PWD_LOCK_TIMES

This system parameter is used for setting the allowed number of entry times before the system locks out the transaction user from accessing the web application due to incorrect login password. A numeric value is expected here. The default value is 5.

FLOW_ACTIVE

This is used to activate the function flow processing logic. This parameter may have the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system activates the function flow processing logic

  • FALSE or null, in which the original processing logic is used

The default value is null.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: This system parameter - together with the SLA_ACTIVE system parameter – is used to activate the SLA function flow mode for a particular country. To control the SLA function flow settings for the whole EE system, the FLOW_ACTIVE and SLA_ACTIVE security parameters must be set. Refer to the Chapter Two: Security Parameters section for more details. For addition information on SLA settings, refer to the EE Service Level Agreement Reference document.

GAPI_VIEW_FLAG

This is used to control whether or not an operator is allowed to preview or view the GAPI message during transaction processing. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system allows the user to preview or view the GAPI message when processing a transaction. The same rule applies if no value is defined for the system parameter.

  • FALSE, in which previewing or viewing a GAPI message while a transaction is being processed is not allowed.

The default value is TRUE.

INTP_BLANK_VAL

This is used to define whether a blank option value is automatically added for every Interpreter-type field in the transaction screen during runtime. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which a blank option value is added although this has not

    been defined for the Interpreter field

  • FALSE, in which only the user-defined option values are shown in the

    dropdown list. No blank option is added

The default value is TRUE.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: To define whether or not a blank value option is added to specific Interpreter-type fields, the Blank Value flag in the Field Conversion Dialog window can be used. This setting is defined in the Field Conversion function of the Maintenance function group. The Blank Value field in the Field Conversion settings is prioritized over the INTP_BLANK_VAL parameter value. For more details on field conversion and the Blank Value flag, refer to EE Utility Reference: Maintenance Functions.

I_REFNOPOOL_SIZE

If C_USE_REFNO_POOL is set to TRUE, this system parameter can be used to define the quantity of reference numbers that are loaded when the reference pool is used.

The default value is 10.

LIKE_FLAG

This is used to control whether or not a % character is automatically appended to the keyword defined in the filter field in the catalog page. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which a % is not appended to the keyword defined in the

    catalog page. If the % sign is not appended to the keyword, the system retrieves all records ending in the specified value.

  • FALSE, in which a % is automatically added after the keyword in the

    catalog page. If a % is appended to the keyword, the system retrieves all records which middle values correspond to the defined value.

If no value is defined, the % is not appended.

MENU_MODE

This is used for controlling the menu style of the EE system. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • ONCLICK, in which the EE transaction menu expands and collapses only

    when the user clicks on the function group folders

  • ONMOUSE, in which a folder on the EE transaction menu expands and

    collapses upon mouse-over

The default value is ONCLICK.

MODULESORT

This is used to define the way by which the modules and function groups are sorted in the EE browser. The possible values for this parameter are:

  • TRUE, in which modules and function groups are arranged according to description.

  • FALSE, in which in which modules and function groups are arranged according to the sequence of user’s FAPs in the relevant XML file.

If no value is specified in this parameter, the system considers the value as FALSE

PD_CHECK_CLASS

This is used to define the class to be used for checking the password when creating a user through the Security Manager. The actual methods used for checking the user password are defined through the Password Check option in the Calculation function and generated in the SYS_PD.js file.

PWD_EXPIRED_EXTEND_DAYS

This system parameter is used for indicating the number of days the user is allowed to change the password after it expires. A numeric value must be specified here.

RELE_MUTI_REVC

This system parameter is used for indicating whether the system can perform multi-release transactions. The possible values for this parameter are:

  • TRUE, in which the system allows the releasing of multiple

    transactions

  • FALSE, in which releasing of multiple transactions is not allowed

The default value is FALSE.

RATE_CHECK_PRICEDATE

This is used to control whether or not PRICE_DATE is the primary key in the Exchange Rate tables (STD_EXCHAN_RATE, STT_EXCHAN_RATE). This may have one of the following values:

  • T, in which PRICE_DATE is the primary key of the Exchange Rate tables.

  • F, in which PRICE_DATE is not the primary key of the Exchange Rate tables. Multiple records are returned in SQL operations or inquiries.

The default value is F.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: To control how the system retrieves the exchange rate for the charge checking price date:

- Set the value of this system parameter to T; and

- Define the following keyword in the [Parameter drive]\EE_SYS\SYST\EE_Charge_Config.xml file: <keywords name="EXCHAGERATE_WITH_PRICE_DATE" value="1900-01-01" description=""/>

If there is no price date specified in the transaction, the system gets the exchange rate using the default price date value of "1900-01-01".

RELEASE_NOT_BYSELF

This is the system-level parameter that is used to control whether or not a user may release his own transaction. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the user who created the transaction may not release it

  • FALSE, in which the creator of the transaction may also be the releaser. If this is the value specified, the system then checks the function-level setting (i.e., Non-Self setting in the Catalog function) to determine whether a user is allowed to release his own transaction.

If no value is defined, a user is not allowed to release his own transaction.

The default value is TRUE.

SEC_USER_MIN_LEN

This system parameter is used for specifying the minimum length of a user ID. If it is defined as 6, for example, the user Id being created in EE via Security Manager must at least be 6 characters long.

If this system parameter is blank, the system defaults the value to 6.

SELECT_MAX_RECORDS

This is used to define the maximum number of records that may be selected (in the catalog page) for processing in the relevant function. If multiple records are selected, the records are processed according to the sequence of the selection. A record may be skipped by clickin on the Next button, after which, the system proceeds with processing the next selected record.

The maximum value for this parameter is 200.

SESSION_TIMEOUT

This is used to set the web session timeout, in minutes, in EE. If it is set to 100, for example, the system terminates the current session and logs off the user automatically if this user has been inactive for 100 minutes.

SHOW_DATETIMEININQEXCHRATE

This system parameter is used to define whether or not the Change Date Time field is to be displayed on the Inquire Exchange Rate function screen in EE. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • FALSE, in which the Change Date Time field is not displayed on the

    Inquire Exchange Rate function screen on EE.

  • TRUE, in which the Change Date Time field is displayed on the

    Inquire Exchange Rate function screen on EE.

The defaults value is FALSE.

SHOW_REJECT_BUTTON

This is used to control whether the Reject button is shown on the release screen. The value may be:

  • TRUE, in which the Release, as well as the Reject and Refuse buttons are displayed on the release screen.

  • FALSE, in which the Reject button on the release screen is not displayed. If the system parameter is set to this value, only the Release and Refuse buttons are shows on the screen.

The default value is FALSE.

SLA_ACTIVE

This is used to activate the SLA processing logic. This parameter may have the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system activates the SLA processing logic.

  • FALSE or blank, in which the original processing logic is used.

The default value is blank.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: This system parameter - together with the FLOW_ACTIVE system parameter – is used to activate the SLA function flow mode for a particular country. To control the SLA function flow settings for the whole EE system, the FLOW_ACTIVE and SLA_ACTIVE security parameters must be set. Refer to the Chapter Two: Security Parameters section for more details. For addition information on SLA settings, refer to the EE Service Level Agreement Reference document.

SSO_ADLDAP_URL

This is used to define the URL of the AP (Active Directory) or LDAP (Lightweight Directory Access Protocol) that the EE system connects to (e.g., ldap://eximbills.com:389).

SSO_CHECK_ADAPTER

This is used to set the value with the adapter's name. If the validating component is designed by the bank, the parameter's value must be the related adapter's name. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • EEADValidatorAdpt, in which the value is validated against the Active Director.

  • EELDAPValidatorAdptimp, in which the value is validated against LDAP.

[NOTE:]{.underline}

The available values mentioned in this reference for this system parameter are the standard adapters provided by the EE system. Adapters are typically developed by banks based on requirements, thus, the value of this parameter is the project-level adapter's name.

SSO_DOMAIN

This is used to specify the name of the domain to be used by the system (e.g., SYS_DOMAIN).

SSO_LOGOFF_LOCATION

This is used to define the path to the JSP file that is to be used as the confirmation page when the Super Security Officer logs off the system (e.g., Y:\screeN\SYS_LogOff.jsp).

SWIFT_BK_ADD

This system parameter is used to define the field name that store the address of the bank that will receive the outgoing SWIFT message. Multiple field names can be defined by using a comma as the delimeter.

SWIFT_BK_KEY

This system parameter is used to define the field name that stores the BIC code of the bank that is to receive the outgoing SWIFT message.

SWIFT_BK_NM

This system parameter is used to define the field name that stores the name of the bank that is to receive the outgoing SWIFT message.

SWIFT_BK_TABLE

This system parameter is used to define the table name that stores the information of the bank that is to receive the outgoing SWIFT message.

SWIFT_ROWS_BY_VALUE

This is used to control whether the system should show the rows of a SWIFT narrative tag according to the size of the tag value. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • T, in which a placeholder with a size that fits the tag value is shown

  • F, in which the placeholder of each tag is displayed with the size defined in the SWIFT Tag Checking function found in the Edit SWIFT Tag window when configuring SWIFT Template Tag settings.

The default value is F.

{width="4.989583333333333in” height="2.6666666666666665in”}

Figure 3. Example: SWIFT_ROWS_BY_VALUE = ‘T’

Figure 3. Example: SWIFT_ROWS_BY_VALUE = ‘F’ or SWIFT_ROWS_BY_VALUE = ‘'

SYS_ADD_DIARY_FUNC_ID

This is used to define the function Id of the Add System Diary function. This parameter is applied if the value of the SYS_DIARY system parameter is TRUE.

SYS_CHECK_FIELD

This is used to control whether or not the system checks the field length and type when the page is submitted. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE or blank or if this system parameter does not exist – in which case the system checks the field against the screen XML.

  • FALSE, in which case the system does not check the fields against the screen XML

The default value is TRUE.

SYS_DIARY

This is used to control the way by which the system Diary details are stored.

  • TRUE, in which the Diary details are stored into the EXIMSYS.TRX_CDRY_HEADER and EXIMSYS.TRX_CDRY_DTAL system tables.

  • FALSE, in which the Diary details are stored into the EXIMTRX.CDRY_MASTER and EXIMTRX.CDRY_LEDGER transaction tables.

The default value is FALSE.

SYS_EOD_CROSS_PC

This system parameter is used to control whether EOD may be run for different process centers or not. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which EOD may be run for multiple process centers, at the same time

  • FALSE, in which EOD may not be run for multiple process centers

SYS_EXRATE_NOT_SHOW_ERR

This system parameter is used for specifying whether or not an error message is displayed if an exchange rate is not found when the SYS_GetExchangeRate_S() function is run, given that its notShowErr parameter is not defined. If the notShowErr is defined, however, the system follows this value and ignores the SYS_EXRATE_NOT_SHOW_ERR system parameter. This may have the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system does not display an error message when the specified exchange rate is not found.

  • FALSE, in which the system displays an error message.

SYS_GET_ERATE_DEF

This is used to control how the system retrieves the exchange rate when From CCY equals To CCY. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • FALSE, in which the system returns 1 as an exchange rate value when

    From CCY equals To CCY

  • TRUE, in which the system queries the exchange value from the

    database and returns the relevant value. If the system cannot find the exchange rate from the database according to the given parameters, it still returns 1.

The default value is FALSE.

SYS_SOD_CHECK_HOLIDAY

This is used to control whether the holiday and weekend settings are checked during SOD / EOD, on either manual or batch mode. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system checks the holiday when performing a manual or batch SOD / EOD. The default business date for SOD / EOD is the current system date. The system does not run SOD / EOD if it is not a workday.

  • FALSE, in which the system does not check the holiday when performing a manual or batch SOD / EOD. The default business date for SOD / EOD is the current system date. The system runs SOD / EOD even if it is not a workday.

  • TRUE_WITH_BUSI_DATE, in which the system checks the holiday when performing a manual SOD / EOD task. The default business date is a workday (last business date + 1), excluding a holiday.

  • FALSE_WITH_BUSI_DATE, in which the system does not check the holiday when performing a manual or batch SOD / EOD. The default business date is a workday (last business date + 1), including a holiday.

  • TRUE_WITH_BUSI_DATE_CONTINUE, in which the system checks the holiday when performing a manual EOD. If it is a holiday, an alert message is displayed: the user may decide whether or not to run Cut Time on a holiday. This value is only used if Cut Time is defined for the system. (Cut Time pertains to the process of initializing or stopping the transmission of accounting vouchers.)

The default value is TRUE.

SYS_STD_BLOCK_REFUSE

This is used to control whether or not to disable the Refuse option when releasing a Standing Data record which status is set to U (Updated). This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the Refuse option is disabled when releasing a Standing Data record which status is set to U (Updated).

  • FALSE or null, in which the original logic is applied and the Refuse option is made available during release.

The default value is null.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: The available transaction status when releasing Standing Data records are:

• I - add

• M - release

• U - update

• D - delete

• R - refuse

VCH_AMT_SINGLE_COL

This controls whether or not the amount of the generated voucher is retrieved from the N_AMT field. This may have one of the following values:

  • F, in which case the amount of the debit and credit equals the value of N_AMT

  • T, in which the credit amount is retrieved from N_AMT_C, and the debit amount from N_AMT_D

VIEW_SIGNED_DOCUMENT_PATH

This Web Server system parameter is used to define the path in which the returned signed documents, or documents that were initially rejected but have been reprocessed in the Signed Documents Maintenance function, are stored.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: Refer to the Signed Documents Maintenance Function discussion in the EE BIRT Report Engine manual for more information on this parameter.

WEB_CATALOG_REPLACE_USER_ID_WITH_DESC

This system parameter is used to control how the fields related to the USER_ID field are displayed on the Catalog screen. This may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which all fields related to the USER_ID field (i.e., CLERK_ID, C_USER_ID, C_RELE_BY, and C_CREA_BY) are displayed as C_USER_DESC

  • FALSE, in which all fields related to the USER_ID field (i.e., CLERK_ID, C_USER_ID, C_RELE_BY, and C_CREA_BY) are displayed as C_USER_ID

The default value is blank.

WEB_IMAGE_BATCH_START_TIME

This system parameter is used for specifying the start time of each image batch task. The value follows this format: YYYY-MM-DD.

WEB_IMAGE_MAX_FILE_SIZE

This system parameter is used to define the maximum size of an image file that can be uploaded in the image interface. The unit used is Kilobytes. The maximum value that may be defined is 5000 Kb. The default value is 2000.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: If the database used is DB2, the WEB_IMAGE_MAX_FILE_SIZE value must not exceed the size of EXIMSYS.TRX_IMAGES_TEMP.B_IMAGE_CONTENT in the DB2 database.

WEB_IMAGE_ROOT_PATH

This system parameter is used to set the image root path. When this is defined, the system saves the image files uploaded in EE transactions to the defined path. When the Image Batch Upload function is run, the system goes directly to this path to search for the image files and save them in the database. The recommended path is a local drive (e.g., c:\images). It is not advisable to use mapped drives (x:\images).

WEB_IMG_TOTAL_FILES_MAX_SIZE

This system parameter is used to define the maximum total size of all image files that can be uploaded in the image interface in one transaction. The unit used is Kilobytes. The maximum value that may be defined is 20000 Kb. The default value is blank.

WEB_SCRN_TEXTAREA_IGNORE_NLCR

This system parameter is used to control whether or not a new line is counted in the total number of characters specified in a textarea field. This may have one of the following values:

  • FALSE, in which a new line is counted in the total number of characters

  • TRUE, in which a new line is not counted in the total number of characters

The default value is blank.

WIDGET

The WIDGET system parameter controls which widgets are displayed on the EE dashboard. This can be set to any of the following values:

  • FALSE or null, wherein only the Quick Launch widget is displayed;

  • TRUE, wherein the dashboard widget and sub-widgets for general transaction details are displayed along with the Quick Launch widget; and

  • NEW_WIDGET, wherein the SCF-related dashboard widgets are displayed along with the Quick Launch widget.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: For additional information on widgets, refer to the EE FAQs documentation.

{#section-1 .CS-head1}

Web/AP Server System Parameters

Parameters with this attribute are used by or run in the EE application and web servers.

CALL_EJB_MODE

This is used to control whether or not EJB is used. Setting this parameter to EJB_MODE indicates that if EE is deployed under a distribution model, the EJB parameters must be defined. On the other hand, if this parameter is set to CLASS_MODE, EJB is not used by the system.

HIERACHY_AUTHORIZATION

This parameter is used to control whether to apply the level-by-level authorization mode. The possible values are TRUE and FALSE. The default value is FALSE.

LMTS_SHARE_STATEMENT

This parameter is used to control whether the system is to prompt that the limit may be shared and displays the LMTS Share List window after a transaction is confirmed. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the system displays the LMTS Share List window if a transaction goes overlimit and Share Limit settings exist for the customer

  • FALSE, in which a transaction that goes overlimit may not be confirmed

SODEOD_BY_PC

This is used for controlling which user can run the SOD function. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which only the process center operator can perform the SOD and EOD functions

  • FALSE, in which the process center operator and branch operator can run the SOD and EOD functions

The default value is TRUE.

SWIFT_BIC_EXT

This is used to control whether the BIC code is to be extended to show the bank’s name and address in printouts of outgoing SWIFT messages or when users view the messages. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the users can view and print the outgoing SWIFT message with the BIC code extended to show the bank’s name and address

  • FALSE, in which the bank’s name and address are not shown

The default value is FALSE.

SYS_KP_PROTECT

This parameter is used to control whether the fields in a pending transaction are protected when it is loaded in a KP function. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • T, in which the fields from the pending transaction are protected

  • F, in which the fields from the previous transaction are not protected

The default value is T.

SYS_SOD_ONLY_TIME

This is used to control whether the SOD and EOD functions can be run several times in the day. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which the user can run SOD, but must also run EOD before another SOD process. Within one day, the user can run SOD and EOD several times

  • FALSE, in which the user can run SOD several times a day without having to run EOD also.

The default value is FALSE.

{#section-2 .CS-head1}

Utility Workbench System Parameters

Parameters with this attribute are those used by or run in the EE Utility Workbench.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: The BPM_PARAM_PATH and IS_LOAD_INITEC system parameters are currently not used.

AUTO_GENERATE_XML_CONTROLLER

This system parameter is used to control whether XML files are to be automatically generated or not. This may have one of the following values:

  • Not Generate, in which XML files are not automatically generated and manual XML generation must be done;

  • Generate and need not ask, in which the system generates XML files automatically, without asking for confirmation from the user;

  • Generate and ask, in which XML files are automatically generated after user confirmation. In this case, the system displays a message confirming whether XML files are to be generated after a configuration is saved; and

  • Null, in which the system does not automatically generate XML files. This is similar to the “Not Generate” value.

The default value is Not Generate.

CATALOG_PATH

This system parameter is used for defining the folder of the catalog JSP files for a specific Bank-Country group. In catalog settings, the EE Utility directly points to this path.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

Y:\SYS_DOMAIN\WEB\CATA

CLAUSE_PREFIX

This system parameter is used for defining the prefix of the transaction field name that the user has inserted in a clause template.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

If the CLAUSE_PREFIX and CLAUSE_SUFFIX are defined as [[[ and ]]] respectively, the fields inserted in a clause template are generated as…[[[FLD_NAME]]]… in the clause XML file. The system can then determine that the content between [[[ and ]]] is a transaction field name and, as a consequence, retrieve the field value dynamically from the transaction and insert the value in the clause. If there’s no value specified for CLAUSE_PREFIX, the system retrieves the default value: [[[.

CLAUSE_SUFFIX

This system parameter is used for defining the suffix of the transaction field name that the user has inserted in a clause template.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

If the CLAUSE_PREFIX and CLAUSE_SUFFIX are defined as [[[ and ]]] respectively, the fields inserted in a clause template are generated as…[[[FLD_NAME]]]… in the clause XML file. The system can then determine that the content between [[[ and ]]] is a transaction field name and, as a consequence, retrieve the field value dynamically from the transaction and insert the value in the clause. If there’s no value specified for CLAUSE_PREFIX, the system retrieves the default value: [[[.

CVS_RELEASE_PATH

This is used to define the path to be used by the administrator for releasing parameters (CVS).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

C:\RECVS

CVS_SUBMIT_PATH

This is used to define the path to be used by the operator for submitting parameters (CVS).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

C:\SUBCVS

DATE_FORMAT

This is used for defining the date format to be used in EE Utility. This system parameter may have one of the following values:

  • dd/MM/yyyy

  • dd/MM/yy

  • yyyy/MM/dd

  • yy/MM/dd

  • MM/dd/yyyy

  • MM/dd/yy

  • yyyy-MM-dd

  • yy-MM-dd

  • MM-dd-yy

  • MM-dd-yyyy

  • dd-MM-yy

  • dd-MM-yyyy

The default value is yyyy-MM-dd.

DRMWEAVER_PLUGIN_PATH

This system parameter is used for appointing the installation path of the Dreamweaver application on the application server. When the path is defined, EE Utility generates the EE Snippets in the Snippets folder of the Dreamweaver application

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

The value of the DRMWEAVER_PLUGIN_PATH system parameter is –

C:\Program Files\Macromedia\Dreamweaver MX

In this case, the EE Snippets are generated in this path –

C:\Program Files\Macromedia\Dreamweaver MX\Configuration\Snippets\EEField

FORMSET_PATH

This system parameter is used for defining the physical path of the document templates (*.htm files) that are used to generate forms for a Bank-Country group (e.g., Y:\).

GAPI_EXP_PATH

This system parameter is used for specifying the path where the XML files of function screens, to be used in the GAPI function, are generated (e.g., X:\TRXDATA\GAPI_EXP).

GAPI_IMP_PATH

This system parameter is used for specifying the path where the import XML files for GAPI are stored (e.g., X:\TRXDATA\GAPI_IMP).

GEN_WEB_ROOTPATH

This system parameter is used to defining the root path of the web pages in their original format (e.g., Y:\).

GEN_XML_ROOTPATH

This system parameter is used for defining the directory of the generated XML files for the EE Utility parameters (e.g., X:\)

IS_BACKUP_RESTORE_INFO

This system parameter is used to control whether or not a backup of a created or modified parameter is to be generated. The backup is stored as a ZIP file in the EXIMMETA.ECD_VC_HISTORY table. This parameter may have one of the following values:

  • TRUE, in which a backup of the created or modified parameter is generated. If this is the value selected, the backup file may be retrieved through the Audit Log function and the parameter may be restored to its previous state.

  • FALSE, in which a backup file is not generated.

IS_GENERATE_RETURN_STATEMENTS

This system parameter is used to specify whether or not the EE Utility must generate 'return true' statements automatically. This parameter only takes effect in Confirm Business Check methods, and may have one of the following values:

  • ALWAYS, in which the EE Utility generates 'return true' statements automatically at all times.

  • AUTO, in which the EE Utility generates 'return true' statements automatically if the Confirm Business Check method in a function is either not defined or is empty. Otherwise, if the Confirm Business Check method in a function contains values, 'return true' statements are [not]{.underline} automatically generated.

  • NOT or null, in which the EE Utility generates 'return true' statements automatically, if the Confirm Business Check method is not defined in a function. Otherwise, if the Confirm Business Check method in a function is defined with empty content or if there are values defined for the method, 'return true' statements are [not]{.underline} automatically generated.

The default value is null.

JS_PATH

This system parameter is used for defining the physical path of the calculation JS files of a Bank-Country group (e.g., Y:\JS).

MAILTEMPLATE_FOLDER

This system parameter is used for specifying the path of the mail templates (e.g., Y:\MAILTEMPLATE).

ONLINE_REPORT_PATH

This is used to define the path of the online report query page.

REPORT_TEMPLATE

This system parameter is used for specifying the path of the report templates (e.g., Y:\REPORT).

SCREEN_DESIGN

This system parameter is used for appointing the path of the installed Dreamweave.exe program on the Application server (e.g., C:\Program Files\Macromedia\Dreamweaver 8\Dreamweaver.exe).

Through this, the user can directly edit the JSP screen by clicking on the Design button on the Screen function of the EE Utility. The EE Utility automatically invokes the Dreamweave.exe application from the defined path and opens the JSP file for editing.

SECU_PATH

This system parameter is used for specifying the path of the JSP files used in the Security Manager (e.g., Y:\screen\SECU).

SOA_PATH

This system parameter is used for specifying the path of the SOA parameters (e.g., X:\MBConfig)

STD_PATH

This system parameter is used for specifying the path of the JSP files used in the Standing Data module (e.g., Y:\screen\STD).

SYSTEM_ENVIRONMENT

This is a system parameter that must be created by the Administrator, after being assigned with the CVS tool. This defines the type of the current system environment. This may have one of the following pre-defined values:

  • DEV, which pertains to the Development Environment type

  • SIT, which pertains to the Synthetical Test environment type

  • UAT, which pertains to the User Acceptance Test environment type

  • PRO, which pertains to the Production environment type

WEB_SRCPATH

This is used for specifying the root path of the EE transaction JSP files on the Web server (e.g., Y:\).

{#section-3 .CS-ChapterTitle}

Components

  • overview

  • control components

  • business components

  • gapi components

Overview

A component determines the business rules to be used in transactions. The Component Manage function is used by programmers to add and maintain components in the system.

There are three types of components:

  • Control

  • Business

  • GAPI

Figure 4. Component Manage Function

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: The Business File component type is reserved for special projects only.

Control Components

Control components are used as main programs for functions. These regulate the steps within a function.

Figure 4. Setting the Main Program of a Transaction Function

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: The Trx BOC Authorize component is used for special projects only.

Control Component Control Component Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **ArchivingLogManager | | This is used in the | | ** | | Archiving Log Manager | | | | function, to archive | | | | log related | | | | information. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | ArchivingLogManag | | | | er | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | BIRTReportManager | | This is a report | | | | control component | | | | provided for report | | | | functions used the | | | | System Maintenance | | | | module of EE. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | BIRTReportManager | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **ChargeUnlockManager | | Some exceptions are | | ** | | encountered which | | | | causes the deferred | | | | charges to be locked. | | | | This component is | | | | used to unlock locked | | | | deferred charges. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | ChgManagerUnlock | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | CrystalReportManage | | This is used for | | r | | online report | | | | functions that use | | | | Crystal Report | | | | engine. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | CrystalReportMana | | | | ger | | | | | | | | Business Type: Auto | | | | Process Manager | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | eLOAN Control | | This is used for | | Manager | | eLOAN posting | | | | functions such as | | | | eLOAN Batch Interest | | | | Accrual, eLOAN Batch | | | | Posting, and eLOAN GL | | | | Batch Interface. A | | | | pre-defined screen is | | | | provided for this | | | | function. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | SecuBUToGOPReleas | | | | e | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | SECU Cache | | This is used for | | Manager | | security functions | | | | that refresh the | | | | cache content or | | | | update the parameters | | | | in the cache. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | SecuCacheManager | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | SECU Func to GOP | | This is used for | | Manager | | security functions | | | | that assign a | | | | function to a Global | | | | Operator. A | | | | pre-defined screen is | | | | provided for this | | | | function. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | SecuFuncToGOPMana | | | | ger | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | SECU Func to GOP | | This is used for | | Release | | security functions | | | | that release the | | | | function assignments | | | | of a global operator. | | | | A pre-defined screen | | | | is provided for this | | | | function. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | SecuFuncToGOPRele | | | | ase | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | SECU Release BU | | This is for security | | Function Manager | | functions that | | | | release the function | | | | assignments of a | | | | business unit. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | SecuBuFunRelease | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Release | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | SECU Release User | | This is for security | | Func Manager | | functions that | | | | release the function | | | | assignments of a | | | | user.
