A | | | | pre-defined screen is | | | | provided for this | | | | function. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | SecuSwitchUserRel | | | | easeManager | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | Refer to the EE | | | | Security Manager | | | | manual for more | | | | information on these | | | | Switch functions. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | SECU User Function | | This is for functions | | Manager | | that edit or update | | | | user function | | | | details, and | | | | functions that copy | | | | an operator's | | | | function assignment | | | | by branch. A | | | | pre-defined screen is | | | | provided for this | | | | function. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | SecuUserFunManage | | | | r | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | SECU User Manager | | This is used for | | | | security functions | | | | that edit/update | | | | different user | | | | information (e.g., | | | | Add New User, Edit | | | | Password, Add User, | | | | Modify User, and | | | | Unlock Locked Users). | | | | A pre-defined screen | | | | is provided for this | | | | function. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | SecuUserManager | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | SECU User Release | | This is used for | | Manager | | security functions | | | | that release user | | | | information. A | | | | pre-defined screen is | | | | provided for this | | | | function. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | SecuReleaseManage | | | | r | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | SECUErroManager | | This is used for the | | | | Error Message | | | | functions in the | | | | Security Manager. | | | | (Add Error Message | | | | Function, Edit Error | | | | Message Function, | | | | Delete Error Message | | | | Function, Inquire | | | | Error Message | | | | Function, | | | | Export/Import Error | | | | Message Function) | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | SecuErrorManager | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | SecuResetPasswordFo | | This used to reset | | rAll | | and encrypt the | | | | password of all EE | | | | users. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | SecuResetPassword | | | | ForAll | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | STD Manager | | This is used for | | | | system functions that | | | | perform the Add, | | | | Edit, and Delete | | | | processes of the | | | | Standing Data module | | | | (e.g., Add Account | | | | Number, Edit | | | | Currency, and Delete | | | | Fee Rate. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | STDManager | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | STD Master | | This is used for | | Manager | | security functions | | | | that generate master | | | | records in the | | | | Standing Data module. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | STDMasterManager | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | STD Release | | This is for functions | | Manager | | that perform release | | | | processes in the | | | | Standing Data module | | | | (e.g., Release | | | | Account Number, | | | | Release Currency, and | | | | Release Exchange | | | | Rate). | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | STDReleaseMgr | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Release | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx AP Batch Run | | This is used for | | | | transaction functions | | | | that automatically | | | | run semi-automatic | | | | batch processes. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxAPBatchRun | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Auto Process | | | | Manager | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx AP Copy Trxs | | This is used for | | | | transaction functions | | | | that create multiple | | | | copies of the same | | | | transaction. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxAPCopyTrxs | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Auto Process | | | | Manager | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | This is used in EE | | | | Version 1.0 only. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Assign Ref for | | This is used for | | Other SYS | | transaction functions | | | | that pre-assign the | | | | reference number to | | | | other systems (e.g., | | | | Trade Interface). | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxAssignRefNoFor | | | | OtherSYS | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Master Mgr | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx BIRT Report | | This is a report | | Manager | | control component | | | | provided for | | | | standalone report | | | | functions used for | | | | generating online | | | | transaction reports. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | BIRTReportManager | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Auto Process | | | | Manager | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Batch Manager | | This is used for | | | | system functions that | | | | perform Batch Manager | | | | tasks. This is used | | | | when the batch task | | | | is to be triggered by | | | | running a function | | | | and not according to | | | | a pre-defined | | | | schedule. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | BatchManager | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Browser Print | | This is used for | | | | batch printing on the | | | | browser side. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxBrowserPrint | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Cancellation | | This is used for | | Pending Manager | | transaction functions | | | | that roll back | | | | transactions to its | | | | previous condition or | | | | status. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxCancelPendingM | | | | gr | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Cancellation | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Cancellation | | This is used for | | Release Manager | | transaction functions | | | | that release the | | | | rolled back | | | | transactions. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxCancelRelMgr | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Cancellation | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Common | | This is used for | | Manager | | system functions that | | | | perform incoming | | | | SWIFT and voucher | | | | maintenance. A | | | | pre-defined screen is | | | | provided for this | | | | function. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxCommonManager | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Data Mining | | This is used for Data | | | | Mining functions. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxDataMining | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | This component is | | | | used in EE Version | | | | 1.0 only. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Delete Master | | This is used for | | | | transaction functions | | | | that delete records | | | | from the master | | | | table. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxManagerDeleteM | | | | aster | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Delete Master Mgr | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Delete Master | | This is used for | | Release | | transaction functions | | | | that release deleted | | | | master records. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxManagerRelease | | | | DeleteMaster | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Delete Master | | | | Release Mgr | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Delete | | This is used for | | Pending | | transaction functions | | | | that delete pending | | | | transactions. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxManagerDeleteP | | | | ending | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Delete Pending | | | | Mgr | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx EOD Manager | | This is used for | | | | system functions that | | | | perform the End of | | | | Day process. A | | | | pre-defined screen is | | | | provided for this | | | | function. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxEODMgr | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Start of Day & | | | | End of Day | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Export Logs | | This is used for | | | | transaction functions | | | | that export and | | | | display log | | | | information. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxExportLogs | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Manager | | This is used for | | Approve | | transaction functions | | | | that either approve a | | | | SWIFT message before | | | | it is sent or check | | | | this SWIFT message in | | | | the event of failure | | | | in the sending | | | | process. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxManagerApprove | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | TrxManagerApprove | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Manager | | This is used for | | Archiving | | functions that | | | | perform data | | | | archiving for | | | | transaction records. | | | | This is mostly done | | | | on a per module | | | | basis. A pre-defined | | | | screen is provided | | | | for this function. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxManagerArchivi | | | | ng | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Master Mgr | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Manager | | This is used for | | Authorization | | functions that | | | | authorize | | | | transactions or | | | | approve pending | | | | transactions. This | | | | changes the status | | | | (C_TRX_STATUS) of a | | | | record from P | | | | (Pending) to M | | | | (Master). | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxManagerRelease | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Authorize Trx | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | This component is | | | | used in EE Version | | | | 1.0 only. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Manager | | This is used for | | Authorized | | functions that | | | | perform | | | | authorization. It is | | | | similar to the Trx | | | | Auth Manager | | | | component. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxManagerAuthori | | | | zed | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Authorize Trx | | | | | | | | [NOTE: | | | | ]{.underline} | | | | | | | | This is used in EE | | | | Version 1.0 only. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Manager CT | | This is used for | | | | transaction functions | | | | that continue the | | | | processing of a saved | | | | transaction. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxManagerCT | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Continue Saved | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Manager EC | | This is used for | | | | transaction functions | | | | that either correct | | | | pending records or | | | | edit non-master | | | | records. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxManagerEC | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Error Correction | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Manager Inq | | This is used for | | | | transaction functions | | | | that inquire event, | | | | master, and pending | | | | records. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxManagerInq | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Inquire | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Manager KP | | This is used for | | | | transaction functions | | | | that retain or keep | | | | data as pending until | | | | these are processed | | | | by the next function. | | | | These transaction | | | | records are | | | | automatically given a | | | | P (Pending) | | | | transaction status | | | | (C_TRX_STATUS). | | | | These records do not | | | | require the Release | | | | process. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxManagerKP | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Continue Pending | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Manager | | This is used for | | Master | | transaction functions | | | | that inquire from and | | | | post directly into | | | | the master table. | | | | These transactions do | | | | not go through the | | | | Release procedure and | | | | are automatically | | | | given an M (Master) | | | | transaction status | | | | (C_TRX_STATUS). | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxManagerMaster | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Master Mgr | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Manager | | This is used for | | Pending | | transaction functions | | | | that require the | | | | Release process. | | | | These transactions | | | | are automatically | | | | given a P (Pending) | | | | transaction status | | | | (C_TRX_STATUS). | | | | Once the transaction | | | | is released, its | | | | status is updated to | | | | M (Master) | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxManagerPending | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Pending Mgr | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Manager | | This is used for | | Release | | managing transaction | | | | functions that | | | | approve pending | | | | transactions; this | | | | changes the status | | | | (C_TRX_STATUS) of a | | | | record from P | | | | (Pending) to M | | | | (Master) | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxManagerRelease | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Release | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Manager | | This is used for | | Unlock | | transaction functions | | | | that unlock locked | | | | transactions. This | | | | component updates the | | | | C_LOCKED_FLAG | | | | status of the record | | | | from Y to N. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxManagerUnlock | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx SOD and EOD | | This is used for | | | | security functions | | | | that enable the Start | | | | of Day and End of Day | | | | operations. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxSodEod | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Start of Day & | | | | End of Day | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx SOD Manager | | This is used for | | | | system functions that | | | | perform the Start of | | | | Day process. A | | | | pre-defined screen is | | | | provided for this | | | | function. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxSODMgr | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Start of Day & | | | | End of Day | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | TrxAuthManager | | This is used for | | | | functions in the | | | | Authorization Matrix | | | | Maintenance function | | | | group of the System | | | | Maintenance module. | | | | (e.g., Add/Edit | | | | Authorize Rule | | | | Setting, Assign | | | | Authorization Rule, | | | | Assign Common | | | | Authorization Rule, | | | | Authorization Level | | | | Setting, Delete | | | | Authorization Rule, | | | | Domain Function, | | | | Authorization Level | | | | by Function) | | | | | | | | ![](./media/image17.p | | | | ng){width="1.80208333 | | | | 33333333in” | | | | height="3.76041666666 | | | | 66665in”} | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxAuthManager | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **TrxManagerArchiving | | This is used for | | ** | | functions that | | | | perform data | | | | archiving for | | | | transaction records. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxManagerArchivi | | | | ng | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Master Mgr | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | TrxManagerAuthMatri | | This is used for | | xRelease | | functions that | | | | perform authorization | | | | in the Authorization | | | | Matrix Release | | | | process. | | | | | | | | ![](./media/image18.p | | | | ng){width="1.96875in” | | | | height="2.34375in”} | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxManagerAuthMat | | | | rixRelease | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Release | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | TrxUnlockManagerPen | | This is used for the | | ding | | function in the | | | | System Maintenance | | | | module that unlocks | | | | locked transactions. | | | | This component | | | | updates the | | | | C_LOCKED_FLAG | | | | status of the record | | | | from T (locked) to P | | | | (pending unlock). | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxUnlockManagerP | | | | ending | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | TrxUnlockManagerRel | | This is used for the | | ease | | function in the | | | | System Maintenance | | | | module that releases | | | | transactions with | | | | pending unlock | | | | status. This | | | | component updates the | | | | C_LOCKED_FLAG | | | | status of the record | | | | from P (pending | | | | unlock) to F | | | | (unlocked). | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxUnlockManagerR | | | | elease | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **UserBatchJobManager | | This is used for the | | ** | | User Batch Job | | | | Manager function, | | | | which is used to | | | | assign relevant jobs | | | | to particular users. | | | | Once the relevant | | | | jobs are attached to | | | | this function, the | | | | users that are | | | | assigned with this | | | | function may be able | | | | to access the jobs. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | UserBatchJobManag | | | | er | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **UserBatchLogManager | | This is used by the | | ** | | User Batch Log | | | | Manager and User | | | | Batch Exception Log | | | | Manager functions for | | | | operations that | | | | display the details | | | | and status of jobs | | | | and tasks. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | UserBatchLogManag | | | | er | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | UserBatchManager | | This is used by the | | | | User Batch Manager | | | | function for running | | | | user batch tasks. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | UserBatchManager | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | General Trx | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

Business Components

Business components are used as attributes for steps within functions.

Figure 4. Defining an Attribute Setting

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: These business components are reserved for future use: ASFABDEDIDispatch, ASIABDPostingToBA, ASOTMBDBusinessAdd, ASOTMBDBusinessDelete, ASOTMBDBusinessEdit, ASOTMBDBusinessTransferTo, ASOTMBDFinanceDR, ASOTMBDGenerateEDI, ASOTMBDGenerateGAPI, ASOTMBDRelationshipAdd, ASOTMBDRelationshipDelete, ASOTMBDRelationshipEdit, ASOTMBDRelationshipTransferTo, One to Many Add Multi Record, One to Many Add Single Record, One to Many Edit Multi Record, and One to Many Edit Single Record.

Business Component Business Component Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | AdjustEndline | | This is used by the | | | | Adjust Transaction | | | | SLA End Time function | | | | of the Service Level | | | | Agreement (SLA) | | | | feature. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | BookOfAccountBusi | | | | Intf | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | ChgManagerUnLock | | This is used for | | | | unlocking deferred | | | | charges in the EE | | | | browser. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | ChgManagerUnlock | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Copy OP User | | This is used for | | Function | | security functions | | | | that copy an operator | | | | function by branch. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxCombineSwiftMe | | | | ssage | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **TrxFixMasterEditRec | | This is used to | | ** | | update records, | | | | except the system | | | | field | | | | C_FUNC_SHORT_NAME, | | | | in the Master table. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxFixMasterEditR | | | | ec | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Edit Master | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

GAPI Components

General Application Programming Interfaces (GAPI) components are used for interfacing with other bank systems. These components are used when defining GAPI rules (i.e., Convert Class setting, which is the class that is used to handle user-specific requirements such as the message format and response parse).

Figure 4. Defining the GAPI Component in the GAPI Function

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: The BillPD_GAPIDocprep GAPI component is used for special projects only.

GAPI Component GAPI Component Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | ASFAGAPICalculateIn | | This is used in | | t | | factoring | | | | initialization for | | | | calculating the | | | | interest for Invoice. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | ASFAGAPICalculate | | | | Int | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | EJB | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | eLOAN EJB GAPI | | This component is | | | | used by the EE | | | | transaction functions | | | | to connect to the | | | | eLOAN subsystem. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | GAPI2IATrxBusines | | | | s | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | EJB | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Limits EJB GAPI | | This component is | | | | used by the EE | | | | transaction functions | | | | to connect to the | | | | LMTS subsystem. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxGenerateLMTS | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | EJB | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx GAPI Reformat | | This component is | | | | used by the EE | | | | transaction functions | | | | to reformat GAPI. | | | | This is used for | | | | EECore GAPI. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxGAPIReformatCo | | | | mponent | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | Component | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx Generate BA | | This is used for | | | | generating and | | | | sending the message | | | | to BA. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxGenerateBA | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | EJB | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Trx InSwift Send | | This is used to send | | | | the original message | | | | to the other system | | | | for incoming SWIFT, | | | | by MQ. | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | TrxInSwiftSend | | | | | | | | - Business Type: | | | | EJB | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

XML Generator Items

{#section-4 .CS-head1}

XML Generator Items

The created parameters and business logic are stored in the database as Meta data. For this Meta data to be accessible to the application server and the web server, it has to be converted to XML, which is the format used to communicate between the client and the server.

The XML Generator function, which is used to convert the Meta data to XML format, lists all parameters that must be converted to XML.

Figure 5. XML Generator Function

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE:

i. The SOA Calculation Validation parameter is reserved for future use.

ii. The BPM Function Information and BU File items are currently not used.

Item Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | AP Server Setting | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | an application server | | | | setting in the Server | | | | function. | | | | | | | | The XML file is | | | | generated in the | | | | following path: | | | | | | | | [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Country]\ | | | | \AP\APSERV | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Accounting Rules | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | an accounting rule in | | | | the Accounting Rules | | | | function. | | | | | | | | The XML files are | | | | generated in the | | | | following paths: | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\VCH | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\WEB\VCH | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Amount Format | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | an amount or rate | | | | format setting for a | | | | function using the | | | | Amount/Rate Format | | | | function. | | | | | | | | The XML files are | | | | generated in the | | | | following paths: | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\AMTFMT | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\WEB\AMTFMT | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Archiving | | Run this after | | | | creating or | | | | modifiying a setting | | | | defined in the | | | | Archiving function. | | | | | | | | The XML file is | | | | generated in the | | | | following path: | | | | | | | | [Parameter | | | | Drive]\EE_SYS\ARC | | | | HIVE | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Attribute | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | an attribute rule in | | | | the Attribute | | | | function. | | | | | | | | The XML file is | | | | generated in the | | | | following path: | | | | | | | | [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Country]\ | | | | \AP\FUNCATTR | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

a system batch task | | | | or user batch task in | | | | the Batch Manage | | | | function. | | | | | | | | The XML files are | | | | generated in the | | | | following paths: | | | | | | | | - [EXAMPLE:]{.underli | | | | ne} | | | | | | | | For the Catalog | | | | parameter: | | | | | | | | [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[BANK]\[ | | | | COUNTRY]\WEB\CATA | | | | | | | | For the System | | | | Parameter: | | | | | | | | [Parameter | | | | Drive]\EE_SYS\SYS | | | | T | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Incoming ISM | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | an incoming ISM | | | | message setting using | | | | the STP Setting | | | | function. | | | | | | | | The XML files are | | | | generated in the | | | | following paths: | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\STP\INISM\ | | | | ABU | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\STP\INISM | | | | \AFU | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\STP\INISM | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Incoming SWIFT | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | an incoming SWIFT | | | | message setting using | | | | the STP Setting | | | | function. | | | | | | | | The XML files are | | | | generated in the | | | | following paths: | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\STP\INSWT\ | | | | ABU | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Incoming TSU | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | an incoming TSU | | | | message setting using | | | | the STP Setting | | | | function. | | | | | | | | The XML files are | | | | generated in the | | | | following paths: | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\STP\INTSU\ | | | | ABU | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\STP\INTSU\ | | | | AFU | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Incoming XML | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | an incoming XML | | | | message setting using | | | | the STP Setting | | | | function. | | | | | | | | The XML files are | | | | generated in the | | | | following paths: | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\STP\INXML\ | | | | ABU | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\STP\INXML\ | | | | AFU | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Mail | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | a Mail rule using the | | | | Output Device | | | | function. | | | | | | | | The XML file is | | | | generated in the | | | | following path: | | | | | | | | [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Country]\ | | | | \AP\MAIL | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | MakeJSToClass | | Run this to convert | | | | the JS settings for | | | | any of the following | | | | JavaScript settings | | | | to a Java class: | | | | | | | | - Incoming XML | | | | | | | | - Incoming SWIFT | | | | | | | | - Function JS | | | | | | | | - Server Side JS | | | | | | | | - SWIFT Tag Rule | | | | | | | | - Auto Process | | | | | | | | The XML file is | | | | generated in the | | | | following paths: | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\jsss.jar | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\com | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Message Broker | | Run this after | | Setting | | creating or modifying | | | | a message broker | | | | setting using the | | | | Message Broker | | | | Setting function. | | | | | | | | The XML file is | | | | generated in the | | | | following path: | | | | | | | | [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Country]\ | | | | \AP\MSGBKR | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Message Mapping | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | an EE schema, a TSU | | | | mapping rule, or a | | | | Factoring mapping | | | | rule using the | | | | Message Mapping | | | | function. | | | | | | | | The XML files are | | | | generated in the | | | | following paths: | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\SCHEMAMAPPIN | | | | G | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\SCHEMAMAPPIN | | | | G\FACT\MAPPING | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\SCHEMAMAPPIN | | | | G\MAPPING | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Module | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | a module using the | | | | Module and Event | | | | function. | | | | | | | | The XML file is | | | | generated in the | | | | following path: | | | | | | | | [Parameter | | | | Drive]\EE_SYS\SYS | | | | T | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Multi Language | | Run following path: | | | | | | | | [Parameter | | | | Drive]\EE_SYS\I18 | | | | NResources | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Printer Manager | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | a printer queue | | | | setting using the | | | | Output Device | | | | function. | | | | | | | | The XML files are | | | | generated in the | | | | following paths: | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\RMPTSET | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\WEB\RMPRINT | | | | | | | | | | | | | | The XML files are | | | | generated in the | | | | following paths: | | | | | | | | Queue Manager and | | | | JNDI Manager | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\FTPMGR | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\WEB\FTPMGR | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Relation Mapping | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | a relation mapping | | | | setting using the | | | | Relation Mapping | | | | function. | | | | | | | | The XML file is | | | | generated in the | | | | following path: | | | | | | | | [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Country]\ | | | | \AP\TSU | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | SOD EOD | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | a Start of Day or End | | | | of Day task using the | | | | Subtask function. | | | | | | | | The XML files are | | | | generated in the | | | | following paths: | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\SODEOD | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\WEB\SODEOD | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | STD Business Unit | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | | | Drive]\EE_SYS\Uni | | | | tCode | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | SWIFT Message | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | a SWIFT setting using | | | | the SWIFT function. | | | | | | | | The XML files are | | | | generated in the | | | | following paths: | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\EE_SYS\ | | | | \N98SwiftIndex | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\SWIFT | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Say Total | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | settings using the | | | | Say Total function. | | | | | | | | The XML files is | | | | generated in the | | | | following path: | | | | | | | | [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Country]\ | | | | \WEB\SAYTOTAL | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Screen | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | a Screen rule using | | | | the Screen function. | | | | | | | | The XML files are | | | | generated in the | | | | following paths: | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\SCRN | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\WEB\SCRN | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Security System | | Run this after | | Parameter | | creating or modifying | | | | a security system | | | | parameter using the | | | | Security Parameters | | | | function. | | | | | | | | The XML file is | | | | generated in the | | | | following path: | | | | | | | | [Parameter | | | | Drive]\EE_SYS\SYS | | | | T | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Server Side JS | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | a Server Side JS rule | | | | using the Server Side | | | | JS function. | | | | | | | | The XML file is | | | | generated in the | | | | following path: | | | | | | | | [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Country]\ | | | | \AP\ServerSideJS | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | System Parameter | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | a system parameter | | | | using the System | | | | Parameter function. | | | | | | | | The XML files are | | | | generated in the | | | | following paths: | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\AP\SYST | | | | | | | | - [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Countr | | | | y]\WEB\SYST | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | TSU STP Setting | | Run this after | | | | modifying the | | | | settings in the TSU | | | | STP Setting function. | | | | | | | | The XML file is | | | | generated in the | | | | following path: | | | | | | | | [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Country]\ | | | | \AP\TSU | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | TSU Server | | Run this after | | Setting | | modifying the | | | | settings in the TSU | | | | Server Setting | | | | function. | | | | | | | | The XML file is | | | | generated in the | | | | following path: | | | | | | | | [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Country]\ | | | | \AP\TSU | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Table Structure | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | a table using the DB | | | | Dictionary function. | | | | | | | | The XML file is | | | | generated in the | | | | following path: | | | | | | | | [Parameter | | | | Drive]\EE_SYS\LAY | | | | OUT | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Thread JS Setting | | Run this after | | | | modifying the | | | | settings in the | | | | Thread JS Setting | | | | function. | | | | | | | | The XML file is | | | | generated in the | | | | following path: | | | | | | | | [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Country]\ | | | | \AP\TSU | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Transfer To | | Run this after | | | | creating or modifying | | | | a Transfer To rule | | | | | y]\AP\TRFT | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Voucher Output | | Run this to generate | | | | the table structure | | | | or layout of the | | | | accounting voucher. | | | | | | | | The XML file is | | | | generated in the | | | | following path: | | | | | | | | [Parameter | | | | Drive]\[Bank | | | | Group]\[Country]\ | | | | \WEB\PARASET | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

Server Side System Methods

  • ACCOUNTING RULES FUNCTION

  • batch manager function

  • server side js function

  • stp setting function

  • swift FUNCTION

  • transaction function components

  • subtask: auto process function

Accounting Rules Function

Methods

The system methods for the Accounting Rule function are as follows.

Figure 6. System Methods for the Accounting Rules Function

DV.getCurrentRecordStatus()

This is used to retrieve the current status of the DO record.

DV.SYS_getCUBK(String,String)

This is used to get the field value from a predefined transaction table using the Get CUBK rule. The field value that is returned is placed in the memory.

Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the Get CUBK mapping rule name.

  • String 2: This is the key field name of the Get CUBK rule.

This returns the field value that is selected from the database according to the Get CUBK rule.

DV.SYS_getTableData(String,String,String)

This method is used to get the table field values from the server side. **Parameters: **

  • String 1: This is the name of the table to be queried.

  • String 2: This is the query condition to be used.

  • String 3: This is the field list to be queried.

This returns an array of records resulting from the query.

**DV.SYS_getTableDataValue(String, String, String) **

This is used to retrieve the field value from the database. Parameters:

  • String: This pertains to the field list. If there are two columns defined, the system only retrieves the value of the first column.

  • String: This is the table name to be queried.

  • String: This is the condition list.

DV.amountFormat(CCY,AMTField)

This method is used to set the amount format on the generated voucher. Parameters:

  • CCY: This refers to the related currency field.

  • AMTField: This refers to the related amount field.

DV.appendBarcode(formName, barcode, custid, birtbarcodeMappingField)

This method is used to add a barcode to a generated document. The barcode is generated based on the values of the relevant fields from the transaction screen. Parameters:

  • formName: This is the name of the BIRT Form rule.

  • barcode: This refers to a fixed value to be used for the generation of the barcode if the field defined as the birtbarcodeMappingField has no value. This parameter is optional.

  • custid: This is the Customer Id field. The value here must be retrieved from the available variables and not from the mapping fields. This parameter is optional.

  • birtbarcodeMappingfield: This is the field on which the generation of the barcode is based.

DV.appendBarcode(formName, barcode, custid, birtbarcodeMappingField, doXpath)

This method is used to add a barcode to a generated document. The barcode is generated based on the values that are retrieved from a data object. Parameters:

  • formName: This is the name of the BIRT Form rule.

  • barcode: This refers to a fixed value to be used for the generation of the barcode if the field defined as the birtbarcodeMappingField has no value. This parameter is optional.

  • custid: This is the Customer Id field. The value here must be retrieved from the available variables and not from the mapping fields. This parameter is optional.

  • birtbarcodeMappingField: This is the field on which the generation of the barcode is based.

  • doXpath: This is the name of the data object where the barcode mapping field is located.

DV.appendBarcode(formName, barcode, custid, birtbarcodeMappingField, doXpath, condition)

This method is used to add a barcode to a generated document. The barcode is generated based on the values that are retrieved from a data object provided that the specified condition is met. Parameters:

  • formName: This is the name of the BIRT Form rule.

  • barcode: This refers to a fixed value to be used for the generation of the barcode if the field defined as the birtbarcodeMappingField has no value. This parameter is optional.

  • custid: This is the Customer Id field. The value here must be retrieved from the available variables and not from the mapping fields. This parameter is optional.

  • birtbarcodeMappingField: This is the field on which the generation of the barcode is based.

  • doXpath: This is the name of the data object where the barcode mapping field is located.

  • condition: This is the condition for generating the barcode.

DV.appendDOSWIFT(String, String)

This method is used to apply the outward SWIFT message rule in the data object. Parameter:

  • String: This is the outgoing SWIFT message rule.

  • String: This is the condition for retrieving the DO data.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if(MESG_TYPE_BANK.substr(0,2) == 'MT' && type!='D'){

if(sResult == "TRUE" || sMT == "999"){

DV.appendDOSWIFT('SSSS_sendtobank_sw_mt' + MESG_TYPE_BANK.substr(2,3),"MESG_TYPE_BANK = '" + MESG_TYPE_BANK + "'");

DV.appendField(String)

This is used to attach an Accounting rule to the transaction function. Parameter:

  • String: This is the Accounting rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if (nCHG_CUST_AMT > 0){

DV.appendField("ChgVoucher");

}

DV.appendField(String, boolean ignoreDO)

This is used to attach an Accounting rule to the transaction function. Parameters:

  • String: This is the Accounting rule.

  • Boolean ignoreDO: If this is set to false, a GAPI message with a DO is generated only if the DO has a value. If this is set to true, a GAPI message with a DO is generated whether or not the DO has a value. This parameter defaults to false.

DV.appendField(String, String, String)

This is used to attach an Accounting rule to the transaction function. Parameter:

  • String: This is the Accounting rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if (nCHG_CUST_AMT > 0){

DV.appendField("ChgVoucher");

}

DV.appendFieldGroup()

This method is currently not used for the Accounting Rules function.

DV.appendGroupField(ruleName,xPath,fieldName)

This method is currently not used for the Accounting Rules function.

DV.appendInternalSWIFT(String)

This is used to apply an outward SWIFT Message rule that is defined in the SWIFT Config function (SWIFT Message tab) for the transaction module. The SWIFT messages that are generated with this internal SWIFT are not sent to the SWIFT Alliance. Instead, the message is sent to a recipient through an internal route that is provided by the EE system through a third party. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the Outgoing SWIFT Message rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if (SEND_ACK == ‘YES’){

DV.appendInternalSWIFT(‘MT100’);

}

DV.appendInternalTSU(String)

This is used to apply a TSU message mapping rule defined in a outgoing TSU message function. Parameter:

  • String: This is the TSU message mapping rule.

DV.appendSWIFT(String)

This is used to apply an outward SWIFT Message rule that is defined in the SWIFT Config (SWIFT Message tab) for the transaction module. The outward SWIFT message that is generated using this method is sent out to the SWIFT Alliance or Merva device according to the parameters that are defined in the SWIFT Send Setting. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the outward SWIFT Message rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if(ADV_BK_CORR_MED=='SWIFT' && tag79 !='')

{

DV.appendSWIFT("MT999_AmdLC ");

}

DV.appendTag(String)

This determines whether a SWIFT Tag should appear in an outward SWIFT message. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the Tag Code that is to appear in the SWIFT output message based on the rule that is defined in the SWIFT Message Tag Rule. When merging SWIFT message, the system checks against the Tag rule where the DV.appendTag() method is used. If this meets the condition that is defined in the Tag Rule, the defined Tag is displayed in the SWIFT output message. If, on the other hand, it does meet the rule condition, the Tag does not appear in the message even if the mapping field contains a valid value in the transaction.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var FieldA = DV.getFieldValue(FieldA);

var FieldB = DV.getFieldValue(FieldB);

if (FieldA !='' && FieldB !='' ) {

DV.appendTag('57A');

}

DV.calDate(String,int)

This method is used to calculate a new date from a given date +/- a given number of days. Parameters:

  • String: This is the date in string format

  • int: This is the number of days to be added or subtracted from the given date.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

var date = DV.calDate (‘2005-03-20’, 5);

RESULT: date = 2005-03-25;

DV.checkRMA()

This is used to invoke the SWIFT RMA service’s checking process.

DV.getCurrentDoData(String)

This is used to retrieve the value of a DO field when generating a voucher.

Parameters:

  • String: This is the name of the DO field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.getCurrentDoData(“CHG_CUST_AMT”)

DV.getParentDO(int)

This is used to retrieve details of the parent data object into the voucher rule.

Parameters:

  • Int: This indicates the parent DO level of the current sub-DO.sub-DO

    The DO Path is defined with PaymentDealer.PaymentDebitHeader.PaymentDebit

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

  • To retrieve the data of the parent DO PaymentDealer:

var nDO=DV.getParentDoNode(2);

  • To retrieve the data of DO PaymentDebitHeader:

var nDO= DV.getParentDoNode(1);

DV.day1MustbeLaterThanDay2(String strFirstDay, String strSecondDay)

This is used to check that the first Date field value is later than the second Date field value. Parameters:

  • strFirstDay: This is the first date.

  • strSecondDay: This is the second date.

This returns a Boolean.

DV.getDOValue(Element,String)

This method is used for getting the value of a field from a data object. Parameters:

  • Element eDO: This is the name of the data object.

  • String fieldName: This is the data object field which value is to be retrieved.

DV.getFieldValue(String)

This is used to get the value of a specified field. Parameter:

  • String: This is the transaction field name.

The system returns the value of the specified field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var nCHG_CUST_AMT = DV.toFloat(DV.getFieldValue("CHG_CUST_AMT"));

DV.getLineValue(String,int)

This method is used to return a line or a sub-text from a line, beginning from the defined position number. Parameters:

  • String: This is the string from which the sub-text is to be retrieved.

  • int: This is the position within the line where the system starts retrieving the text.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

DV.getLineValue(“address”, 20)

DV.getPartValue(String,int,int)

This method is used to get a particular part of a field value with a specified starting position and a defined data length. Parameters:

  • String: This is the source of the sub-text to be retrieved.

  • Int 1: This is the start position.

  • Int 2: This is the number of characters to retrieve.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

DV.getPartValue(“address”, 10, 6)

DV.getRecord(String, String)

This method is used for retrieving a data object record based on a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the name of the data object.

  • String 2: This is the condition for retrieving the record.

DV.getRecords(String, String)

This method is used to retrieve the records of a data object. Parameter:

  • String: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

This returns an array of records.

DV.getSubDays(strFirstDay,strSecondDay,strCntyCode,strSubCntyCode,isGetWorkDay)

This method is used to get the number of days between two specified dates. Parameters:

  • strFirstDay: This is the first date.

  • strSecondDay: This is the second date.

  • strCntyCode: This is the country code.

  • strSubCntyCode: This is the sub-country code.

  • isGetWorkDay: This flag setting indicates whether or not to include the working days in the calculation.

This returns an Integer.

DV.getSysBusiDate()

This method is used to get the system business date.

DV.getSysDate()

This method is used to get the system date.

This returns the SYS_DATE value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

//SYS_DATE = ‘2005-03-15’; system date of the application server

var sysDate = DV.getSysDate();

Return: sysDate = ‘2005-03-15’;

DV.getUpdatedData()

This method is used to updatethe DOM data for the current transaction. This is used with the stp.updateFieldValue system method.

DV.setDOValue(String, String, String)

This method is used to set or assign the value of a data object field. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the name of the data object**.**

  • String 2: This is the field of the data object which value is to be set.

  • String 3: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

DV.setVoucherGapiRule(String GapiRuleName)

This is used to set the GAPI rule to be used when the voucher is generated.

  • String GapiRuleName: This the name of the GAPI rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.setVoucherGapiRule(" IMLC_EEOUT");

DV.toDouble(String)

This is used to convert the value of a string into a Double data type. Parameter:

  • String: This may be any numeric string value.

This returns a Double value that is converted from the specified string value.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

// LC_AMT = 2,365,000.00;

var LC_AMT = DV.getFieldValue(‘LC_AMT’);

var Amt1 = DV.toDouble(LC_AMT) + 100;

RESULT: Amt1 = 2365100

DV.toFloat(String)

This method is used to convert the value of a string into a Float data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into a Float data type.

This returns a Float data type.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

// LC_AMT = 2,365,000.00;

var LC_AMT = DV.getFieldValue(‘LC_AMT’);

var Amt1 = DV.toFloat(LC_AMT) + 100;

RESULT: Amt1 = 2365100

DV.toInteger(String)

This method is used to convert a value of a string to an Integer data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into the Integer data type.

This returns an Integer.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

// CHG_TERM = 3;

var terms = DV.toInteger(DV.getFieldValue(‘CHG_TERM’)); //terms = 3

if (terms > 5)

DV.appendField(‘AccRule1’);

else

DV.appendField(‘AccRule2’);

RESULT: AccRule2 is used.

DV.updateField(String, String)

This is used to update the field with a field value. Parameters:

  • String: This is the transaction field name which value is to be updated.

  • String: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

This updates the REMIT_BKID field with the new value ‘CHASUS33XXX’:

stp.updateFieldValue('REMIT_BKID','CHASUS33XXX');

DV.writeLog(String)

This method is used to write log information for user notification or debugging in the EE log file. Parameter:

  • String: This is the text to be written into the log file.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.writeLog("DV.SYS_BANK_COUNTRY="+DV.SYS_BANK_COUNTRY);

Variables

The system variables for the Accounting Rule function are as follows.

Figure 6. System Variables for the Accounting Rules Function

DV.SYS_AUTH_LEVEL

This is used to retrieve the authorization level.

DV.SYS_BANK_COUNTRY

This is used to retrieve the bank-country.

DV.SYS_BANK_GROUP

This is used to retrieve the bank group.

DV.SYS_FUNCTION_NAME

This is used to retrieve the function name.

DV.SYS_FUNCTION_SHORT_NAME

This is used to retrieve the function short name.

DV.SYS_FUNCTION_TYPE

This is used to retrieve the function type.

DV.SYS_LCY

This is used to retrieve the system’s local currency.

DV.SYS_BUSI_UNIT

This is used to retrieve the business unit.

DV.SYS_MODULE_NAME

This is used to retrieve the module name.

DV.SYS_ORI_UNIT_CODE

This is used to retrieve the unit code.

DV.SYS_USER_ID

This is used to retrieve the logon user Id.

DV.SYS_BUSI_DATE

This is used to retrieve the business date.

DV.SYS_LCY_2ND

This is used to retrieve the cross currency applied.

DV.SYS_DATE_FORMAT

This is used to retrieve the system date format.

DV.SYS_LOGIN_BIC

This is used to retrieve the logon BIC.

DV.SYS_ORG_FUNCTION_NAME

This is used to retrieve the original function name.

DV.SYS_ORG_FUNCTION_SHORT_NAME

This is used to retrieve the original function short name.

DV.SYS_I_EVENT_TIMES

This is used to retrieve the number of events the transaction has gone through.

DV.SYS_LOCAL_CCY

This is used to retrieve the system’s local currency.

DV.SYS_PC_UNIT

This is used to retrieve the processing center unit.

DV.SYS_ORG_FUNCTION_ID

This is used to retrieve the original function Id.

DV.SYS_AMT_INT_FORMAT

This is used to define the separator for an amount (i.e., Decimal point)

DV.SYS_AMT_DEC_FORMAT

This is used to define the separator for an amount (i.e., thousands).

DV.SYS_USER_NAME

This is used to retrieve the logon user name.

DV.SYS_LOADTEMP_FLAG

This is used to control whether or not the template is to be downloaded.

Batch Manager Function

Methods

The system methods and variables for the Batch Manager – Task function are as follows.

Figure 6. System Methods for the Batch Manager: User Batch – Task Function

DV.SYS_FloatAdd(arg1,arg2)

This is used to calculate the sum of 2 Float-type numeric values. Parameters:

  • arg1: This is the first Float numeric value.

  • arg2: This is the second Float numeric value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var Add01 = 3000.00

var Add02 = 5000.00

DV.SYS_FloatAdd(Add01,Add02)

Result = 8000.00

DV.SYS_FloatDiv(arg1, arg2)

This is used to calculate the value when one Float-type numeric value is divided by another Float-type numeric values. Parameters:

  • arg1: This is the first Float numeric value.

  • arg2: This is the second Float numeric value by which the first float is to be divided.

The decimal places of the resulting value is based on the related currency.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var Add01 = 5000.00

var Add02 = 3000.00

DV.SYS_FloatADiv(Add01,Add02)

Result = 1.67

DV.SYS_FloatMul(arg1, arg2)

This is used to calculate the value when one Float-type numeric value is multiplied by another Float-type numeric value. Parameters:

  • arg1: This is the first Float numeric value.

  • arg2: This is the second Float numeric value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var Add01 = 3000.00

var Add02 = 5000.00

DV.SYS_FloatMul(Add01,Add02)

Result = 15,000,000.00,

DV.SYS_FloatSub(arg1, arg2)

This is used to calculate the difference between 2 Float-type numeric values. Parameters:

  • arg1: This is the first Float numeric value.

  • arg2: This is the second Float numeric value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var Add01 = 5000.00

var Add02 = 3000.00

DV.SYS_FloatSub(Add01,Add02)
Result = 2000.00

DV.SYS_GetExchangeRate(String,String,String,String)

This is used to retrieve the exchange rate value to update the rate field. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the From CCY value.

  • String 2: This is the To CCY value.

  • String 3: This is the rate type value.

  • String 4: This is the name of the rate field that is to get the rate value.

This does not return a value.

DV.SYS_GetExchangeRate(String,String,String)

This is used to retrieve the exchange rate value to update the rate field. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the From CCY value.

  • String 2: This is the To CCY value.

  • String 3: This is the rate type value.

This returns the exchange rate value based on the From CCY, To CCY and Rate Type value.

DV.SYS_InsertClause(String,String,boolean)

This is used to insert or update a specified clause text to a transaction field automatically in auto processing. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the name of the clause field. The field that is specified is used to get the clause value.

  • String 2: This is the clause template name. The template that is specified must be one of the clause templates that have been assigned to the field through the Clause function in the EE Utility.

  • boolean: This may be set as either True or False. Setting this to True instructs the system to insert the selected clause content to the specified field without removing the original field value, if there is an original value. Setting this to False, on the other hand, instructs the system to update or replace the initial field value with the specified clause content.

This does not return a value.

DV.SYS_getCUBK(String, String,String,String,boolean)

This is used to get the field value from predefined transaction table using the Get CUBK rule. The field value that is returned is placed in the memory. Other methods such as stp.getFieldValue() and stp.updateFieldValue() may use this method in the script for transaction data processing. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the Get CUBK mapping rule name.

  • String 2: This is the key field name of the Get CUBK rule.

  • String 3: This is the JS function to be called if the retrieval is successful.

  • String 4: This is the JS function to be called if the retrieval fails.

  • boolean: This indicates whether or not an error message is to be shown if the operation fails. This may have a true or false value. If the value is false, the system displays an error message. Otherwise, no error is prompted.

This returns the field value that is selected from the database according to the Get CUBK rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.SYS_getCUBK("NO_OF_AMD","C_MAIN_REF");

DV.SYS_getRefNo(String)

This function is used to generate the transaction reference number and return the reference number value. This method is used mainly when using the auto process to generate a new transaction record in the database. Parameter:

  • String: This is the reference rule name that has been defined in the Reference Number function.

This returns the base transaction reference number that is generated by the defined reference rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var MainRef = DV.SYS_getRefNo (‘IMIS_CHECK’);

DV.updateField("C_MAIN_REF", MainRef);

DV.addDORec(String,String,DataObjectFields)

This method is used for adding a record to a data object based on a given condition. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the xPath of the data object.

  • String 2: This is the condition for adding a record to the data object.

  • DataObjectFields: These are the fields which may be added to the data object depending on the condition.

DV.addField(DataObjectFields,String,String)

This method is used to add the information from a data object to the specific fields. Parameters:

  • DataObjectFields: This is the DO fields and their values.

  • String 1: This is the field name.

  • String 2: This is the field value.

DV.addFieldList(ServerDataInfo,String)

This is used to append the fields to an SQL query. These are the fields that are to be selected from a table in the database. This method is normally used together with other methods such as DV.addSQLCondition() and DV.getTableMultiDataToArray() in order to get the expected field value. Parameters:

  • ServerDataInfo: This is the field list. When it is to add the first field in the field list, a null value must be provided.

  • String: This is the field name that is to be included in the field list.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var fld_list = DV.addFieldList(null,"C_MAIN_REF");

fld_list = DV.addFieldList(fld_list,"C_FUNC_SHORT_NAME");

fld_list = DV.addFieldList(fld_list,"C_CUST_ID");

DV.addSQLCondition(ServerDataInfo, String, String)

This is used to append the fields that compose the SQL select condition. Parameters:

  • ServerDataInfo: This is the SQL condition list. If it is used as a condition for the first field, a null value should be provided.

  • String 1: This is the field that is used in the SQL Where condition.

  • String 2: This is placed as the value of the field defined in String 1.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var MainRef = “REF000001”

var sqlCondition= DV.addSQLCondition(null, “C_MAIN_REF”, MainRef);

sqlCondition= DV.addSQLCondition(sqlCondition, “C_UNIT_CODE”, “201”);

RESULT: …where C_MAIN_REF = “REF000001” and C_UNIT_CODE = “201”.

DV.addTrxCharge(comCode)

This method is used to add a charge with a commission code. Parameters:

  • comCode: This is the commission code list array or commission code string defined in the standing module

This returns a transaction charge object.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

To add a Letter of Credit Issue Commission

var comList = 'IPLC_OPEN_COMM,EPLC_POST_CHG';

var trxChg = DV.addTrxCharge(comList);

or

var comList = ['IPLC_OPEN_COMM'];

DV.addTrxCharge(comList);

DV.buildArray()

This method is used for adding a DataObjectFields’ object.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.buildArray(‘ClaimDO’)

DV.calDate(String, int)

This method is used to calculate a new date from a given date +/- a given number of days. Parameters:

  • String: This is the date in string format.

  • int: This is the number of days to be added or subtracted from the given date.

This returns the date.

DV.calEndWorkingDate(strCntyCode,strStartDate,strDaysValue,strBeforeOrAfter,strlfCheckHol,strlfJumpHol)

This method is used to get the end working date based on the start date and the number of days to add or subtract. Parameters:

  • strCntyCode: This is the country code.

  • strStartDate: This is the starting date.

  • strDaysValue: This is the number of days.

  • strBeforeOrAfter: This is the Before or After flag setting. The possible values are A, the default value, and B.

  • strIfCheckHol: This flag setting indicates whether or not to check holiday dates. The possible values are Y, the default value, and N.

  • strIfJumpHol: This flag setting indicates whether or not to include the holiday dates in the calculation. The possible values are N, the default value, and Y.

This returns the date.

DV.calHoliday(String strDateS,String strDateE,String strSubCntyCode)

This method is used to calculate the number of days between the specified start date and end date excluding the holidays and weekends. Parameters:

  • String StrDateS: This is the start date.

  • String StrDateE: This is the end date.

  • String strSubCntyCode: This is the sub-country code (or simply the country code).

This returns an integer that indicates the number of days.

DV.calNumberOfTerms(String,String,int)

This method is used to calculate number of terms from the start date to the end date. The term may be monthly, quarterly, semi-annually, or annually. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the start date.

  • String 2: This is the end date.

  • int: This is the term period.

This returns an Integer value.

DV.calWorkingDay(String strDateS,String strDateE,String strSubCntyCode)

This method is used to calculate the number of working days between a specified start date and a specified end date. Parameters:

  • String strDateS: This is the start date.

  • String strDateE: This is the end date.

  • String strSubCntyCode: This is the sub-country code (or country code)

This returns an Integer.

DV.calculate(commListArr,calPara)

This method is used to calculate charges. Parameters:

  • commListArr: This is the commission code list array. The array follows this order: Commission Code1, Commission Code 2.
  • calPara: This is the parameter string array, which may contain the following variables.

  • trxCcy is the currency of the transaction.

  • amount is the amount involved in the transaction.

  • sDate is the start date of the transaction.

  • eDate is the end date of the transaction.

  • from is the location of the sender of the express fee.

  • to is the location of the recipient of the express fee.

  • baseDay is the base number of days used in the calculation of interests.

  • plusTimes is the number of times the charges are to be calculated.

  • extendFldsArr allows the values of the fields to be stored, making these fields .reusable

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var parameter = ['USD','100000','2011-3-23','2011-4-23','US','CN','360','null',null];

var comList = ['IPLC_OPEN_COMM',’ EPLC_POST_CHG’];

var result = DV.calculate(comList,parameter);

DV.callCalcService(String)

This is used to calculate charges based on the charge agreement rule. Parameter:

  • String: This is the parameter string array, which may contain the following variables.

  • trxCcy is the transaction currency. This is mandatory.

  • amount is the transaction amount. This is mandatory.

  • commCode is the commission code. This is mandatory.

  • chargeFor is the party to be charged; 'L' for local customer and 'F' for foreign customer. This is mandatory.

  • custID is the customer Id. If chargefor is 'L', this pertains to the local customer Id. If chargeFor is 'F', this pertains to the foreign customer Id. This is mandatory.

  • collectCcy is the bank collection currency. This is mandatory.

  • rateType is the rate type used to convert the charge agreement currency to the transaction currency. This is mandatory.

  • sDate is the start date of the transaction.

  • eDate is the end date of the transaction.

  • from is the location of the sender of the express fee**.**

  • to is the location of the recipient of the express fee**.**

  • baseDay is the base number of days used in the calculation of interests**.**

  • plusTimes is the number of times the charges are to be calculated (i.e., calculated charges multiplied by this number).

  • OverWriteAgree pertains to the Charge field to be overridden and the corresponding value (e.g., “Y_FLAT_AMT=222”). The Charge fields that can be overridden are F_BASE_PERCENTAGE, F_EXTEND_PERCENTAGE, Y_MAX_AMT, Y_MIN_AMT, I_PERIOD_MAX, I_PERIOD_MIN, Y_FLAT_AMT, C_PERIOD_NUM, C_PERIOD_UNIT, Y_TIER_AMT, and C_CCY_TIER.

  • (extendFlds is reserved for future use.)

DV.capureDefChargesByScope()

This method is used to retrieve the deferred charges according to the condition defined in the stp.setDefChargeScope() system method.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setDefChargeScope(DV.SCOPE_MAINREF);

DV.capureDefChargesByScope()

DV.checkHoliday(String strDate,String strSubCntyCode)

This method is used to check whether or not a given date is a holiday. Parameters:

  • String StrDate: This is the date to be verified as a holiday

  • String strSubCntyCode: This is the sub-country code

This returns a Boolean.

DV.clearDOCondition()

This method is used to clear the cache. This is used with the DV.setAddDoCondition() and DV.setDoData() parameters.

DV.confirmCharge()

This is used to confirm all charges and calculate the charges in the application server.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.confirmCharge();

DV.day1MustbeLaterThanDay2(strFirstDay,strSecondDay)

This method is used to check that the first Date field value is later than the second Date field value. Parameters:

  • strFirstDay: This is the first date.

  • strSecondDay: This is the second date.

This returns a Boolean.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

//ISSUE_DT = 2007-09-04; EXPIRY_DT=2007-09-08;

var issueDT=DV.getParamFieldValue("ISSUE_DT");

var expiryDT=DV.getParamFieldValue("EXPIRY_DT");

var dateComp=DV.day1MustbeLaterThanDay2(expiryDT, issueDT);

RESULT: True

DV.delDORec(String,String)

This method is used to delete a record from a data object according to a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

  • String 2: This is the condition for deleting the record. The format is similar to an SQL statement.

This returns a Boolean.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

var PARTY_ID2='vicky';

var delcond= 'PARTY_ID=\''+PARTY_ID2+'\'';

DV.delDORec('PARTY_INFO',delcond);

RESULT: If the record is deleted, this returns TRUE.

DV.deleteDocs(int)

This is used to delete document files stored in this system path: [user.dir]\\TRXDATA\\[Bank Group]\\[Country Code]\\DOCS. Parameters:

  • Int: This is the number of days to be subtracted from the current system date.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.deleteDocs(5);

If the current system date is 2012-06-21and [system date] – 5 is 2012-06-16, the system deletes all document files before 2012-06-16

DV.deleteLogs(int, boolean)

This is used to delete log files (on File mode) from the log directory specified in the EE_Log_Config.xml file. Parameters:

  • int: This is the number of days to be subtracted from the current system date.

  • boolean: This is used to control whether logs on DB mode are to be deleted as well.This may have a true or false value. If the value is set to true, the logs in the following tables are to be deleted as well: TRX_SYS_ACESS_LOG, TRX_SYS_COMP_LOG, TRX_SYS_PERF_LOG.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.deleteLogs(5, false);

If the current system date is 2012-06-21 and [system date] – 5 is 2012-06-16, all log files from the log directory set in the EE_Log_Config.xml file (e.g., X:\EELog) will be deleted.

DV.deleteLogs(6, true);

If the current system date is 2012-06-21 and [system date] – 5 is 2012-06-16, all log files from the log directory set in the EE_Log_Confog.xml file (e.g., X:\EELog) and the data from the TRX_SYS_ACESS_LOG, TRX_SYS_COMP_LOG, TRX_SYS_PERF_LOG database tables which are generated before 2012-06-16 will be deleted.

DV.deleteSwifts(int)

This method is used to delete generated SWIFT messages saved in the path specified in the SWIFT_OUT_GOING_FOLDER system parameter. Parameters:

  • int: This is the number of days to be subtracted from the current system date.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

If the current system date is 2012-06-21 and [system date] – 5 is 2012-06-16, all SWIFT messages in the directory specified in the SWIFT_OUT_GOING_FOLDER (e.g., X:\TRXDATA\) generated before 2012-06-16 will be deleted.

DV.formatAMT(String sAmt, String sCcy, int iRound)

This method is used for amount format processing.

  • String sAmt: This is the amount to be formatted.

  • String sCcy: This is the currency to be used for amount format processing.

  • int iRound: This is the rounding mode of the formatted amount. This may have one of the following values:

  • 0 ROUND_UP: Rounding mode to round away from zero.

  • 1 ROUND_DOWN: Rounding mode to round towards zero.

  • 2 ROUND_CEILING: Rounding mode to round towards positive infinity.

  • 3 ROUND_FLOOR: Rounding mode to round towards negative infinity.

  • 4 ROUND_HALF_UP: Rounding mode to round towards nearest neighbor unless both neighbors are equidistant, in which case round up. This is the frequently-used rounding mode.

  • 5 ROUND_HALF_DOWN: Rounding mode to round towards nearest neighbor unless both neighbors are equidistant, in which case round down.

  • 6 ROUND_HALF_EVEN: Rounding mode to round towards the "nearest neighbor" unless both neighbors are equidistant, in which case, round towards the even neighbor.

– 7 ROUND_UNNECESSARY: Rounding mode to assert that the requested operation has an exact result, hence no rounding is necessary.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

feeAmt = DV.formatAMT(feeAmt.toString(), DV.getFieldValue("CCY"), 4);

DV.getCountryCode()

This method is used to get the country code for the current business unit.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

Country Code is “CN”;

var cnty=DV.getCountryCode();

Result: cnty = ‘CN’;

DV.getDORecCount(String,String)

This method is used to count the number of records in a data object that satisfies the defined condition. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

  • String 2: This is the condition for including the record in the record count. The format is similar to an SQL statement.

This returns an Integer.

DV.getDOValue(Element,String)

This method is used for getting the value of a field from a data object. Parameters:

  • Element: This is the name of the data object.

  • String: This is the data object field which value is to be retrieved.

DV.getDateByIncrement(sDateFldName,sYearsIncr,sDaysIncr,sMonthsIncr)

This method is used to calculate the date based on the parameter that is passed. Parameters:

  • sDateFldName: This is the Date field name.

  • sYearsIncr: This is the number of years to be added to the Date field.

  • sDaysIncr: This is the number of days to be added to the Date field.

  • sMonthsIncr: This is the number of months to be added to the Date field.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.getDateByIncrement('FA_PMT_VAL_DT',0,0)

DV.getFieldValue(String)

This is used to get the value of a specified field. Parameter:

  • String: This is the transaction field name.

The system returns the value of the specified field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

C_MAIN_REF = ‘IMLCDBU0056’;

var MainRef = DV.getFieldValue(‘C_MAIN_REF’);

RESULT: MainRef = ‘IMLCDBU0056’

DV.getForeignBalTotalAmt(ccy)

This is used to get the total balance amount of the foreign customer. Parameters:

  • ccy: This is the currency in which the resulting balance is to be returned

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var balAmtLocal = DV.getForeignBalTotalAmt("USD");

DV.getForeignTotalCollectAmt()

This is used to get the total amount, including the charge amount and VAT amount, collected from the foreign customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalCollAmt = DV.getForeignTotalCollectAmt();

DV.getForeignTotalCollectCharge()

This is used to get the total amount of bank charges collected from the foreign customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalCollChg = DV.getForeignTotalCollectCharge();

DV.getForeignTotalCollectVAT()

This is used to get the total VAT amount collected from the foreign customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalCollVAT = DV.getForeignTotalCollectVAT();

DV.getForeignTotalPayAmt()

This is used to get the total amount paid by the foreign customer, including the charge payment and VAT payment amounts.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalPayAmt = DV.getForeignTotalPayAmt();

DV.getForeignTotalPayCharge()

This is used to get the total amount of bank charges paid by the foreign customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalPayCharges = DV.getForeignTotalPayCharge();

DV.getForeignTotalPayVAT()

This is used to get the total VAT amount paid by the foreign customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalPayVAT = DV.getForeignTotalPayVAT();

DV.getLastWorkingDay(String strDate,String strSubCnty)

This method is used to get the last working date beginning from the specified starting working date. Parameters:

  • String strDate: This is the start date.

  • String strSubCnty: This is the sub-country code (or country code).

This returns a String.

DV.getLineValue(String,int)

This method is used to return a line or a sub-text from a line, beginning from the defined position number. Parameters**:**

  • String: This is the string from which the sub-text is to be retrieved.

  • Int: This is the position within the line where the system starts retrieving the text.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

DV.getLineValue(“address”, 20)

DV.getLocalBalTotalAmt(ccy)

This is used to get the total balance amount of the local customer. Parameters:

  • ccy: This is the currency in which the resulting balance is to be returned

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var balAmtLocal = DV.getLocalBalTotalAmt("USD");

DV.getLocalCCY(String cnty)

This is used to get the local currency of a country. Parameter:

  • String cnty: This is the country code which local currency is to be retrieved.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.getLocalCCY(‘CN’)

DV.getLocalTotalCollectAmt()

This is used to get the total amount, including the charge amount and VAT amount, collected from the local customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var localTotalCollAmt = DV.getLocalTotalCollectAmt();

DV.getLocalTotalCollectCharge()

This is used to get the total amount of bank charges collected from the local customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var localTotalCollChg = DV.getLocalTotalCollectCharge();

DV.getLocalTotalCollectVAT()

This is used to get the total VAT amount collected from the local customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var locaTotalCollVAT = DV.getLocalTotalCollectVAT();

DV.getLocalTotalPayAmt()

This is used to get the total amount paid by the local customer, including charge and VAT payments.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var locaTotalPayAmt = DV.getLocalTotalPayAmt();

DV.getLocalTotalPayCharge()

This is used to get the total amount of bank charges paid by the local customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var locaTotalPayChg = DV.getLocalTotalPayCharge()

DV.getLocalTotalPayVAT()

This is used to get the total VAT amount paid by the local customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var locaTotalPayVAT = DV.getLocalTotalPayVAT();

DV.getModuleName()

This method is used to retrieve the module to which the running function belongs.

This returns a String.

DV.getNextWorkingDay(String strDate,String strSubCnty)

This method is used to retrieve the next working day based on the current date. Parameters:

  • String strDate: This is the current date.
  • String strSubCnty: This is the sub-country code (or country code).

This returns a String.

DV.getOriginalFuncShortName()

This method is used to retrieve the last step’s function short name.

This returns a String.

DV.getPartValue(String,int,int)

This method is used to get a particular part of a field value through a specified starting position and a defined data length. Parameters:

  • String: This is the source of the sub-text to be retrieved

  • Int 1: This is the start position.

  • Int 2: This is the number of characters to retrieve.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

DV.getPartValue(“address”, 10, 6)

DV.getRecord(String,String)

This method is used for retrieving a data object record based on a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the name of the data object.

  • String 2: This is the condition for retrieving the record.

DV.getRecords(String)

This method is used to retrieve the records of a data object. Parameter:
