  • String: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

This returns an array of records.

DV.getServerDateTime()

This method is used to get the server date and time and converts these to the proper format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.

This returns a String.

DV.getServerTime()

This method is used to get the server time and converts this to the proper time format: HH:MM:SS.

This returns a String.

DV.getSysBusiDate()

This method is used to get the system business date.

DV.getSysDate()

This method is used to get the system date.

This returns the SYS_DATE value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

//SYS_DATE = ‘2005-03-15’; system date of the application server

var sysDate = DV.getSysDate();

Return: sysDate = ‘2005-03-15’;

DV.getTableMultiDataToArray(String,ServerDataInfo,ServerDataInfo,String)

This is used to retrieve table data based on a given condition and store the values in another array. This can invoke a call-back function. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the table that is to be inquired on.

  • ServerDataInfo: These are the fields which values are to be retrieved and populated into an array.

  • ServerDataInfo: This is the condition for inquring on the table.

  • String 2: This is the order by which the queried fields are to be sorted.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var fieldList=DV.addFieldList(null,"C_MAIN_REF");

var sqlCondition=DV.addSQLCondition(null,"DRWE_NM","Test Name");

var orderBy="ORDER BY C_MAIN_REF";

DV.getTableMultiDataToArray("IMCO_MASTER",fieldList,sqlCondition,orderBy);

DV.getValue(String,String)

This method is used to get the value of a field from a data object. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the name of the data object.

  • String 2: This is the Data Object field which value is to be retrieved.

This returns a String.

DV.getValue(String,String,String)

This method is used to get the value of a field from a data object according to a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the Data Object field which value is to be retrieved.

  • String 2: This is the name of the data object.

  • String 3: This is the condition for determining the record that contains the field which value is to be retrieved. The condition, which is similar to an SQL statement, can be null. When this results in more than one value (record), the system returns the first value.

This returns a String.

DV.getValueFromGAPI(String)

This is used to retrieve the field values that are obtained by the DV.inqGAPI() method. This method must be used after the DV.inqGAPI() method. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the name of the field that has been defined as the receiving field in the GAPI rule of DV.inqGAPI() method.

This returns, from the system memory, the value of the defined field.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

/*

‘GAPI_IN’ is an inquire GAPI setting parameter name and in this GAPI rule DOC_REQ field is defined.

**/

DV.inqGAPI (‘GAPI_IN’)

var Test = DV.getValueFromGAPI(‘DOC_REQ’);

RESULT: This gets the DOC_REQ value via GAPI and gives the value to variable Test.

DV.init(String, String, String, String)

This method is used to set the initial exchange rate to be used for a charge transactions.

Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the exchange rate applied between Transaction- and Charge Agreement-Currency

  • String 2: This is the exchange rate applied between Charge Collect- and Charge Agreement-Currency

  • String 3: This is the exchange rate applied between Charge Unpaid- and Charge Agreement-Currency

  • String 4: This is the exchange rate applied between Charge Collect- and Charge Unpaid-Currency

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.init("Booking Rate", "Booking Rate", "Booking Rate", "Booking Rate");

DV.inqGAPI(String)

This is used to submit an inquiry to an outward system via GAPI. The query result is temporarily placed in the system memory. The return value may be used from the outward system for transaction processing such as judgment or field value update. This method is usually used before the DV.getValueFromGAPI() method. Parameter:

  • String: This is the predefined inquire GAPI rule name. The transaction type of the GAPI rule should be Inquire.

This returns the value of the fields that have been defined in the inquire GAPI parameter as receiving fields. The value is not returned immediately to the transaction fields as this method is only for inquiring. Instead, the value is stored in the memory and is later obtained using the DV.getValueFromGAPI() method.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

/*

‘GAPI_IN’ is an inquire GAPI setting parameter name and in this GAPI rule DOC_REQ field is defined.

**/

DV.inqGAPI(‘GAPI_IN’)

var Test = DV.getValueFromGAPI(‘DOC_REQ’);

RESULT: This gets the DOC_REQ value via GAPI and gives the value to variable Test.

DV.mapForeignCust(String, String, String, String)

This method is used to define the field names that are related to the local customer.

Parameters:

  • custID: This is the field name of the foreign customer Id.

  • custName: This is the field name of the coreign customer Name.

  • custCCY: This is the name of the ‘Foreign Customer Pay CCY’ field.

  • custACNO: This is the field name of the foreign customer account number field name

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.mapForeignCust("BENE_ID", "BENE_NM", "BENE_CCY", "BENE_ACNO");

DV.mapLocalCust(String, String, String, String)

This method is used to define the field names that are related to the local customer.

Parameters:

  • custID: This is the field name of the local customer Id.

  • custName: This is the field name of the local customer name.

  • custCCY: This is the name of the ‘Local Customer Pay CCY’ field.

  • custACNO: This is the field name of the local customer account number

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.mapLocalCust("APPL_ID","APPL_NM",“CUST_PAY_CCY","CUST_ACNO");

DV.setAddDOCondition(xDOPath,tableName,strFKsParent,strSelFlds,layerNum,doOperateType,filterCondition)

This method is used to retrieve DO records based on the given condition. If several elements are included in the data object hierarchy, this method should be applied to each element. This is used with the DV.setDoData() method. Parameters:

  • xDOPath: This is the complete path if the data object element in the

    data object hierarchy.

  • tableName: This is the name of the table from which the data are to

    be retrieved

  • strFKsParent: This is the foreign key relationship between the

    parent and child tables. This is to be specified as the condition for retrieving the data object record. The value of this parameter follows this format: parentDOFldName:tableFld:parentDOFldName:tableFld.

  • strSelFlds: This is the corresponding relation of the TDO table

    field and the field from the transaction page which is used to determine the DO fields which data are to be retrieved. The value of this parameter follows this format: pageFldName:tableFldName;pageFldName:tableFldName.

  • layerNum: This is the hierarchy number of the current data object

    element (i.e., 1 or 2).

  • doOperateType: This is the handle or operation type applied on the

    record. This may have an “A” (add a new record to the grid), “E” (edit the record on the grid), “D” (delete a record from the grid) value.

  • filterCondition: This is the SQL condition for retrieving data from

    the data object. This is reserved for future use.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setAddDOCondition("PaymentObligation","TSUM_PMTOBLGTN","C_MAIN_REF:C_MAIN_REF","C_MAIN_REF:C_MAIN_REF;TSU_CCY:TSU_CCY;TSU_RCPTBK_NAME:TSU_RCPTBK_NAME;TSU_OBLGR_BK:TSU_OBLGR_BK","1","E","");

xDOPath: PaymentObligation

tableName: TSUM_PMTOBLGTN

strFKsParent: C_MAIN_REF:C_MAIN_REF

strSelFlds: C_MAIN_REF;TSU_CCY;TSU_RCPTBK_NAME ;TSU_OBLGR_BK

layerNum :1

doOperateType:E

filterCondition: ""

DV.setAllCollCcy(String)

This method is used to set the initial charge collect currency. Parameters:

  • ccy: This is the bank collection currency

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setAllCollCcy('USD');

DV.setAllDefPayAt(String at)

This method is used to set the deferred charges Pay at value. Parameter:

  • String: This is the value of the deferred Pay At charge.

DV.setAllLocalPayCcy(String)

This method is used to set the value of the ‘Local Customer Pay CCY’ field. Parameter:

  • ccy: This is the local customer payment currency.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setAllLocalPayCcy('USD')

DV.setAllPayAt(payAt)

This is used to set the initial value of the ‘Paid At’ field. Parameters:

  • payAt: This is the value of the ‘Paid At’ field. The possible values are DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION (Transaction), DV.CHG_AT_DEFERRED (Deferred), DV.CHG_AT_FREE (Waived).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setAllPayAt(DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION);

DV.setAllPayBy(payBy)

This is used to set the value of the ‘Paid By’ field. Parameter:

  • payBy: This is the value of the ‘Paid By’ field. The possible values are: DV. CHG_FOR_LOCAL (Local Customer), and DV.CHG_FOR_FOREIGN (Foreign Customer).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setAllPayBy(DV.CHG_FOR_LOCAL);

DV.setAllUnpaidCcy(String)

This method is used to set the value of ‘Balance CCY’ field. Parameter:

  • ccy: This is the balance currency.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setAllUnpaidCcy('USD');

DV.setAutoProcess(boolean)

This is used to indicate whether a pending or master record is to be generated directly in the database by running the auto process or as a record with an S status, for which a Fix function is required. (This is the same as the result of saving a transaction in the EE system). This method must be set before creating a script for the transaction field value. Parameter:

  • Boolean: This may be set as either True or False. Setting this to True indicates that the pending or master record is to be generated directly into the database; setting this to False, on the other hand, indicates that the record is to be generated as a record with an S status.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.setAutoProcess (true); //first line

DV.setChargeValue(String,String,String)

This used for directly specifying the amount of a particular charge item. This amount is displayed in the ‘Charge Amount’ field of the corresponding charge entry. The other field values are updated or calculated according to this specified amount. Parameters:

  • String: This refers to the commission code. This parameter is mandatory.

  • String: This refers to the currency. This parameter is mandatory.

  • String: This refers to the amount of charge. This parameter is mandatory.

DV.setDOValue(Element,String,String)

This method is used to set or assign the value of a data object field. Parameters:

  • Element: This is the name of the data object**.**

  • String 1: This is the field of the data object which value is to be set.

  • String 2: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

DV.setDefChargeScope(scope)

This is used to define the condition when retrieving deferred charges (i.e., transaction reference, main reference). Parameters:

  • scope: This is the condition for retrieving the deferred charges. The possible values are: SCOPE_MAINREF (deferred charges are to be retrieved from the main or whole transaction), TRXREF (deferred charges are to be retrieved from a transaction reference), MAINWITHTRXREF (deferred charges are to be retrieved from both the main and transaction reference).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setDefChargeScope(DV.SCOPE_MAINREF);

DV.setDefPayAt(String commCode, String at)

This is used to set the initial value of the deferred charge’s Paid At field. Parameters:

  • String commCode: This is the value of the commission code
  • payAt: This is the value of the ‘Paid At’ field. The possible values are: DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION (Transaction), DV.CHG_AT_DEFERRED (Deferred), DV.CHG_AT_FREE (Waived).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setDefPayAt(DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION);

DV.setDiscRate(String, int)

This is used to set the discount rate. Parameters:

  • String: This is the commission code or the commission code string list array

  • int: This is the discount rate

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var comList = ['IPLC_OPEN_COMM',’ EPLC_POST_CHG’];

DV.setDiscRate(comList,'20');

OR

DV.setDiscRate('IPLC_OPEN_COMM','20');

DV.setDoData()

This is used to retrieve DO records from the cache and generate the DOM data.

DV.setPayAt(String, payAt)

This is used to set the initial value of the deferred charge’s Paid At field. Parameters:

  • String commCode: This is the value of the commission code
  • payAt: This is the value of the ‘Paid At’ field. The possible values are: DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION (Transaction), DV.CHG_AT_DEFERRED (Deferred), DV.CHG_AT_FREE (Waived).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setDefPayAt(DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION);

DV.setPayBy(String, payBy)

This is used to set the value of the ‘Paid At’ field in a transaction with a commission code. Parameters:

  • String: This is the name of the commission code.

  • payBy: This is the value of the ‘Paid At’ field. The possible values are CHG_FOR_LOCAL (Local Customer), and CHG_FOR_FOREIGN (Foreign Customer).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

If the charge is paid by the ‘Local Customer’:

DV.setPayBy('IPLC_OPEN_COMM',STP.CHG_FOR_LOCAL);

DV.setTrxFunction(String)

This is used to invoke a user-predefined [transaction]{.underline} function in the auto process. The system runs this function automatically at the defined schedule of the task. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the transaction function name.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.writeLog(‘Auto Process Log Start: CloseFile’);

var CLOSE_FLAG = 'Yes';

DV.updateField(‘CLOSE_FLAG’,CLOSE_FLAG);

DV.setTrxFunction(‘Close File’); // ‘Close File’ is the function name.

DV.writeLog(‘Auto Process Log End: CloseFile’);

DV.setValue(String,String,String)

This method is used to set or assign the value of a field from a data object. Parameters:

  • String 1**:** This is the data object field which value is to be set.

  • String 2: This is the name of the data object.

  • String 3: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

DV.setValue(String,String,String,String)

This method is used to set or assign the value of a field from a data object according to a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the Data Object field which value is to be set.

  • String 2: This is the name of the data object.

  • String 3: This is the value to be assigned to the field based on the given condition.

  • String 4: This is the parameter that contains the condition for assigning the value to the field. The condition, which is similar to an SQL statement, can be null. When this results in more than one value (or record), the system sets the first record.

DV.toDouble(String)

This is used to convert the value of a string into a Double data type. Parameter:

  • String: This may be any numeric string value.

This returns a Double value that is converted from the specified string value.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

// LC_AMT = 2,365,000.00;

var LC_AMT = DV.getFieldValue(‘LC_AMT’);

var Amt1 = DV.toDouble(LC_AMT) + 100;

RESULT: Amt1 = 2365100

DV.toFloat(String)

This method is used to convert the value of a string into a Float data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into a Float data type.

This returns a Float data type.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

// LC_AMT = 2,365,000.00;

var LC_AMT = DV.getFieldValue(‘LC_AMT’);

var Amt1 = DV.toFloat(LC_AMT) + 100;

RESULT: Amt1 = 2365100

DV.toInteger(String)

This method is used to convert a value of a string to an Integer data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into the Integer data type.

This returns an Integer.

DV.toLong(String)

This method is used to convert the value of a string to a Long data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into a Long data type.

This returns a Long data type.

DV.updateField(String,Object)

This is used to assign the value of a field or variable to another field or variable. Parameters:

  • String: This is the variable name.

  • Object: This is the value to be assigned to the variable or field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var aa = DV.getFieldValue(‘GOODS_DESC’);

DV.updateField(‘DESC_GOODS1’, aa);

[NOTE]{.underline}: This is to first get the field value of GOODS_DESC and set the field value to the variable DESC_GOODS1.

DV.writeLog()

This method is used to write log information for user notification or debugging in the EE log file. Parameter:

  • String: This is the text to be written into the log file.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.writeLog("DV.SYS_BANK_COUNTRY="+DV.SYS_BANK_COUNTRY);

{#section-5 .CS-head2}

Variables

The system variables and variables for the Batch Manager – Task function are as follows.

Figure 6. System Variables for the Accounting Rules Function

DV.CHG_AT_DEFERRED

This is used for retrieving the value of deferred charges.

DV.CHG_AT_FREE

This is used for retrieving the value of the waived charges.

DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION

This is used to retrieve the value of the charges to be paid at transaction.

DV.CHG_FOR_FOREIGN

This is used to retrieve the value of charges to be paid by the foreign customer.

DV.CHG_FOR_LOCAL

This is used to retrieve the value of charges to be paid by the local customer.

DV.LEVEL_BUSINESS_UNIT

This is used to retrieve the business unit level.

DV.LEVEL_COMM_RANGE

This is used to retrieve the comm. level.

DV.LEVEL_COUNTRY

This is used to retrieve the country level.

DV.LEVEL_CUSTOMER

This is used to retrieve the customer level.

DV.LEVEL_STANDARD

This is used to retrieve the standard level.

DV.MAINWITHTRXREF

This is used to retrieve the reference name of a reference number setting.

DV.SCOPE_MAINREF

This is used to retrieve the reference name of a reference number setting.

DV.SYS_BANK_COUNTRY

This is used to retrieve the reference name of a transaction number setting.

DV.SYS_BANK_GROUP

This is used to retrieve the bank group.

DV.SYS_BUSI_DATE

This is used to retrieve the business date.

DV.SYS_BUSI_UNIT

This is used to retrieve the business unit.

DV.SYS_FUNCTION_TYPE

This is used to retrieve the function type.

**DV.SYS_LCY **

This is used to retrieve the system’s local currency.

DV.SYS_LCY_2ND

This is used to retrieve the second currency applied.

DV.SYS_ORI_UNIT_CODE

This is used to retrieve the unit code.

DV.SYS_REF_NO

This is used to retrieve the reference number.

**DV.TRXREF **

This is used to retrieve the reference name of a transaction number setting.

Server Side JS Function

Methods

The system methods for the Server Side JS function are as follows.

Figure 6. System Methods for the Server Side JS Function

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: An xPath pertains to the complete path of the data object element in the data object hierarchy. This data object element can be the data object element itself or a child template.

Refer to the following examples.

+———————————————————————–+ | Examples of xPath Values | | | | i. To determine the value of Field1: | | | | - Data object – TestDataObject (This is a DO with a template root | | node.) | | | | - DOTemplate – This is the corresponding template of the DO | | | | - DOTemplate has 3 child templates: DOTemplateA, DOTemplateB, | | DOTemplateC. | | | | - If Field1 is in DOTemplateC, the xPath is: | | TestDataObject.DOTemplateC. | | | | ii. To determine the value of Field1: | | | | - Data object – TestDataObject (This is a DO with a template root | | node) | | | | - DOTemplate – This is the corresponding template of the DO | | | | - DOTemplate has 3 child templates: DOTemplateA, DOTemplateB, | | DOTemplateC. | | | | - DOTemplateC has 2 child templates: DOTemplateC1 and DOTemplateC2. | | | | - If Field1 is in DOTemplateC2, the xPath is: | | TestDataObject.DOTemplateC.DOTemplateC2 | | | | iii. To determine the value of Field1: | | | | - Data object – Test2DataObject (This is a DO with a none-template | | root node) | | | | - Test2DataObject has 3 child templates, all at the same level: | | Template1, Template2, Template3 | | | | - If Field1 is in Template3, the xPath is: | | Test2DataObject.Template3 | +———————————————————————–+

DV.DynaInc(String)

This is used to set the value of the C_DYNAINCLUDE_FIELD_NAME. Parameters:

  • String: this is the name of the .lbi file.

DV.SYS_FloatAdd(arg1,arg2)

This is used to calculate the sum of 2 Float-type numeric values. Parameters:

  • arg1: This is the first Float numeric value.

  • arg2: This is the second Float numeric value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var Add01 = 3000.00

var Add02 = 5000.00

DV.SYS_FloatAdd(Add01,Add02)

Result = 8000.00

DV.SYS_FloatDiv(arg1, arg2)

This is used to calculate the value when one Float-type numeric value is divided by another Float-type numeric values. Parameters:

  • arg1: This is the first Float numeric value.

  • arg2: This is the second Float numeric value by which the first float is to be divided.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var Add01 = 5000.00

var Add02 = 3000.00

DV.SYS_FloatADiv(Add01,Add02)

Result = 1.67

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: The number of decimal places of the resulting value is based on the related currency.

DV.SYS_FloatMul(arg1, arg2)

This is used to calculate the value when one Float-type numeric value is multiplied by another Float-type numeric value. Parameters:

  • arg1: This is the first Float numeric value.

  • arg2: This is the second Float numeric value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var Add01 = 3000.00

var Add02 = 5000.00

DV.SYS_FloatMul(Add01,Add02)

Result = 15,000,000.00,

DV.SYS_FloatSub(arg1, arg2)

This is used to calculate the difference between 2 Float-type numeric values. Parameters:

  • arg1: This is the first Float numeric value.

  • arg2: This is the second Float numeric value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var Add01 = 5000.00

var Add02 = 3000.00

DV.SYS_FloatSub(Add01,Add02)

Result = 2000.00

DV.addErrorInfo(code,parameters)

This calls the error codes that are used by the system to display error messages. The system then terminates all processes immediately. This is similar to the DV.throwException(code, parameters) method. **Parameters: **

  • code: This is the error code.

  • parameters: This is an array containing the parameters used in the error code.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var para=new Array();

para[0]="test";

para[1]="test2";

DV.addErrorInfo("1705",para);

RESULT: The system throws exceptions with the error code 1705 from the ee.input.dir\EE_SYS\ERROR\E1705.xml. There are two parameters defined within the error message; e.g., “The pay amount %1 is larger than %2 that is needed!” where %n is the format of the parameter. The error message shown on the browser is “[E1705] The pay amount test is larger than test2 that is needed!”

DV.addFieldList(Object,String)

This is used to append the fields to an SQL query. These are the fields that are to be selected from a table in the database. This method is normally used together with other methods such as DV.addSQLCondition() and DV.executeQuery() in order to get the expected field value. Parameters:

  • Object: This is the field list. When it is to add the first field in the field list, a null value should be provided.

  • String: This is the field name that is to be included in the field list.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

var fieldList = DV.addFieldList (null, ‘Fld1’);

fieldList = DV.addFieldList (fieldList, ‘Fld2’);

fieldList = DV.addFieldList (fieldList, ‘Fld3’);

…

RESULT: Fld1, Fld2 and Fld3 are the objects to be handled.

DV.addFieldList(ServerDataInfo sdi,String fieldname,String strAlias)

This is used to append the fields to an SQL query. These are the fields that are to be selected from a table in the database. This method is normally used together with other methods such as DV.addSQLCondition() and DV.executeQuery() in order to get the expected field value. Parameters:

  • ServerDataInfo sdi: This is the field list. When it is to add the first field in the field list, a null value should be provided.

  • String fieldname: This is the field name that is to be included in the list.

  • String strAlias: This is the alias of the table.

DV.addSQLCondition(Object,String,String)

This is used to append the fields that compose the SQL select condition. Parameters

  • Object: This is the SQL condition list. If it is used as a condition for the first field, a null value should be provided.

  • String 1: This is the field that is used in the SQL Where condition.

  • String 2: This is placed as the value of the field defined in String 1.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var vMainRef = ‘IMLC000234’;

var sqlCondition= DV.addSQLCondition(null, ‘C_MAIN_REF’, vMainRef);

sqlCondition= DV.addSQLCondition(sqlCondition, ‘C_UNIT_CODE’, ‘201’);

RESULT: …where C_MAIN_REF ='IMLC000234’ and C_UNIT_CODE = ‘201’.

[NOTE]{.underline}: In reading the field list, the system ignores these characters:

  • (, if it precedes the field name; and

  • ), if it follows the field name.

DV.addSQLCondition(ServerDataInfo sdi,String fieldname,String fieldValue,String operator, String relation, String strAlias)

This is used to append the fields that compose the SQL select condition. Parameters:

  • ServerDataInfo sdi: This is the SQL condition list. If it is used as a condition for the first field, a null value should be provided.

  • String fieldName: This is the field that is used in the SQL Where condition.

  • String fieldValue: This is placed as the value of the field defined in String 1.

  • String operator: This is the SQL operator.

  • String relation: This is the SQL relation.

  • String strAlias: This is the alias of the table.

This does not return any value.

[NOTE]{.underline}: In reading the field list, the system ignores these characters:

  • (, if it precedes the field name; and

  • ), if it follows the field name.

DV.addTableList(ServerDataInfo sdi, String TableName, String strAlias)

This method is used to append a table to an SQL query to make sure that the query is selected from multiple tables. This method is normally used together with other methods such as DV.addSQLCondition() and DV.executeQuery() in order to get the expected field value. Parameters:

  • ServerDataInfo sdi: This is the table list. When it is to add the first table in the table list, a null value must be provided.

  • String TableName: This is the table name that is to be added to the query.

  • strAlia: This is the table alias.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var sTableList = DV.addTableList(null,"CNPT_SSI_DO","t1");

sTableList = DV.addTableList(sTableList,"FXDL_MASTER","t2");

DV.addTrxCharge(comCode)

This method is used to add a charge with a commission code. Parameters:

  • comCode: This is the commission code list array or commission code string defined in the standing module

This returns a transaction charge object.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

To add a Letter of Credit Issue Commission

var comList = 'IPLC_OPEN_COMM,EPLC_POST_CHG';

var trxChg = DV.addTrxCharge(comList);

or

var comList = ['IPLC_OPEN_COMM'];

DV.addTrxCharge(comList);

DV.appendNotifyMail(String)

This is used to append the notification mail rule.Parameters:

  • String: This is the name of the mail rule.

DV.calDate(String,int)

This method is used to calculate a new date from a given date +/- a given number of days. Parameters:

  • String: This is the date in string format.

  • Int: This is the number of days to be added or subtracted from the given date.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var date = DV.calDate (‘2005-03-20’, 5);

RESULT: date = 2005-03-25;

DV.calEndWorkingDate(strCntyCode,strStartDate,strDaysValue,strBeforeOrAfter,strlfCheckHol,strlfJumpHol)

This method is used to get the end working date based on the start date and the number of days to add or subtract. Parameters:

  • strCntyCode: This is the country code.

  • strStartDate: This is the starting date.

  • strDaysValue: This is the number of days.

  • strBeforeOrAfter: This is the Before or After flag setting. The possible values are A, the default value, and B.

  • strIfCheckHol: This flag setting indicates whether or not to check holiday dates. The possible values are Y, the default value, and N.

  • strIfJumpHol: This flag setting indicates whether or not to include the holiday dates in the calculation. The possible values are N, the default value, and Y.

This returns the date.

DV.calHoliday(String strDateS,String strDateE,String strSubCntyCode)

This method is used to calculate the number of days between the specified start date and end date excluding the holidays and weekends. Parameters:

  • String StrDateS: This is the start date.

  • String StrDateE: This is the end date.

  • String strSubCntyCode: This is the sub-country code (or simply the country code).

This returns an integer that indicates the number of days.

DV.calNumberOfTerms(String,String,int)

This method is used to calculate number of terms from the start date to the end date. The term may be monthly, quarterly, semi-annually, or annually. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the start date.

  • String 2: This is the end date.

  • int: This is the term period.

This returns an Integer.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.calNumberOfTerms(‘2007-02-12’,’ 2007-05-12’,10)

DV.calWorkingDay(String strDateS,String strDateE,String strSubCntyCode)

This method is used to calculate the number of working days between a specified start date and a specified end date. Parameters:

  • String strDateS: This is the start date.

  • String strDateE: This is the end date.

  • String strSubCntyCode: This is the sub-country code (or country code)

This returns an Integer.

DV.calculate(commListArr, calPara)

This method is used to calculate charges. Parameters:

  • commListArr: This is the commission code list array. The array follows this order: Commission Code1, Commission Code 2.
  • calPara: This is the parameter string array, which may contain the following variables.

  • trxCcy is the currency of the transaction.

  • amount is the amount involved in the transaction.

  • sDate is the start date of the transaction.

  • eDate is the end date of the transaction.

  • from is the location of the sender of the express fee.

  • to is the location of the recipient of the express fee.

  • baseDay is the base number of days used in the calculation of interests.

  • plusTimes is the number of times the charges are to be calculated.

  • extendFldsArr allows the values of the fields to be stored, making these fields reusable.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var parameter = ['USD','100000','2011-3-23','2011-4-23','US','CN','360','null',null];

var comList = ['IPLC_OPEN_COMM',’ EPLC_POST_CHG’];

var result = DV.calculate(comList,parameter);

DV.capureDefChargesByScope()

This method is used to retrieve the deferred charges according to the condition defined in the stp.setDefChargeScope() system method.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setDefChargeScope(DV.SCOPE_MAINREF);

DV.capureDefChargesByScope()

DV.checkFieldConversion (String, String);

This method will check the fields which the value is retrieved via field conversion

Parameters:

  • String: The name which will used to load the field conversion configuration file.

  • String: The field name will be checked.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.checkFieldConversion (“INVC_FA_NOTIFY_BY”,“TEST”);

DV.checkFieldConversion (“SSSS_FIN_INF_CD”,“TEST”);

DV.checkHoliday(String strDate, String strSubCntyCode)

This method is used to check whether or not a given date is a holiday. Parameter:

  • String StrDate: This is the date to be verified as a holiday

  • String strSubCntyCode: This is the sub-country code

This returns a Boolean.

DV.checkProtectedFields(Array)

This method checks the protected field that has the original data in the C_TEMP_DATA field. Parameters:

  • Array: The field name array to be checked

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var checklist = [“C_MAIN_REF”,“C_CNTY_CODE”];

DV.checkProtectedFields(checklist);

DV.checkProtectedFields_CUBK(String, Array, Array);

This method checks whether or not the protected field loaded by the GET CUBK or INQUIRE CUBK function has been modified.

Parameters:

  • String: The rule name of the CUBK

  • Array 1: The field name list which will be checked

  • Array 2: The key field name list

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var checklist = [“BUYER_NAME”,“BUYER_ADD”];

var keyfieldname = ['C_CUST_ID'];

DV.checkProtectedFields_CUBK(“EPPM_BUYER”, checklist, keyfieldname)

DV.checkProtectedFields_DO(String, Array);

This method will check the protected field of the DO record. Parameters:

  • String: The XPath of the DO

  • Array: The field name array which will be checked.

**
**

DV.confirmCharge()

This is used to confirm all charges and calculate the charges in the application server.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.confirmCharge();

DV.day1MustbeLaterThanDay2(String strFirstDay, String strSecondDay)

This method is used to check that the first Date field value is later than the second Date field value. Parameters:

  • strFirstDay: This is the first date.

  • strSecondDay: This is the second date.

This returns a Boolean.

DV.day1MustbeLaterThanDay2(strFirstDay,strSecondDay)

These methods are used to check if the first Date field value is later than the second Date field value. Parameters:

  • strFirstDay: This is the first date.

  • strSecondDay: This is the second date.

This returns a Boolean.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

//ISSUE_DT = 2007-09-04; EXPIRY_DT=2007-09-08;

var issueDT=DV.getParamFieldValue("ISSUE_DT");

var expiryDT=DV.getParamFieldValue("EXPIRY_DT");

var dateComp=DV.day1MustbeLaterThanDay2(expiryDT, issueDT);

RESULT: TRUE

DV.delDORec(doName,sCondition)

This method is used to delete a record from a data object according to a defined condition. Parameters:

  • doName: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

  • sCondition: This is the condition for deleting the record. The format is similar to an SQL statement.

This returns a Boolean.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var PARTY_ID2='vicky';

var delcond= 'PARTY_ID=\''+PARTY_ID2+'\'';

DV.delDORec('PARTY_INFO',delcond);

DV.executeQuery(String,Object,Object)

This is used to execute an SQL query with user-defined conditions. This returns the field value that is defined in the field list as a hash map. Parameters:

  • String: This is the table name.

  • Object 1: This is the field list.

  • Object 2: This is the query condition.

This returns the value of the fields that are defined in the field list.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

var fld_list = DV.addFieldList (null, ‘APPL_ID’);

fld_list = DV.addFieldList (fieldList, ‘LC_AMT’);

var vMainRef = DV.getFieldValue(‘C_MAIN_REF’);

var sql_Cnd = DV.addSQLCondition(null, ‘C_MAIN_REF’, vMainRef);

sql_Cnd = DV.addSQLCondition(sql_Cnd, ‘C_UNIT_CODE’, ‘201’);

var result = DV.executeQuery (‘IMLC_MASTER’, fld_list, sql_Cnd);

RESULT: The following SQL is executed: select APPL_ID, LC_AMT from IMLC_MASTER where C_MAIN_REF= vMainRef and C_UNIT_CODE = ‘201’

[NOTE]{.underline}: In reading the field list, the system ignores these characters:

  • (, if it precedes the field name; and

  • ), if it follows the field name.

DV.getBULocalDate()

This method is used to get the local date for the current business unit using this format: yyyy-MM-DD

This returns the date of the current business unit.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

//the application server’s time zone is GMT+8:00;

//the Business Unit’s time zone is GMT+10:00;

//the server date time is 2007-09-08 23:00:00

var BUDate=DV.getBULocalDate();

RESULT: BUDate= 2007-09-09

DV.getBULocalDateTime()

Usage: This method is used to get the local date for the current business unit using this format: yyyy-MM-DD.

This returns the date of the current Business unit.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

//the application server’s time zone is GMT+8:00;

//the Business Unit’s time zone is GMT+10:00;

//the server date time is 2007-09-08 23:00:00

var BUDate=DV.getBULocalDate();

RESULT: BUDate= 2007-09-09

DV.getBULocalTime()

This method is used to get the local date and time for the current business unit, which are the browser date and time, and converts these to the proper format: yyyy-MM-DD HH:mms

This returns the date and time of the current business unit.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

//the application server’s time zone is GMT+8:00;

//the Business Unit’s time zone is GMT+10:00;

//the server date time is 2007-09-08 23:00:00

var BUDateTime=DV.getBULocalDateTime();

RESULT: BUDateTime= 2007-09-09 01:00:00

DV.getBankingGroupID()

This method is used to get the current bank group Id.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

//Bank Group ID is “ChinaSystems”;

var bankGroup=DV.getBankingGroupID();

RESULT: bankGroup = ‘ChinaSystems’;

DV.getBusiUnit()

This method is used to get the current business unit.

This returns the value of the current business unit.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

// SYS_BUSI_UNIT="BOCPC001";

var busiUnit=DV.getBusiUnit();

RESULT: busiUnit = ‘BOCPC001’;

DV.getCUBK(strCUBKMappingName,strKeyFieldValue)

This method is used to get the table field value according to the Get CUBK rule that is passed. Parameters:

  • strCUBKMappingName: This is the Get CUBK mapping rule name.

  • strKeyFieldValue: This is the key field name of the Get CUBK rule.

This returns the field value that is selected from the database according to the Get CUBK rule.

DV.getCataFldVal(fieldName)

This method is used to get the value of the field for the catalog. The field must be included in the catalog of the relevant function. Parameter:

  • fieldName: This is the name of the field which value is to be retrieved.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.getCataFldVal(“C_MAIN_REF”)

DV.getDBFieldValue(Object,String)

This method is used to get the field value from an object parameter. Parameters:

  • Object: This is the object parameter which value is retrieved from the database and assigned to a field.

  • String: This is the field that is assigned with the value obtained from the database.

This returns the value of the defined string (i.e., field or variable).

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var fld_list = DV.addFieldList (null, ‘APPL_ID’);

fld_list = DV.addFieldList (fieldList, ‘LC_AMT’);

var sql_Cnd = DV.addSQLCondition(null, ‘C_MAIN_REF’, ‘IMLC00023’);

sql_Cnd = DV.addSQLCondition(sql_Cnd, ‘C_UNIT_CODE’, ‘201’);

var result = DV.executeQuery (‘IMIS_MASTER’, fld_list, sql_Cnd);

var vApplID = DV.getDBFieldValue(result, ‘APPL_ID’);

var vLCAmt = DV.getDBFieldValue(result, ‘LC_AMT’);

if (vApplID == '’ || vLCAmt == 0)

result = DV.executeQuery(‘IMIS_ISSUE’, fld_list, sql_Cnd);

vApplID = DV.getDBFieldValue(result, ‘APPL_ID’);

vLCAmt = DV.getDBFieldValue(result, ‘LC_AMT’);

[NOTE]{.underline}: Use C_MAIN_REF = ‘IMLC00023’ and C_UNIT_CODE = ‘201’ as the SQL condition to get the APPL_ID field value and the LC_AMT field value from the IMIS_MASTER table; if the returned APPL_ID is blank or the returned LC_AMT = 0, then C_MAIN_REF = ‘IMLC00023’ and C_UNIT_CODE = ‘201’ as the SQL condition instructs the system to get the APPL_ID value and LC_AMT value from the IMIS_ISSUE table.

DV.getDORecCount(doName,sCondition)

This method is used to count the number of records in a data object that satisfies the defined condition. Parameters:

  • doName: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

  • sCondition: This is the condition for including the record in the record count. The format is similar to an SQL statement.

This returns an Integer.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

DV.getDORecCount('PARTY_INFO','PARTY_NM=\'1\'');

DV.getDOValue(doInst,fieldName)

This method is used for getting the value of a field from a data object. Parameters:

  • doInst: This is the parameter that contains the result of the applied DV.getRecord() or DV.getRecords() method.

  • fieldName: This is the data object field which value is to be retrieved.

DV.getDateByIncrement(strDate,sYearsIncr,sDaysIncr)

This method is used to calculate the date based on the parameter that is passed. Parameters:

  • strDate: This is the Date field name.

  • sYearsIncr: This is the number of years to be added to the Date field.

  • sDaysIncr: This is the number of days to be added to the Date field.

This returns a String.

DV.getDateByStr(strDate)

This method is used to get the date value from a string value, e.g., 2008-04-26. Parameter

  • strDate: This is the date string.

This returns a String.

DV.getExchangeRate(strFromCCY,strToCCY,strRateType)

This method is used to inquire on multiple exchange rate, MD Flag setting, and Tolerance. **Parameters: **

  • strFromCCY: This is the From CCY value.

  • strToCCY: This is the To CCY value.

  • strRateType: This is the rate type value.

This returns an array containing the query result {rateValue,MDFlag,ToleranceValue}.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var rate= new Array();

rate=DV.getExchangeRate("CNY", "USD", "Booking Rate");

RESULT: The query is: “SELECT F_VALUE, C_MD_FLAG, F_TOLERANCE FROM eximtrx.STD_EXCHAN_RATE where C_FROM_CCY='CNY' AND C_TO_CCY='USD' and C_DESC_ID='Booking Rate'". The query result is an array including the F_VALUE (the values of the exchange rate), C_MD_FLAG (the flag to indicate whether the exchange value is multiplied or divided), and F_TOLERANCE (the tolerance of the exchange rate).

DV.getExchangeRates(exchangeAry)

This method is used to obtain multiple exchange rates, MD Flag settings, and Tolerance settings. **Parameter: **

  • exchangeAry: This is the two-dimensional array that includes the From CCY, To CCY and Rate Type.

This returns a two-dimensional array that contains the query result (F_VALUE, C_MD_FLAG and F_TOLERANCE).

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

var aExchangeRate=[["CNY","USD","Booking Rate"],["HKD","CNY","Booking Rate"]];

var rates=DV.getExchangeRates(aExchangeRate);

RESULT: The query is “SELECT F_VALUE, C_MD_FLAG, F_TOLERANCE FROM eximtrx.STD_EXCHAN_RATE where C_FROM_CCY='CNY' AND C_TO_CCY='USD' and C_DESC_ID='Booking Rate' and SELECT F_VALUE, C_MD_FLAG, F_TOLERANCE FROM eximtrx.STD_EXCHAN_RATE where C_FROM_CCY='HKD' AND C_TO_CCY='CNY' and C_DESC_ID='Booking Rate'". The query result is a two-dimensional including the F_VALUE (the values of the exchange rate), C_MD_FLAG (the flag to indicate whether the exchange value is multiplied or divided), and F_TOLERANCE( the tolerance of the exchange rate); for example: [[“8.00”,“M”,“0.1”],[ “1.00”,“M”,“0.1”]].

DV.getFieldSumByDoName(fieldname,doName,sCondition)

This method is used to get the sum of the values of a field in a data object according to the data object’s name and a defined condition. This name must be unique among the elements of the given data object (i.e., data object tree). Parameters:

  • fieldname: This is the field, from a data object with multiple records, which sum is to be obtained.

  • doName: This is the name of the data object.

  • sCondition: This is the condition for including the field value in the sum to be calculated. The format is similar to an SQL statement.

This returns a String, which contains the sum of the values of the given field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV. getFieldSumByDoName ('LC_AMT','PARTY_INFO','PARTY_NM=\'1\'');

Result: 2.00

DV.getFieldSumByXpath(fieldname,doxPath,sCondition)

This method is used to get the sum of the values of a field in a data object according to the data object’s xPath and a defined condition. Parameters:

  • fieldname: This is the field, from a data object with multiple records, which sum is to be obtained.

  • doxPath: This is the xPath of the data object.

  • sCondition: This is the condition for including the field value in the sum to be calculated. The format is similar to an SQL statement.

This returns a String, which contains the sum of the values of the given field.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

DV.getFieldSumByXpath ('CL_AMT','JaneLineItem.Jane_Adjust_test', 'LC_NO=\''+test1+'\'');

Result: 10.00

DV.getForeignBalTotalAmt(ccy)

This is used to get the total balance amount of the foreign customer. Parameters:

  • ccy: This is the currency in which the resulting balance is to be returned

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var balAmtLocal = DV.getForeignBalTotalAmt("USD");

DV.getForeignTotalCollectAmt()

This is used to get the total amount, including the charge amount and VAT amount, collected from the foreign customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalCollAmt = DV.getForeignTotalCollectAmt();

DV.getForeignTotalCollectCharge()

This is used to get the total amount of bank charges collected from the foreign customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalCollChg = DV.getForeignTotalCollectCharge();

DV.getForeignTotalCollectVAT()

This is used to get the total VAT amount collected from the foreign customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalCollVAT = DV.getForeignTotalCollectVAT();

DV.getForeignTotalPayAmt()

This is used to get the total amount paid by the foreign customer, including the charge payment and VAT payment amounts.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalPayAmt = DV.getForeignTotalPayAmt();

DV.getForeignTotalPayCharge()

This is used to get the total amount of bank charges paid by the foreign customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalPayCharges = DV.getForeignTotalPayCharge();

DV.getForeignTotalPayVAT()

This is used to get the total VAT amount paid by the foreign customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalPayVAT = DV.getForeignTotalPayVAT();

DV.getLastWorkingDay(String strDate,String strSubCnty)

This method is used to get the last working date beginning from the specified starting working date. Parameters:

  • String strDate: This is the start date.

  • String strSubCnty: This is the sub-country code (or country code).

This returns a String.

DV.getLineValue(String,int)

Parameters**:**

  • String: This is the string from which the sub-text is to be retrieved.

  • Int: This is the position within the line where the system starts retrieving the text.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.getLineValue(“address”, 20)

DV.getLocalBalTotalAmt(ccy)

This is used to get the total balance amount of the local customer. Parameters:

  • ccy: This is the currency in which the resulting balance is to be returned

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var balAmtLocal = DV.getLocalBalTotalAmt("USD");

DV.getLocalTotalCollectAmt()

This is used to get the total amount, including the charge amount and VAT amount, collected from the local customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var localTotalCollAmt = DV.getLocalTotalCollectAmt();

DV.getLocalTotalCollectCharge()

This is used to get the total amount of bank charges collected from the local customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var localTotalCollChg = DV.getLocalTotalCollectCharge();

DV.getLocalTotalCollectVAT()

This is used to get the total VAT amount collected from the local customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var locaTotalCollVAT = DV.getLocalTotalCollectVAT();

DV.getLocalTotalPayAmt()

This is used to get the total amount paid by the local customer, including charge and VAT payments.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var locaTotalPayAmt = DV.getLocalTotalPayAmt();

DV.getLocalTotalPayCharge()

This is used to get the total amount of bank charges paid by the local customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var locaTotalPayChg = DV.getLocalTotalPayCharge()

DV.getLocalTotalPayVAT()

This is used to get the total VAT amount paid by the local customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var locaTotalPayVAT = DV.getLocalTotalPayVAT();

DV.getNextWorkingDay(String strDate,String strSubCnty)

This method is used to retrieve the next working day based on the current date. Parameters:

  • String strDate: This is the current date.
  • String strSubCnty: This is the sub-country code (or country code).

This returns a String.

DV.getParamFieldValue(String)

This is used to get field values from the transaction JSP using the value as parameter for other functions, e.g. SYS_GetDataBySSS(). Parameter:

  • String: This is the field name.

This returns the value of the transaction field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

//contents of SYS_GetDataBySSS(‘SSSTest’,‘APPL_ID’) function:

//Set SQL condition

var UNIT_CODE = DV.getParamFieldValue(‘C_UNIT_CODE’);

var APPL_ID = DV.getParamFieldValue(‘APPL_ID’);

var CUST_ID = UNIT_CODE+'ISSU LC086COMMAED'+APPL_ID;

var sql_condition = DV.addSQLCondition(null,‘C_UNIT_CODE’,UNIT_CODE);

DV.addSQLCondition(sql_condition,‘C_MAIN_REF’,CUST_ID);

RESULT: The C_UNIT_CODE and APPL_ID field values are retrieved from the JSP. These values are used as an SQL condition parameter.

DV.getPartValue(String,int,int)

This method is used to get a particular part of a field value through a specified starting position and a defined data length. Parameters:

  • String: This is the source of the sub-text to be retrieved

  • Int 1: This is the start position.

  • Int 2: This is the number of characters to retrieve.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.getPartValue(“address”, 10, 6)

DV.getRecord(doName,sCondition)

This method is used for retrieving a data object record based on a defined condition. Parameters:

  • doName: This is the name of the data object.

  • sCondition: This is the condition for retrieving the record.

DV.getRecords(doName)

This method is used to retrieve the records of a data object. Parameter:

  • String doName: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

This returns an array of records.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.getRecords('PARTY_INFO');

DV.getRefNo(strRefName,sRefType,ignoreAutoDisabling)

This method is used to get the reference number. Parameters:

  • strRefName: This is the reference number rule defined in the browser Standing Data module.

  • sRefType: This is the reference number type (e.g., SYSTEM_IMG_RE). If there is more than one reference number in the transaction, these numbers must have different types. This is an optional parameter.

  • ignoreAutoDisabling: This filters the function types that are to get the reference number. This may have a T or F value.

This returns a String.

DV.getServerDate()

This method is used to get the server date and time and converts these to the proper format: yyyy-MM-DD HH:mms.

This returns a String.

DV.getServerDateTime()

This method is used to get the server date and time and converts these to the proper format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.

This returns a String.

DV.getServerTime()

This method is used to get the server time and converts this to the proper time format: HH:MM:SS.

This returns a String.

DV.getSubDays(strFirstDay,strSecondDay,strCntyCode,strSubCntyCode,isGetWorkDay)

This method is used to get the number of days between two specified dates. Parameters:

  • strFirstDay: This is the first date.

  • strSecondDay: This is the second date.

  • strCntyCode: This is the country code.

  • strSubCntyCode: This is the sub-country code.

  • isGetWorkDay: This flag setting indicates whether or not to include the working days in the calculation.

This returns an Integer.

DV.getSysBusiDate(string,string,string)

This method is used to get the system business date.

  • String 1: This is the name of the bank.

  • String 2: This is the name of the country.

  • String 3: This is the name of the business unit.

DV.getSysDate()

This method is used to get the system date.

DV.getTableData(strTableName,where,fieldList)

This method is used to get the table field value from the server side. **Parameters: **

  • strTableName: This is the name of the table to be queried.

  • where: This is the query condition to be used.

  • fieldList: This is the field list to be queried.

This returns an array that contains the query result.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

var appl=DV.getParamFieldValue("APPL_ID");

var sql="CUST_ID+'"+appl+"' and C_TRX_STATUS='M'";

var fld_list="CUST_NM;CUST_NM_ADD";

var result=DV.getTableData("eximtrx.CUST_MASTER",sql,fld_list);

RESULT: The query is “select CUST_NM, CUST_NM_ADD from eximtrx.CUST_MASTER where CUST_NM=[APPL_ID] and C_TRX_STATUS='M’ " . The query result is an array.

**DV.getTableMultiData(String strTableName, String where, String fieldList) **

This method is used to retrieve table data based on a condition and return a two-dimensional string array. **Parameters: **

  • strTableName: This is the name of the table to be queried.

  • where: This is the query condition to be used.

  • fieldList: These pertain to the fields which values are to be retrieved and populated into a string array.

DV.getTableMultiDataToArray(ServerDataInfo tableName, ServerDataInfo fldList, ServerDataInfo sqlCondition, String orderby)

This is used to retrieve table data based on a given condition and store the values in another array. This can invoke a call-back function. Parameters:

  • tableName: This is the table that is to be inquired on.

  • fieldList: These are the fields which values are to be retrieved and populated into an array.

  • ServerDataInfo sqlCondition: This is the condition for inquring on the table.

  • String orderBy: This is the order by which the queried fields are to be sorted.

[NOTE:]{.underline}

In reading the field list, the system ignores these characters:

  • (, if it precedes the field name; and

  • ), if it follows the field name.

DV.getTrxFieldValue(String)

This method is used to get the transaction field value. Parameter:

  • String: This is the field name.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

…

var vApplID = DV.getDBFieldValue(result, ‘APPL_ID’); // to get APPL_ID from DB

DV.updateTrxFieldValue(‘APPL_ID’, vApplID);

//to update the DB value to transaction field APPLI_ID in the memory;

var vNewApplID = DV.getTrxFieldValue(‘APPL_ID’);

/**

to get the updated APPL_ID value from memory and set it to the variable vNewApplID;

**/

…

RESULT: The APPL_ID value is first obtained from the database, and is then updated in the APPL_ID field from the memory, after which the updated APPL_ID value is obtained from the system memory and populates the variable vNewApplID for further processing.

DV.getValue(fieldName,doName,sCondition)

This method is used to get the value of a field from a data object according to a defined condition. Parameters:

  • fieldName: This is the data object field which value is to be retrieved.

  • doName: This is the name of the data object.

  • sCondition: This is the condition for determining the record that contains the field which value is to be retrieved. The condition, which is similar to an SQL statement, can be null. When this results in more than one value (record), the system returns the first value.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

var PARTY_ID='PARTY_ID';

var cond='PARTY_ID=\''+PARTY_ID+'\'';

var partyID=DV.getValue('PARTY_ID','PARTY_INFO',cond);

Result: 1

DV.init(String, String, String, String)

This method is used to set the initial exchange rate to be used for a charge transactions.

Parameters:

  • String1: This is the exchange rate applied between Transaction- and Charge Agreement-Currency

  • String2: This is the exchange rate applied between Charge Collect- and Charge Agreement-Currency

  • String3: This is the exchange rate applied between Charge Unpaid- and Charge Agreement-Currency

  • String4: This is the exchange rate applied between Charge Collect- and Charge Unpaid-Currency

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.init("Booking Rate", "Booking Rate", "Booking Rate", "Booking Rate");

DV.mapDynamicParas(dynaPara)

This method is used to calculate charges based on dynamic fields. Parameter:

  • dynaPara: This is the array of dynamic fields.

DV.mapForeignCust(String, String, String, String)

This method is used to define the field names that are related to the local customer.

Parameters:

  • String1: This is the field name of the foreign customer Id.

  • String2: This is the field name of the coreign customer Name.

  • String3: This is the name of the ‘Foreign Customer Pay CCY’ field.

  • String4: This is the field name of the foreign customer account number field name

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.mapForeignCust("BENE_ID", "BENE_NM", "BENE_CCY", "BENE_ACNO");

DV.mapLocalCust(String, String, String, String)

This method is used to define the field names that are related to the local customer.

Parameters:

  • String1: This is the field name of the local customer Id.

  • String2: This is the field name of the local customer name.

  • String3: This is the name of the ‘Local Customer Pay CCY’ field.

  • String4: This is the field name of the local customer account number

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.mapLocalCust("APPL_ID","APPL_NM",“CUST_PAY_CCY","CUST_ACNO");

DV.match(String mtYype, String ruleData)

This method is used to perform auto matching for MT300, MT320, MT305 and MT306. Parameters:

  • String mtType: This is the SWIFT message type.

  • String ruleData: This is the name of the matching rule. Multiple rules may specified, separated by this character: |.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.match("MT300", "3,3,FXS;FXDL_BK_SPOT,FXDL_BK_FWD;SWIFT_MATCH_STATUS|2,2,MM;FXDL_BK_SPOT,FXDL_BK_FWD;SWIFT_MATCH_STATUS");

In this example, 3,3 means that the system retrieves the fourth character from the value of Tag 20 of the SWIFT MT300 message, after which, the system counts three characters. If the three characters are equivalent to ‘FXS’, the system runs the validation.

Similarly, the “2,2” parameter indicates that the system locates the third character and retrieves the succeeding two characters. If the values of the characters correspond to ‘MM’, the system executes the operation.

DV.setAllCollCcy(String)

This method is used to set the initial charge collect currency.

Parameters:

  • String: This is the bank collection currency

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setAllCollCcy('USD');

DV.setAllDefPayAt(String at)

This method is used to set the deferred charges Pay at value. Parameter:

  • String: This is the value of the deferred Pay At charge.

DV.setAllLocalPayCcy(String)

This method is used to set the value of the ‘Local Customer Pay CCY’ field. Parameter:

  • String: This is the local customer payment currency.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setAllLocalPayCcy('USD');

DV.setAllPayAt(payAt)

This is used to set the initial value of the ‘Paid At’ field. Parameters:

  • payAt: This is the value of the ‘Paid At’ field. The possible values are DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION (Transaction), DV.CHG_AT_DEFERRED (Deferred), DV.CHG_AT_FREE (Waived).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setAllPayAt(DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION);

DV.setAllPayBy(payBy)

This is used to set the value of the ‘Paid By’ field. Parameter:

  • payBy: This is the value of the ‘Paid By’ field. The possible values are: DV. CHG_FOR_LOCAL (Local Customer), and DV.CHG_FOR_FOREIGN (Foreign Customer).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setAllPayBy(DV.CHG_FOR_LOCAL);

DV.setAllUnpaidCcy(String)

This method is used to set the value of ‘Balance CCY’ field. Parameter:

  • String: This is the balance currency.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setAllUnpaidCcy('USD');

DV.setDOValue(doInst,fieldname,value)

This method is used to set or assign the value of a data object field that is retrieved through the result of the DV.getRecord() or DV.getRecords() method. Parameters:

  • doInst: This is the parameter that contains the result of the applied DV.getRecord() or DV.getRecords() method.

  • fieldname: This is the field of the data object which value is to be set.

  • value: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.setDOValue(record,'PARTY_NM','betty001');

DV.getValue('PARTY_NM','PARTY_INFO','');

Result: betty001

DV.setDefChargeScope(scope)

This is used to define the condition when retrieving deferred charges (i.e., transaction reference, main reference). Parameters:

  • scope: This is the condition for retrieving the deferred charges. The possible values are: SCOPE_MAINREF (deferred charges are to be retrieved from the main or whole transaction), TRXREF (deferred charges are to be retrieved from a transaction reference), MAINWITHTRXREF (deferred charges are to be retrieved from both the main and transaction reference).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setDefChargeScope(DV.SCOPE_MAINREF);

DV.setDefPayAt(String commCode, String at)

This is used to set the initial value of the deferred charge’s Paid At field. Parameters:

  • String commCode: This is the value of the commission code
  • payAt: This is the value of the ‘Paid At’ field. The possible values are: DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION (Transaction), DV.CHG_AT_DEFERRED (Deferred), DV.CHG_AT_FREE (Waived).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setDefPayAt(DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION);

DV.setDiscRate(String, int)

This is used to set the discount rate. Parameters:

  • String: This is the commission code or the commission code string list array

  • int: This is the discount rate

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var comList = ['IPLC_OPEN_COMM',’ EPLC_POST_CHG’];

DV.setDiscRate(comList,'20');

OR

DV.setDiscRate('IPLC_OPEN_COMM','20');

DV.setGetDefChgScope(scope)

This is used to define the where condition when retrieving deferred charges. This can be used with the DV.getCataFldVal() system method. The field usedin the condition must be included in the Charge deferred table. Parameter:

  • scope: This is the condition for retrieving the deferred charges.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var main = DV.getCataFldVal(“C_MAIN_REF”)

var trx = DV.getCataFldVal(“C_TRX_REF”)

var charge = "C_MAIN_REF='" + main + "' AND C_TRX_REF='" + trx+ "' ";

DV.setGetDefChgScope(charge)

DV.setPayAt(String, payAt)

This is used to set the initial value of the ‘Paid At’ field in a transaction with a commission code. Parameters:

  • String: This is the name of the commission code.

  • payAt: This is the value of the ‘Paid At’ field. The possible values are DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION (Transaction), DV.CHG_AT_DEFERRED (Deferred), DV.CHG_AT_FREE (Waived). The default value is DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setPayAt('IPLC_OPEN_COMM',DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION);

DV.setPayBy(String, payBy)

This is used to set the value of the ‘Paid At’ field in a transaction with a commission code. Parameters:

  • String: This is the name of the commission code.

  • payBy: This is the value of the ‘Paid At’ field. The possible values are DV.CHG_FOR_LOCAL (Local Customer), and DV.CHG_FOR_FOREIGN (Foreign Customer).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

If the charge is paid by the ‘Local Customer’:

DV.setPayBy('IPLC_OPEN_COMM',DV.CHG_FOR_LOCAL);

DV.setValue(fieldName,doName,value,sCondition)

This method is used to set or assign the value of a field from a data object according to a defined condition. Parameters:

  • fieldName: This is the data object field which value is to be set.

  • doName: This is the name of the data object.

  • value: This is the value to be assigned to the field based on the given condition.

  • sCondition: This is the condition for assigning the value to the field. The condition, which is similar to an SQL statement, can be null. When this results in more than one value (or record), the system returns the first record.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

var PARTY_ID='PARTY_ID';

var cond='PARTY_ID=\''+PARTY_ID+'\'';

DV.setValue('PARTY_ID','PARTY_INFO','test001','1=1');

var PARTY_ID=DV.getValue('PARTY_ID', 'PARTY_INFO',cond);

Result: test001

DV.show(String,boolean)

This is used to show or hide a data object that is attached to a transaction function. Parameters:

  • String: This is the name of the data object. This can also be the xPath of the data object.

  • boolean: This indicates whether or not the DO is to be shown. The values are true and false.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

i. DV.show("R2Goods",false);

ii. DV.show("R2PaymentTermsRe;R2SettlementTermsRe;R2PaymentObligationRe;R2DatasetRequiredRe;UserDefinedInformationRe",false);

DV.throwException(code,parameters)

This method is used, when validation is unsuccessful. The system calls the error code and terminates the processing immediately. **Parameters: **

  • Code: This is the error code.

  • Parameters: This is the array that contains the parameters that are used in the error code.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

var para=new Array();

para[0]="test";

para[1]="test2";

DV.throwException("1705",para);

RESULT: The system throws an exception with the error code 1705 (ee.input.dir\EE_SYS\ERROR\E1705.xml). There are two parameters that are defined within the error message: “The pay amount %1 is larger than %2 that is needed!” (%n is the format of the parameter). The error message that is shown on the browser is: “[E1705]The pay amount test is larger than test2 that is needed!”

DV.toDouble(String)

This is used to convert the value of a string into a Double data type. Parameter:

  • String: This may be any numeric string value.

This returns a Double value that is converted from the specified string value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.toDouble(“LC_AMT”)

DV.toFloat(String)

This method is used to convert the value of a string into a Float data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into a Float data type.

This returns a Float data type.

DV.toInteger(String)

This method is used to convert a value of a string to an Integer data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into the Integer data type.

This returns an Integer.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.toInteger(“LC_AMT”)

DV.toLong(String)

This method is used to convert the value of a string to a Long data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into a Long data type.

This returns a Long data type.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

DV.toLong(“LC_AMT”)

DV.updateSQLCondition(Object,String,String)

This is used to update a field value in an existing SQL select condition. Parameters:

  • Object: This parameter pertains to the SQL condition.

  • String 1: This is the transaction field name.

  • String 2: This is the value in the database of the specified field**.**

This returns an Object.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

var sql_cnd = DV.addSQLCondition(null, ‘C_UNIT_CODE’, ‘UNIT_CODE’);

sql_cnd = DV.addSQLCondition(sql_cnd, ‘C_MAIN_REF’, ‘CUST_ID’);

…

var CUST_ID = UNIT_CODE + ‘153ISSAED’;

DV.updateSQLCondition((sql_cnd, ‘C_MAIN_REF’, CUST_ID);

[NOTE]{.underline}: The C_MAIN_REF value in the original SQL condition is updated after the CUST_ID value is updated by “var CUST_ID = UNIT_CODE + ‘153ISSAED’”

DV.updateTrxFieldValue(String,Variable)

This method is used to update a transaction field value. Parameters:

  • String: This is the name of the JSP field which value is to be updated.

  • Variable: This is the value that is to be assigned to the JSP field.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

var CHG_CCY = DV.getParamFieldValue(‘SYS_LCY’);

DV.updateTrxFieldValue(‘CHG_CCY’, CHG_CCY);

Result: the transaction field CHG_CCY’s value is updated and gets the same value of the SYS_LCY.

DV.writeLog(String)

This method is used to write log information for user notification or debugging in the EE log file. Parameter:

  • String: This is the text to be written into the log file.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.writeLog("DV.SYS_BANK_COUNTRY="+DV.SYS_BANK_COUNTRY);

{#section-6 .CS-head2}

Variables

The system variables for the Server Side JS function are as follows.

Figure 6. System Variables for Server Side JS Function

DV.CHG_AT_DEFERRED

This is used for retrieving the value of deferred charges.

DV.CHG_AT_FREE

This is used for retrieving the value of the waived charges.

DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION

This is used to retrieve the value of the charges to be paid at transaction.

DV.CHG_FOR_FOREIGN

This is used to retrieve the value of charges to be paid by the foreign customer.

DV.CHG_FOR_LOCAL

This is used to retrieve the value of charges to be paid by the local customer.

DV.LEVEL_BUSINESS_UNIT

This is used to retrieve the business unit.

DV.LEVEL_COMM_RANGE

This is used to retrieve the comm. level.

DV.LEVEL_COUNTRY

This is used to retrieve the country level.

DV.LEVEL_CUSTOMER

This is used to retrieve the customer level.

DV.LEVEL_STANDARD

This is used to retrieve the standard level.

DV.MAINWITHTRXREF

This is the transaction reference for the charge trxEvent.

DV.SCOPE_MAINREF

This is used to retrieve the reference name of a reference number setting.

DV.SYS_BANK_COUNTRY

This is used to retrieve the bank country.

DV.SYS_BANK_GROUP

This is used to retrieve the bank group.

DV.SYS_BUSI_DATE

This is used to retrieve the business date.

DV.SYS_BUSI_UNIT

This is used to retrieve the business unit.

DV.SYS_FUNCTION_TYPE

This is used to retrieve the function type.

**DV.SYS_LCY **

This is used to retrieve the system’s local currency.

DV.SYS_LCY_2ND

This is used to retrieve the second currency applied.

DV.SYS_ORI_UNIT_CODE

This is used to retrieve the unit code.

DV.SYS_PRX_USER_ID

This is used to retrieve the user Id

DV.SYS_REF_NAME

This is used to retrieve the reference rule.

DV.SYS_REF_NO

This is used to retrieve the reference number.

DV.SYS_USER_ID

This is used to retrieve the logon user Id.

DV.TRXREF

This is used to retrieve the reference name of a transaction number setting.

STP Setting Function

The system methods and variables for the STP Setting function are as follows.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE:

i. The ISM message type is reserved for special projects only.

ii. An xPath pertains to the complete path of the data object element in the data object hierarchy. This data object element can be the data object element itself or a child template.

+———————————————————————–+ | Examples of xPath Values | | | | i. To determine the value of Field1: | | | | - Data object – TestDataObject (This is a DO with a template root | | node.) | | | | - DOTemplate – This is the corresponding template of the DO | | | | - DOTemplate has 3 child templates: DOTemplateA, DOTemplateB, | | DOTemplateC. | | | | - If Field1 is in DOTemplateC, the xPath is: | | TestDataObject.DOTemplateC. | | | | ii. To determine the value of Field1: | | | | - Data object – TestDataObject (This is a DO with a template root | | node) | | | | - DOTemplate – This is the corresponding template of the DO | | | | - DOTemplate has 3 child templates: DOTemplateA, DOTemplateB, | | DOTemplateC. | | | | - DOTemplateC has 2 child templates: DOTemplateC1 and DOTemplateC2. | | | | - If Field1 is in DOTemplateC2, the xPath is: | | TestDataObject.DOTemplateC.DOTemplateC2 | | | | iii. To determine the value of Field1: | | | | - Data object – Test2DataObject (This is a DO with a none-template | | root node) | | | | - Test2DataObject has 3 child templates, all at the same level: | | Template1, Template2, Template3 | | | | - If Field1 is in Template3, the xPath is: | | Test2DataObject.Template3 | +———————————————————————–+

{#section-7 .CS-head2}

Incoming SWIFT

The following sections list the methods and variables used in the STP settings for incoming SWIFT messages.

####### Business Unit: Methods

Figure 6. Methods for STP Incoming SWIFT – Business Unit

Method Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | stp.SYS_GetExchang | | This method is used | | eRate(String | | to retrieve the | | fromCCY,String | | exchange rate value. | | toCCY,String | | | | rateType):double | | Parameters: | | | | | | | | - String | | | | fromCCY: This | | | | is the From CCY | | | | value. | | | | | | | | - String toCCY: | | | | This is the To | | | | CCY value. | | | | | | | | - String | | | | rateType: This | | | | is the rate type | | | | value. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | stp.SYS_GetPayment | | This method is used | | Routing() | | to get the payment | | | | record and display it | | | | on the transaction | | | | screen. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | stp.addTrxCharge(co | | This method is used | | mCode) | | to add a charge with | | | | a commission code. | | | | | | | | Parameters: | | | | | | | | - comCode: This is | | | | the commission | | | | code list array | | | | or commission | | | | code string | | | | defined in the | | | | standing module | | | | | | | | This returns a | | | | transaction charge | | | | object. | | | | | | | | [EXAMPLE]{.underlin | | | | e}: | | | | | | | | To add a Letter of | | | | Credit Issue | | | | Commission | | | | | | | | var comList = | | | | 'IPLC_OPEN_COMM,EP | | | | LC_POST_CHG'; | | | | | | | | var trxChg = | | | | stp.addTrxCharge(comL | | | | ist); | | | | | | | | or | | | | | | | | var comList = | | | | ['IPLC_OPEN_COMM\ | | | | ‘]; | | | | | | | | stp.addTrxCharge(comL | | | | ist); | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | stp.calEndWorkingDa | | This method is used | | te(String | | to get the end | | strCntyCode, String | | working date based on | | strStartDate, String | | the start date and | | strDaysValue, String | | the number of days | | strBeforeOrAfter, | | delayed. | | String strlfCheckHol, | | | | String | | Parameters: | | strlfJumpHol) | | | | | | - strCntyCode: This | | | | is the country | | | | code. This is | | | | mandatory. | | | | | | | | - strStartDate: | | | | This is the | | | | starting date. | | | | This is | | | | mandatory. | | | | | | | | - strDaysValue: | | | | This is the | | | | number of days | | | | delayed. This is | | | | mandatory. | | | | | | | | - strBeforeOrAfter: | | | | This is the | | | | Before or After | | | | flag setting. The | | | | possible values | | | | are A, the | | | | default value, | | | | and B. | | | | | | | | - strIfCheckHol: | | | | This flag setting | | | | indicates whether | | | | or not to check | | | | holiday dates. | | | | The possible | | | | values are Y, the | | | | default value, | | | | and N. | | | | | | | | - strIfJumpHol: | | | | This flag setting | | | | indicates whether | | | | or not to include | | | | the holiday dates | | | | in the | | | | calculation. The | | | | possible values | | | | are N, the | | | | default value, | | | | and Y. This | | | | parameter is only | | | | available if the | | | | strfCheckHol | | | | value is Y. | | | | | | | | This returns the | | | | date. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | stp.calculate(commL | | This method is used | | istArr, | | to calculate charges. | | calPara) | | | | | | Parameters: | | | | | | | | - commListArr: This | | | | is the commission | | | | code list array. | | | | The array follows | | | | this order: | | | | Commission Code | | | | 1, Commission | | | | Code 2. | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | - calPara: This | | | | is the parameter | | | | string array, | | | | which may contain | | | | the following | | | | variables. | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | - trxCcy is the | | | | currency of the | | | | transaction. | | | | | | | | - amount is the | | | | amount involved | | | | in the | | | | transaction. | | | | | | | | - sDate is the | | | | start date of the | | | | transaction. | | | | | | | | - eDate is the end | | | | date of the | | | | transaction. | | | | | | | | - from is the | | | | location of the | | | | sender of the | | | | express fee. | | | | | | | | - to is the | | | | location of the | | | | recipient of the | | | | express fee. | | | | | | | | - baseDay is the | | | | base number of | | | | days used in the | | | | calculation of | | | | interests. | | | | | | | | - plusTimes is the | | | | number of times | | | | the charges are | | | | to be calculated. | | | | | | | | - extendFldsArr | | | | allows the values | | | | of the fields to | | | | be stored, making | | | | these fields | | | | reusable. | | | | | | | | [EXAMPLE]{.underlin | | | | e}: | | | | | | | | var parameter = | | | | ['USD','100000', | | | | '2011-3-23','2011- | | | | 4-23','US','CN', | | | | '360','null',null | | | | ]; | | | | | | | | var comList = | | | | ['IPLC_OPEN_COMM\ | | | | ‘,’ | | | | EPLC_POST_CHG’]; | | | | | | | | var result = | | | | stp.calculate(comList | | | | ,parameter); | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | stp.capureDefCharge | | This method is used | | sByScope() | | to retrieve the | | | | deferred charges | | | | according to the | | | | condition defined in | | | | the | | | | stp.setDefChargeScope | | | | () | | | | system method. | | | | | | | | [EXAMPLE]{.underlin | | | | e}: | | | | | | | | stp.setDefChargeScope | | | | (STP.SCOPE_MAINREF); | | | | | | | | stp.capureDefChargesB | | | | yScope() | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | stp.checkHoliday(St | | This method is used | | ring | | to check whether or | | strDate,String | | not a given date is a | | strSubCntyCode) | | holiday. | | | | | | | | Parameters: | | | | | | | | - String strDate: | | | | This is the date | | | | to be verified as | | | | a holiday. | | | | | | | | - String | | | | strSubCntyCode: | | | | This is the | | | | sub-country code | | | | (or country | | | | code). | | | | | | | | This returns a | | | | Boolean. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **stp.confirmCharge() | | This is used to | | ** | | confirm all charges | | | | and calculate the | | | | charges in the | | | | application server. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | stp.day1MustBeLater | | This method is used | | ThanDay2(String | | to check that the | | strFirstDay, String | | first Date field | | strSecondDay) | | value is later than | | | | the second Date field | | | | value. | | | | | | | | Parameters: | | | | | | | | - strFirstDay: This | | | | is the first | | | | date. | | | | | | | | - strSecondDay: | | | | This is the | | | | second date. | | | | | | | | If the first date is | | | | later than the second | | | | date, this returns | | | | True; otherwise, it | | | | returns False. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **stp.demergeWithDO() | | This method is used | | ** | | to indicate whether a | | | | particular message | | | | type is to be | | | | demerged into one | | | | transaction with the | | | | data object. This has | | | | the same function as | | | | the | | | | SWIFT_INCOMING_WITH | | | | DO | | | | system parameter. If | | | | this system method is | | | | not defined in the | | | | STP Setting function, | | | | the system uses the | | | | system parameter | | | | setting. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | stp.getForeignBalTo | | This is used to get | | talAmt(ccy) | | the total balance | | | | amount of the foreign | | | | customer. | | | | | | | | Parameters: | | | | | | | | - ccy: This is the | | | | currency in which | | | | the resulting | | | | balance is to be | | | | returned | | | | | | | | [EXAMPLE]{.underlin | | | | e}: | | | | | | | | var balAmtLocal = | | | | stp.getForeignBalTota | | | | lAmt("USD");
