[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var comList = ['IPLC_OPEN_COMM',’ EPLC_POST_CHG’];

stp.setDiscRate(comList,'20');

OR

stp.setDiscRate('IPLC_OPEN_COMM','20');

stp.setEdiRule(String strEdiMappingName)

This is used to call an EDI message mapping rule. Parameter:

  • String gapiRule: This is the EDI rule.

stp.setGapiRule(String gapiRule):void

This is used to call a GAPI rule. Parameter:

  • String gapiRule: This is the GAPI rule.

stp.setMainRef(String mainRef):void

This is used to set a value for the system field C_MAIN_REF. **Parameter: **

  • String mainRef: This is the main reference number value. It may be any String type variable, or an expression that generates the main reference value.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var ref =stp.SYS_getRefNo("EPLC");

stp.setMainRef(ref);

stp.setPayAt(commCode,payAt)

This is used to set the initial value of the ‘Paid At’ field in a transaction with a commission code. Parameters:

  • commCode: This is the name of the commission code.

  • payAt: This is the value of the ‘Paid At’ field. The possible values are STP.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION (Transaction), STP.CHG_AT_DEFERRED (Deferred), STP.CHG_AT_FREE (Waived). The default value is STP.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

stp.setPayAt('IPLC_OPEN_COMM',STP.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION);

stp.setPayBy(comCode,payBy)

This is used to set the value of the ‘Paid At’ field in a transaction with a commission code. Parameters:

  • String: This is the name of the commission code.

  • payBy: This is the value of the ‘Paid At’ field. The possible values are STP.CHG_FOR_LOCAL (Local Customer), and STP.CHG_FOR_FOREIGN (Foreign Customer).

[
EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

If the charge is paid by the ‘Local Customer’:

stp.setPayBy('IPLC_OPEN_COMM',STP.CHG_FOR_LOCAL);

stp.setProcessName(String processName):void

This is used to invoke a process that is defined in the Workflow system. This method is used in an environment that is interfaced with or provides integrated workflow solutions. Parameter:

  • String processName: This is the processing name. The system calls the Workflow process task through the interface. The relevant processes are then performed by the Workflow system.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

stp.setProcessName(LC_CHECKING);

[NOTE]{.underline}: LC_CEHCKING is the process name that is defined in the Workflow system.

stp.setStrAssBu(String strAssBu)

This is used to set the assigned business unit. Parameters:

  • String strAssBU: This is the name of the business unit.

stp.setValue(String doName,String fieldName,String fieldValue)

This method is used to set or assign the value of a field from a data object. Parameter:

  • String doName**:** This is the data object field which value is to be set.

  • String fieldName: This is the name of the data object.

  • String fieldValue: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

This does not return any value.

stp.setValue(String fieldName, String doName,String value,String sCondition)

This method is used to set or assign the value of a field from a data object according to a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String fieldName: This is the data object field which value is to be set.

  • String doName: This is the name of the data object.

  • String value: This is the value to be assigned to the field based on the given condition.

  • String sCondition: This is the parameter that contains the condition for assigning the value to the field. The condition, which is similar to an SQL statement, can be null. When this results in more than one value (or record), the system sets the first record.

This does not return any value.

stp.toDouble(String value):double

This is used to convert the value of a string into a Double data type. Parameter:

  • String: This may be any numeric string value.

This returns a Double value that is converted from the specified string value.

stp.toFloat(String value):float

This method is used to convert the value of a string into a Float data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into a Float data type.

This returns a Float data type.

stp.toInteger(String value):int

This method is used to convert a value of a string to an Integer data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into the Integer data type.

This returns an Integer.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var NO_OF_AMD =stp.toInteger(stp.getFieldValue("NO_OF_AMD"))+1;

stp.toLong(String value):long

This method is used to convert the value of a string to a Long data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into a Long data type.

This returns a Long data type.

stp.updateFieldValue(String doName,String fieldName,String fieldValue)

This is used to update the field of a data object with a field value. Parameters:

  • doName: This is the data object.

  • fieldName: This is the data object field which value is to be updated.

  • fieldValue: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

stp.updateFieldValue(String fieldName,String fieldValue):void

This is used to update the field with a field value. Parameters:

  • String fieldName: This is the transaction field which value is to be updated.

  • String fieldValue: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

This does not return any value.

stp.updateSQLCondition(ServerDataInfo sdi,String fieldName, String fieldValue)

This is used to update a field value in an existing SQL select condition. Parameters:

  • ServerDataInfo sdi: This parameter pertains to the SQL condition.

  • String fieldName: This is the transaction field name.

  • String fieldValue: This is the value in the database of the specified field**.**

stp.writeLog(String)

This method is used to write log information for user notification or debugging in the EE log file. Parameter:

  • String: This is the text to be written into the log file.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

stp.updateFieldValue("CLS_FLG",cls_flg);

stp.writeLog("cls_flg:'"+ cls_flg +"'");

stp.writeLog("TAG21:'"+ TAG21+"'");

Outgoing SWIFT

The system methods for the Outgoing SWIFT transaction function component are as follows.

Figure 6. System Methods for Transaction Function – Outgoing SWIFT

DV.SYS_getCUBK(String,String)

This is used to get the field value from a predefined transaction table using the Get CUBK rule. The field value that is returned is placed in the memory. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the Get CUBK mapping rule name.

  • String 2: This is the key field name of the Get CUBK rule.

This returns the field value that is selected from the database according to the Get CUBK rule.

DV.SYS_getTableData(String,String,String)

This method is used to get the table field values from the server side. **Parameters: **

  • String 1: This is the name of the table to be queried.

  • String 2: This is the query condition to be used.

  • String 3: This is the field list to be queried.

This returns an array of records resulting from the query.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.appendField("IssueLCAmd_toMaster");

DV.SYS_getTableDataValue(String, String, String)

This is used to retrieve the field value from the database. Parameters:

  • String: This pertains to the field list. If there are two columns defined, the system only retrieves the value of the first column.

  • String: This is the table name to be queried.

  • String: This is the condition list.

DV.appendBarcode(formName, barcode, custid, birtbarcodeMappingField)

This method is used to add a barcode to a generated document. The barcode is generated based on the values of the relevant fields from the transaction screen. Parameters:

  • formName: This is the name of the BIRT Form rule.

  • barcode: This refers to a fixed value to be used for the generation of the barcode if the field defined as the birtbarcodeMappingField has no value. This parameter is optional.

  • custid: This is the Customer Id field. The value here must be retrieved from the available variables and not from the mapping fields. This parameter is optional.

  • birtbarcodeMappingfield: This is the field on which the generation of the barcode is based.

DV.appendBarcode(formName, barcode, custid, birtbarcodeMappingField, doXpath)

This method is used to add a barcode to a generated document. The barcode is generated based on the values that are retrieved from a data object. Parameters:

  • formName: This is the name of the BIRT Form rule.

  • barcode: This refers to a fixed value to be used for the generation of the barcode if the field defined as the birtbarcodeMappingField has no value. This parameter is optional.

  • custid: This is the Customer Id field. The value here must be retrieved from the available variables and not from the mapping fields. This parameter is optional.

  • birtbarcodeMappingField: This is the field on which the generation of the barcode is based.

  • doXpath: This is the name of the data object where the barcode mapping field is located.

DV.appendBarcode(formName, barcode, custid, birtbarcodeMappingField, doXpath, condition)

This method is used to add a barcode to a generated document. The barcode is generated based on the values that are retrieved from a data object provided that the specified condition is met. Parameters:

  • formName: This is the name of the BIRT Form rule.

  • barcode: This refers to a fixed value to be used for the generation of the barcode if the field defined as the birtbarcodeMappingField has no value. This parameter is optional.

  • custid: This is the Customer Id field. The value here must be retrieved from the available variables and not from the mapping fields. This parameter is optional.

  • birtbarcodeMappingField: This is the field on which the generation of the barcode is based.

  • doXpath: This is the name of the data object where the barcode mapping field is located.

  • condition: This is the condition for generating the barcode.

DV.appendDOSWIFT(String,String)

This method is used to apply the outward SWIFT message rule in the data object. Parameter:

  • String: This is the outgoing SWIFT message rule.

  • String: This is the condition for retrieving the DO data.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if(MESG_TYPE_BANK.substr(0,2) == 'MT' && type!='D'){

if(sResult == "TRUE" || sMT == "999"){

DV.appendDOSWIFT('SSSS_sendtobank_sw_mt' + MESG_TYPE_BANK.substr(2,3),"MESG_TYPE_BANK = '" + MESG_TYPE_BANK + "'");

DV.appendField(String)

This is used to attach a Transfer To rule to the transaction function. Parameter:

  • String: This is the Transfer To rule.

DV.appendField(String, boolean)

This method is currently not used for Outgoing SWIFT transaction function component.

DV.appendField(String,String,String)

This is used to attach a SWIFT message rule to the transaction function. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the SWIFT message rule to be attached to the transaction function.

  • String 2: This is the data object that serves as the source for the condition indicated in String 3.

  • String3: This is the condition for attaching the SWIFT message rule to the transaction function.

DV.appendFieldGroup()

This method is currently not used for Outgoing SWIFT transaction function component.

DV.appendGroupField(ruleName,xPath,fieldName)

This method is currently not used for Outgoing SWIFT transaction function component.

DV.appendInternalSWIFT(String)

This is used to apply an outward SWIFT Message rule that is defined in the SWIFT Config function (SWIFT Message tab) for the transaction module. The SWIFT messages that are generated with this internal SWIFT are not sent to the SWIFT Alliance. Instead, the message is sent to a recipient through an internal route that is provided by the EE system through a third party. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the Outgoing SWIFT Message rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if (SEND_ACK == ‘YES’){

DV.appendInternalSWIFT(‘MT100’);

}

DV.appendInternalTSU(String,String)

This is used to apply a TSU message mapping rule defined in a outgoing TSU message function. Parameter:

  • String: This is the TSU message mapping rule.

  • String: This is the TSU version.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.appendInternalTSU("tsmt.012.001.03","R2")

DV.appendSWIFT(String)

This is used to apply an outward SWIFT Message rule that is defined in the SWIFT Config (SWIFT Message tab) for the transaction module. The outward SWIFT message that is generated using this method is sent out to the SWIFT Alliance or Merva device according to the parameters that are defined in the SWIFT Send Setting. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the outward SWIFT Message rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if(ADV_BK_CORR_MED=='SWIFT' && tag79 !='')

{

DV.appendSWIFT("MT999_AmdLC ");

}

DV.appendTag(String)

This determines whether a SWIFT Tag should appear in an outward SWIFT message. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the Tag Code that is to appear in the SWIFT output message based on the rule that is defined in the SWIFT Message Tag Rule. When merging SWIFT message, the system checks against the Tag rule where the DV.appendTag() method is used. If this meets the condition that is defined in the Tag Rule, the defined Tag is displayed in the SWIFT output message. If, on the other hand, it does meet the rule condition, the Tag does not appear in the message even if the mapping field contains a valid value in the transaction.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var FieldA = DV.getFieldValue(FieldA);

var FieldB = DV.getFieldValue(FieldB);

if (FieldA !='' && FieldB !='' ) {

DV.appendTag('57A'); }

DV.calDate(String,int)

This method is used to calculate a new date from a given date +/- a given number of days.

  • String: This is the date in string format.

  • int: This is the number of days to be added or subtracted from the given date.

This returns a String.

DV.checkRMA()

This is used to invoke the SWIFT RMA service’s checking process.

DV.day1MustbeLaterThanDay2(String strFirstDay, String strSecondDay)

This method is used to check that the first Date field value is later than the second Date field value. Parameters:

  • strFirstDay: This is the first date.

  • strSecondDay: This is the second date.

This returns a Boolean.

DV.getDOValue(Element,String)

This method is used for getting the value of a field from a data object. Parameter:

  • Element: This can be the name of the data object, or a specific record in the data object.

  • String: This is the data object field which value is to be retrieved.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

for(var i = 0;i < records.length;i++){

MESG_TYPE_BANK = DV.getDOValue(records[i],"MESG_TYPE_BANK");

type = DV.getNodeAttr(records[i], "Type");

DV.getFieldValue(String)

This is used to get the value of a specified field. Parameter:

  • String: This is the transaction field name.

The system returns the value of the specified field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var sB2_700 = DV.getFieldValue("ADV_BK_SW_ADD");

DV.getLineValue(String,int)

This method is used to return a line or a sub-text from a line, beginning from the defined from the position number. Parameters:

  • String: This is the string from which the sub-text is to be retrieved.

  • int: This is the position within the line where the system starts retrieving the text.

This returns a String.

DV.getPartValue(String,int,int)

This method is used to get a particular part of a field value with a specified starting position and a defined data length. Parameters:

  • String: This is the source of the sub-text to be retrieved.

  • Int 1: This is the start position.

  • Int 2: This is the number of characters to get.

This returns a String.

DV.getRecord(String,String)

This method is used for retrieving a data object record based on a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the name of the data object.

  • String 2: This is the condition for retrieving the record.

DV.getRecords(String)

This method is used to retrieve the records of a data object. Parameter:

  • String: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

This returns an array of records.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var records = DV.getRecords("AdivceForBankCust");

DV.getSubDays(strFirstDay,strSecondDay,strCntyCode,strSubCntyCode,isGetWorkDay)

This method is used to get the number of days between two specified dates. Parameters:

  • strFirstDay: This is the first date.

  • strSecondDay: This is the second date.

  • strCntyCode: This is the country code.

  • strSubCntyCode: This is the sub-country code.

  • isGetWorkDay: This flag setting indicates whether or not to include the working days in the calculation.

This returns an Integer.

DV.getSysBusiDate()

This method is used to get the system business date.

DV.getSysDate()

This method is used to get the system date.

DV.getUpdatedData()

This method is used to updatethe DOM data for the current transaction. This is used with the stp.updateFieldValue system method.

DV.setDOValue(String,String,String)

This method is used to set or assign the value of a data object field. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the element of the data object**.**

  • String 2: This is the field of the data object which value is to be set.

  • String 3: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

DV.setVoucherGapiRule(String GapiRuleName)

This is used to set the GAPI rule to be used when the voucher is generated.

  • String GapiRuleName: This the name of the GAPI rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.setVoucherGapiRule(" IMLC_EEOUT");

DV.toDouble(String)

This is used to convert the value of a string into a Double data type. Parameter:

  • String: This may be any numeric string value.

This returns a Double value that is converted from the specified string value.

DV.toFloat(String)

This method is used to convert the value of a string into a Float data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into a Float data type.

This returns a Float data type.

DV.toInteger(String)

This method is used to convert a value of a string to an Integer data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into the Integer data type.

This returns an Integer.

DV.updateField(String,String)

This is used to update the field with a field value. Parameters:

  • String: This is the transaction field name which value is to be updated.

  • String: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

stp.updateFieldValue('REMIT_BKID','CHASUS33XXX');

[NOTE:]{.underline}

This updates the REMIT_BKID field with the new value ‘CHASUS33XXX’.

DV.writeLog(String)

This method is used to write log information for user notification or debugging in the EE log file. Parameter:

  • String: This is the text to be written into the log file.

This does not return any value.

{#section-17 .CS-head2}

Incoming XML

The system methods for the Incoming XML transaction function component are as follows.

Figure 6. System Methods for Transaction Function – Incoming XML

stp.SYS_GetExchangeRate(String fromCCY,String toCCY,String rateType,String fieldName):void

This is used to retrieve the exchange rate value. Parameters:

  • String fromCCY: This is the From CCY value.

  • String toCCY: This is the To CCY value.

  • String rateType: This is the rate type value.

  • String fieldName: This is the field that gets the exchange rate value.

stp.SYS_InsertClause(String fieldName,String clauseName,boolean bAppend):void

This is used to append, insert, or update a specified clause text to a transaction field automatically through the STP setting. Parameters:

  • String fieldName: This is the name of the clause field. The field that is specified is used to get the clause value.

  • String clauseName: This is the clause template name. The template that is specified must be one of the clause templates that have been assigned to the field through the Clause function in the EE Utility.

  • Boolean: This may be set as either True or False. Setting this to True instructs the system to insert the selected clause content to the specified field without removing the original field value, if there is an original value. Setting this field to False, on the other hand, instructs the system to update or replace the initial field value with the specified clause content.

This does not return any value.

stp.SYS_getRefNo(String refName):String

This is used to get the transaction reference number. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the reference number rule defined in the browser Standing Data module.

This returns the C_MAIN_REF value.

stp.addDORec(String doXpath, String sCondition, DataObjectFields fields):Element

This method is used for adding a record to a data object based on a given condition. Parameters:

  • String doXPath: This is the xPath of the data object.

  • String sCondition: This is the condition for adding a record to the data object.

  • DataObjectFields field: These are the fields which which may be added to the data object depending on the condition.

stp.addField(DataObjectFields fields, String name, String value):void

This method is used to add the information from a data object to specific fields. Parameters:

  • DataObjectFields: This pertains to the DO fields and their values.

  • name: This is the name of the field that is to get the value of the data object.

  • value: This is the field value.

stp.addTrxCharge(comCode)

This method is used to add a charge with a commission code. Parameters:

  • comCode: This is the commission code list array or commission code string defined in the standing module

This returns a transaction charge object.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

To add a Letter of Credit Issue Commission

var comList = 'IPLC_OPEN_COMM,EPLC_POST_CHG';

var trxChg = stp.addTrxCharge(comList);

or

var comList = ['IPLC_OPEN_COMM'];

stp.addTrxCharge(comList);

stp.buildArray():DataObjectFields

This method is used for adding a DataObjectFields’ object.

stp.calculate(commListArr, calPara)

This method is used to calculate charges. Parameters:

  • commListArr: This is the commission code list array. The array follows this order: Commission Code1, Commission Code 2.
  • calPara: This is the parameter string array, which may contain the following variables.

  • trxCcy is the currency of the transaction.

  • amount is the amount involved in the transaction.

  • sDate is the start date of the transaction.

  • eDate is the end date of the transaction.

  • from is the location of the sender of the express fee.

  • to is the location of the recipient of the express fee.

  • baseDay is the base number of days used in the calculation of interests.

  • plusTimes is the number of times the charges are to be calculated.

  • extendFldsArr allows the values of the fields to be stored, making these fields reusable.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var parameter = ['USD','100000','2011-3-23','2011-4-23','US','CN','360','null',null];

var comList = ['IPLC_OPEN_COMM',’ EPLC_POST_CHG’];

var result = stp.calculate(comList,parameter);

stp.capureDefChargesByScope()

This method is used to retrieve the deferred charges according to the condition defined in the stp.setDefChargeScope() system method.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

stp.setDefChargeScope(STP.SCOPE_MAINREF);

stp.capureDefChargesByScope()

stp.clearDOVar():void

This is used clear the values of the variables in a data object.

stp.confirmCharge()

This is used to confirm all charges and calculate the charges in the application server.

[
EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

stp.confirmCharge();

stp.delDORec(String doName, String sCondition):Boolean

This method is used to delete a record from a data object according to a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String doName: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

  • sCondition: This is the condition for deleting the String record. The format is similar to an SQL statement.

This returns a Boolean.

stp.getDORecCount(String eDo, String sCondition):int

This method is used to count the number of records in a data object that satisfy the defined condition. Parameters:

  • String eDO: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

  • String sCondition: This is the condition for including the record in the record count. The format is similar to an SQL statement.

This returns an Integer.

stp.getDOValue(Element eDo, String fieldName):String

This method is used for getting the value of a field from a data object. Parameters:

  • Element eDO: This is the name of the data object.

  • String fieldName: This is the data object field which value is to be retrieved.

stp.getFieldSumByDoName(String fieldname, String doxPath, String sCondition):String

This method is used to get the sum of the values of a field in a data object according to the data object’s name and a defined condition. This name must be unique among the elements of the given data object (i.e., data object tree). Parameters:

  • String fieldname: This is the field, from a data object with multiple records, which sum is to be obtained.

  • String doxPath: T his pertains to the xPath of the data object.

  • String sCondition: This is the condition for including the field value in the sum to be calculated. The format is similar to an SQL statement.

This returns the sum of the values of the given field.

stp.getFieldSumByXpath(String fieldname, String doxPath, String sCondition):String

This method is used to get the sum of the values of a field in a data object according to the data object’s xPath and a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String fieldname: This is the field, from a data object with multiple records, which sum is to be obtained.

  • String doxPath: This is the xPath of the data object.

  • String sCondition: This is the condition for including the field value in the sum to be calculated. The format is similar to an SQL statement.

This returns a String, which contains the sum of the values of the given field.

stp.getFieldValue(String fieldName):String

This is used to get the value of the field. Parameter:

  • String fieldName: This is the field name.

This returns the value of the specified field.

stp.getForeignBalTotalAmt(ccy)

This is used to get the total balance amount of the foreign customer. Parameters:

  • ccy: This is the currency in which the resulting balance is to be returned

[
EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var balAmtLocal = stp.getForeignBalTotalAmt("USD");

stp.getForeignTotalCollectAmt()

This is used to get the total amount, including the charge amount and VAT amount, collected from the foreign customer.

[
EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalCollAmt = stp.getForeignTotalCollectAmt();

stp.getForeignTotalCollectCharge()

This is used to get the total amount of bank charges collected from the foreign customer.

[
EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalCollChg = stp.getForeignTotalCollectCharge();

stp.getForeignTotalCollectVAT()

This is used to get the total VAT amount collected from the foreign customer.

[
EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalCollVAT = stp.getForeignTotalCollectVAT();

stp.getForeignTotalPayAmt()

This is used to get the total amount paid by the foreign customer, including the charge payment and VAT payment amounts.

[
EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalPayAmt = stp.getForeignTotalPayAmt();

stp.getForeignTotalPayCharge()

This is used to get the total amount of bank charges paid by the foreign customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalPayCharges = stp.getForeignTotalPayCharge();

stp.getForeignTotalPayVAT()

This is used to get the total VAT amount paid by the foreign customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalPayVAT = stp.getForeignTotalPayVAT();

stp.getGrpDataByFldNm(String fieldname, String doName, String sCondition):String[][]

This method is used to retrieve all the values of a field in a data object according to a defined condition. The data object name must be unique among the elements of the given data object (i.e., data object tree). Parameters:

  • String fieldname: This is the field, from a data object with multiple records, which values are to be obtained.

  • String doName: This is the name of the data object.

  • String sCondition: This is the condition for determining the records that includes the field values to be retrieved.

This returns a String, which contains the values of the given field.

stp.getLocalBalTotalAmt(ccy)

This is used to get the total balance amount of the local customer. Parameters:

  • ccy: This is the currency in which the resulting balance is to be returned

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var balAmtLocal = stp.getLocalBalTotalAmt("USD");

stp.getLocalTotalCollectAmt()

This is used to get the total amount, including the charge amount and VAT amount, collected from the local customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var localTotalCollAmt = stp.getLocalTotalCollectAmt();

stp.getLocalTotalCollectCharge()

This is used to get the total amount of bank charges collected from the local customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var localTotalCollChg = stp.getLocalTotalCollectCharge();

stp.getLocalTotalCollectVAT()

This is used to get the total VAT amount collected from the local customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var locaTotalCollVAT = stp.getLocalTotalCollectVAT();

stp.getLocalTotalPayAmt()

This is used to get the total amount paid by the local customer, including charge and VAT payments.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var locaTotalPayAmt = stp.getLocalTotalPayAmt();

stp.getLocalTotalPayCharge()

This is used to get the total amount of bank charges paid by the local customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var locaTotalPayChg = stp.getLocalTotalPayCharge()

stp.getLocalTotalPayVAT()

This is used to get the total VAT amount paid by the local customer.

[
EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var locaTotalPayVAT = stp.getLocalTotalPayVAT();

stp.getRecord(String doName, String sCondition):Element

This method is used for retrieving a data object record based on a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String doName: This is the name of the data object.

  • String sCondition: This is the condition for retrieving the record.

stp.getRecords(String doName):Element[]

This method is used to retrieve the records of a data object. Parameter:

  • String doName: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

This returns an array of records.

stp.getSysTime()

This method is used to retrieve the current system time.

stp.getValue(String fieldName, String doName, String sCondition):String

This method is used to get the value of a field from a data object according to a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String fieldName: This is the data object field which value is to be retrieved.

  • String doName: This is the name of the data object.

  • String sCondition: This is the condition for determining the record that contains the field which value is to be retrieved. The condition, which is similar to an SQL statement, can be null. When this results in more than one value (record), the system returns the first value.

This returns a String.

stp.getValueFromGAPI(String fieldName):void

This is used to get the value of a receiving field from a GAPI message. This is usually used after the stp.inqGAPI() method is invoked. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the name of the field which value is to be obtained after the inqGAPI method is invoked.

stp.getXMLNodeValue(String tagName):String

This is used to get the value of a tag in an XML file. Parameter:

  • String tagName: This is the node in the XML file.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var invNO=stp.getXMLNodeValue("InvCreditNoteNr","MSG11.PmtDetails",".");

stp.init(trx2ChgType,chg2CollType,rule2UnpaidType,unpaid2CollType)

This method is used to set the initial exchange rate to be used for charge transactions.

Parameters:

  • trx2ChgType: This is the exchange rate applied between Transaction- and Charge Agreement-Currency

  • chg2CollType: This is the exchange rate applied between Charge Collect- and Charge Agreement-Currency

  • rule2UnpaidType: This is the exchange rate applied between Charge Unpaid- and Charge Agreement-Currency

  • unpaid2CollType: This is the exchange rate applied between Charge Collect- and Charge Unpaid-Currency

[
EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

stp.init("Booking Rate", "Booking Rate", "Booking Rate", "Booking Rate");

stp.inqGAPI(String GAPIName):void

This is used to inquire the GAPI rule name that is set in the EE Utility GAPI function. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the GAPI rule name defined in the EE Utility through the GAPI function. The transaction type of the GAPI rule is Inquire.

This does not return any value.

stp.mapDynamicParas(dynaPara)

This method is used to calculate charges based on dynamic fields. Parameter:

  • dynaPara: This is the array of dynamic fields.

stp.mapForeignCust(custID,custName,custCCY,custACNO)

This method is used to define the field names that are related to the local customer.

Parameters:

  • custID: This is the field name of the foreign customer Id.

  • custName: This is the field name of the coreign customer Name.

  • custCCY: This is the name of the ‘Foreign Customer Pay CCY’ field.

  • custACNO: This is the field name of the foreign customer account number field name

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

stp.mapForeignCust("BENE_ID", "BENE_NM", "BENE_CCY", "BENE_ACNO");

stp.mapLocalCust(custID,custName,custCCY,custACNO)

This method is used to define the field names that are related to the local customer.

Parameters:

  • custID: This is the field name of the local customer Id.

  • custName: This is the field name of the local customer name.

  • custCCY: This is the name of the ‘Local Customer Pay CCY’ field.

  • custACNO: This is the field name of the local customer account number

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

stp.mapLocalCust("APPL_ID","APPL_NM",“CUST_PAY_CCY","CUST_ACNO");

stp.mergeDO2TrxDom()

This method is used to merge the XML file from the extension system, including multi-DO, with the EE system.

stp.setAllCollCcy(ccy)

This method is used to set the initial charge collect currency.

Parameters:

  • ccy: This is the bank collection currency

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

stp.setAllCollCcy('USD');

stp.setAllDefPayAt(String at)

This method is used to set the deferred charges Pay at value. Parameter:

  • String: This is the value of the deferred Pay At charge.

stp.setAllLocalPayCcy(ccy)

This method is used to set the value of the ‘Local Customer Pay CCY’ field. Parameter:

  • ccy: This is the local customer payment currency.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

stp.setAllLocalPayCcy('USD')

stp.setAllPayAt(payAt)

This is used to set the initial value of the ‘Paid At’ field. Parameters:

  • payAt: This is the value of the ‘Paid At’ field. The possible values are STP.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION (Transaction), STP.CHG_AT_DEFERRED (Deferred), STP.CHG_AT_FREE (Waived).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

stp.setAllPayAt(STP.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION);

stp.setAllPayBy(payBy)

This is used to set the value of the ‘Paid By’ field. Parameter:

  • payBy: This is the value of the ‘Paid By’ field. The possible values are: STP. CHG_FOR_LOCAL (Local Customer), and STP.CHG_FOR_FOREIGN (Foreign Customer).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

stp.setAllPayBy(STP.CHG_FOR_LOCAL);

stp.setAllUnpaidCcy(ccy)

This method is used to set the value of ‘Balance CCY’ field. Parameter:

  • ccy: This is the balance currency.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

stp.setAllUnpaidCcy('USD');

stp.setAutoProcess(Boolean bAuto):void

This is used to decide whether the pending or master record is to be generated directly in the database by running STP or as a record with an S status. In case of the latter, a Fix function must process the record. This is similar to the result of saving a transaction in the EE system. This method must be set before creating the scripts for the transaction field value. Parameter:

  • Boolean bAuto: This may be set as either True or False. Setting this to True indicates that the pending or master record is to be generated directly into the database; setting this to False, on the other hand, indicates that the record is to be generated as a record with an S status.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

stp.setAutoProcess(true);

stp.setDOExecJs(String Js):void

This is used to execute a JavaScript function for a data object. Parameter:

  • Js: This refers to the JavaScript function

stp.setDOValue(Element eDo, String fieldName, String value):void

This method is used to set or assign the value of a data object field. Parameters:

  • Element DOElement: This is the element name of the data object**.**

  • String fieldName: This is the field of the data object which value is to be set.

  • String value: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

This does not return any value.

stp.setDOValueByJs(String doXpath, String sCondition):void

This is used to set the value of a data object through a JavaScript condition. Parameters:

  • doXpath: This refers to the xPath of the data object.

  • sCondition: This refers to the JS condition.

stp.setDOVar(String varName, String value):void

This is used to set the value of a data object variable. Parameters:

  • varName: This is the name of the variable.

  • value: This is the value to be assigned to the variable.

stp.setDefChargeScope(scope)

This is used to define the condition when retrieving deferred charges (i.e., transaction reference, main reference). Parameters:

  • scope: This is the condition for retrieving the deferred charges. The possible values are: SCOPE_MAINREF (deferred charges are to be retrieved from the main or whole transaction), TRXREF (deferred charges are to be retrieved from a transaction reference), MAINWITHTRXREF (deferred charges are to be retrieved from both the main and transaction reference).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

stp.setDefChargeScope(DV.SCOPE_MAINREF);

stp.setDefPayAt(String commCode, String at)

This is used to set the initial value of the deferred charge’s Paid At field. Parameters:

  • String commCode: This is the value of the commission code
  • payAt: This is the value of the ‘Paid At’ field. The possible values are: STP.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION (Transaction), STP.CHG_AT_DEFERRED (Deferred), STP.CHG_AT_FREE (Waived).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

STP.setDefPayAt(STP.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION);

stp.setDiscRate(String, int)

This is used to set the discount rate. Parameters:

  • String: This is the commission code or the commission code string list array

  • int: This is the discount rate

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var comList = ['IPLC_OPEN_COMM',’ EPLC_POST_CHG’];

stp.setDiscRate(comList,'20');

OR

stp.setDiscRate('IPLC_OPEN_COMM','20');

stp.setEventTimes(int eventTimes):void

This is used to set the EVENT_TIMES for a new record that is to be generated through the STP. Parameter:

  • int eventTimes: This is the value of the Event Times field for the record that is to be created via STP.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

stp.setAutoProcess(true); //first line

stp.updateFieldValue('C_MAIN_REF', stp.SYS_getRefNo('EXAD'));

stp.setEventTimes(0); //setup EVENT_TIMES

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: The event time value of the new record that is to be generated is ‘1’. In this case example, creating a new record is not mandatory. The system sets I_EVENT_TIMES as ‘1’ automatically if it is an Add transaction.

stp.setEventTimesFromTable(String masterTable):void

This method is used when an existing record must be updated and a new event is to be created based on the updating process. The logic is that the system obtains the I_EVENT_TIMES field value from the module master table (the I_EVENT_TIMES in the MASTER table always shows the latest event status), and sets the new event as EVENTTIMES = I_EVENT_TIMES + 1. Parameter:

  • String: This indicates the module master table from which I_EVENT_TIMES is retrieved

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var mainRef = stp.getDBFieldValue(result,"FSBC_REF");

stp.writeLog("111111111111111111"+mainRef);

stp.updateFieldValue("C_MAIN_REF",mainRef);

stp.updateFieldValue("C_TRX_REF",invNO);

stp.setEventTimesFromTable("EXIMTRX.FAEF_MASTER");

stp.setGapiRule(String value):void

This is used to call a GAPI rule. Parameter:

  • String gapiRule: This is the GAPI rule.

stp.setMainRef(String mainRef):void

This is used to set a value for the system field C_MAIN_REF. **Parameter: **

  • String mainRef: This is the main reference number value. It may be any String type variable, or an expression that generates the main reference value.

This does not return any value.

stp.setPayAt(commCode,payAt)

This is used to set the initial value of the ‘Paid At’ field in a transaction with a commission code. Parameters:

  • commCode: This is the name of the commission code.

  • payAt: This is the value of the ‘Paid At’ field. The possible values are STP.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION (Transaction), STP.CHG_AT_DEFERRED (Deferred), STP.CHG_AT_FREE (Waived). The default value is STP.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

stp.setPayAt('IPLC_OPEN_COMM',STP.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION);

stp.setPayBy(comCode,payBy)

This is used to set the value of the ‘Paid At’ field in a transaction with a commission code. Parameters:

  • String: This is the name of the commission code.

  • payBy: This is the value of the ‘Paid At’ field. The possible values are STP.CHG_FOR_LOCAL (Local Customer), and STP.CHG_FOR_FOREIGN (Foreign Customer).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

If the charge is paid by the ‘Local Customer’:

stp.setPayBy('IPLC_OPEN_COMM',STP.CHG_FOR_LOCAL);

stp.setValue(String fieldName, String doName, String value, String sCondition):void

This method is used to set or assign the value of a field from a data object according to a defined condition. Parameters:

  • fieldName: This is the data object field which value is to be set.

  • doName: This is the name of the data object.

  • value: This is the value to be assigned to the field based on the given condition.

  • sCondition: This is the condition for assigning the value to the field. The condition, which is similar to an SQL statement, can be null. When this results in more than one value (or record), the system returns the first record.

This does not return any value.

stp.toDouble(String value):double

This is used to convert the value of a string into a Double data type. Parameter:

  • String: This may be any numeric string value.

This returns a Double value that is converted from the specified string value.

stp.toFloat(String value):float

This method is used to convert the value of a string into a Float data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into a Float data type.

This returns a Float data type.

stp.toInteger(String value):int

This method is used to convert a value of a string to an Integer data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into the Integer data type.

This returns an Integer.

stp.toLong(String value):long

This method is used to convert the value of a string to a Long data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into a Long data type.

This returns a Long data type.

stp.updateFieldValue(String fieldName,String fieldValue):void

This is used to update the field with a field value. Parameters:

  • String fieldName: This is the transaction field which value is to be updated.

  • String fieldValue: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

This does not return any value.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

stp.updateFieldValue("C_TRX_REF",invNO);

{#section-18 .CS-head2}

GAPI

The system methods for the GAPI transaction function component are as follows.

Figure 6. System Methods for Transaction Function – GAPI

appendFieldByDateCompare(fieldValue, doXpath, sCondition, trxDomNodeName, domDataNodeName, operator)

This method is used to attach a rule to the transaction function by conditions. Parameters:

  • fieldValue: This is the rule to be attached to the transaction function.

  • doXpath: This is the data object that serves as the source for the condition indicated in the third parameter.

  • sCondition: This is the condition for attaching the rule to the transaction function

  • trxDomNodeName: This is the date field in the main page.

  • domDataNodeName: This is the date field in the DO.

  • operator: This is the operator used to compare above two date fields, it must be used as this order: trxDomNodeName operator domDataNodeName.

DV.SYS_getCUBK(String,String)

This is used to get the field value from a predefined transaction table using the Get CUBK rule. The field value that is returned is placed in the memory. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the Get CUBK mapping rule name.

  • String 2: This is the key field name of the Get CUBK rule.

This returns the field value that is selected from the database according to the Get CUBK rule.

DV.SYS_getTableData(String,String,String)

This method is used to get the table field values from the server side. **Parameters: **

  • String 1: This is the name of the table to be queried.

  • String 2: This is the query condition to be used.

  • String 3: This is the field list to be queried.

This returns an array of records resulting from the query.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.appendField("IssueLCAmd_toMaster");

DV.SYS_getTableDataValue(String, String, String)

This is used to retrieve the field value from the database. Parameters:

  • String: This pertains to the field list. If there are two columns defined, the system only retrieves the value of the first column.

  • String: This is the table name to be queried.

  • String: This is the condition list.

DV.appendBarcode(formName, barcode, custid, birtbarcodeMappingField)

This method is used to add a barcode to a generated document. The barcode is generated based on the values of the relevant fields from the transaction screen. Parameters:

  • formName: This is the name of the BIRT Form rule.

  • barcode: This refers to a fixed value to be used for the generation of the barcode if the field defined as the birtbarcodeMappingField has no value. This parameter is optional.

  • custid: This is the Customer Id field. The value here must be retrieved from the available variables and not from the mapping fields. This parameter is optional.

  • birtbarcodeMappingfield: This is the field on which the generation of the barcode is based.

DV.appendBarcode(formName, barcode, custid, birtbarcodeMappingField, doXpath)

This method is used to add a barcode to a generated document. The barcode is generated based on the values that are retrieved from a data object.

Parameters:

  • formName: This is the name of the BIRT Form rule.

  • barcode: This refers to a fixed value to be used for the generation of the barcode if the field defined as the birtbarcodeMappingField has no value. This parameter is optional.

  • custid: This is the Customer Id field. The value here must be retrieved from the available variables and not from the mapping fields. This parameter is optional.

  • birtbarcodeMappingField: This is the field on which the generation of the barcode is based.

  • doXpath: This is the name of the data object where the barcode mapping field is located.

DV.appendBarcode(formName, barcode, custid, birtbarcodeMappingField, doXpath, condition)

This method is used to add a barcode to a generated document. The barcode is generated based on the values that are retrieved from a data object provided that the specified condition is met. Parameters:

  • formName: This is the name of the BIRT Form rule.

  • barcode: This refers to a fixed value to be used for the generation of the barcode if the field defined as the birtbarcodeMappingField has no value. This parameter is optional.

  • custid: This is the Customer Id field. The value here must be retrieved from the available variables and not from the mapping fields. This parameter is optional.

  • birtbarcodeMappingField: This is the field on which the generation of the barcode is based.

  • doXpath: This is the name of the data object where the barcode mapping field is located.

  • condition: This is the condition for generating the barcode.

DV.appendDOSWIFT(String,String)

This method is used to apply the outward SWIFT message rule in the data object. Parameter:

  • String: This is the outgoing SWIFT message rule.

  • String: This is the condition for retrieving the DO data.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if(MESG_TYPE_BANK.substr(0,2) == 'MT' && type!='D'){

if(sResult == "TRUE" || sMT == "999"){

DV.appendDOSWIFT('SSSS_sendtobank_sw_mt' + MESG_TYPE_BANK.substr(2,3),"MESG_TYPE_BANK = '" + MESG_TYPE_BANK + "'");

DV.appendField(String)

This is used to call the relevant GAPI rule.

Parameter:

  • String: This is the GAPI rule.

In cases when a data object is included in the GAPI:

  • If the DO has a value, the GAPI is generated.

  • If the DO has no value, the GAPI is not generated.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if(sDetermimFlg=='Yes')

{

DV.appendField("EE_CE_IMLC_009_ImpLcAmdBeneCnst");

}else{

DV.appendField("EE_CE_IMLC_008_ImpLcAmendment");

}

}

DV.appendField(String, boolean)

This is used to attach a GAPI rule to the transaction function. Parameters:

  • String: This is the GAPI rule.

  • boolean: If this is set to false, a GAPI message with a DO is generated only if the DO has a value. If this is set to true, a GAPI message with a DO is generated whether or not the DO has a value. This parameter defaults to false.

DV.appendField(String,String,String)

This is used to attach a GAPI rule to the transaction function. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the GAPI rule to be attached to the transaction function.

  • String 2: This is the data object that serves as the source for the condition indicated in String 3.

  • String3: This is the condition for attaching the GAPI rule to the transaction function.

DV.appendFieldGroup()

This is used to combine multiple GAPI rules with the same GAPI template into one GAPI message.

This only applies to Transaction and Release GAPIs.

DV.appendGroupField(ruleName,xPath,fieldName)

This method is currently not used for the GAPI transaction function component.

DV.appendInternalSWIFT(String)

This is used to apply an outward SWIFT Message rule that is defined in the SWIFT Config function (SWIFT Message tab) for the transaction module. The SWIFT messages that are generated with this internal SWIFT are not sent to the SWIFT Alliance. Instead, the message is sent to a recipient through an internal route that is provided by the EE system through a third party. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the Outgoing SWIFT Message rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if (SEND_ACK == ‘YES’){

DV.appendInternalSWIFT(‘MT100’);

}

DV.appendInternalTSU(String,String)

This is used to apply a TSU message mapping rule defined in a outgoing TSU message function. Parameter:

  • String: This is the TSU message mapping rule.

  • String: This is the TSU version.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.appendInternalTSU("tsmt.012.001.03","R2")

DV.appendSWIFT(String)

This is used to apply an outward SWIFT Message rule that is defined in the SWIFT Config (SWIFT Message tab) for the transaction module. The outward SWIFT message that is generated using this method is sent out to the SWIFT Alliance or Merva device according to the parameters that are defined in the SWIFT Send Setting. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the outward SWIFT Message rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if(ADV_BK_CORR_MED=='SWIFT' && tag79 !='')

{

DV.appendSWIFT("MT999_AmdLC ");

}

DV.appendTag(String)

This determines whether a SWIFT Tag should appear in an outward SWIFT message. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the Tag Code that is to appear in the SWIFT output message based on the rule that is defined in the SWIFT Message Tag Rule. When merging SWIFT message, the system checks against the Tag rule where the DV.appendTag() method is used. If this meets the condition that is defined in the Tag Rule, the defined Tag is displayed in the SWIFT output message. If, on the other hand, it does meet the rule condition, the Tag does not appear in the message even if the mapping field contains a valid value in the transaction.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var FieldA = DV.getFieldValue(FieldA);

var FieldB = DV.getFieldValue(FieldB);

if (FieldA !='' && FieldB !='' ) {

DV.appendTag('57A');

}

DV.calDate(String,int)

This method is used to calculate a new date from a given date +/- a given number of days. Parameters:

  • String: This is the date in string format.

  • int: This is the number of days to be added or subtracted from the given date.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

var date = DV.calDate (‘2005-03-20’, 5);

RESULT: date = 2005-03-25;

DV.checkRMA()

This is used to invoke the SWIFT RMA service’s checking process.

DV.day1MustbeLaterThanDay2(String strFirstDay, String strSecondDay)

This method is used to check that the first Date field value is later than the second Date field value. Parameters:

  • strFirstDay: This is the first date.

  • strSecondDay: This is the second date.

If the first date is later than the second date, this returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

DV.getDOValue(Element,String)

This method is used for getting the value of a field from a data object. Parameter:

  • Element: This can be the name of the data object, or a specific record in the data object.

  • String: This is the data object field which value is to be retrieved.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

for(var i = 0;i < records.length;i++){

MESG_TYPE_BANK = DV.getDOValue(records[i],"MESG_TYPE_BANK");

type = DV.getNodeAttr(records[i], "Type");

DV.getFieldValue(String)

This is used to get the value of a specified field. Parameter:

  • String: This is the transaction field name.

The system returns the value of the specified field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

//C_MAIN_REF = ‘IMLCDBU0056’;

var MainRef = DV.getFieldValue(‘C_MAIN_REF’);

RESULT: MainRef = ‘IMLCDBU0056’

DV.getLineValue(String,int)

This method is used to return a line or a sub-text from a line, beginning from the defined from the position number. Parameters:

  • String: This is the string from which the sub-text is to be retrieved.

  • int: This is the position within the line where the system starts retrieving the text.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

DV.getLineValue(“address”, 20)

DV.getPartValue(String,int,int)

This method is used to get a particular part of a field value with a specified starting position and a defined data length. Parameters:

  • String: This is the source of the sub-text to be retrieved.

  • Int 1: This is the start position.

  • Int 2: This is the number of characters to get.

This returns a String.

[
EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

DV.getPartValue(“address”, 10, 6)

DV.getRecord(String,String)

This method is used for retrieving a data object record based on a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the name of the data object.

  • String 2: This is the condition for retrieving the record.

DV.getRecords(String)

This method is used to retrieve the records of a data object. Parameter:

  • String: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

This returns an array of records.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var records = DV.getRecords("AdivceForBankCust");

DV.getSubDays(strFirstDay,strSecondDay,strCntyCode,strSubCntyCode,isGetWorkDay)

This method is used to get the number of days between two specified dates. Parameters:

  • strFirstDay: This is the first date.

  • strSecondDay: This is the second date.

  • strCntyCode: This is the country code.

  • strSubCntyCode: This is the sub-country code.

  • isGetWorkDay: This flag setting indicates whether or not to include the working days in the calculation.

This returns an Integer.

DV.getSysBusiDate()

This method is used to get the system business date value from the database.

DV.getSysDate()

This method is used to get the system date.

This returns the SYS_DATE value.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

//SYS_DATE = ‘2005-03-15’; system date of the application server

var sysDate = DV.getSysDate();

Return: sysDate = ‘2005-03-15’

DV.getUpdatedData()

This method is used to updatethe DOM data for the current transaction. This is used with the stp.updateFieldValue system method.

DV.setDOValue(String,String,String)

This method is used to set or assign the value of a data object field. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the element of the data object**.**

  • String 2: This is the field of the data object which value is to be set.

  • String 3: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

DV.setVoucherGapiRule(String GapiRuleName)

This is used to set the GAPI rule to be used when the voucher is generated.

  • String GapiRuleName: This the name of the GAPI rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.setVoucherGapiRule(" IMLC_EEOUT");

DV.toDouble(String)

This is used to convert the value of a string into a Double data type. Parameter:

  • String: This may be any numeric string value.

This returns a Double value that is converted from the specified string value.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

// LC_AMT = 2,365,000.00;

var LC_AMT = DV.getFieldValue(‘LC_AMT’);

var Amt1 = DV.toDouble(LC_AMT) + 100;

RESULT: Amt1 = 2365100;

DV.toFloat(String)

This method is used to convert the value of a string into a Float data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into a Float data type.

This returns a Float data type.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

// LC_AMT = 2,365,000.00;

var LC_AMT = DV.getFieldValue(‘LC_AMT’);

var Amt1 = DV.toFloat(LC_AMT) + 100;

RESULT: Amt1 = 2365100;

DV.toInteger(String)

This method is used to convert a value of a string to an Integer data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into the Integer data type.

This returns an Integer.

DV.updateField(String,String)

This is used to update the field with a field value. Parameters:

  • String: This is the transaction field name which value is to be updated.

  • String: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

stp.updateFieldValue('REMIT_BKID','CHASUS33XXX');

[NOTE]{.underline}: This updates the REMIT_BKID field with the new value ‘CHASUS33XXX’.

DV.writeLog(String)

This method is used to write log information for user notification or debugging in the EE log file. Parameter:

  • String: This is the text to be written into the log file.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.writeLog("DV.SYS_BANK_COUNTRY="+DV.SYS_BANK_COUNTRY);

{#section-19 .CS-head2}

Accounting Rule

The system methods for the Accounting Rule transaction function component are as follows.

Figure 6. System Methods for Transaction Function – Accounting Rule

appendFieldByDateCompare(fieldValue, doXpath, sCondition, trxDomNodeName, domDataNodeName, operator)

This method is used to attach a rule to the transaction function by conditions. Parameters:

  • fieldValue: This is the rule to be attached to the transaction function.

  • doXpath: This is the data object that serves as the source for the condition indicated in the third parameter.

  • sCondition: This is the condition for attaching the rule to the transaction function

  • trxDomNodeName: This is the date field in the main page.

  • domDataNodeName: This is the date field in the DO.

  • operator: This is the operator used to compare above two date fields, it must be used as this order: trxDomNodeName operator domDataNodeName.

DV.SYS_getCUBK(String,String)

This is used to get the field value from a predefined transaction table using the Get CUBK rule. The field value that is returned is placed in the memory. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the Get CUBK mapping rule name.

  • String 2: This is the key field name of the Get CUBK rule.

This returns the field value that is selected from the database according to the Get CUBK rule.

DV.SYS_getTableData(String,String,String)

This method is used to get the table field values from the server side. **Parameters: **

  • String 1: This is the name of the table to be queried.

  • String 2: This is the query condition to be used.

  • String 3: This is the field list to be queried.

This returns an array of records resulting from the query.

DV.SYS_getTableDataValue(String, String, String)

This is used to retrieve the field value from the database. Parameters:

  • String: This pertains to the field list. If there are two columns defined, the system only retrieves the value of the first column.

  • String: This is the table name to be queried.

  • String: This is the condition list.

DV.appendBarcode(formName, barcode, custid, birtbarcodeMappingField)

This method is used to add a barcode to a generated document. The barcode is generated based on the values of the relevant fields from the transaction screen. Parameters:

  • formName: This is the name of the BIRT Form rule.

  • barcode: This refers to a fixed value to be used for the generation of the barcode if the field defined as the birtbarcodeMappingField has no value. This parameter is optional.

  • custid: This is the Customer Id field. The value here must be retrieved from the available variables and not from the mapping fields. This parameter is optional.

  • birtbarcodeMappingfield: This is the field on which the generation of the barcode is based.

DV.appendBarcode(formName, barcode, custid, birtbarcodeMappingField, doXpath)

This method is used to add a barcode to a generated document. The barcode is generated based on the values that are retrieved from a data object. Parameters:

  • formName: This is the name of the BIRT Form rule.

  • barcode: This refers to a fixed value to be used for the generation of the barcode if the field defined as the birtbarcodeMappingField has no value. This parameter is optional.

  • custid: This is the Customer Id field. The value here must be retrieved from the available variables and not from the mapping fields. This parameter is optional.

  • birtbarcodeMappingField: This is the field on which the generation of the barcode is based.

  • doXpath: This is the name of the data object where the barcode mapping field is located.

DV.appendBarcode(formName, barcode, custid, birtbarcodeMappingField, doXpath, condition)

This method is used to add a barcode to a generated document. The barcode is generated based on the values that are retrieved from a data object provided that the specified condition is met. Parameters:

  • formName: This is the name of the BIRT Form rule.

  • barcode: This refers to a fixed value to be used for the generation of the barcode if the field defined as the birtbarcodeMappingField has no value. This parameter is optional.

  • custid: This is the Customer Id field. The value here must be retrieved from the available variables and not from the mapping fields. This parameter is optional.

  • birtbarcodeMappingField: This is the field on which the generation of the barcode is based.

  • doXpath: This is the name of the data object where the barcode mapping field is located.

  • condition: This is the condition for generating the barcode.

DV.appendDOSWIFT(String,String)

This method is used to apply the outward SWIFT message rule in the data object.

Parameter:

  • String: This is the outgoing SWIFT message rule.

  • String: This is the condition for retrieving the DO data.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if(MESG_TYPE_BANK.substr(0,2) == 'MT' && type!='D'){

if(sResult == "TRUE" || sMT == "999"){

DV.appendDOSWIFT('SSSS_sendtobank_sw_mt' + MESG_TYPE_BANK.substr(2,3),"MESG_TYPE_BANK = '" + MESG_TYPE_BANK + "'");

DV.appendField(String)

This is used to call the relevant Accounting rule.

Parameter:

  • String: This is the Accounting rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if (nCHG_CUST_AMT > 0){

DV.appendField("ChgVoucher");

}

DV.appendField(String, boolean)

This method is currently not used for the Accounting Rule transaction function component.

DV.appendField(String,String,String)

This is used to attach an Acountint rule to the transaction function.

Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the Accounting rule to be attached to the transaction function.

  • String 2: This is the data object that serves as the source for the condition indicated in String 3.

  • String3: This is the condition for attaching the Accounting rule to the transaction function.

DV.appendFieldGroup()

This method is currently not used for the Accounting Rule transaction function component.

DV.appendGroupField(ruleName,xPath,fieldName)

This method is currently not used for the Accounting Rule transaction function component.

DV.appendInternalSWIFT(String)

This is used to apply an outward SWIFT Message rule that is defined in the SWIFT Config function (SWIFT Message tab) for the transaction module. The SWIFT messages that are generated with this internal SWIFT are not sent to the SWIFT Alliance. Instead, the message is sent to a recipient through an internal route that is provided by the EE system through a third party. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the Outgoing SWIFT Message rule.

DV.appendInternalTSU(String,String)

This is used to apply a TSU message mapping rule defined in a outgoing TSU message function. Parameters:

  • String: This is the TSU message mapping rule.

  • String: This is the TSU version.

DV.appendSWIFT(String)

This is used to apply an outward SWIFT Message rule that is defined in the SWIFT Config (SWIFT Message tab) for the transaction module. The outward SWIFT message that is generated using this method is sent out to the SWIFT Alliance or Merva device according to the parameters that are defined in the SWIFT Send Setting. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the outward SWIFT Message rule.

DV.appendTag(String)

This determines whether a SWIFT Tag should appear in an outward SWIFT message. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the Tag Code that is to appear in the SWIFT output message based on the rule that is defined in the SWIFT Message Tag Rule. When merging SWIFT message, the system checks against the Tag rule where the DV.appendTag() method is used. If this meets the condition that is defined in the Tag Rule, the defined Tag is displayed in the SWIFT output message. If, on the other hand, it does meet the rule condition, the Tag does not appear in the message even if the mapping field contains a valid value in the transaction.

This does not return any value.

DV.calDate(String,int)

This method is used to calculate a new date from a given date +/- a given number of days. Parameters:

  • String: This is the date in string format

  • int: This is the number of days to be added or subtracted from the given date.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

var date = DV.calDate (‘2005-03-20’, 5);

RESULT: date = 2005-03-25;

DV.checkRMA()

This is used to invoke the SWIFT RMA service’s checking process.

DV.day1MustbeLaterThanDay2(String strFirstDay, String strSecondDay)

This method is used to check that the first Date field value is later than the second Date field value. Parameters:

  • strFirstDay: This is the first date.

  • strSecondDay: This is the second date.

This returns a Boolean.

DV.getDOValue(Element,String)

This method is used for getting the value of a field from a data object. Parameters:

  • Element: This is the name of the data object.

  • String: This is the data object field which value is to be retrieved.

DV.getFieldValue(String)

This is used to get the value of a specified field. Parameter:

  • String: This is the transaction field name.

The system returns the value of the specified field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var nCHG_CUST_AMT = DV.toFloat(DV.getFieldValue("CHG_CUST_AMT"));

DV.getLineValue(String,int)

This method is used to return a line or a sub-text from a line, beginning from the defined position number. Parameters:

  • String: This is the string from which the sub-text is to be retrieved.

  • int: This is the position within the line where the system starts retrieving the text.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

DV.getLineValue(“address”, 20)

DV.getPartValue(String,int,int)

This method is used to get a particular part of a field value with a specified starting position and a defined data length. Parameters:

  • String: This is the source of the sub-text to be retrieved.

  • Int 1: This is the start position.

  • Int 2: This is the number of characters to retrieve.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

DV.getPartValue(“address”, 10, 6)

DV.getRecord(String,String)

This method is used for retrieving a data object record based on a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the name of the data object.

  • String 2: This is the condition for retrieving the record.

DV.getRecords(String)

This method is used to retrieve the records of a data object. Parameter:

  • String: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

This returns an array of records.

DV.getSubDays(strFirstDay,strSecondDay,strCntyCode,strSubCntyCode,isGetWorkDay)

This method is used to get the number of days between two specified dates. Parameters:

  • strFirstDay: This is the first date.

  • strSecondDay: This is the second date.

  • strCntyCode: This is the country code.

  • strSubCntyCode: This is the sub-country code.

  • isGetWorkDay: This flag setting indicates whether or not to include the working days in the calculation.

This returns an Integer.

DV.getSysBusiDate()

This method is used to get the system business date.

DV.getSysDate()

This method is used to get the system date.

This returns the SYS_DATE value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

//SYS_DATE = ‘2005-03-15’; system date of the application server

var sysDate = DV.getSysDate();

Return: sysDate = ‘2005-03-15’;

DV.getUpdatedData()

This method is used to updatethe DOM data for the current transaction. This is used with the stp.updateFieldValue system method.

DV.setDOValue(String,String,String)

This method is used to set or assign the value of a data object field. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the element of the data object**.**

  • String 2: This is the field of the data object which value is to be set.

  • String 3: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

DV.setVoucherGapiRule(String GapiRuleName)

This is used to set the GAPI rule to be used when the voucher is generated.

  • String GapiRuleName: This the name of the GAPI rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.setVoucherGapiRule(" IMLC_EEOUT");

DV.toDouble(String)

This is used to convert the value of a string into a Double data type. Parameter:

  • String: This may be any numeric string value.

This returns a Double value that is converted from the specified string value.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

// LC_AMT = 2,365,000.00;

var LC_AMT = DV.getFieldValue(‘LC_AMT’);

var Amt1 = DV.toDouble(LC_AMT) + 100;

RESULT: Amt1 = 2365100

DV.toFloat(String)

This method is used to convert the value of a string into a Float data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into a Float data type.

This returns a Float data type.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

// LC_AMT = 2,365,000.00;

var LC_AMT = DV.getFieldValue(‘LC_AMT’);

var Amt1 = DV.toFloat(LC_AMT) + 100;

RESULT: Amt1 = 2365100

DV.toInteger(String)

This method is used to convert a value of a string to an Integer data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into the Integer data type.

This returns an Integer.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

// CHG_TERM = 3;

var terms = DV.toInteger(DV.getFieldValue(‘CHG_TERM’)); //terms = 3

if (terms > 5)

DV.appendField(‘AccRule1’);

else

DV.appendField(‘AccRule2’);

RESULT: AccRule2 is used.

DV.updateField(String, String)

This is used to update the field with a field value. Parameters:

  • String: This is the transaction field name which value is to be updated.

  • String: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

stp.updateFieldValue('REMIT_BKID','CHASUS33XXX');

[NOTE]{.underline}: This updates the REMIT_BKID field with the new value ‘CHASUS33XXX’.

DV.writeLog(String)

This method is used to write log information for user notification or debugging in the EE log file. Parameter:

  • String: This is the text to be written into the log file.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.writeLog("DV.SYS_BANK_COUNTRY="+DV.SYS_BANK_COUNTRY);

{#section-20 .CS-head2}

Form Set

The system methods for the Form Set transaction function component are as follows.

Figure 6. System Methods for Transaction Function – Form Set

DV.SYS_getCUBK(String,String)

This is used to get the field value from a predefined transaction table using the Get CUBK rule. The field value that is returned is placed in the memory. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the Get CUBK mapping rule name.

  • String 2: This is the key field name of the Get CUBK rule.

This returns the field value that is selected from the database according to the Get CUBK rule.

DV.SYS_getTableData(String,String,String)

This method is used to get the table field values from the server side. **Parameters: **

  • String 1: This is the name of the table to be queried.

  • String 2: This is the query condition to be used.

  • String 3: This is the field list to be queried.

This returns an array of records resulting from the query.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.appendField("IssueLCAmd_toMaster");

DV.SYS_getTableDataValue(String, String, String)

This is used to retrieve the field value from the database. Parameters:

  • String: This pertains to the field list. If there are two columns defined, the system only retrieves the value of the first column.

  • String: This is the table name to be queried.

  • String: This is the condition list.

DV.appendBarcode(formName, barcode, custid, birtbarcodeMappingField)

This method is used to add a barcode to a generated document. The barcode is generated based on the values of the relevant fields from the transaction screen. Parameters:

  • formName: This is the name of the BIRT Form rule.

  • barcode: This refers to a fixed value to be used for the generation of the barcode if the field defined as the birtbarcodeMappingField has no value. This parameter is optional.

  • custid: This is the Customer Id field. The value here must be retrieved from the available variables and not from the mapping fields. This parameter is optional.

  • birtbarcodeMappingfield: This is the field on which the generation of the barcode is based.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.appendBarcode("CZQO_FORM_BARCODE ","","","C_MAIN_REF");

DV.appendBarcode(formName, barcode, custid, birtbarcodeMappingField, doXpath)

This method is used to add a barcode to a generated document. The barcode is generated based on the values that are retrieved from a data object. Parameters:

  • formName: This is the name of the BIRT Form rule.

  • barcode: This refers to a fixed value to be used for the generation of the barcode if the field defined as the birtbarcodeMappingField has no value. This parameter is optional.

  • custid: This is the Customer Id field. The value here must be retrieved from the available variables and not from the mapping fields. This parameter is optional.

  • birtbarcodeMappingField: This is the field on which the generation of the barcode is based.

  • doXpath: This is the name of the data object where the barcode mapping field is located.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.appendBarcode("CZQO_FORM_BARCODEDO","",CUST_ID, "C_TRX_NO","LIMIT_TDO");

**
**

DV.appendBarcode(formName, barcode, custid, birtbarcodeMappingField, doXpath, condition)

This method is used to add a barcode to a generated document. The barcode is generated based on the values that are retrieved from a data object provided that the specified condition is met. Parameters:

  • formName: This is the name of the BIRT Form rule.

  • barcode: This refers to a fixed value to be used for the generation of the barcode if the field defined as the birtbarcodeMappingField has no value. This parameter is optional.

  • custid: This is the Customer Id field. The value here must be retrieved from the available variables and not from the mapping fields. This parameter is optional.

  • birtbarcodeMappingField: This is the field on which the generation of the barcode is based.

  • doXpath: This is the name of the data object where the barcode mapping field is located.

  • condition: This is the condition for generating the barcode.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.appendBarcode("CZQO_FORM_BARCODEDO","",CUST_ID,"C_TRX_NO","LIMIT_TDO","LM_TRX_AMT>100");

DV.appendDOSWIFT(String,String)

This method is used to apply the outward SWIFT message rule in the data object. Parameter:

  • String: This is the outgoing SWIFT message rule.

  • String: This is the condition for retrieving the DO data.

**
**

DV.appendField(String)

This is used to attach a Form rule to the transaction function. Parameter:

  • String: This is the Form rule.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.appendField("Test_Form");

DV.appendField(String, boolean)

This method is currently not used for the Form Set transaction function component.

DV.appendField(String,String,String)

This is used to attach a Form rule to the transaction function. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the Form rule to be attached to the transaction function. This parameter is mandatory.

  • String 2: This is the data object that serves as the source for the condition indicated in String 3.

  • String 3: This is the condition for attaching the Form rule to the transaction function.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.appendField("ALL_Blank_Advice_Bank_E","AdivceForBankCust","MESG_TYPE_BANK = 'Mail'&&SEND_TO_BANK_LANG = 'English'");

**
**

DV.appendFieldGroup()

This method is currently not used for the Form Set transaction function component.

DV.appendGroupField(ruleName,xPath,fieldName)

This is used to generate multiple documents based on a group of DO records. Parameters:

  • ruleName: This refers to the Form rule.

  • xPath: This refers to the xPath of the data object. If this is null, the system retrieves the value of fieldname from the main screen.

  • fieldName: This refers to the condition field or the field that is the basis for grouping the DO records into a document; i.e., the records with this same field value are grouped into one document. If xPath is null, the system retrieves the value of fieldName from the main screen.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

The data object contains 5 records: 2 are for Bank A, 1 is for Bank B, and 2 records have no defined bank Id. If the fieldname parameter is set to the bank Id field, the DO records are grouped according to the bank Id and multiple records are generated: 1 document for Bank A, 1 document for Bank B, and 1 document for the records with no defined bank Ids.

DV.appendInternalSWIFT(String)

This is used to apply an outward SWIFT Message rule that is defined in the SWIFT Config function (SWIFT Message tab) for the transaction module. The SWIFT messages that are generated with this internal SWIFT are not sent to the SWIFT Alliance. Instead, the message is sent to a recipient through an internal route that is provided by the EE system through a third party. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the Outgoing SWIFT Message rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if (SEND_ACK == ‘YES’){

DV.appendInternalSWIFT(‘MT100’);

}

DV.appendInternalTSU(String,String)

This is used to apply a TSU message mapping rule defined in a outgoing TSU message function. Parameters:

  • String: This is the TSU message mapping rule.

  • String: This is the TSU version.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}
