DV.appendInternalTSU("tsmt.012.001.03","R2")

DV.appendSWIFT(String)

This is used to apply an outward SWIFT Message rule that is defined in the SWIFT Config (SWIFT Message tab) for the transaction module. The outward SWIFT message that is generated using this method is sent out to the SWIFT Alliance or Merva device according to the parameters that are defined in the SWIFT Send Setting. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the outward SWIFT Message rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if(ADV_BK_CORR_MED=='SWIFT' && tag79 !='')

{

DV.appendSWIFT("MT999_AmdLC ");

}

DV.appendTag(String);

This determines whether a SWIFT Tag should appear in an outward SWIFT message. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the Tag Code that is to appear in the SWIFT output message based on the rule that is defined in the SWIFT Message Tag Rule. When merging SWIFT message, the system checks against the Tag rule where the DV.appendTag() method is used. If this meets the condition that is defined in the Tag Rule, the defined Tag is displayed in the SWIFT output message. If, on the other hand, it does meet the rule condition, the Tag does not appear in the message even if the mapping field contains a valid value in the transaction.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var FieldA = DV.getFieldValue(FieldA);

var FieldB = DV.getFieldValue(FieldB);

if (FieldA !='' && FieldB !='' ) {

DV.appendTag('57A');

}

DV.calDate(String,int)

This method is used to calculate a new date from a given date +/- a given number of days. Parameters:

  • String: This is the date in string format.

  • int: This is the number of days to be added or subtracted from the given date.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

var date = DV.calDate (‘2005-03-20’, 5);RESULT: date = 2005-03-25;

DV.checkRMA()

This is used to invoke the SWIFT RMA service’s checking process.

DV.day1MustbeLaterThanDay2(String strFirstDay, String strSecondDay)

This method is used to check that the first Date field value is later than the second Date field value. Parameters:

  • strFirstDay: This is the first date.

  • strSecondDay: This is the second date.

This returns a Boolean.

DV.getDOValue(Element,String)

This method is used for getting the value of a field from a data object. Parameter:

  • Element: This can be the name of the data object, or a specific record in the data object.

  • String: This is the data object field which value is to be retrieved.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

for(var i = 0;i < records.length;i++){

MESG_TYPE_BANK = DV.getDOValue(records[i],"MESG_TYPE_BANK");

type = DV.getNodeAttr(records[i], "Type");

DV.getFieldValue(String)

This is used to get the value of a specified field. Parameter:

  • String: This is the transaction field name.

The system returns the value of the specified field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

//C_MAIN_REF = ‘IMLCDBU0056’;

var MainRef = DV.getFieldValue(‘C_MAIN_REF’);

RESULT: MainRef = ‘IMLCDBU0056’

DV.getLineValue(String,int)

This method is used to return a line or a sub-text from a line, beginning from the defined from the position number. Parameters:

  • String: This is the string from which the sub-text is to be retrieved.

  • int: This is the position within the line where the system starts retrieving the text.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

DV.getLineValue(“address”, 20)

DV.getPartValue(String,int,int)

This method is used to get a particular part of a field value with a specified starting position and a defined data length. Parameters:

  • String: This is the source of the sub-text to be retrieved.

  • Int 1: This is the start position.

  • Int 2: This is the number of characters to retrieve.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

DV.getPartValue(“address”, 10, 6)

DV.getRecord(String,String)

This method is used for retrieving a data object record based on a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the name of the data object.

  • String 2: This is the condition for retrieving the record.

DV.getRecords(String)

This method is used to retrieve the records of a data object. Parameter:

  • String: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

This returns an array of records.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var records = DV.getRecords("AdivceForBankCust");

DV.getSubDays(strFirstDay,strSecondDay,strCntyCode,strSubCntyCode,isGetWorkDay)

This method is used to get the number of days between two specified dates. Parameters:

  • strFirstDay: This is the first date.

  • strSecondDay: This is the second date.

  • strCntyCode: This is the country code.

  • strSubCntyCode: This is the sub-country code.

  • isGetWorkDay: This flag setting indicates whether or not to include the working days in the calculation.

This returns an Integer.

DV.getSysBusiDate()

This method is used to get the system business date.

DV.getSysDate()

This method is used to get the system date.

This returns the SYS_DATE value.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

//SYS_DATE = ‘2005-03-15’; system date of the application server

var sysDate = DV.getSysDate();

Return: sysDate = ‘2005-03-15’

DV.getUpdatedData()

This method is used to updatethe DOM data for the current transaction. This is used with the stp.updateFieldValue system method.

DV.setDOValue(String,String,String)

This method is used to set or assign the value of a data object field. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the element of the data object**.**

  • String 2: This is the field of the data object which value is to be set.

  • String 3: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

DV.setVoucherGapiRule(String GapiRuleName)

This is used to set the GAPI rule to be used when the voucher is generated.

  • String GapiRuleName: This the name of the GAPI rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.setVoucherGapiRule(" IMLC_EEOUT");

DV.toDouble(String)

This is used to convert the value of a string into a Double data type. Parameter:

  • String: This may be any numeric string value.

This returns a Double value that is converted from the specified string value.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

// LC_AMT = 2,365,000.00;

var LC_AMT = DV.getFieldValue(‘LC_AMT’);

var Amt1 = DV.toDouble(LC_AMT) + 100;

RESULT: Amt1 = 2365100;

DV.toFloat(String)

This method is used to convert the value of a string into a Float data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into a Float data type.

This returns a Float data type.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

// LC_AMT = 2,365,000.00;

var LC_AMT = DV.getFieldValue(‘LC_AMT’);

var Amt1 = DV.toFloat(LC_AMT) + 100;

RESULT: Amt1 = 2365100;

DV.toInteger(String)

This method is used to convert a value of a string to an Integer data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into the Integer data type.

This returns an Integer.

DV.updateField(String, String)

This is used to update the field with a field value. Parameters:

  • String: This is the transaction field name which value is to be updated.

  • String: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

stp.updateFieldValue('REMIT_BKID','CHASUS33XXX');

[NOTE:]{.underline}

This updates the REMIT_BKID field with the new value ‘CHASUS33XXX’.

DV.writeLog(String)

This method is used to write log information for user notification or debugging in the EE log file. Parameter:

  • String: This is the text to be written into the log file.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.writeLog("DV.SYS_BANK_COUNTRY="+DV.SYS_BANK_COUNTRY);

{#section-21 .CS-head2}

Auto Release

The system methods for the Auto Release transaction function component are as follows.

Figure 6. System Methods for Transaction Function – Auto Release

DV.autoRelease( )

This method is used to automatically release the transaction; the transaction does not have to be released in the related Release function.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: If the DV.autoRelease method is set for functions with defined authorization rules, once the last authorizer confirms the transaction, the transaction is automatically released and its status is updated to Master.

DV.getFieldValue(String)

This is used to get the value of a specified field. Parameter:

  • String: This is the transaction field name.

The system returns the value of the specified field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

//C_MAIN_REF = ‘IMLCDBU0056’;

var MainRef = DV.getFieldValue(‘C_MAIN_REF’);

RESULT: MainRef = ‘IMLCDBU0056’

DV.toDouble(String)

This is used to convert the value of a string into a Double data type. Parameter:

  • String: This may be any numeric string value.

This returns a Double value that is converted from the specified string value.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

// LC_AMT = 2,365,000.00;

var LC_AMT = DV.getFieldValue(‘LC_AMT’);

var Amt1 = DV.toDouble(LC_AMT) + 100;

RESULT: Amt1 = 2365100;

DV.toFloat(String)

This method is used to convert the value of a string into a Float data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into a Float data type.

This returns a Float data type.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

// LC_AMT = 2,365,000.00;

var LC_AMT = DV.getFieldValue(‘LC_AMT’);

var Amt1 = DV.toFloat(LC_AMT) + 100;

RESULT: Amt1 = 2365100;

DV.toInteger(String)

This method is used to convert a value of a string to an Integer data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into the Integer data type.

This returns an Integer.

{#section-22 .CS-head2}

Outgoing TSU

The system methods for the Outgoing TSU transaction function component are as follows.

Figure 6. System Methods for Transaction Function – Outgoing TSU

DV.SYS_getCUBK(String,String)

This is used to get the field value from a predefined transaction table using the Get CUBK rule. The field value that is returned is placed in the memory. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the Get CUBK mapping rule name.

  • String 2: This is the key field name of the Get CUBK rule.

This returns the field value that is selected from the database according to the Get CUBK rule.

DV.SYS_getTableData(String,String,String)

This method is used to get the table field values from the server side. **Parameters: **

  • String 1: This is the name of the table to be queried.

  • String 2: This is the query condition to be used.

  • String 3: This is the field list to be queried.

This returns an array of records resulting from the query.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.appendField("IssueLCAmd_toMaster");

DV.SYS_getTableDataValue(String, String, String)

This is used to retrieve the field value from the database. Parameters:

  • String: This pertains to the field list. If there are two columns defined, the system only retrieves the value of the first column.

  • String: This is the table name to be queried.

  • String: This is the condition list.

DV.appendBarcode(formName, barcode, custid, birtbarcodeMappingField)

This method is used to add a barcode to a generated document. The barcode is generated based on the values of the relevant fields from the transaction screen. Parameters:

  • formName: This is the name of the BIRT Form rule.

  • barcode: This refers to a fixed value to be used for the generation of the barcode if the field defined as the birtbarcodeMappingField has no value. This parameter is optional.

  • custid: This is the Customer Id field. The value here must be retrieved from the available variables and not from the mapping fields. This parameter is optional.

  • birtbarcodeMappingfield: This is the field on which the generation of the barcode is based.

DV.appendBarcode(formName, barcode, custid, birtbarcodeMappingField, doXpath)

This method is used to add a barcode to a generated document. The barcode is generated based on the values that are retrieved from a data object. Parameters:

  • formName: This is the name of the BIRT Form rule.

  • barcode: This refers to a fixed value to be used for the generation of the barcode if the field defined as the birtbarcodeMappingField has no value. This parameter is optional.

  • custid: This is the Customer Id field. The value here must be retrieved from the available variables and not from the mapping fields. This parameter is optional.

  • birtbarcodeMappingField: This is the field on which the generation of the barcode is based.

  • doXpath: This is the name of the data object where the barcode mapping field is located.

DV.appendBarcode(formName, barcode, custid, birtbarcodeMappingField, doXpath, condition)

This method is used to add a barcode to a generated document. The barcode is generated based on the values that are retrieved from a data object provided that the specified condition is met. Parameters:

  • formName: This is the name of the BIRT Form rule.

  • barcode: This refers to a fixed value to be used for the generation of the barcode if the field defined as the birtbarcodeMappingField has no value. This parameter is optional.

  • custid: This is the Customer Id field. The value here must be retrieved from the available variables and not from the mapping fields. This parameter is optional.

  • birtbarcodeMappingField: This is the field on which the generation of the barcode is based.

  • doXpath: This is the name of the data object where the barcode mapping field is located.

  • condition: This is the condition for generating the barcode.

DV.appendDOSWIFT(String,String)

This method is used to apply the outward SWIFT message rule in the data object. Parameter:

  • String: This is the outgoing SWIFT message rule.

  • String: This is the condition for retrieving the DO data.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if(MESG_TYPE_BANK.substr(0,2) == 'MT' && type!='D'){

if(sResult == "TRUE" || sMT == "999"){

DV.appendDOSWIFT('SSSS_sendtobank_sw_mt' + MESG_TYPE_BANK.substr(2,3),"MESG_TYPE_BANK = '" + MESG_TYPE_BANK + "'");

DV.appendField(String)

This is used to attach an Outgoing TSU message rule to the transaction function. Parameter:

  • String: This is the outgoing TSU message rule.

DV.appendField(String, boolean)

This method is currently not used for the Outgoing TSU transaction function component.

DV.appendField(String,String,String)

This is used to attach a Outgoing TSU message rule to the transaction function. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the Outgoing TSU message to be attached to the transaction function.

  • String 2: This is the data object that serves as the source for the condition indicated in String 3.

  • String3: This is the condition for attaching the Outgoing TSU message rule to the transaction function.

DV.appendFieldGroup()

This method is currently not used for the Outgoing TSU transaction function component.

DV.appendGroupField(ruleName,xPath,fieldName)

This method is currently not used for the Outgoing TSU transaction function component.

DV.appendInternalSWIFT(String)

This is used to apply an outward SWIFT Message rule that is defined in the SWIFT Config function (SWIFT Message tab) for the transaction module. The SWIFT messages that are generated with this internal SWIFT are not sent to the SWIFT Alliance. Instead, the message is sent to a recipient through an internal route that is provided by the EE system through a third party.

**Parameter: **

  • String: This is the Outgoing SWIFT Message rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if (SEND_ACK == ‘YES’){

DV.appendInternalSWIFT(‘MT100’);

}

DV.appendInternalTSU(String,String)

This is used to apply a TSU message mapping rule defined in a outgoing TSU message function. Parameter:

  • String: This is the TSU message mapping rule.

  • String: This is the TSU version.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.appendInternalTSU("tsmt.012.001.03","R2")

DV.appendSWIFT(String)

This is used to apply an outward SWIFT Message rule that is defined in the SWIFT Config (SWIFT Message tab) for the transaction module. The outward SWIFT message that is generated using this method is sent out to the SWIFT Alliance or Merva device according to the parameters that are defined in the SWIFT Send Setting.

**Parameter: **

  • String: This is the outward SWIFT Message rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if(ADV_BK_CORR_MED=='SWIFT' && tag79 !='')

{

DV.appendSWIFT("MT999_AmdLC ");

}

DV.appendTag(String);

This determines whether a SWIFT Tag should appear in an outward SWIFT message. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the Tag Code that is to appear in the SWIFT output message based on the rule that is defined in the SWIFT Message Tag Rule. When merging SWIFT message, the system checks against the Tag rule where the DV.appendTag() method is used. If this meets the condition that is defined in the Tag Rule, the defined Tag is displayed in the SWIFT output message. If, on the other hand, it does meet the rule condition, the Tag does not appear in the message even if the mapping field contains a valid value in the transaction.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var FieldA = DV.getFieldValue(FieldA);

var FieldB = DV.getFieldValue(FieldB);

if (FieldA !='' && FieldB !='' ) {

DV.appendTag('57A'); }

DV.calDate(String,int)

This method is used to calculate a new date from a given date +/- a given number of days.

  • String: This is the date in string format.

  • int: This is the number of days to be added or subtracted from the given date.

This returns a String.

DV.checkRMA()

This is used to invoke the SWIFT RMA service’s checking process.

DV.day1MustbeLaterThanDay2(String strFirstDay, String strSecondDay)

This method is used to check that the first Date field value is later than the second Date field value. Parameters:

  • strFirstDay: This is the first date.

  • strSecondDay: This is the second date.

This returns a Boolean.

DV.getDOValue(Element,String)

This method is used for getting the value of a field from a data object. Parameter:

  • Element: This can be the name of the data object, or a specific record in the data object.

  • String: This is the data object field which value is to be retrieved.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

for(var i = 0;i < records.length;i++){

MESG_TYPE_BANK = DV.getDOValue(records[i],"MESG_TYPE_BANK");

type = DV.getNodeAttr(records[i], "Type");

DV.getFieldValue(String)

This is used to get the value of a specified field. Parameter:

  • String: This is the transaction field name.

The system returns the value of the specified field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var sB2_700 = DV.getFieldValue("ADV_BK_SW_ADD");

DV.getLineValue(String,int)

This method is used to return a line or a sub-text from a line, beginning from the defined from the position number.

Parameters:

  • String: This is the string from which the sub-text is to be retrieved.

  • int: This is the position within the line where the system starts retrieving the text.

This returns a String.

DV.getPartValue(String,int,int)

This method is used to get a particular part of a field value with a specified starting position and a defined data length.

Parameters:

  • String: This is the source of the sub-text to be retrieved.

  • Int 1: This is the start position.

  • Int 2: This is the number of characters to get.

This returns a String.

DV.getRecord(String,String)

This method is used for retrieving a data object record based on a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the name of the data object.

  • String 2: This is the condition for retrieving the record.

DV.getRecords(String)

This method is used to retrieve the records of a data object. Parameter:

  • String: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

This returns an array of records.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var records = DV.getRecords("AdivceForBankCust");

DV.getSubDays(strFirstDay,strSecondDay,strCntyCode,strSubCntyCode,isGetWorkDay)

This method is used to get the number of days between two specified dates. Parameters:

  • strFirstDay: This is the first date.

  • strSecondDay: This is the second date.

  • strCntyCode: This is the country code.

  • strSubCntyCode: This is the sub-country code.

  • isGetWorkDay: This flag setting indicates whether or not to include the working days in the calculation.

This returns an Integer.

DV.getSysBusiDate()

This method is used to get the system business date.

DV.getSysDate()

This method is used to get the system date.

DV.getUpdatedData()

This method is used to updatethe DOM data for the current transaction. This is used with the stp.updateFieldValue system method.

DV.setDOValue(String,String,String)

This method is used to set or assign the value of a data object field.

Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the element of the data object**.**

  • String 2: This is the field of the data object which value is to be set.

  • String 3: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

DV.setVoucherGapiRule(String GapiRuleName)

This is used to set the GAPI rule to be used when the voucher is generated.

  • String GapiRuleName: This the name of the GAPI rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.setVoucherGapiRule(" IMLC_EEOUT");

DV.toDouble(String)

This is used to convert the value of a string into a Double data type.

Parameter:

  • String: This may be any numeric string value.

This returns a Double value that is converted from the specified string value.

DV.toFloat(String)

This method is used to convert the value of a string into a Float data type.

Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into a Float data type.

This returns a Float data type.

DV.toInteger(String)

This method is used to convert a value of a string to an Integer data type.

Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into the Integer data type.

This returns an Integer.

DV.updateField(String, String)

This is used to update the field with a field value.

Parameters:

  • String: This is the transaction field name which value is to be updated.

  • String: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

stp.updateFieldValue('REMIT_BKID','CHASUS33XXX');

- This updates the REMIT_BKID field with the new value ‘CHASUS33XXX’.

DV.writeLog(String)

This method is used to write log information for user notification or debugging in the EE log file. Parameter:

  • String: This is the text to be written into the log file.

This does not return any value.

EDI

The system methods for the EDI transaction function component are as follows.

Figure 6. System Methods for Transaction Function – EDI

DV.appendField(String):String

This is used to attach an EDI rule to the transaction function. Parameter:

  • String: This is the parameter rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.appendField("InvoiceTransfer");

DV.getFieldValue(String):String

This is used to get the value of a specified field. Parameter:

  • String: This is the transaction field name.

The system returns the value of the specified field.

DV.toDouble(String ):String

This is used to convert the value of a string into a Double data type. Parameter:

  • String: This may be any numeric string value.

This returns a Double value that is converted from the specified string value.

DV.toFloat(String ):String

This method is used to convert the value of a string into a Float data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into a Float data type.

This returns a Float data type.

DV.toInteger(String ):String

This method is used to convert a value of a string to an Integer data type. Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into the Integer data type.

This returns an Integer.

Subtask: Auto Process Function

Methods

The system methods for the Subtask – Auto Process Manage function are as follows.

Figure 6. System Methods for the Auto Process Function

DV.SYS_FloatAdd(arg1, arg2)

This is used to calculate the sum of 2 Float-type numeric values. Parameters:

  • arg1: This is the first Float numeric value.

  • arg2: This is the second Float numeric value.

DV.SYS_FloatDiv(arg1, arg2)

This is used to calculate the value when one Float-type numeric value is divided by another Float-type numeric values. Parameters:

  • arg1: This is the first Float numeric value.

  • arg2: This is the second Float numeric value.

DV.SYS_FloatMul(arg1, arg2)

This is used to calculate the value when one Float-type numeric value is multiplied by another Float-type numeric value. Parameters:

  • arg1: This is the first Float numeric value.

  • arg2: This is the second Float numeric value.

DV.SYS_FloatSub(arg1, arg2)

This is used to calculate the difference between 2 Float-type numeric values. Parameters:

  • arg1: This is the first Float numeric value.

  • arg2: This is the second Float numeric value.

DV.SYS_GetExchangeRate(String fromCCY, String toCCY, String rateType, String fieldName, String md)

This is used to retrieve the exchange rate value to update the rate field. Parameters:

  • String fromCCY: This is the From CCY value.

  • String toCCY: This is the To CCY value.

  • String rateType: This is the rate type value.

  • String fieldName: This is the name of the rate field that is to get the rate value.

  • String md: This is the value of the exchange rate’s M/D Flag. (i.e., Multipy or Divide)

This does not return a value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.SYS_GetExchangeRate (‘USD’, ‘AED’, ‘Booking Rate’,‘LC_CONF_CHG_FCY’, ‘M’);

DV.SYS_GetExchangeRate(String,String,String)

This is used to retrieve the exchange rate value to update the rate field. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the From CCY value.

  • String 2: This is the To CCY value.

  • String 3: This is the rate type value.

This returns the exchange rate value based on the From CCY, To CCY and Rate Type value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var BkRate= DV.SYS_GetExchangeRate (‘USD’, 'TWD', 'Booking Rate’);

or

var BKRate= DV.SYS_GetExchangeRate (DV.getFieldValue ('LC_CCY'), 'TWD',' Booking Rate ');

[NOTE]{.underline}:

  • The LC_CCY is a field of the transaction module. The system retrieves the exchange rate value from the database and returns the variable BKRate.

  • If the From CCY value does not correspond to any of the existing CCY records, the system retrieves the value of the Local CCY and uses it in the exchange rate calculation.

DV.SYS_InsertClause(String,String,boolean)

This is used to insert or update a specified clause text to a transaction field automatically in auto processing. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the name of the clause field. The field that is specified is used to get the clause value

  • String 2: This is the clause template name. The template that is specified must be one of the clause templates that have been assigned to the field through the Clause function in the EE Utility.

  • Boolean: This may be set as either True or False. Setting this to True instructs the system to insert the selected clause content to the specified field without removing the original field value, if there is an original value. Setting this to False, on the other hand, instructs the system to update or replace the initial field value with the specified clause content.

This does not return a value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV. SYS_InsertClause ('PAY_INS','IWRT_PAY_INS', true);

[NOTE]{.underline}: PAY_INS is a field of the IWRT Module; IWRT_PAY_INS is the clause template name.

DV.SYS_getCUBK(String ,String,String ,String,boolean)

This is used to get the field value from predefined transaction table using the Get CUBK rule. The field value that is returned is placed in the memory. Other methods such as stp.getFieldValue() and stp.updateFieldValue() may use this method in the script for transaction data processing. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the Get CUBK mapping rule name.

  • String 2: This is the key field name of the Get CUBK rule.

  • String 3: This is the JS function to be called if the retrieval is successful.

  • String 4: This is the JS function to be called if the retrieval fails.

  • boolean: This indicates whether or not an error message is to be shown if the operation fails. This may have a true or false value. If the value is false, the system displays an error message. Otherwise, no error is prompted.

This returns the field value that is selected from the database according to the Get CUBK rule.

DV.SYS_getRefNo(String)

This function is used to generate the transaction reference number and return the reference number value. This method is used mainly when using the auto process to generate a new transaction record in the database. Parameter:

  • String: This is the reference rule name that has been defined in the Reference Number function.

This returns the base transaction reference number that is generated by the defined reference rule.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var MainRef = DV.SYS_getRefNo (‘IMIS_CHECK’);

DV.updateField("C_MAIN_REF", MainRef);

DV.addDORec(String,String,DataObjectFields)

This method is used for adding a record to a data object based on a given condition. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the xPath of the data object.

  • String 2: This is the condition for adding a record to the data object.

  • DataObjectFields: These are the fields which may be added to the data object depending on the condition.

DV.addField(DataObjectFields,String,String)

This method is used to add the information from a data object to the specific fields. Parameters:

  • DataObjectFields: This is the DO fields and their values.

  • String 1: This is the field name.

  • String 2: This is the field value.

DV.addFieldList(ServerDataInfo,String)

This is used to append the fields to an SQL query. These are the fields that are to be selected from a table in the database. This method is normally used together with other methods such as DV.addSQLCondition() and DV.getTableMultiDataToArray() in order to get the expected field value. Parameters:

  • ServerDataInfo: This is the field list. When it is to add the first field in the field list, a null value must be provided.

  • String: This is the field name that is to be included in the field list.

This does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var fld_list = DV.addFieldList(null,"C_MAIN_REF");

fld_list = DV.addFieldList(fld_list,"C_FUNC_SHORT_NAME");

fld_list = DV.addFieldList(fld_list,"C_CUST_ID");

DV.addSQLCondition(ServerDataInfo, String,String)

This is used to append the fields that compose the SQL select condition. Parameters:

  • ServerDataInfo: This is the SQL condition list. If it is used as a condition for the first field, a null value should be provided.

  • String 1: This is the field that is used in the SQL Where condition.

  • String 2: This is placed as the value of the field defined in String 1.

This does not return any value.

DV.addTrxCharge(comCode)

This method is used to add a charge with a commission code. Parameters:

  • comCode: This is the commission code list array or commission code string defined in the standing module

This returns a transaction charge object.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

To add a Letter of Credit Issue Commission

var comList = 'IPLC_OPEN_COMM,EPLC_POST_CHG';

var trxChg = DV.addTrxCharge(comList);

or

var comList = ['IPLC_OPEN_COMM'];

DV.addTrxCharge(comList);

DV.buildArray()

This method is used for adding a DataObjectFields’ object.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.buildArray(‘ClaimDO’)

DV.calDate(String,int)

This method is used to calculate a new date from a given date +/- a given number of days. Parameters:

  • String: This is the date in string format.

  • int: This is the number of days to be added or subtracted from the given date.

This returns the date.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

var date = DV.calDate (‘2005-03-20’, 5);

RESULT: date = 2005-03-25

DV.calEndWorkingDate(strCntyCode,strStartDate,strDaysValue,strBeforeOrAfter,strlfCheckHol,strlfJumpHol)

This method is used to get the end working date based on the start date and the number of days to add or subtract. Parameters:

  • strCntyCode: This is the country code.

  • strStartDate: This is the starting date.

  • strDaysValue: This is the number of days.

  • strBeforeOrAfter: This is the Before or After flag setting. The possible values are A, the default value, and B.

  • strIfCheckHol: This flag setting indicates whether or not to check holiday dates. The possible values are Y, the default value, and N.

  • strIfJumpHol: This flag setting indicates whether or not to include the holiday dates in the calculation. The possible values are N, the default value, and Y.

This returns the date.

DV.calHoliday(String strDateS,String strDateE,String strSubCntyCode)

This method is used to calculate the number of days between the specified start date and end date excluding the holidays and weekends. Parameters:

  • String StrDateS: This is the start date.

  • String StrDateE: This is the end date.

  • String strSubCntyCode: This is the sub-country code (or simply the country code).

This returns an integer that indicates the number of days.

DV.calNumberOfTerms(String,String,int)

This method is used to calculate number of terms from the start date to the end date. The term may be monthly, quarterly, semi-annually, or annually. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the start date.

  • String 2: This is the end date.

  • int: This is the term period.

This returns an Integer value.

[
EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

DV.calNumberOfTerms(‘2007-02-12’,’ 2007-05-12’,10)

DV.calWorkingDay(String strDateS, String strDateE, String strSubCntyCode)

This method is used to calculate the number of working days between a specified start date and a specified end date. Parameters:

  • String strDateS: This is the start date.

  • String strDateE: This is the end date.

  • String strSubCntyCode: This is the sub-country code (or country code).

This returns an Integer.

DV.calculate(commListArr,calPara)

This method is used to calculate charges. Parameters:

  • commListArr: This is the commission code list array. The array follows this order: Commission Code1, Commission Code 2.
  • calPara: This is the parameter string array, which may contain the following variables.

Where:

  • trxCcy is the currency of the transaction.

  • amount is the amount involved in the transaction.

  • sDate is the start date of the transaction.

  • eDate is the end date of the transaction.

  • from is the location of the sender of the express fee.

  • to is the location of the recipient of the express fee.

  • baseDay is the base number of days used in the calculation of interests.

  • plusTimes is the number of times the charges are to be calculated.

  • extendFldsArr allows the values of the fields to be stored, making these fields reusable.

[
EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var parameter = ['USD','100000','2011-3-23','2011-4-23','US','CN','360','null',null];

var comList = ['IPLC_OPEN_COMM',’ EPLC_POST_CHG’];

var result = DV.calculate(comList,parameter);

DV.callCalcService(String)

This is used to calculate charges based on the charge agreement rule. Parameter:

  • String: This is the parameter string array, which may contain the following variables.

  • trxCcy is the transaction currency. This is mandatory.

  • amount is the transaction amount. This is mandatory.

  • commCode is the commission code. This is mandatory.

  • chargeFor is the party to be charged; 'L' for local customer and 'F' for foreign customer. This is mandatory.

  • custID is the customer Id. If chargefor is 'L', this pertains to the local customer Id. If chargeFor is 'F', this pertains to the foreign customer Id. This is mandatory.

  • collectCcy is the bank collection currency. This is mandatory.

  • rateType is the rate type used to convert the charge agreement currency to the transaction currency. This is mandatory.

  • sDate is the start date of the transaction.

  • eDate is the end date of the transaction.

  • from is the location of the sender of the express fee**.**

  • to is the location of the recipient of the express fee**.**

  • baseDay is the base number of days used in the calculation of interests**.**

  • plusTimes is the number of times the charges are to be calculated (i.e., calculated charges multiplied by this number).

  • OverWriteAgree pertains to the Charge field to be overridden and the corresponding value (e.g., “Y_FLAT_AMT=222”). The Charge fields that can be overridden are F_BASE_PERCENTAGE, F_EXTEND_PERCENTAGE, Y_MAX_AMT, Y_MIN_AMT, I_PERIOD_MAX, I_PERIOD_MIN, Y_FLAT_AMT, C_PERIOD_NUM, C_PERIOD_UNIT, Y_TIER_AMT, and C_CCY_TIER

  • (extendFlds is reserved for future use.)

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var comList = ['IMCO_SDC_TRCR_7390'];

DV.addTrxCharge(comList);

var COLL_CCY = DV.getFieldValue("COLL_CCY");

var COLL_AMT = DV.getFieldValue("COLL_TRX_CCY_AMT");

var CUST_ID = DV.getFieldValue("DRWE_ID");

var parameter = [COLL_CCY,COLL_AMT,comList,'L',CUST_ID, DV.SYS_LCY, "Booking Rate", null, null, null, null, null, null, null,''];

var result = DV.callCalcService(parameter);

DV.capureDefChargesByScope()

This method is used to retrieve the deferred charges according to the condition defined in the stp.setDefChargeScope() system method.

[
EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setDefChargeScope(DV.SCOPE_MAINREF);

DV.capureDefChargesByScope()

DV.checkHoliday(String strDate, String strSubCntyCode)

This method is used to check whether or not a given date is a holiday. Parameter:

  • String StrDate: This is the date to be verified as a holiday.

  • String strSubCntyCode: This is the sub-country code

This returns a Boolean.

**DV.clearDOCondition() **

This method is used to clear the cache. This is used with the DV.setAddDoCondition() and DV.setDoData() parameters.


DV.confirmCharge()

This is used to confirm all charges and calculate the charges in the application server.

[
EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.confirmCharge();

DV.day1MustbeLaterThanDay2(strFirstDay,strSecondDay)

This method is used to check that the first Date field value is later than the second Date field value. Parameters:

  • strFirstDay: This is the first date.

  • strSecondDay: This is the second date.

This returns a Boolean.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

//ISSUE_DT = 2007-09-04; EXPIRY_DT=2007-09-08;

var issueDT=DV.getParamFieldValue("ISSUE_DT");

var expiryDT=DV.getParamFieldValue("EXPIRY_DT");

var dateComp=DV.day1MustbeLaterThanDay2(expiryDT, issueDT);

RESULT: True

DV.delDORec(String,String)

This method is used to delete a record from a data object according to a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

  • String 2: This is the condition for deleting the record. The format is similar to an SQL statement.

This returns a Boolean.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

var PARTY_ID2='vicky';

var delcond= 'PARTY_ID=\''+PARTY_ID2+'\'';

DV.delDORec('PARTY_INFO',delcond);

RESULT: If the record is deleted, this returns TRUE.

DV.deleteDocs(int)

This is used to delete document files stored in this system path: [user.dir]\\TRXDATA\\[Bank Group]\\[Country Code]\\DOCS. Parameters:

  • Int: This is the number of days to be subtracted from the current system date.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.deleteDocs(5);

If the current system date is 2012-06-21and [system date] – 5 is 2012-06-16, the system deletes all document files before 2012-06-16

DV.deleteLogs(int, boolean)

This is used to delete log files (on File mode) from the log directory specified in the EE_Log_Config.xml file. Parameters:

  • int: This is the number of days to be subtracted from the current system date.

  • boolean: This is used to control whether logs on DB mode are to be deleted as well.This may have a true or false value. If the value is set to true, the logs in the following tables are to be deleted as well: TRX_SYS_ACESS_LOG, TRX_SYS_COMP_LOG, TRX_SYS_PERF_LOG.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.deleteLogs(5, false);

If the current system date is 2012-06-21 and [system date] – 5 is 2012-06-16, all log files from the log directory set in the EE_Log_Config.xml file (e.g., X:\EELog) will be deleted.

DV.deleteLogs(6, true);

If the current system date is 2012-06-21 and [system date] – 5 is 2012-06-16, all log files from the log directory set in the EE_Log_Confog.xml file (e.g., X:\EELog) and the data from the TRX_SYS_ACESS_LOG, TRX_SYS_COMP_LOG, TRX_SYS_PERF_LOG database tables which are generated before 2012-06-16 will be deleted.

DV.deleteSwifts(int)

This method is used to delete generated SWIFT messages saved in the path specified in the SWIFT_OUT_GOING_FOLDER system parameter. Parameters:

  • int: This is the number of days to be subtracted from the current system date.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

If the current system date is 2012-06-21 and [system date] – 5 is 2012-06-16, all SWIFT messages in the directory specified in the SWIFT_OUT_GOING_FOLDER (e.g., X:\TRXDATA\) generated before 2012-06-16 are deleted.

DV.getCountryCode()

This method is used to get the country code for the current business unit.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

Country Code is “CN”;

var cnty=DV.getCountryCode();

Result: cnty = ‘CN’;

DV.getDORecCount(String,String)

This method is used to count the number of records in a data object that satisfies the defined condition. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

  • String 2: This is the condition for including the record in the record count. The format is similar to an SQL statement.

This returns an Integer.

DV.getDOValue(Element,String)

This method is used for getting the value of a field from a data object. Parameters:

  • Element: This is the name of the data object.

  • String: This is the data object field which value is to be retrieved.


DV.getDateByIncrement(strDate, sYearsIncr, sDaysIncr, sMonthsIncr)

This method is used to calculate the date based on the parameter that is passed. Parameters:

  • sDateFldName: This is the Date field name.

  • sYearsIncr: This is the number of years to be added to the Date field.

  • sDaysIncr: This is the number of days to be added to the Date field.

  • sMonthsIncr: This is the number of months to be added to the Date field.

This returns a String.

DV.getFieldValue(String)

This is used to get the value of a specified field. Parameter:

  • String: This is the transaction field name.

The system returns the value of the specified field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

C_MAIN_REF = ‘IMLCDBU0056’;

var MainRef = DV.getFieldValue(‘C_MAIN_REF’);

RESULT: MainRef = ‘IMLCDBU0056’

DV.getForeignBalTotalAmt(ccy)

This is used to get the total balance amount of the foreign customer. Parameters:

  • ccy: This is the currency in which the resulting balance is to be returned

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var balAmtLocal = DV.getForeignBalTotalAmt("USD");

DV.getForeignTotalCollectAmt()

This is used to get the total amount, including the charge amount and VAT amount, collected from the foreign customer.

DV.getForeignTotalCollectCharge()

This is used to get the total amount of bank charges collected from the foreign customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalCollChg = DV.getForeignTotalCollectCharge();

DV.getForeignTotalCollectVAT()

This is used to get the total VAT amount collected from the foreign customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalCollVAT = DV.getForeignTotalCollectVAT();

DV.getForeignTotalPayAmt()

This is used to get the total amount paid by the foreign customer, including the charge payment and VAT payment amounts.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalPayAmt = DV.getForeignTotalPayAmt();

DV.getForeignTotalPayCharge()

This is used to get the total amount of bank charges paid by the foreign customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalPayCharges = DV.getForeignTotalPayCharge();

DV.getForeignTotalPayVAT()

This is used to get the total VAT amount paid by the foreign customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var forTotalPayVAT = DV.getForeignTotalPayVAT();

DV.getLastWorkingDay(String strDate,String strSubCnty)

This method is used to get the last working date beginning from the specified starting working date. Parameters:

  • String strDate: This is the start date.

  • String strSubCnty: This is the sub-country code (or country code).

This returns a String.

DV.getLineValue(String,int)

This method is used to return a line or a sub-text from a line, beginning from the defined position number. Parameters**:**

  • String: This is the string from which the sub-text is to be retrieved.

  • Int: This is the position within the line where the system starts retrieving the text.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

DV.getLineValue(“address”, 20)

DV.getLocalBalTotalAmt(ccy)

This is used to get the total balance amount of the local customer. Parameters:

  • ccy: This is the currency in which the resulting balance is to be returned

[
EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var balAmtLocal = DV.getLocalBalTotalAmt("USD");

DV.getLocalCCY(String cnty)

This is used to get the local currency of a country. Parameter:

  • String cnty: This is the country code which local currency is to be retrieved.

[
EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.getLocalCCY(‘CN’)

DV.getLocalTotalCollectAmt()

This is used to get the total amount, including the charge amount and VAT amount, collected from the local customer.

[
EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var localTotalCollAmt = DV.getLocalTotalCollectAmt();

DV.getLocalTotalCollectCharge()

This is used to get the total amount of bank charges collected from the local customer.

[
EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var localTotalCollChg = DV.getLocalTotalCollectCharge();

**
**

DV.getLocalTotalCollectVAT()

This is used to get the total VAT amount collected from the local customer.

[
EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var locaTotalCollVAT = DV.getLocalTotalCollectVAT();

DV.getLocalTotalPayAmt()

This is used to get the total amount paid by the local customer, including charge and VAT payments.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var locaTotalPayAmt = DV.getLocalTotalPayAmt();

DV.getLocalTotalPayCharge()

This is used to get the total amount of bank charges paid by the local customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var locaTotalPayChg = DV.getLocalTotalPayCharge()

DV.getLocalTotalPayVAT()

This is used to get the total VAT amount paid by the local customer.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var locaTotalPayVAT = DV.getLocalTotalPayVAT();

DV.getModuleName()

This method is used to retrieve the module to which the running function belongs.

This returns a String.

DV.getNextWorkingDay(String strDate,String strSubCnty)

This method is used to retrieve the next working day based on the current date. Parameters:

  • String strDate: This is the current date.
  • String strSubCnty: This is the sub-country code (or country code).

This returns a String.

DV.getOriginalFuncShortName()

This method is used to retrieve the last step’s function short name.

This returns a String.

DV.getPartValue(String,int,int)

This method is used to get a particular part of a field value through a specified starting position and a defined data length. Parameters:

  • String: This is the source of the sub-text to be retrieved

  • Int 1: This is the start position.

  • Int 2: This is the number of characters to retrieve.

This returns a String.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

DV.getPartValue(“address”, 10, 6)

DV.getRecord(String,String)

This method is used for retrieving a data object record based on a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the name of the data object.

  • String 2: This is the condition for retrieving the record.

DV.getRecords(String)

This method is used to retrieve the records of a data object. Parameter:

  • String: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

This returns an array of records.

DV.getServerDateTime()

This method is used to get the server date and time and converts these to the proper format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.

This returns a String.

DV.getServerTime()

This method is used to get the server time and converts this to the proper time format: HH:MM:SS.

This returns a String.

DV.getSysBusiDate()

This method is used to get the system business date.

DV.getSysDate()

This method is used to get the system date.

This returns the SYS_DATE value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

//SYS_DATE = ‘2005-03-15’; system date of the application server

var sysDate = DV.getSysDate();

Return: sysDate = ‘2005-03-15’;

DV.getTableMultiDataToArray(String, ServerDataInfo,ServerDataInfo, String)

This is used to retrieve table data based on a given condition and store the values in another array. This can invoke a call-back function. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the table that is to be inquired on.

  • ServerDataInfo: These are the fields which values are to be retrieved and populated into an array.

  • ServerDataInfo: This is the condition for inquring on the table.

  • String 2: This is the order by which the queried fields are to be sorted.

DV.getValue(String,String)

This method is used to get the value of a field from a data object. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the name of the data object.

  • String 2: This is the Data Object field which value is to be retrieved.

This returns a String.

DV.getValue(String,String,String)

This method is used to get the value of a field from a data object according to a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the Data Object field which value is to be retrieved.

  • String 2: This is the name of the data object.

  • String 3: This is the condition for determining the record that contains the field which value is to be retrieved. The condition, which is similar to an SQL statement, can be null. When this results in more than one value (record), the system returns the first value.

This returns a String.

DV.getValueFromGAPI(String)

This is used to retrieve the field values that are obtained by the DV.inqGAPI() method. This method must be used after the DV.inqGAPI() method. **Parameter: **

  • String: This is the name of the field that has been defined as the receiving field in the GAPI rule of DV.inqGAPI() method.

This returns, from the system memory, the value of the defined field.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

/*

‘GAPI_IN’ is an inquire GAPI setting parameter name and in this GAPI rule DOC_REQ field is defined.

**/

DV.inqGAPI (‘GAPI_IN’)

var Test = DV.getValueFromGAPI(‘DOC_REQ’);

RESULT: This gets the DOC_REQ value via GAPI and gives the value to variable Test.

DV.init(String, String,String, String)

This method is used to set the initial exchange rate to be used for a charge transactions.

Parameters:

  • trx2ChgType: This is the exchange rate applied between Transaction- and Charge Agreement-Currency

  • chg2CollType: This is the exchange rate applied between Charge Collect- and Charge Agreement-Currency

  • rule2UnpaidType: This is the exchange rate applied between Charge Unpaid- and Charge Agreement-Currency

  • unpaid2CollType: This is the exchange rate applied between Charge Collect- and Charge Unpaid-Currency

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.init("Booking Rate", "Booking Rate", "Booking Rate", "Booking Rate");

DV.inqGAPI(String)

This is used to submit an inquiry to an outward system via GAPI. The query result is temporarily placed in the system memory. The return value may be used from the outward system for transaction processing such as judgment or field value update. This method is usually used before the DV.getValueFromGAPI() method. Parameter:

  • String: This is the predefined inquire GAPI rule name. The transaction type of the GAPI rule should be Inquire.

This returns the value of the fields that have been defined in the inquire GAPI parameter as receiving fields. The value is not returned immediately to the transaction fields as this method is only for inquiring. Instead, the value is stored in the memory and is later obtained using the DV.getValueFromGAPI() method.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

/*

‘GAPI_IN’ is an inquire GAPI setting parameter name and in this GAPI rule DOC_REQ field is defined.

**/

DV.inqGAPI(‘GAPI_IN’)

var Test = DV.getValueFromGAPI(‘DOC_REQ’);

RESULT: This gets the DOC_REQ value via GAPI and gives the value to variable Test.

**DV.mapForeignCust(**String, String, String, String)

This method is used to define the field names that are related to the local customer.

Parameters:

  • custID: This is the field name of the foreign customer Id.

  • custName: This is the field name of the coreign customer Name.

  • custCCY: This is the name of the ‘Foreign Customer Pay CCY’ field.

  • custACNO: This is the field name of the foreign customer account number field name

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.mapForeignCust("BENE_ID", "BENE_NM", "BENE_CCY", "BENE_ACNO");

DV.mapLocalCust(String, String, String, String)

This method is used to define the field names that are related to the local customer.

Parameters:

  • custID: This is the field name of the local customer Id.

  • custName: This is the field name of the local customer name.

  • custCCY: This is the name of the ‘Local Customer Pay CCY’ field.

  • custACNO: This is the field name of the local customer account number

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.mapLocalCust("APPL_ID","APPL_NM",“CUST_PAY_CCY","CUST_ACNO");

DV.setAddDOCondition(xDOPath,tableName,strFKsParent,strSelFlds,layerNum,doOperateType,filterCondition)

This method is used to retrieve DO records based on the given condition. If several elements are included in the data object hierarchy, this method should be applied to each element. This is used with the DV.setDoData() method. Parameters:

  • xDOPath: This is the complete path if the data object element in the data object hierarchy.

  • tableName: This is the name of the table from which the data are to be retrieved

  • strFKsParent: This is the foreign key relationship between the parent and child tables. This is to be specified as the condition for retrieving the data object record. The value of this parameter follows this format: parentDOFldName:tableFld:parentDOFldName:tableFld.

  • strSelFlds: This is the corresponding relation of the TDO table field and the field from the transaction page which is used to determine the DO fields which data are to be retrieved. The value of this parameter follows this format: pageFldName:tableFldName;pageFldName:tableFldName.

  • layerNum: This is the hierarchy number of the current data object element (i.e., 1 or 2).

  • doOperateType: This is the handle or operation type applied on the record. This may have an “A” (add a new record to the grid), “E” (edit the record on the grid), “D” (delete a record from the grid) value.

  • filterCondition: This is the SQL condition for retrieving data from the data object. This is reserved for future use.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setAddDOCondition("PaymentObligation","TSUM_PMTOBLGTN","C_MAIN_REF:C_MAIN_REF","C_MAIN_REF:C_MAIN_REF;TSU_CCY:TSU_CCY;TSU_RCPTBK_NAME:TSU_RCPTBK_NAME;TSU_OBLGR_BK:TSU_OBLGR_BK","1","E","");

xDOPath: PaymentObligation

tableName: TSUM_PMTOBLGTN

strFKsParent: C_MAIN_REF:C_MAIN_REF

strSelFlds: C_MAIN_REF;TSU_CCY;TSU_RCPTBK_NAME ;TSU_OBLGR_BK

layerNum :1

doOperateType:E

filterCondition: ""

DV.setAllCollCcy(String)

This method is used to set the initial charge collect currency.

Parameters:

  • ccy: This is the bank collection currency

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setAllCollCcy('USD');

DV.setAllDefPayAt(String at)

This method is used to set the deferred charges Pay at value. Parameter:

  • String: This is the value of the deferred Pay At charge.

DV.setAllLocalPayCcy(String)

This method is used to set the value of the ‘Local Customer Pay CCY’ field. Parameter:

  • ccy: This is the local customer payment currency.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setAllLocalPayCcy('USD')

DV.setAllPayAt(payAt)

This is used to set the initial value of the ‘Paid At’ field. Parameters:

  • payAt: This is the value of the ‘Paid At’ field. The possible values are DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION (Transaction), DV.CHG_AT_DEFERRED (Deferred), DV.CHG_AT_FREE (Waived).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setAllPayAt(DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION);

DV.setAllPayBy(payBy)

This is used to set the value of the ‘Paid By’ field. Parameter:

  • payBy: This is the value of the ‘Paid By’ field. The possible values are: DV. CHG_FOR_LOCAL (Local Customer), and DV.CHG_FOR_FOREIGN (Foreign Customer).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setAllPayBy(DV.CHG_FOR_LOCAL);

DV.setAllUnpaidCcy(String)

This method is used to set the value of ‘Balance CCY’ field. Parameter:

  • ccy: This is the balance currency.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setAllUnpaidCcy('USD');

DV.setAutoProcess(boolean)

This is used to indicate whether a pending or master record is to be generated directly in the database by running the auto process or as a record with an S status, for which a Fix function is required. (This is the same as the result of saving a transaction in the EE system). This method must be set before creating a script for the transaction field value. Parameter:

  • Boolean: This may be set as either True or False. Setting this to True indicates that the pending or master record is to be generated directly into the database; setting this to False, on the other hand, indicates that the record is to be generated as a record with an S status.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.setAutoProcess (true); //first line

DV.setChargeValue(String,String,String)

This used for directly specifying the amount of a particular charge item. This amount is displayed in the ‘Charge Amount’ field of the corresponding charge entry. The other field values are updated or calculated according to this specified amount. Parameters:

  • String: This refers to the commission code. This parameter is mandatory.

  • String: This refers to the currency. This parameter is mandatory.

  • String: This refers to the amount of charge. This parameter is mandatory.

DV.setDOValue(Element,String,String)

This method is used to set or assign the value of a data object field.

Parameters:

  • Element: This is the name of the data object**.**

  • String 1: This is the field of the data object which value is to be set.

  • String 2: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

DV.setDefChargeScope(scope)

This is used to define the condition when retrieving deferred charges (i.e., transaction reference, main reference).

Parameters:

  • scope: This is the condition for retrieving the deferred charges. The possible values are: SCOPE_MAINREF (deferred charges are to be retrieved from the main or whole transaction), TRXREF (deferred charges are to be retrieved from a transaction reference), MAINWITHTRXREF (deferred charges are to be retrieved from both the main and transaction reference).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setDefChargeScope(DV.SCOPE_MAINREF);

DV.setDefPayAt(String commCode, String at)

This is used to set the initial value of the deferred charge’s Paid At field.

Parameters:

  • String commCode: This is the value of the commission code
  • payAt: This is the value of the ‘Paid At’ field. The possible values are: DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION (Transaction), DV.CHG_AT_DEFERRED (Deferred), DV.CHG_AT_FREE (Waived).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setDefPayAt(DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION);

DV.setDiscRate(String, int)

This is used to set the discount rate.

Parameters:

  • String: This is the commission code or the commission code string list array

  • int: This is the discount rate

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

var comList = ['IPLC_OPEN_COMM',’ EPLC_POST_CHG’];

DV.setDiscRate(comList,'20');

OR

DV.setDiscRate('IPLC_OPEN_COMM','20');

DV.setDoData()

This is used to retrieve DO records from the cache and generate the DOM data.

DV.set****PayAt(String, payAt)

This is used to set the initial value of the ‘Paid At’ field in a transaction with a commission code. Parameters:

  • commCode: This is the name of the commission code.

  • payAt: This is the value of the ‘Paid At’ field. The possible values are DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION (Transaction), DV.CHG_AT_DEFERRED (Deferred), DV.CHG_AT_FREE (Waived). The default value is DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION.

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

DV.setPayAt('IPLC_OPEN_COMM',DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION);

DV.setPayBy(String, payBy)

This is used to set the value of the ‘Paid At’ field in a transaction with a commission code. Parameters:

  • String: This is the name of the commission code.

  • payBy: This is the value of the ‘Paid At’ field. The possible values are CHG_FOR_LOCAL (Local Customer), and CHG_FOR_FOREIGN (Foreign Customer).

[EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

If the charge is paid by the ‘Local Customer’:

DV.setPayBy('IPLC_OPEN_COMM',STP.CHG_FOR_LOCAL);

DV.setTrxFunction(String)

This is used to invoke a user-predefined transaction function in the auto process. The system runs this function automatically at the defined schedule of the task.

**Parameter: **

  • String: This is the transaction function name.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.writeLog(‘Auto Process Log Start: CloseFile’);

var CLOSE_FLAG = 'Yes';

DV.updateField(‘CLOSE_FLAG’,CLOSE_FLAG);

DV.setTrxFunction(‘Close File’); // ‘Close File’ is the function name.

DV.writeLog(‘Auto Process Log End: CloseFile’);

DV.setValue(String,String,String)

This method is used to set or assign the value of a field from a data object.

Parameters:

  • String 1**:** This is the data object field which value is to be set.

  • String 2: This is the name of the data object.

  • String 3: This is the value to be assigned to the field.

DV.setValue(String,String,String,String)

This method is used to set or assign the value of a field from a data object according to a defined condition. Parameters:

  • String 1: This is the Data Object field which value is to be set.

  • String 2: This is the name of the data object.

  • String 3: This is the value to be assigned to the field based on the given condition.

  • String 4: This is the parameter that contains the condition for assigning the value to the field. The condition, which is similar to an SQL statement, can be null. When this results in more than one value (or record), the system sets the first record.

DV.toDouble(String)

This is used to convert the value of a string into a Double data type.

Parameter:

  • String: This may be any numeric string value.

This returns a Double value that is converted from the specified string value.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

// LC_AMT = 2,365,000.00;

var LC_AMT = DV.getFieldValue(‘LC_AMT’);

var Amt1 = DV.toDouble(LC_AMT) + 100;

RESULT: Amt1 = 2365100


DV.toFloat(String)

This method is used to convert the value of a string into a Float data type.

Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into a Float data type.

This returns a Float data type.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

// LC_AMT = 2,365,000.00;

var LC_AMT = DV.getFieldValue(‘LC_AMT’);

var Amt1 = DV.toFloat(LC_AMT) + 100;

RESULT: Amt1 = 2365100

DV.toInteger(String)

This method is used to convert a value of a string to an Integer data type.

Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into the Integer data type.

This returns an Integer.

DV.toLong(String)

This method is used to convert the value of a string to a Long data type.

Parameter:

  • String: This is the numeric data to be converted into a Long data type.

This returns a Long data type.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

DV.toLong(“LC_AMT”)

DV.updateField(String,Object)

This is used to assign the value of a field or variable to another field or variable.

Parameters:

  • String: This is the variable name.

  • Object: This is the value to be assigned to the variable or field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var aa = DV.getFieldValue(‘GOODS_DESC’);

DV.updateField(‘DESC_GOODS1’, aa);

[NOTE]{.underline}: This is to first get the field value of GOODS_DESC and set the field value to the variable DESC_GOODS1.

DV.writeLog(String)

This method is used to write log information for user notification or debugging in the EE log file. Parameter:

  • String: This is the text to be written into the log file.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.writeLog("DV.SYS_BANK_COUNTRY="+DV.SYS_BANK_COUNTRY);

{#section-23 .CS-head2}

Variables

The system variables for the Subtask – Auto Process Manage function are as follows.

Figure 6. Variables for the Auto Process Function

DV.CHG_AT_DEFERRED

This is used for retrieving the value of deferred charges.

DV.CHG_AT_FREE

This is used for retrieving the value of the waived charges.

DV.CHG_AT_TRANSACTION

This is used to retrieve the value of the charges to be paid at transaction.

DV.CHG_FOR_FOREIGN

This is used to retrieve the value of charges to be paid by the foreign customer.

DV.CHG_FOR_LOCAL

This is used to retrieve the value of charges to be paid by the local customer.

DV.LEVEL_BUSINESS_UNIT

This is used to retrieve the business unit level.

DV.LEVEL_COMM_RANGE

This is used to retrieve the comm. level.

DV.LEVEL_COUNTRY

This is used to retrieve the country level.

DV.LEVEL_CUSTOMER

This is used to retrieve the customer level.

DV.LEVEL_STANDARD

This is used to retrieve the standard level.

DV.MAINWITHTRXREF

This is used to retrieve the reference name of a reference number setting.

DV.SCOPE_MAINREF

This is used to retrieve the reference name of a reference number setting.

DV.SYS_BANK_COUNTRY

This is used to retrieve the reference name of a transaction number setting.

DV.SYS_BANK_GROUP

This is used to retrieve the bank group.

DV.SYS_BUSI_DATE

This is used to retrieve the business date.

DV.SYS_BUSI_UNIT

This is used to retrieve the business unit.

DV.SYS_FUNCTION_TYPE

This is used to retrieve the function type.

**DV.SYS_LCY **

This is used to retrieve the system’s local currency.

DV.SYS_LCY_2ND

This is used to retrieve the second currency applied.

**DV.SYS_LOCAL_CCY **

This is used to retrieve the local currency.

DV.SYS_ORI_UNIT_CODE

This is used to retrieve the unit code.

DV.SYS_REF_NO

This is used to retrieve the reference number.

**DV.TRXREF **

This is used to retrieve the reference name of a transaction number setting.

Calculation Methods

Calculation Methods

Terminology

  • xPath: The complete path of the data object element in the data object hierarchy. This data object element can be the data object element itself or a child template.

  • Brother DO: A data object that has the same parent DO as the current DO

  • Child DO: A DO template under another DO template (i.e.g, parent DO template). This is also referred to as child data object, child DO template, child template, or sub-DO.

  • Parent DO: The main template used in creating a Data Object Entity.

  • DomData: The data property from which, while confirming the transaction, all the transaction fields’ values are stored.

+———————————————————————–+ | Examples of xPathValues | | | | i. To determine the value of Field1: | | | | - Data object – TestDataObject (This is a DO with a template root | | node.) | | | | - DOTemplate – This is the corresponding template of the DO | | | | - DOTemplate has 3 child templates: DOTemplateA, DOTemplateB, | | DOTemplateC. | | | | - If Field1 is in DOTemplateC, the xPath is: | | TestDataObject.DOTemplateC. | | | | ii. To determine the value of Field1: | | | | - Data object – TestDataObject (This is a DO with a template root | | node) | | | | - DOTemplate – This is the corresponding template of the DO | | | | - DOTemplate has 3 child templates: DOTemplateA, DOTemplateB, | | DOTemplateC. | | | | - DOTemplateC has 2 child templates: DOTemplateC1 and DOTemplateC2. | | | | - If Field1 is in DOTemplateC2, the xPath is: | | TestDataObject.DOTemplateC.DOTemplateC2 | | | | iii. To determine the value of Field1: | | | | - Data object – Test2DataObject (This is a DO with a none-template | | root node) | | | | - Test2DataObject has 3 child templates, all at the same level: | | Template1, Template2, Template3 | | | | - If Field1 is in Template3, the xPath is: | | Test2DataObject.Template3 | +———————————————————————–+

{#section-24 .CS-head2}

System Methods

The system methods for the Calculation function are as follows.

Figure 7. System Methods for the Calculation Function

+———————————————————————–+ | Terms | | | | xPath– the complete path of the data object element in the data | | object hierarchy. This data object element can be the data object | | element itself or a child template. | | | | Brother DO – a data object that has the same parent DO as the | | current DO | | | | Child DO – a DO template under another DO template (i.e.g, parent | | DO template). This is also referred to as child data object, child DO | | template, child template, or sub-DO. | | | | Parent DO – the main template used in creating a Data Object | | Entity. | | | | DomData – The data property from which, while confirming the | | transaction, all the transaction fields’ values are stored. | +———————————————————————–+

+———————————————————————–+ | Examples of xPathValues | | | | i. To determine the value of Field1: | | | | - Data object – TestDataObject (This is a DO with a template root | | node.) | | | | - DOTemplate – This is the corresponding template of the DO | | | | - DOTemplate has 3 child templates: DOTemplateA, DOTemplateB, | | DOTemplateC. | | | | - If Field1 is in DOTemplateC, the xPath is: | | TestDataObject.DOTemplateC. | | | | ii. To determine the value of Field1: | | | | - Data object – TestDataObject (This is a DO with a template root | | node) | | | | - DOTemplate – This is the corresponding template of the DO | | | | - DOTemplate has 3 child templates: DOTemplateA, DOTemplateB, | | DOTemplateC. | | | | - DOTemplateC has 2 child templates: DOTemplateC1 and DOTemplateC2. | | | | - If Field1 is in DOTemplateC2, the xPath is: | | TestDataObject.DOTemplateC.DOTemplateC2 | | | | iii. To determine the value of Field1: | | | | - Data object – Test2DataObject (This is a DO with a none-template | | root node) | | | | - Test2DataObject has 3 child templates, all at the same level: | | Template1, Template2, Template3 | | | | - If Field1 is in Template3, the xPath is: | | Test2DataObject.Template3 | +———————————————————————–+

{width="0.3298611111111111in” height="0.3298611111111111in”}NOTE: The EEHTML methods are used to define the standard Javascript codes required to enable EE to work on multiple browsers, specifically Internet Explorer 11, Mozilla Firefox, and Google Chrome. The codes are stored in the following path: [EximbillWeb.War drive]\SYS_JS\YS_CrossBrowser.js

Chg.Screen.getForeignUnpayVatTotalAmt();

This method is used to get the total unpaid VAT amount for a foreign customer.

Chg.Screen.getLocalUnpayVatTotalAmt();

This method is used to get the total unpaid VAT amount for a local customer.

Chg.Screen.setChgOverrideFlag(index,“F”)

This is used to disable the Override flag in order to prevent overwriting existing charge data.

GetExchangeRate_Batch(Fccy, Tccy, Rtype, FieldNameOrVarName, FuncName, MDFlagName)

This is used to obtain multiple exchange rates at one time as a batch. This requires the SYS_BATCH_GETDATA_COMMIT() method.

Parameters:

  • Fccy: This is the Foreign CCY value.

  • Tccy: This is the Transaction CCY value.

  • Rtype : This is the Rtype value.

  • FieldNameOrVarName: This is the field or variable name.

  • FuncName: This is the function name.

  • MDFlagName: This is the operation to be performed between Fccy and Tccy for getting the exchange rate – multiplication or division.

SYS_APAR_Refuse()

This function must be included in the _cancel_onclick() function. When the SYS_InqAPAR(custID,aparFlag,ccy,sys_index,amount) method is called, the system records correspondingly. This function must be called when a transaction is cancelled, as some variables of the record must be reset.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

function _cancel_onclick(){

if(SYS_CONFIRM_FLAG=="false") {

SYS_APAR_Refuse();

SYS_RefuseRefNumber(SYS_REF_NAME_LCRefNo,SYS_REF_NO_LCRefNo);

}

}

SYS_BATCH_GETDATA_COMMIT()

This function sends the batch request to the server and returns the response into the JSP file.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

function OnInit(){

………

GetExchangeRate("USD","TWD","SPOTSELL"," DEAL_RATE "," DEAL_RATE_OnChange");

GetExchangeRate("USD","TWD","SPOTSELL","U_TRate","N");

GetExchangeRate("USD","TWD","SPOTBUY","LC_TRate","N");

SYS_BATCH_GETDATA_COMMIT();……

}

RESULT: When the JSP file is initialized, the function GetExchangeRate() is called in batch. The SYS_BATCH_GETDATA_COMMIT() function sends the request to the server and returns the response into the JSP file.

SYS_BeFloat(objValue)

This function converts objValue to a Float data type if objValue is not numeric. If objValue contains illegal characters, the function truncates the remaining part of the value starting from the first illegal character. If objValue is null or if the first character is an illegal character, the function returns 0.

Parameter:

  • objValue: This is the value to be converted.

This returns a Float data type.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var STL_AMT = SYS_BeFloat(document.MAINFORM.STL_AMT.value);

SYS_BeFloatForConFalse(objValue)

This functions like the BeFloat() method but the decimal separator is a period (.).

If objValue is not a numeric type, the following statement example converts objValue to a numeric value.

If objValue includes an illegal letter, the remainder part is truncated from the first illegal letter.

If objValue is null or the first letter is an illegal letter, this method returns 0.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

Var objAmtValue=SYS_BeFloatForConFalse(objAmt.value);

SYS_BeInt(objValue)

This function converts objValue to an integer if objValue is not numeric. If objValue contains illegal characters, the function truncates the remaining part of the value starting from the first illegal character. If objValue is null or if the first character is an illegal characters, the function returns 0.

Parameter:

  • objValue**:** This is the value to be converted.

This returns an Integer type.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var STANDBY_TENORS = beInt(document.MAINFORM.STANDBY_TENORS.value);

SYS_CalEndWorkingDate(strCntyCode, strStartDateValue, strDays, strJsFuncName, strBeforeOrAfter, strIfCheckHol, strIfJumpHol)

The function is used to get the end date based on the start date and delay days. The return value is sent to the function for strJsFuncName.

Parameters:

  • strCntyCode: This is the country code. Several country codes may be defined for this parameter. This parameter is mandatory.

  • strStartDate: This is the starting date. This parameter is mandatory.

  • strDays: This is the number of delay days. This parameter is mandatory.

  • strJsFuncName: This is the JS function that is to receive the resulting end date. This parameter is mandatory.

  • strBeforeOrAfter: This is the Before or After flag setting. The possible values are A, the default value, and B.

  • strIfCheckHol: This flag setting indicates whether or not to check holiday dates. The possible values are Y, the default value, and N.

  • strIfJumpHol: This flag setting indicates whether or not to include the holiday dates in the calculation. The possible values are N, the default value, and Y.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

<input type="button" name="APPL" value="..." style="width:25; height:20" onclick=" SYS_CalEndWorkingDate('BENE_CNTY','ISSUE_DATE','APPL_BRCODE','go')">

SYS_CalEndWorkingDateSubcnty(strCntyCodeValue, sfSubCntyCodeValue,strStartDateValue, strDaysValue,strJsFuncName, strBeforeOrAfter, strIfCheckHol, strIfJumpHol)

This method is used to retrieve the end working date of a sub-country based on the start date and the number of days to be added to or deducted from this date.

  • strCntyCodeValue: This is the country code. Several country codes may be defined for this parameter.

  • sfSubCntyCodeValue: This is the sub-country code (or country code)

  • strStartDateValue: This is the starting date.

  • strDaysValue: This is the number of delay days.

  • strJsFuncName: This is the JS function that is to receive the resulting end date. This parameter is mandatory.

  • strBeforeOrAfter: This is the Before or After flag setting. The possible values are A, the default value, and B.

  • strIfCheckHol: This flag setting indicates whether or not to check holiday dates. The possible values are Y, the default value, and N.

  • strIfJumpHol: This flag setting indicates whether or not to include the holiday dates in the calculation. The possible values are N, the default value, and Y.

SYS_CalEndWorkingDateSubcnty_S(strCntyCodeValue,sfSubCntyCodeValue,strStartDateValue, strDaysValue, fldOrParaName, strBeforeOrAfter, strIfCheckHol, strIfJumpHol)

**This functions like the SYS_CalEndWorkingDateSubcnty() method but this is executed on Synchronize Mode. **

SYS_CalEndWorkingDate_S(strCntyCode, strStartDate, strDays, fldOrParaName, strBeforeOrAfter, strIfCheckHol, strIfJumpHol)

This functions like the SYS_CalEndWorkingDate() method but this is executed on Synchronize Mode.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

SYS_CalEndWorkingDate_S('CN',invduedate,graceday,'duedate','A','N','N');

SYS_CalcNumberOfTerms(dStartDate, dEndDate, nTermPeriod)

This method is used to calculate number of terms from the start date to the end date. The term may be monthly, quarterly, semi-annually, or annually.

Parameters:

  • sStartDate: This is the start date.

  • dEndDate: This is the end date.

  • nTermPeriod: This is the term period.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var S_DATE=getDateByStr(document.MAINFORM. S_DATE.value);

var E_DATE=getDateByStr(document.MAINFORM. E_DATE.value);

document.MAINFORM.TERM_NUM=calcNumberOfTerms(S_DATE,E_DATE,3);

SYS_CallJavaClass(ProjectClass, Type, FieldNames, JsFuncName,sFailJsFuncName)

This method is used to plug in a user-defined class.

Parameters:

  • ProjectClass: This is the user-defined class.

  • Type: This pertains the type of the Java Class.

  • FieldNames: This is the page field name which value is to be transferred to the server.

  • JsFuncName: This is the function to be run if the operation is successful.

  • sFailJsFuncName: This is the JS function to be called if the operation fails.

SYS_CallJavaClassCallBack(xmlhttp,mode,sSucJsFuncName,sFailJsFuncName)

This is currently not used.

SYS_CheckError(o,strErrMsg)

The function is used to both display an error message alert based on a checking rule, and focus on the error field.

Parameters:

  • o: This is the field name.

  • strErrMsg: This is the error message.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if(document.MAINFORM.LC_BALA.value<0)

{SYS_CheckError (document.MAINFORM.LC_BALA,"LC_BALA is error! Plz input again!")

SYS_CheckHoliday(sfCntyCode, sfDate, sfSubCntyCode, sfState, sfUnitCode, sSucJsFuncName, sFailJsFuncName, isShowErr)

This method is used to check whether or not a given date is a holiday.

Parameters:

  • sfCntyCode: This is the sub-country code.

  • sfDate: This is the date to be verified as a holiday.

  • sfSubCntyCode: This is the sub-country code.

  • sfState: This is the name of the state.

  • sfUnitCode: This indicates the business unit.

  • sSucJsFunc: This indicates the JS function that is to run if the verification is successfully confirmed.

  • sFailJsFunc: This indicates the JS function that is to run if the verification fails.

  • isShowErr: This indicates whether or not an error message is to be shown if the operation fails. This may have a true or false value. If the value is true, the system displays an error message. Otherwise, no error is prompted.

This returns a Boolean.

{width="0.3298611111111111in” height="0.3298611111111111in”}NOTE: To enable the system to automatically check input Date fields for holidays, include the SYS_DEFAULT_CHECK_HOL system constant in the calculation rule and set it to true.  In this case, the verification is performed whether or not the SYS_CheckHoliday() method is used on a Date field.

SYS_CheckHoliday_S(sfCntyCode, sfDate, sfSubCntyCode,sfState, sfUnitCode,sSucJsFunc,sFailJsFunc,isShowErr)

This functions like the SYS_CheckHoliday() system method but this is exceuted on Synchronized Mode.
