SYS_CheckLimit_S(checkString,dispFlag, sType)

This method is used to check the customer, group, and member facility limits that, in turn, serve as bases in determining the services that can be accessed by end-users.

Parameters:

  • checkString: This is the string that includes the fields containing the information of the group which limit is to be checked. The values must be separated by a colon (e.g., custid+”:“+rcustid+”:“+subLimitDesc+”:“+facilityType+”:“+trxCcy+”:“trxAmt+”:“+darkMrk+”:“+trxDate+”:“+dueDate+”:

  • dispFlag: This controls whether the details of the result (i.e., Passed or Failed) of the limit checking are to be displayed. This may have a TRUE or FALSE value.

  • sType: This is the level of limit to be checked by the system. This parameter may have one or a combination of the following values: G (Group Level), C (Customer Level), S (Sub-limit Level), M (Member Facility Level). If there are several levels to be checked, these may be indicated as:

“CS” – Customer and Sub-limit Level

“CM” –Customer and Member Facility Level

“CSM” – Customer, Sub-limit, and Member Facility Level

GCSM – Group, Customer, Sub-limit and Member Facility Level

"” – All limit levels

If the method uses multiple checkString parameters, an sType value, separated by a semi-colon, must be specified for each. Example:

“C;S” – Customer Level for checkString1, and Sub-limit Level for checkString2

“CS;SM” – Customer and Sub-limit Level for checkString1, and Sub-limit and Member Facility level for checkString2

“C” – Customer Level for checkString1 and all levels for checkString2

“CM” – Customer and Member Facility Level for checkString1, and all levels for checkString2

"” – all levels for checkString1 and checkString2

SYS_CheckOptions(fldName,value)

This method is used to determine if the selected option is correct or not.

Parameters:

  • fldName: This is the field to which the option belongs.

  • value: This is the option value.

SYS_ClearLastInitData()

This method is used to clear existing records in a data object tree when the transaction screen is refreshed.

SYS_DateToStr(date)

This method converts a string type date into a properly formatted date value. The format is determined through the SYS_DATE_FORMAT system parameter.

Parameter:

  • date: This is the date to be formatted. This can also be an object (e.g., document.MAINFORM.EXPIRE_DATE)

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

If the input date value is 20021215, and the format defined in the SYS_DATE_FORMAT system parameter is YYYY-MM-DD, this function converts the value to 2002-12-15.

SYS_Day1MustbeLaterThanDay2(sfFirstDayName,sfSecondDayName)

This function is used to check that the first Date field value is later than the second Date field value. This function displays the relevant error message if the dates do not follow this condition.

Parameters:

  • sfFirstDayName: This is the first date.

  • sfSecondDayName: This is the second date.

This returns a Boolean.

[
EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

if(!SYS_Day1MustbeLaterThanDay2('S_DATE','E_DATE'))return false

SYS_EToNumStr(vNum)

This method is reserved for special projects only.

SYS_Edit_Image(mainRefKeyField)

This method is currently not used.

SYS_FilterOptions(fldName,valueArray)

This method is used to filter the options in a dropdown field.

Parameters:

  • fldName: This is the name of the field to be filtered.

  • valueArray: This is the filter rule.

SYS_FilterRecordByXpath(xpath,namevalue)

This method is used to filter or search for a record in a data object based on a name value.

Parameters:

  • xPath: This is the xPath of the data object.

  • namevalue: This is the value of a node (field) of the data object.

SYS_FloatAdd(arg1,arg2)

This is used to calculate the sum of 2 Float-type numeric values.

Parameters:

  • arg1: This is the first Float numeric value.

  • arg2: This is the second Float numeric value.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var Add01 = 3000.00

var Add02 = 5000.00

SYS_FloatAdd(Add02,Add01)

Result = 8000.00

SYS_FloatDiv(arg1,arg2)

This is used to calculate the value when one Float-type numeric value is divided by another Float-type numeric values.

Parameters:

  • arg1: This is the first Float numeric value.

  • arg2: This is the second Float numeric value.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var Add01 = 3000.00

var Add02 = 5000.00

SYS_FloatAdd(Add02,Add01)

SYS_FloatMul(arg1,arg2)

This is used to calculate the value when one Float-type numeric value is multiplied by another Float-type numeric value.

Parameters:

  • arg1: This is the first Float numeric value.

  • arg2: This is the second Float numeric value.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var Add01 = 3000.00

var Add02 = 5000.00

SYS_FloatAdd(Add02,Add01)

Result = 1500000.00

SYS_FloatSub(arg1,arg2)

This is used to calculate the difference between 2 Float-type numeric values.

Parameters:

  • arg1: This is the first Float numeric value.

  • arg2: This is the second Float numeric value.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var Add01 = 3000.00

var Add02 = 5000.00

SYS_FloatSub(Add02,Add01)

Result = 2000.00

SYS_FormatDate(sfDateFieldName)

This function converts the string type data into a properly formatted date value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

If the input date value is 20021215, and the format defined in the SYS_DATE_FORMAT system parameter is YYYY-MM-DD, this function converts the date to 2002-12-15.

SYS_SetDateFormat('S_DATE')

SYS_FormatDateToStd(value)

This method is used to convert the date value in the SYS_DATE_FORMAT format. If SYS_DATE_FORMAT is not defined, the system uses the YYYY-MM-DD format.

Parameter:

  • value: This is the date to be formatted.

SYS_GETServerTime()

This function converts the server time into the accepted time string format.

**SYS_GET_DEF(sBankGoupId,sBuCntyCode,sAcctCcy,sClearType,sAcctByID,sFieldName,scheckName) **

This is currently not used.

SYS_GenSelectElement(strFldName,strFldList)

This is used to select an element from a dropdown list.

Parameters:

  • strFldName: This is the name of the field that contains the element to be selected.

  • strFldList: This is the dropdown list name.

SYS_GenSelectElement_S(strFldName,strFldList)

**This functions like the SYS_GenSelectElement() method but this is executed on Synchronize Mode. **

SYS_Get()

This is currently not used.

SYS_GetAcBank_Boc(bankId,ccy,unitCode,claimType)

This is currently not used.

SYS_GetCUBK(sCUBKMappingName, sfKeyFldName, sSucJsFuncName, sFailJsFuncName, notshowError)

This function is used to retrieve, from the database, field values that are mapped according to the Get CUBK rule that is passed.

Parameters:

  • sCUBKMappingName: This is the Get CUBK mapping rule name. This parameter is mandatory.

  • sfKeyFldName**:** This is the key field name of the Get CUBK rule. This parameter is mandatory.

  • sSucJsFuncName: This is the JS function to be called if the retrieval is successful. This parameter is optional.

  • sFailJsFuncName: This is the JS function to be called if the retrieval fails. This parameter is optional.

  • notshowError: This indicates whether or not an error message is to be shown if the operation fails. This may have a true or false value. If the value is false, the system displays an error message. Otherwise, no error is prompted. (As an alternative to defining this parameter for every instance of the method, the SYS_HIDE_ERROR_ON_NO_DATA system JS variable can be used.  When set to true, the warning message is hidden; otherwise, the warning message is shown.)

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

i. <input name="APPL_ID" type="text" class="CHAR_M" > title="Applicant ID" > onBlur="SYS_GetCUBK('APPL_ID','APPL_ID','getTrue','getFalse')" > size="20" maxlength="12">

ii. SYS_GetCUBK('APPL_ID', > document.MAINFORM.APPL_ID.name,'SYF_IPLC_Charge()');

SYS_GetCUBK_S(sCUBKMappingName, sfKeyFldName, notshowError)

This function is used to retrieve, from the database, field values that are mapped according to the Get CUBK rule that is passed.

Parameters:

  • sCUBKMappingName: This is the Get CUBK mapping rule name. This parameter is mandatory.

  • sfKeyFldName**:** This is the key field name of the Get CUBK rule. This parameter is mandatory.

  • notshowError: This indicates whether or not an error message is to be shown if the operation fails. This may have a true or false value. If the value is false, the system displays an error message. Otherwise, no error is prompted. (As an alternative to defining this parameter for every instance of the method, the SYS_HIDE_ERROR_ON_NO_DATA system JS variable can be used.  When set to true, the warning message is hidden; otherwise, the warning message is shown.)

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

i. SYS_GetCUBK_S('CPYT_BENE_ID_SW','CPYT_BENE_ID');

ii. SYS_GetCUBK_S('X202_ACC_BKID_57A','X202_ACC_BKID_57A','X202_ACC_BKID_57A_back()')


SYS_GetCablePost(FeeTableName,FeeName,CCY,BR_Code)

This is currently not used.

SYS_GetClearing(sBankGoupId,sBuCntyCode,sAcctCcy,sClearType,sFieldName,sFuncName)

This is currently not used.

SYS_GetCrossRate(sFromCcy, sToCcy, sMediumCcy, sRateType, sFieldNameOrVarName, sJsFuncName, decimal, notShowErr)

This is used to calculate the cross rate based on a defined currency and rate type.

Parameters:

  • sFromCcy: This is the From CCY value.

  • sToCcy: This is the To CCY value.

  • sMediumCcy: This is the “intermediate conversion currency”. This is the currency to which the From CCY is to be converted before it is converted to the To CCY.

  • sRateType: This is the rate type value.

  • sFieldNameOrVarName: This is the field name or the global variable where the returned cross rate value is to be stored.

  • sJsFuncName: This is the name of the system function to be invoked.

  • Decimal: This is the number of decimal places to be shown in the calculated cross rate.

  • notShowErr: This indicates whether or not an error message is to be shown in the operation fails. This may have a true or false value. If the value is true, the system displays an error message. Otherwise, no error is prompted.

This returns the cross rate based on the From CCY, To CCY, and Rate Type value.

SYS_GetCrossRate_S(sFromCcy, sToCcy, sMediumCcy, sRateType, sFieldNameOrVarName, sJsFuncName, decimal, notShowErr)

This functions like the SYS_GetCrossRate() system method but this is executed on Synchronized Mode.

SYS_GetDataBatchForDO_S(objRule,objStatus)

This function is used for getting multiple data from a data object at one time as a batch.

Parameters:

  • objRule: This is the Get Data rule.

  • objStatus: This is the status of the DO record retrieved. The possible values are: N, A, V

SYS_GetDataBySSS(sRuleName,sFldList,sJSFuncName)

This function is used to call the server side JavaScript that is defined in the Server Side JS function in the EE Utility.

Parameters:

  • sRuleName: This is the server side JavaScript rule name as defined in the Server Side JS function.

  • sFldList: This is the field list name, where the format is: F1; F2;…FN.

  • sJSFuncName: This is the function name that is to call the server side JavaScript. This is optional.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

SYS_GetDataBySSS('X103_ACC_BKACNO57A_CHKMORE','X103_ACC_BKACNO57A;AC_WT_INST_CNTY_CODE;CHIPFED');

SYS_GetDataBySSS_S(sRuleName,sFldList)

This functions like the SYS_GetDataBySSS() but this is executed on Synchronized Mode.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

function GetDataBySSS_S(){

SYS_GetDataBySSS_S('SANDY_SSS_S','APPL_ID;NOTE_S');

alert(document.MAINFORM.NOTE_S.name + "=" + document.MAINFORM.NOTE_S.value);

}

SYS_GetDataForDO(sCUBKMappingName,status,showError,datafromDO)

This is used to retrieve data from the data object.

Parameters:

  • sCUBKMappingName: This is the Get CUBK mapping rule name.

  • status: This is the status of the DO record retrieved. The possible values are: N, A, V

  • showError: This indicates whether or not an error message is to be shown if the operation fails. This may have a true or false value. If the value is true, the system displays an error message. Otherwise, no error is prompted.

  • datafromDO: This is currently not used.

SYS_GetDataForDO_S(sCUBKMappingName,status,showError,datafromDO,xpathFordo)

This is used to retrieve data from the data object.

Parameters:

  • sCUBKMappingName: This is the Get CUBK mapping rule name.

  • status: This is the status of the DO record retrieved. The possible values are: N, A, V

  • showError: This indicates whether or not an error message is to be shown if the operation fails. This may have a true or false value. If the value is true, the system displays an error message. Otherwise, no error is prompted.

  • datafromDO: This is currently not used.

  • xpathFordo: This is the path for the DO.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

SYS_GetDataForDO_S("AdivceForBankCust","V",null,null,"AdivceForBankCust");

SYS_GetDataForDO_TSU_S(sCUBKMappingName,status,showError,datafromDO,xpathFordo,config)

This is used to retrieve data from a TSU message.

Parameters:

  • sCUBKMappingName: This is the Get Data rule name.

  • status: This is the status of the DO record retrieved. The possible values are: N, A, V

  • showError: This indicates whether or not an error message is to be shown if the operation fails. This may have a true or false value. If the value is true, the system displays an error message. Otherwise, no error is prompted.

  • datafromDO: This is currently not used.

  • xpathFordo: This is the path for the DO.

  • config: This is used for TSU.

SYS_GetDataFromGapi_S(inquireGapiRule)

This is used to retrieve data from a GAPI message.

Parameter:

  • sGapiMappingName: This is the GAPI rule name.

  • sSucJsFuncName: This indicates the JS function that is to run if the verification is successfully confirmed.

  • sFailJsFuncName: This indicates the JS function that is to run if the verification fails.

SYS_GetDateByIncrement(sDateFldName,sYearsIncr,sDaysIncr)

This is used to get the resulting date if the number of years or days of a given date is incremented.

Parameters:

  • sDateFldName: This is the Date field name.

  • sYearsIncr: This is the number of years to be added to the Date field.

  • sDaysIncr: This is the number of days to be added to the Date field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var date=SYS_GetDateByIncrement('FA_PMT_VAL_DT',0,0);

var vYear = date.getFullYear();

var vMonth = date.getMonth()+1;

var vDay = date.getDate();

SYS_GetDateByStr(sfDateFieldName)

This function converts a string into a properly formatted date value.

**Parameter: **

  • sfDateFieldName: This is the date field.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var S_DATE=SYS_GetDateByStr('S_DATE');

SYS_GetExchangeRate(sFromCcy, sToCcy, sRateType, sFieldNameOrVarName, sJsFuncName, sMDFlagName, sToleName,sIndirection,priceDate,decimal,notShowErr)

This is used to return the rate from the From Currency to the Local Currency, from the To Currency to the Local Currency, and from the Local Currency to the To Currency.

Parameters:

  • sFromCcy: This is the From Currency value. This parameter is mandatory.

  • sToCcy: This is the To Currency value. This parameter is mandatory.

  • sRateType: This is the rate type value. This parameter is mandatory.

  • This is the field or variable name that receives the exchange rate value. This parameter is mandatory.

  • sJsFuncName: This is the function that receives and uses the resulting exchange rate.

  • sMDFlagName: This is the exchange rate operation to be performed: Multiplication or Division.

  • sToleName: This is the floating rate.

  • sIndirection: This control whether the currencies involved in the retrieval of an exchange rate are interchangeable. For instance, if the initial exchange rate to be retrieved is from EUR to USD and the value of this parameter is set to “Y”, the system retrieves the exchange rate from USD to EUR.

  • priceDate: This is the date with a corresponding exchange rate value that the system retrieves during transaction processing. (e.g., The exchange rate on February 20, 2012 is $0.77 and the priceDate is February 20, 2012, the system retrieves and applies the exchange rate value of $0.77).

  • decimal: This indicates the number of decimal places to be allotted for the result. If no value is specified, this defaults to 6 decimal places.

  • notShowErr: This indicates whether or not an error message is to be shown if the operation fails. This may have a true or false value. If the value is true, the system displays an error message. Otherwise, no error is prompted.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if (ISSUE_BK_CHG_CCY != PRES_CCY){

SYS_GetExchangeRate(ISSUE_BK_CHG_CCY, PRES_CCY, 'Booking Rate', document.MAINFORM.TEMP_RATE_ISS_BK_CHG_CCY.name);

}

else{

document.MAINFORM.TEMP_RATE_ISS_BK_CHG_CCY.value = 1;

SYS_GetExchangeRateAMT_S(sFromCcy,sToCcy, sRateType,strAmt,sFieldNameOrVarName,byReciprocal,sToleField,sToleTableName,sSQLWhere,sucFn,failedFn,decimal)

This is used to retrieve the exchange rate, amount and currency and convert an amount from one currency to another.

Parameters:

  • sFromCcy: This is the From Currency value.

  • sToCcy: This is the To Currency value.

  • sRateType: This is the rate type value.

  • strAmt: This is the amount that is to be converted.

  • sFieldNameOrVarName**:** This is the field or variable name that receives the converted amount.

  • byReciprocal: This is the exchange rate operation (M/D): Multiply or Divide.

  • sToleField: This is the floating rate.

  • sToleTableName: This is the floating rate table that is to be inquired.

  • sSQLWhere: This is the condition for inquiring on the floating rate table.

  • sucFn: This is the function to be run if the operation is successful.

  • failedFn: This is the function to be run if the operation fails.

  • decimal: This indicates the number of decimal places to be allotted for the result. If no value is specified, this defaults to 6 decimal places.

SYS_GetExchangeRate_Batch(aExchangeRate,sJsFuncName)

This function is used to get several exchange rates in a batch. When this is used, the SYS_BATCH_GETDATA_COMMIT() function must be called.

Parameters:

  • aExchangeRate: This is the array of From and To currencies which equivalent exchange rate values are to be retrieved.

  • sJsFuncName: This is the function that receives and uses the resulting exchange rates.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

function OnInit(){

GetExchangeRate("USD","TWD","SPOTSELL"," DEAL_RATE "," DEAL_RATE_OnChange");

GetExchangeRate("USD","TWD","SPOTSELL","U_TRate","N");

GetExchangeRate("USD","TWD","SPOTBUY","LC_TRate","N");

SYS_BATCH_GETDATA_COMMIT();……

}

where:

When the JSP file is initialized, the function GetExchangeRate() is called in batch. The SYS_BATCH_GETDATA_COMMIT()function sends

SYS_GetExchangeRate_Batch_S(aExchangeRate)

This function is used to get several exchange rates in a batch.

Parameter:

  • aExchangeRate: This is the array of From and To currencies which equivalent exchange rate values are to be retrieved.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

function GetExchangeRateBatch_S(){

var fromccy = document.MAINFORM.CCY3.value;

var array1=[fromccy,"USD","Booking Rate","TEMP_RATE3"];

var array2 = [fromccy,"USD","Selling Rate","TEMP_RATE4"];

var aExchangeRate = new Array();

var aExchangeRate = [array1, array2];

SYS_GetExchangeRate_Batch_S(aExchangeRate);

alert("GetExchangeRateBatch_S Result: [From "+document.MAINFORM.CCY3.value + " To USD] "+document.MAINFORM.TEMP_RATE3.name + "=" + document.MAINFORM.TEMP_RATE3.value + " & " + document.MAINFORM.TEMP_RATE4.name + "=" + document.MAINFORM.TEMP_RATE4.value);

}

SYS_GetExchangeRate_Boc(sFromCcy, sToCcy, sRateTypeList,sFiledList)

This is currently not used.

SYS_GetExchangeRate_Fee(sFromCcy, sToCcy, sRateTypeList,sFiledList)

This is currently not used.

SYS_GetExchangeRate_S(sFromCcy, sToCcy, sRateType, sFieldNameOrVarName, sJsFuncName, sMDFlagName, sToleName, sIndirection,priceDate,decimal,notShowErr)

This functions like the SYS_GetExchangeRate() method but this is executed in Synchronized Mode.

SYS_GetFee(FeeTableName,FeeName,CCY,BR_Code,Cust_ID)

This is currently not used.

SYS_GetIntRate_BOC(rateType,productCode,custId,brID,fieldName)

This is currently not used.

SYS_GetLimitShareInfo(objCustID,objRCustID,objCslValue,objCsflValue,objAmt,objCcy)

This system method is used for getting the shared limit information.

Parameters:

  • objCustID: This is the Customer Id.

  • objRCustID: This is the Related Customer Id.

  • objCslValue: This is the Sub-limit Description.

  • objCsflValue: This is the name of the Facility Type.

  • objAmt: This is the transaction amount.

  • objCcy: This is the transaction currency.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var custid = LM_CUST_ID.value;

var rcustid = LM_RCUST_ID.value;

var subLimitDesc = LM_CSL_DESC.value;

var facilityType = LM_FACI_TP.value;

var trxAmt = SYS_BeFloat(LM_TRX_AMT.value);

var trxCcy = LM_TRX_CCY.value;

var result = SYS_GetLimitShareInfo(custid,rcustid,subLimitDesc,facilityType,trxAmt,trxCcy);

return result;

SYS_GetMultiData_Boc(TableName,Key,FList)

This is currently not used.

SYS_GetMultiFldValueFromArray(fldName)

This is used to retrieve the values of a field from a given array. This method is used with the method SYS_GetTableMultiDataToArray_S.

Parameter:

  • fieldName: This is the field.

[
EXAMPLE]{.underline}:

SYS_GetMultiFldValueFromArray(“LC_AMT”)

SYS_GetMultiValueRefreshOptions(sTableName,sSQLWhere,sFieldList,sMappingList,sSucJsFuncName,sFailJsFuncName,notShowErr)

This is used to refresh the values of a Select-type field (dropdown list) based on a given condition. This can invoke a call-back function.

Parameters:

  • sTableName: This is the table to be used for inquiring the Select-type field.

  • sSQLWhere: This is the condition for inquiring on the Select-type field.

  • sFieldList: This is the list of Select-type fields.

  • sMappingList: This is the key field to be used for inquiring on the table indicated in the sTableName parameter.

  • sSucJsFuncName: This is the function to be run if the operation is successful.

  • sFailJsFuncName: This is the function to be run if the operation fails.

  • notShowErr: This indicates whether or not an error message is to be shown if the operation fails. This may have a true or false value. If the value is true, the system displays an error message. Otherwise, no error is prompted.

SYS_GetMultiValueRefreshOptions_S(sTableName,sSQLWhere,sFieldList,sMappingList)

This is used to refresh the values of a Select-type field (dropdown list) based on a given condition.

Parameters:

  • sTableName: This is the table to be used for inquiring the Select-type field.

  • sSQLWhere: This is the condition for inquiring on the Select-type field.

  • sFieldList: This is the list of Select-type fields.
  • sMappingList: This is the key field to be used for inquiring on the table indicated in the sTableName parameter.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

document.MAINFORM.C_MAIN_REF.value=document.MAINFORM.FA_TEMP3.value;

var sSQLWhere="FA_SEL_ID='"+document.MAINFORM.FA_SEL_ID.value+"'";

var sFieldList="DISTINCT(FA_IF_ID) AS FA_IF_ID";

var sMappingList="FA_IF_ID";

SYS_GetMultiValueRefreshOptions_S("FADA_SEL_INFO",sSQLWhere,sFieldList,sMappingList);

SYS_GetRecvCHG(strSqlWhere,strCcy)

This is currently not used.

SYS_GetRefNo(sRefName,sFuncName,sFuncNameSec,sRefType,ignoreAutoDisabling,refField,isBusinessNo)

This function is used for getting the reference number. The returned value is sent to the function indicated in the sFuncName parameter.

The parameters are:

  • sRefName: This is the name of the reference number rule defined in the Standing Data module.

  • sFuncName: This is the function that is to receive the reference number.

  • sFuncNameSec: This is the secondary name of the function. This is an optional parameter.

  • sRefType: This is the reference number type. If there is more than one reference number in the transaction, these numbers must have different types. This is an optional parameter.

  • ignoreAutoDisabling: This filters the function types that are to get the reference number. This may have a T or F value.

  • refField: This is the field that is to receive the reference number.

  • IsBusinessNo: This indicates whether or not a business reference number is to be generated in the EC function. The value may be set to True or False, or left blank. The default value is False or blank.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

SYS_GetRefNo('EXCO','SYF_EXCO_C_MAIN_REF','SYF_EXCO_GET_REF_20');

SYS_GetRefNo_S(sRefName,sFuncName,sFuncNameSec,sRefType,ignoreAutoDisabling,refField)

This method is similar to the SYS_GetRefNo() method and is also used for getting the reference number. However, this method is executed on Synchronized mode.

Parameters:

  • sRefName: This is the name of the reference number rule defined in the Standing Data module.

  • sFuncName: This is the function that is to receive the reference number.

  • sFuncNameSec: This is the secondary name of the function. This is an optional parameter.

  • sRefType: This is the reference number type. If there is more than one reference number in the transaction, these numbers must have different types. This is an optional parameter.

  • ignoreAutoDisabling: This filters the function types that are to get the reference number. This may have a T or F value.

  • refField: This is the field that is to receive the reference number.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

SYS_GetRefNo_S('DF_MAIN_REF','SYF_FAEF_setMainRef');

SYS_GetSubDays(sfFirstDayName,sfSecondDayName,sfCntyCodeName,sfSubCntyCodeName,isGetWorkDay,strJsFuncName)

This function determines the number of days between two specified dates. This uses millisecond difference between two dates as its parameter, and returns a Float type value. The sfFirstDayName and sfSecondDayNam parameters represent the number of milliseconds in Coordinated Universal Time. Either parameter may not have a null value. The parameters are:

  • sfFirstDayName**: This is the first date.**

  • sfSecondDayName**: This is the second date.**

  • sfCntyCodeName**: This is the country code.**

  • sfSubCntyCodeName**: This is the sub-country code.**

  • isGetWorkDay**:** This flag setting indicates whether or not to include the working days in the calculation.

  • strJsFuncName**:** This is the function that is run if the operation is successful.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var days = SYS_GetSubDays(document.MAINFORM.LTST_SHIP_DT.name,document.MAINFORM.EXPIRY_DT.name);

SYS_GetSubPageRefNo(sRefName,fSuccessCallback,fFailureCallback,refTypeSuffix,refFieldSuffix)

This method is used to retrieve the second-level reference number on the one-to-many sub-page.

Parameters:

  • sRefName: This is the reference name.

  • fSuccessCallback: This is the function that is called after a successful operation.

  • fFailureCallback: This is the function that is called if the operation fails.

  • refTypeSuffix: This is the suffix of the reference type.

  • refFieldSuffix: This is the suffix of the field that is to be populated with the reference number.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

SYS_GetSubPageRefNo('FAEF_INV_REF',setInvRef,'','InvRef');

SYS_GetSubPageRefNo_S(sRefName,fSuccessCallback,fFailureCallback,refTypeSuffix,refFieldSuffix)

This functions like the SYS_GetSubPageRefNo() method but this is executed on Synchronized Mode.

SYS_GetSwiftBicCode(sJspFieldName)

This function is used to retrieve the corresponding BIC of a field value on the transaction screen.

Parameter:

  • sJspFieldName: This is the JSP field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

<input size="20" class="CHAR_M" title="Bank ID" type="text" name="BANK_ID" maxlength="12" onBlur="SYS_GetSwiftBicCode('BANK_ADD')">

SYS_GetSystemTime_String()

This function gets the system time and converts it to the accepted time string format. If the system time value is 7:15:35 PM, this function converts the value to 19:15:35.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var S_TIME = SYS_GetSystemTime_String();

SYS_GetSystemVariable(variableName)

This method is used to get the value of the system variable.

Parameter:

  • variableName: This is the variable.

SYS_GetTableData(sTableName,sSQLWhere,sFieldList,sMappingList,sSucJsFuncName, sFailJsFuncName,notshowError)

The function is used to retrieve field values from a table and populate these into the fields of the transaction screen. This can invoke a call-back function.

Parameters:

  • sTableName: This is the table that is to be inquired on.

  • sSQLWhere: This is the condition for inquring on the table.

  • sFieldList: This is the fields in the transaction screen.

  • sMappingList: This is the table fields that are to be mapped to the fields in the transaction screen.

  • sSucJsFuncName: This is the function to be run if the operation is successful.

  • sFailJsFuncName: This is the function to be run if the operation fails.

  • notShowError: This indicates whether or not an error message is to be shown if the operation fails. This may have a true or false value. If the value is false, the system displays an error message. Otherwise, no error is prompted. (As an alternative to defining this parameter for every instance of the method, the SYS_HIDE_ERROR_ON_NO_DATA system JS variable can be used.  When set to true, the warning message is hidden; otherwise, the warning message is shown.)

**[EXAMPLE:]{.underline} **

SYS_GetTableData("IMCL_BILL_BILL","C_MAIN_REF='"+document.MAINFORM.C_MAIN_REF.value+"' AND I_EVENT_TIMES=1","RCV_IC_DRAWEE;CHG_CCY","TEMP_AMT6;TEMP_CHAR1")

SYS_GetTableDataByRule(ruleName,conditionSeq,sSucJsFuncName,sFailJsFuncName,notshowError,isMulti)

The function is used to retrieve field values from a table based on a defined condition and populate these into the fields of the transaction screen.

Parameters:

  • ruleName: The Get Data rule name.

  • conditionSeq: This is the number of the condition used.

  • sSucJsFuncName: This is the function to be run if the operation is successful.

  • sFailJsFuncName: This is the function to be run if the operation fails.

  • notShowError: This indicates whether or not an error message is to be shown if the operation fails. This may have a true or false value. If the value is false, the system displays an error message. Otherwise, no error is prompted.

  • isMulti: This indicates whether only the first record or all records are retrieved from the defined table. This may have a true or false value. If the value is true, the system retrieved all records. Otherwise, only the first record is retrieved..

SYS_GetTableDataByRule_S(ruleName,conditionSeq,notshowErr,isMulti)

This functions like the SYS_GetTableDataByRule() method but this is executed on Synchronized Mode.

SYS_GetTableDataSpcial_Boc(stablename,sKey,sfield,sclause)

This is currently not used.

SYS_GetTableData_Boc(stablename,sKey,tfieldlist,pfieldlist)

This is currently not used.

SYS_GetTableData_FEE(stablename,sKey,tfieldlist,pfieldlist)

This is currently not used.

SYS_GetTableData_S(sTableName,sSQLWhere,sFieldList,sMappingList,notshowError)

The function is used to retrieve field values from a table and populate these into the fields of the transaction screen.

Parameters:

  • sTableName: This is the table that is to be inquired on.

  • sSQLWhere: This is the condition for inquring on the table.

  • sFieldList: This is the fields in the transaction screen.

  • sMappingList: This is the table fields that are to be mapped to the fields in the transaction screen.

  • notShowError: This indicates whether or not an error message is to be shown if the operation fails. This may have a true or false value. If the value is false, the system displays an error message. Otherwise, no error is prompted. (As an alternative to defining this parameter for every instance of the method, the SYS_HIDE_ERROR_ON_NO_DATA system JS variable can be used.  When set to true, the warning message is hidden; otherwise, the warning message is shown.)

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

function GetTableData_S(){

var sql = "CUST_ID="+"'" + document.MAINFORM.APPL_ID.value + "'";

SYS_GetTableData_S('CUST_MASTER',sql,'CUST_NM_C','NOTE_S');

}

SYS_GetTableData_SvrSql(sRuleName,sSQLFieldList,sFieldList,sSucJsFuncName,sFailJsFuncName,notshowError,isMulti)

This function is used for retrieving data from tables through an SQL condition.

Parameters:

  • sRuleName: This is the Get Data rule name.

  • sSQLFieldList: This is the list of fields in the SQL condition from which the data is to be retrieved.

  • sFieldList: This is the fields which values are to be retrieved and populated into an array.

  • sSucJsFuncName: This is the function to be run if the operation is successful.

  • sFailJsFuncName: This is the function to be run if the operation fails.

  • notShowError: This indicates whether or not an error message is to be shown if the operation fails. This may have a true or false value. If the value is false, the system displays an error message. Otherwise, no error is prompted.

  • isMulti: This indicates whether only the first record or all records are retrieved from the defined table. This may have a true or false value. If the value is true, the system retrieved all records. Otherwise, only the first record is retrieved.

SYS_GetTableData_SvrSql_S(sRuleName,sSQLFieldList,sFieldList,sMappingList,notshowErr,isMulti)

This functions like the SYS_GetTableData_SvrSql() method but this is executed on Synchronized Mode.

SYS_GetTableMultiDataToArray(sTableName,sSQLWhere,sFieldList,sSucJsFuncName,sFailJsFuncName,notShowErr)

This is used to retrieve table data based on a given condition and store the values in another array. This can invoke a call-back function.

Parameters:

  • sTableName: This is the table that is to be inquired on.

  • sSQLWhere: This is the condition for inquring on the table.

  • sFieldList: This is the fields which values are to be retrieved and populated into an array.

  • sSucJsFuncName: This is the function to be run if the operation is successful.

  • sFailJsFuncName: This is the function to be run if the operation fails.

  • notShowErr: This indicates whether or not an error message is to be shown if the operation fails. This may have a true or false value. If the value is false, the system displays an error message. Otherwise, no error is prompted.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

function GetMultiData_1(){

alert(" Test SYS_GetTableMultiDataToArray.");

var sSQL="C_CNTY_CODE like '" + "%'";

SYS_GetTableMultiDataToArray("STD_COUNTRY",sSQL,'C_CNTY_NAME;C_LOCAL_CCY','getValue'); }

function getValue(){

alert("Run getValue function, Array back.");

var valueArray1 = SYS_GetMultiFldValueFromArray("C_CNTY_NAME");

var valueArray11 = SYS_GetMultiFldValueFromArray("C_LOCAL_CCY");

SYS_RefreshOptions("SELECT_1",valueArray1);

SYS_RefreshOptions("SELECT_11",valueArray11);

}

SYS_GetTableMultiDataToArray_S(sTableName,sSQLWhere,sFieldList,notShowErr)

This is used to retrieve table data based on a given condition and store the values in another array.

Parameters:

  • sTableName: This is the table that is to be inquired on.

  • sSQLWhere: This is the condition for inquring on the table.

  • sFieldList: This is the fields which values are to be retrieved and populated into an array.

  • notShowErr: This indicates whether or not an error message is to be shown if the operation fails. This may have a true or false value. If the value is false, the system displays an error message. Otherwise, no error is prompted.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

function GetMultiData_1_S(){

var sSQL="C_CNTY_CODE like '" + "%'";

SYS_GetTableMultiDataToArray_S("STD_COUNTRY",sSQL,'C_CNTY_NAME;C_LOCAL_CCY');

var valueArray1 = SYS_GetMultiFldValueFromArray("C_CNTY_NAME");

var valueArray11 = SYS_GetMultiFldValueFromArray("C_LOCAL_CCY");

SYS_RefreshOptions("SELECT_3",valueArray1);

SYS_RefreshOptions("SELECT_33",valueArray11);

}

SYS_GetUUID(sField, sPrefix, sSucJsFuncName, sFailJsFuncName)

This is used to retrieve and display the serial number (UUID).

Parameters:

  • sField: This is the field that retrieves the serial number.

  • sPrefix: This is the prefix of the serial number.

  • sSucJsFuncName**: This is the function that is called if the serial number is successfully retrieved.**

  • sFailJsFuncName**: This is the function that is called if the serial number is not retrieved.**

SYS_GetUUID_S(sField, sPrefix)

This functions like the SYS_GetUUID() method but this is executed on Synchronized Mode.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if(document.MAINFORM.FA_BA_FLG.value=='1'){

document.MAINFORM.BA_UNIT_CODE.value=SYS_BUSI_UNIT;

if(statementShow=='N'){

SYS_GetUUID_S(document.MAINFORM.FA_BA_LINK.name,statementShow);

}else{

SYS_GetUUID_S(document.MAINFORM.FA_BA_LINK.name);

}

SYS_inqAPAR(sfCustIDName,sAparFlag,sfCcyName,sfAmountName,sSql)

This must be used with the SYS_InqAPAR_Refuse() method. This is used to inquire into the APAR list.

SYS_InqCUBK(sCUBKMappingName,sfKeyFldName,sCUBKType,sCUBKRule)

This function is used for inquiring on tables through a Get CUBK rule. The inquiry can also be made when the partial or whole value of the rule’s key field is specified.

Parameters:

  • sCUBKMappingName: This is the Get CUBK mapping rule name.

  • sfKeyFldName: This is the key field name of the Get CUBK rule.

  • sCUBKType: This is the GetCUBK type (e.g., “GAPI”, “LMTS”).

  • sCUBKRule: This is the field name.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

input type="button" name="APPL" value="..." style="width:25; height:20" onClick="javascript:SYS_InqCUBK('APPL_ID')">

SYS_InqCUBK_ServerSql(sCUBKMappingName, arrayValues, sNotNeedBU,sfKeyFldName)

This function is used for inquiring on tables through a Get CUBK rule and an added SQL condition.

Parameters:

  • sCUBKMappingName**:** This is the Get CUBK mapping rule name.

  • arrayValues: This is the fields that contain the values to be mapped to the server.

  • sNotNeedBU: This indicates whether specifying a business unit is optional or not required. This may have a Y or N value. If the value is Y, a business unit is not required. Otherwise, a business unit must be specified.

  • sfKeyFldName**:** This is the key field name of the Get CUBK rule.

SYS_InqCUBK_Sql(sCUBKMappingName, sWhereSql, sNotNeedBU,sfKeyFldName)

This function is used for inquiring on tables through a Get CUBK rule and an added SQL condition.

Parameters:

  • sCUBKMappingName**:** This is the Get CUBK mapping rule name.

  • sWhereSql: This is the condition for inquiring on the Customer and Bank tables.

  • sNotNeedBU: This indicates whether specifying a business unit is optional or not required. This may have a Y or N value. If the value is Y, a business unit is not required. Otherwise, a business unit must be specified.

  • sfKeyFldName**:** This is the key field name of the Get CUBK rule.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

<input type="button" name="FWCNO" value="..." style="width:25; height:20" onClick="javascript:SYS_InqCUBK_Sql('FWC_NO','CU_ID=\'<--APPL_ID-->\' AND CON_CCY=\'<--LC_CCY-->\'AND CON_STATUS=\'<--FW_ON_STATUS-->\'AND (FW_TYPE=\'<--FW_TYPE1-->\'OR FW_TYPE=\'<--FW_TYPE2-->\') AND C_TRX_STATUS=\'<--FW_TRX_STATUS-->\'')">

SYS_InqCUBK_byCondition(sCUBKMappingName, conditionName)

This function is used for inquiring on tables through a Get CUBK rule and an added SQL condition without requiring to call on a SYS_GetCUBK() method to map defined field values.

Parameters:

  • sCUBKMappingName**:** This is the Get CUBK mapping rule name which contains the SQL condition.

  • conditionName: This is the number of the SQL condition to be used as defined in the Get CUBK rule. If a value is not set, the system uses the first condition.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: When using this method, the following conditions are automatically added depending on the settings of the relevant Get CUBK rule.

i. If the table type is set to Customer or Bank, the condition C_TRX_STATUS= ‘M’ is automatically added in the method.

ii. If the Business Unit option is marked, the condition C_UNIT_CODE= SYS_BUSI_UNIT is automatically added in the method.

{width="3.546512467191601in” height="2.7511209536307963in”}

SYS_InqGapi(sGapiInterfaceName,sJSFuncName)

The function is used to get the GAPI interface that is named as sGapiInterfaceName and is defined in the EE Utility. This can invoke a call-back function.

Parameters:

  • sGapiInterfaceName: This is the GAPI interface name.

  • sJSFuncName: This is the transaction function that uses the GAPI.

This returns a GAPI value.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

SYS_InqGapi ("getGapi")

SYS_InqGapi_S(sGapiInterfaceName)

This functions like the SYS_InqGapi() but this is executed on Synchronized Mode.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

function testInqGAPI_S(){

SYS_InqGapi_S("CE_InqGAPI");

alert("test SYS_InqGapi_S result: " + document.MAINFORM.ADV_BK_NM_ADD.name + "=" + document.MAINFORM.ADV_BK_NM_ADD.value);

}

SYS_InqMaster(ModuleName , FunctionName , SQLWhere)

This method is used for inquiring into the master table. This is similar to the Inquire Master function.

Parameters:

  • ModuleName: This is the module.

  • FunctionName: This is the function.

  • SQLWhere: This is the condition for inquiring on the master table.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

function testInqMaster(){

var cond="C_MAIN_REF='QA4000507059112'";

SYS_InqMaster('QAQA','QA_IM',cond); }

SYS_InsertClause(sfInsertClauseIntoFieldName)

This function is used to display and insert a clause setting by way of a separate clause window.

Parameter:

  • sfInsertClauseIntoFieldName: This is the clause field that is defined in the Clause Maintenance function of the Standing Data module.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

<textarea rows="5" cols="65" title="Documents Required" class="CHAR_M" name="DOC_RQUR"></textarea><input type="button" name="Button" value="Insert Clause" onClick="return SYS_InsertClause('DOC_RQUR')">

SYS_InsertClauseDirect(sfInsertClauseIntoFieldName, sClauseName, strSendType, strJSFuncName,strClauseType)

This function is used to display and insert a clause setting directly, without requiring a separate clause window. In this case, the clause is inserted directly into the field.

Parameters:

  • sfInsertClauseIntoFieldName: This is the clause field that is defined in the Clause Maintenance function of the Standing Data module.

  • sClauseName: This is the clause name that is defined in the Clause Maintenance function of the Standing Data module.

  • strSendType: This is the send type which value may either be A or U.

  • strJSFuncName: This is the JS function that is run if the upload process is successful.

  • strClauseType: This is the type of clause defined in the Clause function in EE Utility. This may have a SYST, to retrieve the system clause content, or STD, to get the standing clause content.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

function InitialValues(){SYS_InsertClauseDirect('DOC_RQUR','CIF Document');

SYS_InsertClauseDirect('DOC_RQUR','FCA Document');

SYS_InsertClauseDirect('DOC_RQUR','FOB Document');

}

SYS_RebuildOptions(fldName,valueArray,descArray)

This is used to refresh the values of a Select-type field from a given array.

Parameters:

  • fldName: This is the field.

  • valueArray: This is run if the operation process is successful.

  • descArray: : This is run if the operation process fails.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var str=SYS_getCurrNodeParentValue('FincRepaymentHeader','CFNC_C_REF_TEMP');

var Arrayvalue = str.split(';')

SYS_RebuildOptions('CFNC_C_REF',Arrayvalue);

SYS_RefreshOptions(fldName,valueArray)

This is used to refresh the values of a Select-type field.

Parameters:

  • fldName: This is the field.

  • valueArray: This is the JS function that is run if the upload process is successful.

  • descArray: This is the JS function that is run if the upload process fails.

SYS_SayTotal(sFuncName, sAmt, sCcy, sLanguage, sType)

This is the asynchronous method used for converting an amount into a narrative form.

Parameters:

  • sFuncName: This is the transaction function that is to receive the converted narrative amount.

  • sAmt: This is the amount to be converted into narrative form

  • sCcy: This is the currency to be used in converting the amount into narrative form.

  • sLanguage: This is the language to be used for the converted narrative amount.

  • sType: This is the expression type that serves as the format of the narrative field. If this is not defined, this defaults to the expression type defined in the saytotal_ccy.xml; this may also depend on the assigned country code.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

  • Method Name: SYF_IPLC_GetSayTotal(sAmtDec)
    ADD_AMT_COVRD.value = sAmtDec;

  • Method Name: SYF_IPLC_ConfirmBusinessCall()
    var sLanguage = SYS_BANK_COUNTRY;
    SYS_SayTotal_S(GetSayTotal, LC_AMT.value,LC_CCY.value,sLanguage);

SYS_SayTotal_S(sFuncName, sAmt, sCcy, sLanguage, sType)

This is the synchronous method used for converting an amount into a narrative form.

Parameters:

  • sFuncName: This is the transaction function that is to receive the converted narrative amount.

  • sAmt: This is the amount to be converted into narrative form. This parameter is mandatory.

  • sCCY: This is the currency to be used in converting the amount into narrative form. This parameter is mandatory.

  • sLanguage: This is the language to be used for the converted narrative amount. This parameter is optional.

  • sType: This is the expression type that serves as the format of the narrative field. If this is not defined, this defaults to the expression type defined in the saytotal_ccy.xml; this may also depend on the assigned country code. This parameter is optional.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

  • Method Name: SYF_IPLC_GetSayTotal(sAmtDec)

ADD_AMT_COVRD.value = sAmtDec;

  • Method Name: SYF_IPLC_ConfirmBusinessCall()

var sLanguage = SYS_BANK_COUNTRY;

SYS_SayTotal_S(GetSayTotal, LC_AMT.value,LC_CCY.value,sLanguage);

SYS_SetSelectValue(selectFieldName,objItemValue)

This method is used to set a value manually specified in a dropdown field as a selected value. If the value does not exist in the dropdown list options, the system adds it as a new option.

Parameters:

  • selectFieldName: The name of the dropdown field.

  • objItemValue: The value manually specified.

SYS_SyncGetRefNo(refName,refTypeSuffix)

This method is used to synchronously retrieve and return the reference number.

Parameters:

  • refName: This is the reference number rule defined in the Standing Data module.

  • refTypeSuffix: This is the reference number suffix defined in the Standing Data module.

SYS_ThrowError(code,para)

This method is used when a process or validation is unsuccessful. The system calls the error code and terminates the processing immediately.

Parameters:

  • code: This is the error code.

  • para: This is the array that contains the parameters that are used in the error code.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var maxL=objPsw.maxLength;

if(maxL==null||maxL=="")

maxL=8;

if(objPsw.value.length!=maxL){

SYS_ThrowError_S("4234",maxL);

return false;

}

SYS_ThrowError_S(code,para)

This method is used when a process or validation is unsuccessful. The system calls the error code and terminates the processing immediately.

Parameters:

  • code: This is the error code.

  • para: This is the array that contains the parameters that are used in the error code.

SYS_UpLoadFile(sCUBKMappingName,sSucJsFuncName,sFailJsFuncName)

This function is used to upload a file to a transaction screen.

Parameters:

  • sCUBKMappingName: This is the getCUBK mapping rule name.

  • sSucJsFuncName: This is the JS function that is run if the upload process is successful.

  • sFailJsFuncName: This is the JS function that is run if the upload process fails.

SYS_Upload_Image(param, mainRefKeyField)

This function is used to upload an Image to a transaction screen.

Parameters:

  • param: This is the name of the JSP field.

  • mainRefKeyField: This is the reference number of the transaction.

SYS_ViewIncomingEDIMsg(sFieldName, sType)

This method is used for viewing the incoming EDI message.

Parameters:

  • sFieldName: This is the field which value is to be inquired.

  • sType: This is the message type. The default value is “STP”.

SYS_ViewIncomingMsg(sFieldName, sType)

This function is used for viewing an incoming message.

The parameters are:

  • sFieldName: This is the field which value is to be retrieved.

  • sType: This is the message type. The possible values are “STP” and “REF”.

SYS_View_Image(mainRefKeyField,byBU)

This function is used to view the uploaded image on the transaction screen.

Parameters:

  • mainRefKeyField: This is the reference to the transaction. Single or multiple key fields, or multiple values in a key field, can be defined. Multiple key fields or multiple values must be separated by semicolons. If there is no defined mainRefKeyField field or value, the system uses the C_MAIN_REF value of the transaction to perform the query.

  • byBU: This is used to indicate whether or not the image record is searched by business unit. The values of this parameter may either be TRUE or FALSE. The default value is TRUE.

SYS_calExchAmt(sFromCCYValue,sToCCYValue,sAmtValue,sRateTypeValue,sFieldNameOrVarName,sJsFuncName)

This method is used to get the converted amount after retrieving the rate through the SYS_GetExchangeRate()method.

Parameters:

  • sFromCCYValue: This is the From Currency value.

  • sToCCYValue: This is the To Currency value.

  • sAmtValue: This is the amount that is to be converted to another currency.

  • sRateTypeValue: This is the rate type value.

  • sFieldNameOrVarName: This is the field or variable that receives the converted amount.

  • sJsFuncName: This is the function that receives and uses the resulting converted amount.

SYS_changeGridRowsByXpath(xPath,rows,needSave,initValue,append)

This method is used to change the number of grid rows according to the given xPath. All previous record values are deleted. The parameters are:

  • xPath: This is the xPath of the data object.

  • rows: This is the number of rows to be shown in the data object.

  • needSave: This is used for tree DO.

  • initValue: This is used for initializing the data object record.

  • append: This is used to specify whether or not existing data object records are deleted once a new data object record is added. If this parameter is set to true, new data object records are appended and existing data object records are not deleted. Otherwise, if set to false, existing data object records are deleted once a new data object record is added. The default value is false.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

  • var initValue =

    {fieldname1:["value1","value2","value3"],fieldname2:["value1","value2","value3"]};

  • var addDolen = 3 - ccyno;

if (hasAdd && len < 6) {

if (addDolen = 3) {

var iniValue = {

BK_NOSTRO_FLG: ["Nostro","Vostro"],

BK NOSTRO_CCY: [BK_NOSTRO_CCY, BK_NOSTRO_CCY,]

};

SYS_changeGridRowsByXpath('DO_BANK_2',2,null,inivalue,true);

} else if (addDolen = 2 || addDolen = 1) {

var iniValue = {

BK_NOSTRO_FLG: ["Nostro"],

BK_NOSTRO_CCY: [BK_NOSTRO_CCY]

};

SYS_changeGridRowsByXpath('DO_BANK_2',1,null,inivalue,true);

}

SYS_checkFieldNegative(obj)

This is used to check whether a field is negative or positive.

SYS_getCurrDoScreenValue(fieldName)

This method is used to get the current value of the DO field on the screen.

Parameter:

  • fieldName: This pertains to the DO field which value is to be retrieved.

SYS_getDataByDOComp(methodType,sSucJsFuncName,sFailJsFuncName)

This method is used to retrieve the DO data based on the component.

Parameters:

  • methodType: This is the component type.

  • sSucJsFuncName: This is the function to be called after a successful retrieval.

  • sFailJsFuncName: This is the function to be called if the retrieval fails.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

i. SYS_getDataByDOComp(document.MAINFORM.CFNC_C_RET_FLG.name);

ii. SYS_getDataByDOComp('CFNC_C_REF',setOrgBalancevalue);

SYS_getRecID(record)

This is used to retrieve the Id of the DO record.

Parameter:

  • node: This is the DO record which Id is to be retrieved.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var records=SYS_getRecords(targetDo);

var len=records.length;

var record;

var recordId;

var CPYT_C_PAY_PER=0;

var resultValue;

var datarecords=[];

for (var i=0;i<len;i++){

record=records[i];

recordId=SYS_getRecID(record);

CPYT_C_PAY_PER=SYS_BeFloat(record["CPYT_C_PAY_PER"]);

resultValue=(SYS_BeFloat(PRES_AMT)*CPYT_C_PAY_PER) / 100;

record = SYS_setValToRec(record,"CPYT_N_PAY_AMT", resultValue);

datarecords[i]=record;

}

SYS_getRecState(record)

This is used to get the status of a DO record (e.g., Add, Edit).

Parameter:

  • record: This is the Id of the DO record.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

for(var i=0,len=arrayvalue.length;i<len;i++)

{

var record = arrayvalue[i];

var id=SYS_getRecID(record);

var type = SYS_getRecState(record);

document.MAINFORM.FA_TEMP2.value=SYS_getValFromRec(record,'FA_DOC_REF');

SYS_InqGapi_S('Credit_Cover_InvInq');

var invLimitAmt=document.MAINFORM.FA_TEMP_AMT10.value;

document.MAINFORM.FA_TEMP_AMT10.value=0;

record=SYS_setValToRec(record,'FA_INV_LMT_APPRV',invLimitAmt);

mData.push(record);

}

SYS_getRecord(node,rowId)

This is used to retrieve a DO record based on the given node.

Parameters:

  • node: This is the name of the data object.

  • rowId: This is the Id of the DO record (row) to be retrieved.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if(SYS_DO_XPATH =="R2GoodsRe")

{

var Ship_node = parent.SYS_getNodeByXpath('R2GoodsRe.R2LineItemDetails7.R2ShipmntSchdl');

}

else{

var Ship_node = parent.SYS_getNodeByXpath('R2Goods.R2LineItemDetails7.R2ShipmntSchdl');

}

record=parent.SYS_getRecord(Ship_node,0);

if (record!=null)

{

var nRate =record.TSU_LATST_SHIP_DT;

if (nRate !=''){

document.MAINFORM.TSU_LATST_SHIP_DT.className='DATE_P';

}else {

document.MAINFORM.TSU_LATST_SHIP_DT.className='DATE_O';

}

SYS_getRecords(node)

This method is used to retrieve all the records of a data object.

Parameter:

  • node: This is the name of the data object. This can be an xPath.

This returns an array of records.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var node = SYS_getDoByXpath("InvFinance");

var arrayvalue= SYS_getRecords(node);

var mData=[];

for(var i=0,len=arrayvalue.length;i<len;i++)

{

var record = arrayvalue[i];

var id=SYS_getRecID(record);

var type = SYS_getRecState(record);

document.MAINFORM.FA_TEMP2.value=SYS_getValFromRec(record,'FA_DOC_REF');

SYS_InqGapi_S('Credit_Cover_InvInq');

var invLimitAmt=document.MAINFORM.FA_TEMP_AMT10.value;

document.MAINFORM.FA_TEMP_AMT10.value=0;

record=SYS_setValToRec(record,'FA_INV_LMT_APPRV',invLimitAmt);

mData.push(record);

}

SYS_getScreenObjByxpath(xpath,fldName)

This method is used to the retrieve the field (object) of the current DO by xPath.

Parameters:

  • xPath: This is the xPath of the data object.

  • fildName: This is the DO field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var CrdNum_obj = SYS_getScreenObjByxpath('PaymentDealer.PaymentCreditHeader','CPYT_NO_CR');

if(status == 'A'){

CrdNum_obj.value = SYS_getcurrRecordCount();

SYS_getValFromRec(record,fldname)

This method is used to get the value of a field from a DO record.

Parameters:

  • record: This is the name of the data object.

  • fldname: This is the DO field.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

for(var i=0,len=arrayvalue.length;i<len;i++){

var record = arrayvalue[i];

var recID= SYS_getRecID(record);

if(id==recID)continue;

var invNo = SYS_getValFromRec(record,'FA_DOC_NO');

if(invNo==invNoFromSCR){

alert("Invoice No ["+invNo+"] cannot be duplicated!");

return false;

}

SYS_getValueFromMain(fieldName)

This method is used to get the field value on the main page.

Parameter:

  • fieldName: This is the name of the JSP field.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

i. document.MAINFORM.TSU_SELLER_NAME.value = parent.SYS_getValueFromMain('TSU_SELLER_NAME');

ii. var availby=SYS_getValueFromMain('AVAL_BY');

if(availby=='BY MIXED PYMT'){

//SYS_setValueToMain('MIX_PMT_DETL', mixpay);

}

else if (availby=='BY DEF PAYMENT'){

SYS_setValueToMain('DEF_PMT_DET', mixpay);

SYS_getcurrRecordCount(xpath)

This is used to get the total number of records of the current DO.

Parameter:

  • xpath: This is the xPath of the data object.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

i. num=SYS_getcurrRecordCount("Settle.Settle_loan");

ii. var num= SYS_getcurrRecordCount("InvTRF"); //grid.getRowCount();

SYS_setValueToMain("FA_TTL_INV_NO",num);

SYS_highTrxButton(buttonNames)

This is used to specify the EE transaction buttons that are to be enabled in the transaction screen.

Parameter:

  • buttonNames: This is the names of the buttons to be enabled.

SYS_insertRecordToCurrentDO(record)

This is used to insert a record to the current data object.

Parameter:

  • record: This is the record to be inserted to the current DO.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

SYS_insertRecordToCurrentDO(‘abcd’)

SYS_insertRecordsToCurrentDO(records)

This is used to insert multiple records to the current data object.

Parameter:

  • records: These are the records to be inserted to the current DO.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

if(records!=""&&parent.DoFrame.tree.getPropertyValue(rNode, attrName)==undefined){

parent.DoFrame.tree.setPropertyValue(rNode, attrName,1);

SYS_insertRecordsToCurrentDO(records);

SYS_reLoadGrid(_do,records,needReload)

This is used to refresh the values of the DO records in the grid, usually after calling the SYS_setValToRec() method.

Parameters:

  • _do: This is the name of the data object.

  • records: These are the DO records to be refreshed.

  • needReload: This is used to refresh the values of the records in the DO grid.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var node = SYS_getDoByXpath("AdivceForBankCust");

var arrayvalue = SYS_getRecords(node);

var mData =[];

for(var i=0,len=arrayvalue.length;i<len;i++){

var record = arrayvalue[i];

record = SYS_setValToRec(record,'BANK_N90_REF_20',document.MAINFORM.C_MAIN_REF.value);

mData[i] = record;

}

SYS_reLoadGrid(node,mData);

SYS_refreshChildDoValue(xPath,fieldname,value)

This is used to refresh the value of the DO records in the grid, usually after calling the SYS_setValToRec() method.

Parameters:

  • xPath: This is the xPath of the data object.

  • fieldname: This is the DO field.

  • value: This is the value of the Do field.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

i. SYS_refreshChildDoValue("CreNote",'FA_EF_HAN_CHG_PAMT',document.MAINFORM.FA_EF_HAN_CHG_PAMT.value);

ii. parent.SYS_refreshChildDoValue('R2InvolvedPartyInfo.BuyerBank',"TSU_BYRBK_ID",TSU_SUB_B_ID);

SYS_setBrotherDoDisabled(doName)

This is used to disable the current brother data object.

Parameter:

  • doName: This is the name of the brother data object.

SYS_setBrotherDoEnabled(doName)

This is used to enable the current brother data object.

Parameter:

  • doName: This is the name of the brother data object.

SYS_setChildDoDisabled(doName,recordID)

This is used to disable a record from the current data object.

Parameters:

  • doName: This is the name of the data object.
  • recordID: This is the Id of the DO record to be disabled.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

SYS_setChildDoDisabled("R2MltmdlTrnsprt",recordId);

SYS_setChildDoEnabled("R2IndvTrnsprt",recordId);

SYS_setChildDoEnabled(doName,recordID)

This is used to enable a record from the current data object.

Parameters:

  • doName: This is the name of the data object.
  • recordID: This is the Id of the DO record to be enabled.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

SYS_setChildDoDisabled("R2MltmdlTrnsprt",recordId);

SYS_setChildDoEnabled("R2IndvTrnsprt",recordId);

SYS_setChildDoOfRootDisabled(doName)

This is used to disable the child DO of a given data object.

Parameter:

  • doName: This is the name of the child DO.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var TSU_REJT_RSNTP = SYT_getFldValue("TSU_REJT_RSNTP");

if (TSU_REJT_RSNTP == "2"){

SYS_setChildDoOfRootEnabled("RjctdElmtMis");

SYT_hideObj("Global Rejection Reason");

document.MAINFORM.TSU_REJT_RSN2.className = "CHAR_P";

document.MAINFORM.TSU_REJT_RSN2.value="";

}

else if(TSU_REJT_RSNTP == "1"){

SYS_setChildDoOfRootDisabled("RjctdElmtMis");

SYT_DisObj("Global Rejection Reason");

document.MAINFORM.TSU_REJT_RSN2.className = "CHAR_M";

SYS_setChildDoOfRootEnabled(doName)

This is used to enable the child DO of a given data object.

Parameter:

  • doName: This is the name of the child DO.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var TSU_REJT_RSNTP = SYT_getFldValue("TSU_REJT_RSNTP");

if (TSU_REJT_RSNTP == "2"){

SYS_setChildDoOfRootEnabled("RjctdElmtMis");

SYT_hideObj("Global Rejection Reason");

document.MAINFORM.TSU_REJT_RSN2.className = "CHAR_P";

document.MAINFORM.TSU_REJT_RSN2.value="";

}

else if(TSU_REJT_RSNTP == "1"){

SYS_setChildDoOfRootDisabled("RjctdElmtMis");

SYT_DisObj("Global Rejection Reason");

document.MAINFORM.TSU_REJT_RSN2.className = "CHAR_M";

SYS_setCurrDoScreenValue(fieldName,fieldValue)

This method is used to set or assign the value of a field from a data object screen.

Parameters:

  • fieldName: This is the DO field which value is to be set.

  • value: This is the JSP value to be assigned to the DO field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

SYS_setCurrDoScreenValue(‘C_MAIN_REF’, ‘ABCD’)

SYS_setCurrNodeParentValue(doName,fieldName,value)

This method is used to set or assign the value of a field from a data object screen.

Parameters:

  • doName: This is the name of the data object.

  • fieldName: This is the DO field which value is to be set.

  • value: This is the JSP value to be assigned to the DO field.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

i. SYS_setCurrNodeParentValue('PaymentTermsHeader','CPYT_C_MIX_PAY_DETAIL',mixpay);

ii. SYS_setCurrNodeParentValue('R2Goods',"TSU_LINE_TTL_AMT",TSU_TTL_AMT_sum);

SYS_setCurrNodeParentValue('R2Goods',"TSU_TTL_NET_AMT",nSumTTLAmt);

SYS_RefreshGrid();

SYS_setFieldValue(node,rowid,fieldname,value)

This method is used to update or define the value of a field in a single DO record when the Save button is clicked (i.e., submit the data to the related DO).

Parameters:

  • node: This is the name of the data object.

  • rowid: This is the Id of the DO record.

  • fieldname: This is the field from the DO record which value is to be assigned.

  • value: This is the value to be assigned to the field in the DO record.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

var arrayvalue= SYS_getRecords(node);

for(var i=0,len=arrayvalue.length;i<len;i++){

var record = arrayvalue[i];

var id=SYS_getRecID(record);

var value1 = SYS_getValFromRec(record,'FA_EF_HAN_CHG_PAMT');

SYS_setFieldValue(node,id,"FA_EF_HAN_CHG_PAMT",value1 );

SYS_setGridDisabled(gridIndex)

This is used to disable a particular record from the DO grid. Parameter:

  • gridIndex: This is the row Id or record Id of the DO record to be disabled.

SYS_setGridEnabled(gridIndex)

This is used to enable a particular record from the DO grid. Parameter:

  • gridIndex: This is the row Id or record Id of the DO record to be enabled.

SYS_setValToRec(record,fldname,value)

This is used to assign the values of a DO record. This is often used together with the SYS_reLoadGrid() method.

Parameters:

  • record: This is the DO record.

  • fldname:This is the DO field which value is to be assigned.

  • value: This is the value to be assigned to the DO field.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

for(var i=0,len=arrayvalue.length;i<len;i++){

var record = arrayvalue[i];

record = SYS_setValToRec(record,'BANK_N90_REF_20',document.MAINFORM.C_MAIN_REF.value);

mData[i] = record; }

SYS_setValueToMain(fieldName,value)

This is used to assign the value of a field on the transaction page. Parameters:

  • fieldName: This is the JSP field which value is to be assigned.

  • value: This is the value to be assigned to the JSP field.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

i. SYS_setValueToMain('MIX_PMT_DETL', mixpay);

ii. var TSU_PO_ID=parent.SYS_getCurrDoScreenValue("TSU_PO_ID");

TSU_PO_ID="%"+TSU_PO_ID+"%";

parent.SYS_setValueToMain("TSU_PO_ID_TEMP",TSU_PO_ID.toLowerCase());

invokeCallBack(JsFuncName)

This is currently not used.

Charges and Commissions Methods and APIs

  • CHARGES AND COMMISSIONS METHODS AND\

    APIS

  • SERVER SIDE JS APIS

Charges and Commissions Methods and APIs

Charge APIs

The special types of APIs are as follows.

####### Charge Initialization and Event APIs

+———————————————————————–+ | Chg.reset(commCodeArr) | +=======================================================================+ | This JavaScript API is used to reset the charges. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | - commCodeArr: This pertains to the commission code that is to be | | reset, and is used for the Chg.Screen() API. This parameter is | | mandatory. | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | Chg.reset(['SWIFT','test']); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.init(trx2RuleType,rule2ChgType,rule2BalType,bal2ChgType,trx2Rul | | eCalcFunc,\ | | rule2ChgCalcFunc,rule2BalCalcFunc,bal2ChgCalcFunc) | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API is used to initialize the charges and commissions | | page. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameters: | | | | - trx2RuleType: This is the rate type for retrieving the exchange | | > rate to convert the calculation from the transaction currency | | > to the charges and commissions agreement currency. This | | > parameter is mandatory. | | | | - rule2ChgType: This is the rate type for retrieving the exchange | | > rate to convert the calculation from the charges and | | > commissions agreement currency to the customer’s paying | | > currency. This parameter is mandatory. | | | | - rule2BalType: This is the rate type for retrieving the exchange | | > rate to convert the calculation from the charges and | | > commissions agreement currency to the unpaid charge currency | | > (i.e., balance currency). This parameter is mandatory. | | | | - bal2ChgType: This is the rate type for retrieving the exchange | | > rate to convert the calculation from the unpaid charges | | > currency (balance currency) to the charges currency (customer’s | | > paying currency). This parameter is mandatory. | | | | - trx2RuleCalcFunc: This is the JS function of the rate for | | > retrieving the exchange rate to convert the calculation from | | > float transaction currency to charge currency. This parameter | | > is optional. | | | | - rule2ChgCalcFunc: This is the JS function of the rate for | | > retrieving the exchange rate to convert the calculation from | | > float charge currency to the customer’s paying currency. This | | > parameter is optional. | | | | - rule2BalCalcFunc: This is the JS function of the rate for | | > retrieving the exchange rate to convert the calculation from | | > float charge currency to balance currency. This parameter is | | > optional. | | | | - bal2ChgCalcFunc: This is the JS function of the rate for | | > retrieving the exchange rate to convert the calculation from | | > float charge currency to the customer’s paying currency. This | | > parameter is optional. | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | Chg.init('Booking Rate','Booking Rate','Booking Rate','Booking | | Rate'); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.attchEvent(callback) | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API is used to call back an event that has been | | triggered on the commissions page. However, this function does not | | allow the re-calculation of charges and certain methods as these | | would create an endless loop. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | - callback: The Callback function | | | | This parameter is mandatory. | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | Chg.attchEvent(chgCallback); | | | | function chgCallback(){ | | | | var totalAmt = Chg.Screen.getLocalTotalAmt(); | | | | document.getElementById(‘TOTAL_AMT’).value = totalAmt; | | | | } | +———————————————————————–+

#######

####### Local Customer Information and Charge Data

+———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getLocalCustId() | +=======================================================================+ | This JavaScript API returns the local customer’s ID. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var strLocalCustID = Chg.Screen.getLocalCustId(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.mapLocalCust(idField,nameField) | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API is used to inform the Charge component of the | | field names that are related to the local customer. The Charge | | component may retrieve this information from the given fields (or | | parameters in this API). | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameters: | | | | - idField: This refers to the Id of the local customer. This | | parameter is mandatory. | | | | - nameField: This refers to the name of the local customer. This | | parameter is mandatory. | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | Chg.Screen.mapLocalCust ("APPL_ID", "APPL_NM") | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getLocalCustName() | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API returns the local customer’s name. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var strLocalCustNm = Chg.Screen.getLocalCustName(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getLocalCustCcy() | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API returns currency used by the local customer (for | | payments). | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var strLocalCustCcy = Chg.Screen.getLocalCustCcy(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getLocalCustAcNo() | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API returns the account number of the local customer | | (for payments). | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var strLocalCustAcNo = Chg.Screen.getLocalCustAcNo(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getLocalCollectTotalAmt() | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API returns the total amount collected from the local | | customer, including the charge amount and the VAT amount. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var collectAmtLocal = Chg.Screen.getLocalCollectTotalAmt(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getLocalCollectChgTotalAmt() | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript returns the total amount of the bank charges | | collected from the local customers. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var collectChgAmtLocal = Chg.Screen.getLocalCollectChgTotalAmt(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getLocalCollectVatTotalAmt() | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript returns the total VAT amount collected from the local | | customer. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var collectVatAmtLocal = Chg.Screen.getLocalCollectVatTotalAmt(); | +———————————————————————–+

+———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getLocalPayTotalAmt() | +=======================================================================+ | This JavaScript API returns the total amount paid by the local | | customer, including the charge amount and VAT amount. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var payAmtLocal = Chg.Screen.getLocalPayTotalAmt(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getLocalPayChgTotalAmt() | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API returns the total amount of bank charges paid by | | the local customer | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var payAmtChgLocal = Chg.Screen.getLocalPayChgTotalAmt(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getLocalPayVatTotalAmt() | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API returns the total VAT amount paid by the local | | customer. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var payAmtVatLocal = Chg.Screen.getLocalPayVatTotalAmt(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getLocalBalTotalAmt(ccy) | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API returns the total balance amount of the local | | customer. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | - ccy: This refers to the currency of the local customer. This | | parameter is mandatory. | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var balAmtLocal = Chg.Screen.getLocalBalTotalAmt("USD"); | +———————————————————————–+

####### Foreign Customer Information and Charge Data APIs

+———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getForeignCustId() | +=======================================================================+ | This JavaScript API returns the foreign customer’s ID. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var strLocalForeignID = Chg.Screen.getForeignCustId(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.mapForeignCust(idField,nameField,ccyField,acNoField) | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API is used to inform the Charge component of the | | field names that are related to the foreign customer. The Charge | | component may retrieve this information from the given fields (or | | parameters in this API). | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameters: | | | | - idField: This refers to Id of the foreign bank. This parameter is | | mandatory. | | | | - nameField: This refers to the name of the foreign bank. This | | parameter is mandatory. | | | | - ccyField: This refers to the currency of the foreign customer. | | This parameter is optional. | | | | - acNoField: This refers to the account number of the foreign | | customer. This parameter is optional. | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | Chg.Screen.mapForeignCust(""BENE_ID","BENE_NM","LC_CCY","C | | _ACCOUNT_NO"); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getForeignCustName() | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript returns the foreign customer’s name. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var strForeignCustNm = Chg.Screen.getForeignCustName(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getNostroAcNo() | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API returns the account of the foreign customer (for | | payments). | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var strForeignCustAcNo = Chg.Screen.getForeignCustAcNo(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getForeignCollectTotalAmt() | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API returns the total amount collected from the | | foreign customer, including the charge amount and VAT amount. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var collectAmtForeign = Chg.Screen.getForeignCollectTotalAmt(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getForeignCollectChgTotalAmt() | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API returns the total amount of bank charges | | collected from the foreign customer. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var collectChgAmtForeign = Chg.Screen.getForeignCollectChgTotalAmt(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getForeignCollectVatTotalAmt() | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API returns the total VAT amount collected from the | | foreign customer. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var collectVatAmtForeign = Chg.Screen.getForeignCollectVatTotalAmt(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getForeignPayTotalAmt() | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API returns the total amount paid by the foreign | | customer, including the charge amount and VAT amount. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var payAmtForeign = Chg.Screen.getForeignPayTotalAmt(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getForeignPayChgTotalAmt | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API returns the total amount of bank charges paid by | | the foreign customer. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var payAmtChgForeign = Chg.Screen.getForeignPayChgTotalAmt(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getForeignPayVatTotalAmt() | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API returns the total VAT amount paid by the foreign | | customer. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var payAmtVatForeign = Chg.Screen.getForeignPayVatTotalAmt(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getForeignBalTotalAmt(ccy) | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API returns the charge balance of the foreign | | customer. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | - ccy: This parameter refers to the currency of the foreign | | customer. This parameter is mandatory. | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var balAmtForeign = Chg.Screen.getForeignBalTotalAmt("USD"); | +———————————————————————–+

#######

####### Currency and Exchange Rate APIs

+———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getTrxCcy() | +=======================================================================+ | This JavaScript API returns the transaction currency. Using This | | JavaScript API in the main transaction page is redundant; it is | | typically used in the Charge tab. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var strTrxCcy = Chg.Screen.getTrxCcy(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.mapTrxCcy(fieldName) | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API is used to inform the Charge component of the | | field name that stores the transaction currency. The Charge component | | may retrieve this information from the given field (or parameter in | | this API). | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | - fieldName: This refers to the transaction currency. This | | parameter is mandatory. | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | Chg.Screen.mapTrxCcy('LC_CCY'); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getBalCcy() | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API is used to return the charge balance currency | | from the transaction page. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var strBalCcy = Chg.Screen.getBalCcy(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getCollectCcy() | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API is used to return the bank collection currency. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var collectCcy = Chg.Screen.getCollectCcy(); | +———————————————————————–+ | Chg.Screen.getNostroCcy() | +———————————————————————–+ | This JavaScript API returns the paying currency of the foreign | | customer. | +———————————————————————–+ | Parameter: | | | | N/A | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | var foreignCustCcy = Chg.Screen.getNostroCcy();
