+———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - No: When set to this value or if the parameter is not added,the | | > value of the column IA_C_STATUS_FLAG is updated to F, | | > whether or not the second condition (total posted | | > interest-partial pay interest<=0) is satisfied. | | | | - Yes: When set to this value the value of the column | | > IA_C_STATUS_FLAG is updated to F, only if both of the | | > conditions are satisifed. |

+=======================================================================+ | IA_AMZ_REFUND_FLAG | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates whether or not interest is to be refunded in case the | | due date of an Amortization transaction is shortened or the loan | | amount is decreased, etc. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, for Yes (Default) | | | | - N, for No | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_AMZ_WAIVE_FLAG | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates whether or not the confirmation commission is to be | | waived. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, for Yes | | | | | | | | - N, for No (Default) | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_BACKVAL_COMBINE_FLAG | +———————————————————————–+ | This controls whether or not the system calculates the sum of reverse | | and normal voucher entries (indicated by an R and N Posted Code | | respectively) which value date are the same as or earlier than the | | Last Posted Date and the normal voucher entries, respectively. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, for Yes | | | | | | | | - N, for No (Default) | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_BATCH_COMMIT_TRXNO | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates how many records are to be committed every time the | | eLoan Pre Advice function is run. | | | | When an exception occurs on a record, the other records that belong | | to the same batch are executed only in the next transaction batch | | process. | +———————————————————————–+

+———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Number of transactions (Integer) | | | | - Default value: 50 |

+=======================================================================+ | IA_BATCH_DEFAULT_USER | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates if the Batch Default User is to be run under batch | | task/SOD/EOD. | +———————————————————————–+ | - Default value: LOANUSER | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_BATCH_ON_WEEKHOLIDAY | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates whether the running of eLOAN Batch interest accrual | | and eLOAN Batch Posting processes are to be based on the weekend and | | holiday setting defined in the Weekend/Holiday Maintenance function, | | or not. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, in which the running of the eLoan Batch Interest Accrual and | | > eLoan Batch Posting processes are to be based on the | | > weekend/holiday setting | | | | - N, in which the running of the eLoan Batch Interest Accrual and | | > eLoan Batch Posting processes are not based on the | | > weekend/holiday setting | +———————————————————————–+ | [NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | If the system parameters IA_BATCH_ON_WEEKHOLIDAY and | | IA_MONTH_END_FLAG are set to Y, the eLOAN system runs batch | | interest accrual and batch posting at the end of the month, if that | | day is included in certain weekend and holiday setting. | | | | If the system parameter IA_BATCH_ON_WEEKHOLIDAY is set to Y, and | | the IA_MONTH_END_FLAG system parameter is set to N, the eLOAN | | system runs batch interest accrual and batch posting on the day | | before the next working day, according to the weekend and holiday | | setting. | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_BATCH_RUNNING_MODE | +———————————————————————–+ | This controls the running mode of batch processes. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - 1, for Multi Thread | | | | - 0, for Single Thread (Default) | +———————————————————————–+

+———————————————————————–+ | IA_BATCH_THREAD_NO | +=======================================================================+ | This indicates the maximum thread number in a batch process, if the | | system parameter IA_BATCH_RUNNING_MODE is set to 1 (Multi Thread). | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Number of threads (Integer) | | | | - Default value: 3 | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_BATCH_TRXNO_BY_THREAD | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates the maximum number of transactions handled under one | | thread in a batch process. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Number of transactions (Integer). | | | | - Default value: 100 | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_BATCH_WAIT_MODE | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates whether or not the system is to wait for the end of | | the task. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - 1, for Yes (Default) | | | | - 0, for No | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_CALCULATION_METHOD | +———————————————————————–+ | Round Type When Pay Interest | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - D, for Round Down (Default) | | | | - R, for Round | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_ SYSTDATE_BUDATE | +———————————————————————–+ | This is used to specify the basis for the last date of the interest | | accrual and posting record to be generated. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - BUDATE, in which interest accrual and posting records are | | generated up to the day prior the current business unit start of | | day date. | | | | - The parameter is not added, or its value is not BUDATE, in which | | the interest accrual and posting records are generated up to the | | day prior the current server date. | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_DIR_POST_FLAG | +———————————————————————–+ | Direct Post I or F while Transaction (Reserve for future use) | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, for Yes (Default) | | | | - N, for No | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_ENDOFMONTH_ONHOLIDAY_FLAG | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates if the eLoan Batch Interest Accrual and eLoan Batch | | Posting processes are to be run by the eLOAN system until the end of | | the month or until the day before the next working day, based on the | | weekend/holiday setting. | +———————————————————————–+ | [NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | The usage of this system parameter is the same as setting the | | following parameters with these corresponding values: | | | | IA_BATCH_ON_WEEKHOLIDAY = ‘Y’ and; | | | | IA_MONTH_END = ‘Y/N’ | +———————————————————————–+ | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | The system parameter is set to Y, and November 30 is the last day of | | the month. When either the eLoan Batch Interest Accrual or eLoan | | Batch Posting is run on November 28, the interest is accrued, or the | | eLoan system computations are posted, for November 28, 29, and 30. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, in which the eLOAN system runs the Batch Interest Accrual and | | > eLoan Batch Posting processes until the end of a month, if that | | > day is included in certain weekend and holiday setting. | | | | - N, in which the eLOAN system runs the Batch Interest Accrual and | | > eLoan Batch Posting processes until the day before the next | | > working day, according to the weekend and holiday setting. | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_EXTEND_RATE_FLAG | +———————————————————————–+ | This controls whether or not the extension rate covers the Base Rate | | and Spread Rate after the extension rate. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, for Exchange Rate only | | | | - N, for Base Rate + Spread Rate + Extension Rate (Default) | +———————————————————————–+

+———————————————————————–+ | IA_FUNCID_INQACC_ACCRUAL | +=======================================================================+ | Function for Inquire Accrual Accrue Details | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - To be selected from the dropdown list | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_FUNCID_INQACC_EVENT | +———————————————————————–+ | Function for Inquire Accrual Event Details | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - To be selected from the dropdown list | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_FUNCID_INQACC_POSTING | +———————————————————————–+ | Function for Inquire Accrual Posting Details | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - To be selected from the dropdown list | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_FUNCID_INQACC_PREDIS | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates the Function to be used for inquiring eLOAN Accrual | | Premium/Discount Details. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - To be selected from the dropdown list | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_FUNCID_INQACC_SCHEDULE | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates the Function to be used for inquiring eLOAN Accrual | | Schedule Details | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - To be selected from the dropdown list | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_FUNCID_INQAMZ_EVENT | +———————————————————————–+ | Function for Inquire Amortization Event Details | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - To be selected from the dropdown list | +———————————————————————–+

+———————————————————————–+ | IA_FUNCID_INQAMZ_POSTING | +=======================================================================+ | Function for Inquire Amortization Posting Details | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - To be selected from the dropdown list | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_GET_EXCH_RATE_FLAG | +———————————————————————–+ | Get Exchange Rate | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - 0, for Get rate from Take Down event | | | | - 1, for Get real-time rate from exchange rate table | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_GL_INTF_BANK_NAME | +———————————————————————–+ | This is used to define the bank name. The system then calls the | | corresponding interface for this bank. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - [Bank Name] | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_MERGE_REF_WITH_ACTYPE | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates whether the mapping value of the IA_C_REF_NO field | | is to be combined with the Account Type setting as the final | | IA_C_REF_NO value, or not. | | | | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | If the mapping value of the IA_C_REF_NO field transferred from EE | | is IPLC000001, and the account type used in the transaction is D01, | | the final value of IA_C_REF_NO that is recorded in the eloan table | | is IPLC000001D01. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, in which the mapping value of the IA_C_REF_NO field is | | > combined with the account type setting to generate the final | | > IA_C_REF_NO value. | | | | - N, in which the mapping value of the IA_C_REF_NO field is also | | > the final IA_C_REF_NO value. | +———————————————————————–+

+———————————————————————–+ | IA_MONTH_END_FLAG | +=======================================================================+ | This system parameter is only used if the value of the system | | parameter IA_BATCH_ON_WEEKHOLIDAY is set to Y. | | | | This indicates if the eLoan Batch Interest Accrual and eLoan Batch | | Posting processes are to be run by the eLOAN system until the end of | | the month or until the day before the next working day, based on the | | weekend/holiday setting. | | | | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | The system parameter is set to Y, and Saturday is the last day of the | | month. When either the eLoan Batch Interest Accrual or eLoan Batch | | Posting is run on Friday, the interest is accrued, or the eLoan | | system computations are posted, on Saturday. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, in which the eLOAN system runs the Batch Interest Accrual and | | > eLoan Batch Posting processes until the end of a month, if that | | > day is included in certain weekend and holiday setting. | | | | - N, in which the eLOAN system runs the Batch Interest Accrual and | | > eLoan Batch Posting processes until the day before the next | | > working day, according to the weekend and holiday setting. | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_POST_EXCH_ENTRY_FLAG | +———————————————————————–+ | Post Exchange Entries when transaction currency is different from | | local currency | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, for Yes (Default) | | | | - N, for No | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_POSTING_ZERO_INTEREST | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates whether zero interest entries are to be posted or not. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, in which zero interest entries are posted. | | | | - N, in which zero interest entries are not posted. | | | | [NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | If this system parameter is not defined, zero interest entries are | | posted by the system. | +———————————————————————–+

+———————————————————————–+ | IA_RATEDESC_MAP1, IA_RATEDESC_MAP2, IA_RATEDESC_MAP3, | | IA_RATEDESC_MAP4, IA_RATEDESC_MAP5, IA_RATEDESC_MAP6, | | IA_RATEDESC_MAP7, IA_RATEDESC_MAP8 | +=======================================================================+ | Rate Table Description 1, Rate Table Description 2, Rate Table | | Description 3, Rate Table Description 4, Rate Table Description 5, | | Rate Table Description 6, Rate Table Description 7, Rate Table | | Description 8. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - User-defined | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_RATTBL_BACKVALUE_MODE | +———————————————————————–+ | Run Rate Table Back Valuation Mode | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - A, for Auto (Default) | | | | - M, for Manual | | | | [NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | The M option is reserved for future use. | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_REVERSE_FLAG | +———————————————————————–+ | Reverse Flag for rollback entries | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - N, for No (Default) | | | | - Y | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_SCHEDULE_PERIOD | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates the relevant period for generating schedule | | information. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - 0, in which all the schedule and premium/discount data are | | > generated automatically once the eLoan Accrual Takedown | | > transaction is confirmed. | | | | - 1, in which the schedule and premium/discount data for one year | | > are generated automatically once all the eLoan Accrual Takedown | | > transaction is confirmed. | | | | - 2, in which the schedule and premium/discount data for two years | | > are generated automatically once all the eLoan Accrual Takedown | | > transaction is confirmed. | +———————————————————————–+

+———————————————————————–+ | IA_TODATE_INCLUDE_FLAG | +=======================================================================+ | This controls whether or not the To Date field is to be used when | | inquiring interests. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, to include (Default) | | | | - N, to not include | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_TRX_COMMIT_BY | +———————————————————————–+ | Transaction Commit By | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - 1, if the transaction is to be committed by eLOAN | | | | - 0, if the transaction is to be committed by EE (Default) | +———————————————————————–+

Custom Tag and Embedded Servlet

  • Overview

  • JAVA CLASSES, CUSTOM TAG, AND EMBEDDED SERVLET

  • CUSTOM TAG

  • EMBEDDED SERVLET

  • CUSTOMIZED JAVA CLASS THROUGH SSS

  • STANDARD APIS

  • OTHER METHODS

Overview

In the EE system, particular calculations and validations may be handled, maintained, and performed by project-specific Java classes. This type of Java classes takes over performing specified calculation and validation tasks from the Client Side JS or Server Side JS. Through such Java classes, too, certain calculations may be performed as hidden or background processes.

To call upon these project-specific Java classes at runtime, the system utilizes:

  • a system-level tag or Custom Tag that is used at screen initialization

  • system-level servlet or embedded servlet that may be used to invoke calculations during transaction processing.

The Java classes interact with the system through components that are called Application Programming Interfaces (APIs). These standard APIs are tasked with the actual integration of the Java classes into the operations of the EE system, by facilitating the following:

  • connection to the database

  • management of log control and log information

  • retrieval of values from the database or from an XML file such that these values are displayed in the browser

  • management of batch jobs, message broker tasks, auto process tasks (e.g., Start, Stop)

  • processing of GAPI messages (e.g., sending, receiving)

Java Classes, Custom Tag, and Embedded Servlet

Project-Defined Java Classes

The EE system may use Java classes for any of the following processes:

  • configuration of server side scripts

  • initialization of the transaction JSP by a custom tag

  • transaction processing by embedded servlet which can be invoked by a web side JS (calculation)

Project-specific Java classes may be created to facilitate the execution of specified calculation and validation tasks, relieving the Client Side JS or Server Side JS of this specific load.

A project-specific Java class requires three assisting components to be able to carry out its purpose in the transaction processes. These are:

  • a Custom Tag, which invokes the Java class at screen initialization to facilitate the generation of the relevant mapping of field and field values for automatic display onscreen;

  • a Common Servlet, which invokes the Java class to perform the calculation and validation for these field values; and

  • a Server Side JS rule, which invokes the Java class when the Server Side JS rule is executed.

All these project-defined Java classes should implement the related interface and interact with EE by the standard APIs that EE provides.

The Java classes that are created are stored in the Shared Library of the Application Server of the EE system. They are maintained in this configuration file: EE_Project_Component_Config.xml

Configuration XML

The configuration XML file which maintains the user-defined Java classes is used by the system to load all the project-defined Java classes securely. This file follows this structure:

(Start of Code)

<components>

<component name="vstestE0 ETagClass”>com.cs.project.VstestEETagClass</component>

<component name="vstestEEServletClass”>com.cs.project.VstestEEServletClass</component>

<component name="vstestEESSSClass”>com.cs.project.VstestEESSSClass</component>

</components>

(End of Code)

In this structure:

  • The Name attribute of the component element is the component name; and

  • The value that is assigned to the component name is the actual location of this component as well as the Java class name.

Before the system loads the project-defined Java class from the location, the system facilitates a security check and verifies the file content. The system invokes the component only if the security check conditions are met. Otherwise, the system displays an error message.

XML File Location

This XML file is stored in the EEConfig folder of the ee.input.dir, or in the EE_PARA folder path (e.g., C:\Program Files\IBM\WebSphere\AppServer\profiles\AppSrv01\installedApps\DOC-EENode01Cell\EximBill.ear\EE_PARA).

All project-specific class packages are placed, stored, and loaded by the Application from, in this shared library.

{#section-34 .CS-head1}

Custom Tag

Using Custom Tags

The EE system may utilize a project-specific system level tag to support a project-specific Java class. This Custom Tag is a common tag that is called BTagCommTag and is mainly used at screen initialization. This system tag is tasked to retrieve values from the database or from a file so that these retrieved values may be displayed on a transaction screen.

The Custom Tag is utilized with a system interface that is called ItagComponent through which the project-specific Java class is invoked during screen initialization. The system calls this interface to invoke the getFieldValue method, which sets a map of Field Name-to-Field Value.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

public Map getFieldValues(HttpServletRequest req)throws Exception

When the Custom Tag generates the JavaScript, the values of the mapped fields are displayed automatically. At JavaScript generation, the Custom Tag checks the screen XML of the transaction JSP. If the mapped field name exists in the screen XML, the system sets the value directly to the JSP. Otherwise, the system sets the value to a variable according to the returned map.

The interface is configured as:

(Start of Code)

public Intefrace ITagCompoment {

public Map getFieldValues(HttpServletRequest req)throws Exception

}

(End of Code)

Sample Custom Tag Usage

Calling WgetCustInfo, a project-defined class, from JSP:

[JSP (SYS_GetCustInfo.jsp) codes:]{.underline}

<EXIMTAGS:COMMTAG name="custInfo”/ >

[System-maintained file: ]{.underline}

<tag>
<name>COMMTAG</name>
<tagclass>com.cs.eximweb.usertag.BTAGCommTag</tagclass>
</tag>

[EE_Project_Component_Config.xml, project-maintained: ]{.underline}

<components>
<component name="custInfo” jar="com.jar” md5="aaa.md5”>
com.cs.project.WgetCustInfo
</component>
</components>

The project-defined class WGetCustInfo is invoked as follows when the JSP is forwarded and the Custom Tag is invoked:

public class WGetCustInfo implement ITagComponent{
public Map getFieldValues(HttpServletRequest req )throws Exception{
Map rets = new HashMap();
for(int n=0;n< names.length;n++) {
//get the fieldValue from the DB using the System APIs
}
return rets;
}
}

When the Custom Tag is invoked, the system calls the getFieldValues method of the WGetCustInfo Java class to get the field values. The COMMTAG then generates the following JavaScript and writes the JavaScript to the JSP, by which the related JSP field value is updated:

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

Return map:

{CUST_NAME=vs, CUST_ADDRESS=USA.., SYS_FUNC_NAME=Function test, CUST_AC_NO=[CUST001,CUST002]}

In this sample, the CUST_NAME and CUST_ADDRESS fields exist in the screen XML. The SYS_FUNC_NAME field and CUST_AC_NO field, on the other hand, do not exist in the screen XML. In this case, the JS is generated as:

<script language="JavaScript”>

document.MAINFORM.CUST_NAME.value="vs”; //the field CUST_NAME exists in the JSP.

document.MAINFORM.CUST_ADDRESS.value="USA..";

SYS_FUNC_NAME="Function Test”; //there’s no “SYS_FUNC_NAME” field in the JSP, so that the system assign the value to an auto-created variable.

CUST_AC_NO=[CUST001, CUST002];

</script >

Embedded Servlet

Using Embedded Servlet

For the project-specific Java classes, a common servlet that is called WSCommServlet is provided. To invoke the project-specific system-level servlet, a system JavaScript method is used:

SYS_CallJavaClass (ProjectClass, Type, FieldNames, JsFuncName)

This JavaScript method is composed of the following parameters:

Parameter Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Project Class | | This pertains to the | | | | name of the embedded | | | | servlet of the | | | | project-specific Java | | | | class. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Type | | This pertains to the | | | | type of action that | | | | the servlet is to | | | | perform. If | | | | Validation is | | | | specified as the | | | | type, the system | | | | interface is | | | | configured with the | | | | Validation method. If | | | | getFieldValues is | | | | specified as the | | | | type, the system | | | | interface is | | | | configured with the | | | | getFieldValues | | | | method. | | | | | | | | When the selected | | | | type is | | | | getFieldValues, the | | | | system generates the | | | | corresponding | | | | JavaScript and sets | | | | the value into the | | | | fields of the JSP | | | | file of the | | | | transaction screen. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | FieldNames | | This may be a field | | | | name or a variable. | | | | | | | | The specified | | | | parameter field name | | | | must be passed onto | | | | the servlet. Through | | | | this the system | | | | returns the value | | | | accordingly and | | | | passes the value to | | | | the request. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | JsFuncName | | This pertains to the | | | | callback function | | | | that is to be invoked | | | | after the JavaScript | | | | function is executed. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | SfailJsFuncName | | This pertains to the | | | | callback function | | | | that is to be invoked | | | | if any error is | | | | encountered and the | | | | corresponding error | | | | message is displayed. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

As with the Custom Tag, this system-level servlet also utilizes a system interface by which the project-specific Java class may be called upon at transaction processing. The servlet system interface is called IservComponent. Within this interface, the following methods are provided:

  • public void validation(HttpServletRequest req)throws Exception: This is used to perform the transaction validation

  • public Map getFieldValues(HttpServletRequest req)throws Exception: This is similar to the method that is provided in the Custom Tag interface. This is used to retrieve field values and return the field values into JSP fields. The transaction calculations may also be performed within this method

The interface is configured as:

(Start of Code)

public Intefrace IServComponent {

public void validation (HttpServletRequest req) throws Exception;

public Map getFieldValues(HttpServletRequest req)throws Exception

}

(End of Code)

Sample Project-Specific Servlet Usage

Calling WsGetCustInfo, a project-defined Java class, from JS:

JS Codes:

(Start of Code)

function GetCustInfo(){

SYS_CallJavaClass(“WsGetCustInfo”, “getFieldValue”, “C_MAIN_REF, C_UNIT_CODE”,afterCustInfo);

}

function afterCustInfo(){

alert(“The project-defined Java class has been executed successfully!")

}

(End of Code)

System method:

(Start of Code)

function SYS_CallJavaClass(ProjectClass, Type, FieldNames,callback){

var openUrl = "../servlets/WSCommServlet?_comp= WsGetCustInfo &_type=getFieldValue&C_MAIN_REF=CUST001&C_UNIT_CODE=CSOFFICE";

postDataByAjax(openUrl,null);

var typeofCallBack=typeof callback;

if(typeofCallBack=="function”){

callback();

}else if(typeofCallBack=="string”){

eval(callback)();

}

}

(End of Code)

EE_Project_Component_Config.xml, project maintained:

(Start of Code)

<components>

<component name="WsGetCustInfo” jar="com.jar” md5="aaa.md5”>

com.cs.project.WsGetCustInfo

</component>

</components>

(End of Code)

Sample project-defined class:

(Start of Code)

public class WsGetCustInfo implement IServComponent {

public void validation (HttpServletRequest req) throws Exception{

}

public Map getFieldValues(HttpServletRequest req )throws

Exception{

Map rets = new HashMap();

for(int n=0;n< names.length;n++) {

/get the fieldValue from the DB using the System APIs

}

return rets;

}

}

(End of Code)

In this example, as the _type request parameter is getFieldValue, when the common servlet receives the request from the JS, the system invokes the method getFieldValues request as the input argument for returning the field values. The WSCommServlet then generates the following JavaScript and writes the JavaScript to the JSP, by which the related JSP field value is updated.

(Start of Code)

<script language="JavaScript”>

document.MAINFORM.CUST_NAME.value="vs”; //the field CUST_NAME exists in the JSP.

document.MAINFORM.CUST_ADDRESS.value="USA..";

SYS_FUNC_NAME="Function Test”; //there’s no “SYS_FUNC_NAME” field in the JSP, so that the system assign the value to an auto-created variable.

</script >

(End of Code)

{#section-35 .CS-head1}

Customized Java Class through SSS

Invoking Project-Defined Java Class through SSS

Besides direct usage in the transaction processing of the EE system, project-specific Java classes may also be invoked through a Server Side JS rule at transaction function initialization, processing, or confirmation according to the Server Side JS rule types as follows:

  • Initial SSS, which can be invoked during transaction function initialization on the Server Side, so that it can perform the getFieldValues method to set values to the transaction fields;

  • Transaction SSS, which can be invoked during the transaction processing to perform calculations with the getFieldValues method; and

  • Confirmation SSS, which can be invoked when the transaction function is confirmed on the Server Side. This updates the context and performs the validations.

To invoke project-specific Java classes that are used in a Server Side JavaScript, the system provides this SSS method:

DV.invokeClass(String className)

The Java class is configured in the interface as follows:

public Intefrace ISSSCompoment {

public Map SSSProcess(HttpServletRequest req)throws Exception

}

Sample Usage of a Customized Java Class in SS JS

Calling the (project-defined) WsValidationCustInfo Java class in the Server Side JS at transaction function confirmation:

Transaction Function and Server Side JS Rule Setting

The Server Side Javascript rule that is to utilize the project-defined Java class is configured using the Server Side JS function in the EE Utility. This rule is attached to the relevant transaction function, for use during transaction processing, through the Transaction Function.

EE_Project_Component_Config.xml, project-maintained:

(Start of Code)

<components>

<component name="WsValidationCustInfo” jar="com.jar” md5="aaa.md5”>

com.cs.project.WsValidationCustInfo

</component>

</components>

(End of Code)

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

Project-defined class:

public class WsValidationCustInfo implement ISSSComponent{

public Map SSSProcess(HttpServletRequest req )throws Exception{

String custRef=req.getParameter(“CUST_REF”);

if (!custRefExist(custRef))eximbills.throwException(“202”,new String[]{custRef});

//customer record not found

}

}

In this example, when the transaction is submitted, the Confirmation SSS is invoked. Through this, the project-defined class WsValidationCustInfo is called upon and the SSSProcess method is used. If the customer reference does not exist, the system displays a corresponding error message along with the customer reference number.

Standard APIs

The predefined Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) that are provided in the system and are to be called upon by the customized Java classes are as follows:

querySingleValue(String dataSource, String sql, Object[]parameters): String

This is used to query a particular field value and to return the value as a string. If there is more than one value in the result, the system returns the first value. Parameters:

  • String dataSource: This pertains to the data source.

  • String sql: This pertains to the SQL statement that is used to execute the query.

  • Object[]parameters: This pertains to the parameters that may be passed on to the SQL statement.

This API returns a single String value. A 0 return indicates that no record is found.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

String dataSource="EXIMT";
String sql_custID="select CUST_ID from EXIMTRX.CUST_MASTER where C_MAIN_REF='CS001'";
Object[]parameters = new Object[]{};
String result_custID = Eximbills.querySingleValue(dataSource, sql_custID, parameters);
map.put("APPL_ID", result_custID);

querySingleRec(String dataSource, String sql, Object[]parameters): Map

This is used to query a single record, returning the query result as a map. Parameters:

  • String dataSource: This pertains to the data source.

  • String sql: This pertains to the SQL statement that is used to execute the query.

  • Object[]parameters: This pertains to the parameters that may be passed on to the SQL statement.

This API returns a Map. A return of a 0 map size indicates that no record is found.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

String custID= "CS001";
String sql_custNM="select CUST_NM, CUST_EMAIL_ADD from EXIMTRX.CUST_MASTER WHERE CUST_ID=?";
Object[]paraCustID = new Object[]{custID};
Map custMap=Eximbills.querySingleRec(dataSource, sql_custNM, paraCustID);
String custNM=(String)custMap.get("CUST_NM");
String custEADD=(String)custMap.get("CUST_EMAIL_ADD");
map.put("APPL_NM",custNM);
map.put("APPL_EMAIL_ADD",custEADD);

queryMultiValueforSinglefield(String dataSource, String sql, Object[]parameters): List

This is used to query a particular field value, returning the result as a list. Parameters:

  • String dataSource: This pertains to the data source.

  • String sql: This pertains to the SQL statement that is used to execute the query

  • Object[]parameters: This pertains to the parameters that may be passed on to the SQL statement.

This API returns a list of the field value, where the field has multiple lines. A return of a 0 list size indicates that no record is found.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

String custID= "CS001";
String unitCode="CSOFFICE";
String sql_custAdd="select CUST_ADD from EXIMTRX.CUST_ADDR where CUST_ID=? and C_UNIT_CODE=?";
Object[]paraCustID = new Object[]{custID, unitCode };
List custAdd=Eximbills.queryMultiValueforSinglefield(dataSource, sql_custAdd, paraCustID);
String custAdd0=(String)custAdd.get(0);
String custAdd1=(String)custAdd.get(1);
map.put("APPL_ADD1",custAdd0);
map.put("APPL_ADD2",custAdd1);

QueryMultiValueforMultiFields(String dataSource, String sql, Object[]parameters): List

This is used to query the database to retrieve multiple records of multiple fields, returning a list. Parameters:

  • String dataSource: This pertains to the data source.

  • String sql: This pertains to the SQL statement that is used to execute the query.

  • Object[]parameters: This pertains to the parameters that may be passed on to the SQL statement.

This API returns a hashmap with multiple lines of multiple fields. A return of 0 list size indicates that no record is found.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

String sql_custFA="select FA_INV_REF, FA_INV_CCY, FA_INV_AMT from EXIMTRX.DISC_INV where CUST_ID='CS001’";
List custFA=Eximbills.QueryMultiValueforMultiFields(dataSource, sql_custFA, paraCustID);
Map custFA0=(Map)custFA.get(0);
String invRef0=(String)custFA0.get("FA_INV_REF");
String invCCY0=(String)custFA0.get("FA_INV_CCY");
String invAMT0=custFA0.get("FA_INV_AMT").toString();
Map custFA1=(Map)custFA.get(1);
String invRef1=(String)custFA1.get("FA_INV_REF");
String invCCY1=(String)custFA1.get("FA_INV_CCY");
String invAMT1=custFA1.get("FA_INV_AMT").toString();
map.put("FA_INV_REF1",invRef0);
map.put("FA_INV_CCY1",invCCY0);
map.put("FA_INV_AMT1",invAMT0);
map.put("FA_INV_REF2",invRef1);
map.put("FA_INV_CCY2",invCCY1);
map.put("FA_INV_AMT2",invAMT1);

getFieldValue(String fieldName): String

This is used to retrieve field values from the JSP file or the context. Parameters:

  • String fieldName: This pertains to the name of the field which value is to be retrieved.

This API returns the value of the field. The input and output of this field is from or to the JSP file and/or the context of the system.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

String applID=Eximbills.getFieldValue("APPL_ID");

updateFieldValue(String fieldName, String filedValue): boolean

This is used to update particular field values of the context. Parameters:

  • String fieldName: This pertains to the name of the field that is to be updated. This field may be from the JSP file or from the context of the system.

  • String fieldValue: This pertains to the updated value of the field.

This API returns the update status, which indicates whether or not the field value updating is successful.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

String AVAIL_LMT=creditLMT-advancedAMT+settleAMT;
Eximbills.updateFieldValue (“AVAIL_LMT”, AVAIL_LMT);

updateRec(String dataSource, String sql, Object[]parameters): boolean

This is used to update a record in the database. Parameters:

  • String dataSource: This pertains to the data source.

  • String sql: This pertains to the SQL statement that is used to update the record in the database.

  • Object[]parameters: This pertains to the parameters that may be passed on to the SQL statement.

This API returns the update status, which indicates whether or not the record updating is successful.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

String oldRef="AA";
String newRef="serv001";
String newID="new001";
Object[] para= new Object[]{newRef,newID,oldRef};
String sql_update="update eximtrx.CUST_MASTER set C_MAIN_REF=? ,CUST_ID=? where C_MAIN_REF=?";
Eximbills.updateRec("EXIMT", sql_update, para);

deleteRec(String dataSource, String sql, Object[]parameters): boolean

This is used to delete a record from the database. Parameters:

  • String dataSource: This pertains to the data source.

  • String sql: This pertains to the SQL statement that is used to update the database.

  • Object[]parameters: This pertains to the parameters that may be passed on to the SQL statement.

This API returns the delete process status, which indicates whether or not the process is successful.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

String ref="TEST111";
Object[] delPara=new Object[]{ref};
String sql_delete="delete from eximtrx.CUST_MASTER where c_main_ref=?";
Eximbills.deleteRec("EXIMT", sql_delete, delPara);
Eximbills.writeSYSLog("delete finish...");

redirectPage(String page, HttpServletRequest req, HttpServletResponse res): boolean

This is used for redirecting a page. Parameters:

  • String page: This pertains to the data source.

  • HttpServletRequest req: This pertains to the page request.

  • HttpServletResponse res: This pertains to the page request response.

This API returns True or, otherwise, displays an error message.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

Eximbills.redirectPage("../screen/SYS_GETPYMT.jsp”, req, res);

writeSTPLog(String log): void
writeSTPLog(Exception log): void

These are used for writing logs and error information into the STP log. Parameters:

  • String log: This pertains to the context that is to be logged.

  • Exception log: This pertains to the exception that is to be logged.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

Eximbills.writeSTPLog("end to call servlet1 in STP log...");
String applID=Eximbills.getFieldValue("APPL_ID");
try{
if("Test".equalsIgnoreCase(applID)){
throw new Exception("Test user is not available");
}

}catch(Exception e){
Eximbills.writeSTPLog(e);
Eximbills.addErrorInfo("1708", new String[]{});

}

writeDAOLog(String log): void
writeDAOLog(Exception log): void

These are used for writing logs or error information into the DAO log. Parameters:

  • String log: This pertains to the context that is to be logged.

  • Exception log: This pertains to the exception that is to be logged.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

Eximbills.writeDAOLog("end to call servlet1 in STP log...");
String applID=Eximbills.getFieldValue("APPL_ID");
try{
if("Test".equalsIgnoreCase(applID)){
throw new Exception("Test user is not available");
}

}catch(Exception e){
Eximbills.writeDAOLog(e);
Eximbills.addErrorInfo("1708", new String[]{});
}

writeSYSLog(String log): void
writeSYSLog(Exception log): void

These are used for writing logs or error information into the EE log. Parameters:

  • String log: This pertains to the context that is to be logged.

  • Exception log: This pertains to the exception that is to be logged.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

Eximbills.writeSYSLog("end to call servlet1 in STP log...");
String applID=Eximbills.getFieldValue("APPL_ID");
try{
if("Test".equalsIgnoreCase(applID)){
throw new Exception("Test user is not available");

}

}catch(Exception e){
Eximbills.writeSYSLog(e);
Eximbills.addErrorInfo("1708", new String[]{});

}

getNodeValue(String name): String

This is used for retrieving the node value. Parameter:

  • String name: This pertains to the node name for which the value is retrieved.

This API returns the node value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

String code = Eximbills.getNodeValue(“STP_CODE”);

setNodeValue(String name, String value): void

This is used for setting the value to a node. Parameters:

  • String name: This pertains to the name of the node for which the value is to be changed.

  • String value: This pertains to the node value that is to be set.

This API does not return any value.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

Eximbills.setNodeValue(“C_MAIN_REF”,“20070909-10-1001”)

addErrorInfo(String code, String []paras): void

This is used for calling up an error code for the error message that the system is to display. Parameters:

  • String code: This pertains to the error code of the error message.

  • String paras: This pertains to the parameter that is used by the error code.

This API does not return any value.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

String para1="test1”;
Eximbills.addErrorInfo("1707", new String[]{para1});

throwException(String code, String []paras): void

This is used for calling up an error code for the error message that the system is to display. Parameters:

  • String code: This pertains to the error code of the error message.

  • String paras: This pertains to the parameter that is used by the error code.

This API does not return any value. The system displays an error message if the error code is ERROR.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

String para1="test1”;
Eximbills.throwException ("1707", new String[]{para1});

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: While both the addErrorInfo() method and the throwException() method are used for calling an error code and displaying an error message, they are different in this manner:

When the addErrorInfo() method is called upon, the system continues the transaction processing and displays the error message when the current process is completed. When this method is used, if a process calls up an ERROR-level error code, the system displays the corresponding error message and marks the current transaction accordingly. If the error does not invoke the ERROR-level error code, the system loads the transaction page and only displays the error code once the page is loaded.

When the throwException() method is used, the system displays the error message immediately and ends all processes if the error code level is ERROR.

Other Methods

Authorization Rule Setting

The following are the commonly used server side JS methods when setting authorization rules.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: These methods are used through the Assign Authorization Rule function.

{width="4.78125in” height="1.96875in”}

Once assigned, the system automatically inserts the value in the related SQL0.

{width="4.78125in” height="1.4583333333333333in”}

DV.getFieldValue()

This is used to retrieve the value of a field.

DV.getUserType()

This is used to retrieve the type of user that is logged on to the system. This may return any of the following values:

  • T – for TF Branch

  • C – for Process Center

  • D – for Super Officer

  • N – for Non-TF Branch

DV.appendAuthRule()

This is used to attach the authorization rule to a selected transaction function.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

Where AuthTest pertains to the authorization rule –

DV.appendAuthRule(‘AuthTest’);

DV.setCurrencyForAuthLevel()

This is used for setting the authorization leverl currency.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.setCurrencyForAuthLevel(“USD”));


DV.writelog()

This method is used to write log information for user notification or debugging in the EE log file. Parameter:

  • String: This is the text to be written into the log file.

[
EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

DV.writeLog("Test Authorization");
