{#section-36 .CS-ChapterTitle}

Glossary

Glossary

a

Access Log The log type that records the user logon and logout information, and all the actions performed by the user upon accessing the system (e.g., running a Standing, Security or Transaction function; releasing a transaction).

Accounting Rule The group of settings that define the properties of a Voucher output. An Accounting Rule is configured through the Accounting Rules function of the EE Utility. It is later attached to a specific transaction function that is used to generate accounting vouchers.

Adapter A device or component for converting the attributes of one system to those of another system. This is for enabling communication between two initially incompatible systems.

***Administrator *** The type of EE Utility user with rights to create Administrator and Operator users and define transaction function parameters such as GAPI rules, SWIFT settings, and accounting rules.

Algorithm A set of steps or rules for solving a problem.

Alias A mechanism that allows more than one person to be treated as the same database user with the same privileges. This is often used to enable multiple users to assume the role of Database Owner.

***Amount/Rate Format function *** The EE Utility function that is used to define the relationship of Amount fields and Rate fields with Currency fields.

AP Server System Parameters System parameters that are used by or run in the EE application server.

***API (Application Programming Interface) *** Components through which Java classes are able to interact with the system.

***Application Server *** Server where the EE system is actually deployed and where EE processes the business logic and parameter operations.

Archiving The process of transferring transaction records from the Transaction Database into the Backup Database.

***Array *** A series of elements or objects of the same type and size.

Attribute Pertains to a Business component. Its specific settings regulate the behavior of functions in processing transactions. Unlike the main program (Control component), which provides the general purpose of the function, attributes define the actual actions to be performed by the function. A function may use several attributes; this group of one or more attributes is called an Attribute rule.

Authorization Level The level of authorization or ‘user class’ to be assigned to a user that determines the range of transaction amount that the user is allowed to process.

Authorization Matrix An authorization process that follows specific rules and requires multiple users for a given number of authorization levels. A transaction can only be considered ‘completely authorized’ when all the required users have authorized it.

Authorization Rule This pertains to the parameters defined for a set of authorization levels.

B

Bank-Country Group The combination or grouping of bank groups and countries that is created to facilitate the sharing of parameters and authorization rules among bank groups that utilize similar rules and parameters for business transaction processing and records management.

Batch Manage (r) Function The EE Utility function that is used to configure batch tasks. A batch task processes the subtasks, or batch functions, within the system. The two types of batch tasks are System Batch and User Batch.

***Batch Tasks *** Also referred to as task managers. These are tasks that are automatically run according to a defined schedule and/or criteria. Configured through the System Batch component of the Batch Manager function, there are two predefined task managers included in the system by default: AutoProcessManage and Message Broker.

BIC Also referred to as Bank Identification Code. This pertains to the SWIFT address of the business unit.

BIRT Stands for Business Intelligence and Reporting Tools. It is an Eclipse-based open source reporting system for web applications that provide a variety of reporting design options and report patterns in different file output formats. This application is embedded in EE as a report engine type to be used for the generation of reports and documents.

Book of Account A record of commercial accounts.

Boolean A data type that has two values – typically true or false – that represents the truth values of logic and Boolean algebra.

Branch Administrator EE browser-side users with rights to maintain Branch Operator user profiles and function assignments.

Branch Operator EE browser-side users with transaction processing rights to certain local functions of a branch. If created by a Branch Administrator, this operator inherits the Branch of the former. If created by a Process Center Administrator, the latter can assign this user to any one of the branches that belong to that process center.

Brother DO A data object that has the same parent DO as the current DO.

***BSF *** Server-side scripts that are run in development and testing phases.

***Business Components *** Packaged Java classes that are deployed into the Shared Library folder of the EE system that are called upon at transaction processing. A Business component functions as an attribute in EE. See Attribute also.

Business Unit A processing center or a branch unit of a bank-country group.

Business Unit Config function The EE Utility function that is used to define several inter-related information pertaining to a business unit. This function is only available to the Super Administrator user.

C

Cache A short-term storage used for temporarily storing data, or copies of data, to allow for quick data retrieval and faster computer operations.

***Calculation Rules *** The rule pertaining to the behavior of a field, including computations, value assignments, and validations. Calculation rules may also be referred to as methods that are executed on the client (browser) and server side during transaction processing.

Catalog A set of criteria that is used for filtering the records to be retrieved into, and subsequently processed in, a transaction function.

Character Set A defined set of characters, each designated by a number that serves as its identification to computer hardware and software.

Charge API These are special APIs, configured in the Calculation function, that are used for setting, defining, and manipulating charge data.

Charge Initialization API These are APIs that are used to define the initial charge data settings.

Charges Maintenance functions The function group in the Standing Data module used for maintaining Charge standing data such as commission codes and GL accounts.

Child DO Also referred to as child data object, child DO template, child template, or sub-DO. A child DO is a DO template under another DO template (i.e., parent DO template).

Clause Maintenance function The function group in the Standing Data module used for defining and maintaining clauses.

Clause Templates Templates that store the clauses that may be retrieved at runtime.

***Clauses *** Descriptions, details, narratives, or message contents that are commonly or frequently used in the transactions.

Clean Payment Methods of uncomplicated payment.

Component Log The log type that records the details of user-defined components and the EE core components such as GAPI, SWIFT, Voucher, Document, and Transfer To settings.

Component Manage function The EE Utility function that is used to add and maintain components in the system.

Components Objects that determine the business rules to be used in transactions.

Control Components Components that are used as main programs for functions. These regulate the steps within a function.

D

DAOLOG The log that records all the SQL statements when the EE browser is accessed and transaction functions are run.

Dashboard Widget A widget composed of Quick Launch, bar graph (Transactions waiting for release), pie graphs (Incoming SWIFT Message Types and STP Rates), Calendar, Transaction List, and Filter sub-widgets, which are used for easily accessing and processing transactions, and performing quick, transaction-related operations.

Data Object Also referred to as data object entity or DO. A logical object that has its own attributes and calculation rules, a data object pertains to a set of records for a specific type of information required in a transaction (e.g. payment, advices).

Data Object Template Also referred to as DO templates. It is a group of fields and/or other data object templates. This is the basis on which a data object is created.

***Data Source *** A source of digitized data (e.g., database, connection to a database).

Database An application used for the management, storage, and retrieval of data.

***DataSource Manage(r) function *** The EE Utility function used to define the data source information, schema settings, and relationships among the bank-country groups, data sources, and schemas.

***DB Dictionary *** The EE Utility function used primarily for viewing, creating, updating, and maintaining transaction table structures and data types.

***Debugging *** The process of tracing and handling a bug or error in a computer program.

Document Also referred to as form. It is one of the types of output that can be generated in HTML, PDF, WORD, or EXCEL format by a transaction function.

Domain A network of bank-country groups that allows business units from different bank-country groups to share specific transaction parameters.

DomData The data property from which, while confirming the transaction, all the transaction fields' values are stored.

Dreamweaver Adobe Systems’ web development tool for designing, developing, and maintaining standard-based websites and applications.

E

***EE Baseline *** The EE data and processing model for the bank’s trade finance and supply chain services. It consists of modules that can be executed readily to produce the required output or action.

Edit BU Function The function in the Security Manager that is used for assigning function groups to a specific business unit.

Edit User Function The function in the Security Manager that is used for assigning functions to an EE user.

EE Log Also called the EE application log. This records the system exceptions (Java EE server and EE exceptions) and user-definable debugging information in the Server Side Scripts and STP.

EE SLA The Service Level Agreement (SLA) functionality of EE system, which pertains to a group of settings that control the flow of transaction steps and processes. It is covered in SLA functions from the Standing Data and System Maintenance modules.

***EE Snippets *** See Snippets.

EE Utility Short for Eximbills Enterprise Utility Workbench. This is the main tool for building parameters in EE

EJB Stands for Enterprise Java Beans. It is a server-side component architecture used primarily for enabling the development of portable applications based on Java technology.

Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) The structured transmission of electronic documents or business data between organizations through electronic means.

eLOAN The standalone EE module that covers all interest-related transactions from the legacy, trade finance, factoring, and forfeiting types of systems. It calculates the interest on interest-bearing transactions; posts relevant interest entries to specified interest receivable or interest income accounts; and supports accrual and amortization types of interest processing.

End of Day An EE browser-side function that is run at the end of each business date to instruct the system that the business day has closed. No transaction may be processed until after the next instance that the Start of Day function is run.

Error Log See EE Log.

Event A grouping of the activities that occur in the life cycle of a specific type of transaction.

***Event Driven function *** The EE Utility function that is used to define the message-driven Java bean file and the bean’s event-handler for the GAPI function, and for configuring the necessary setup of the message-driven Java bean, especially for the queue of asynchronous non-conditional and asynchronous conditional receiving GAPI.

Exception Atypical or exceptional events that necessitate special processing. Handling exceptions usually entails changes in the normal flow of program execution.

Eximbills Enterprise (EE) An integrated system that automates and audits the complete cycle of Trade Finance, Open Account, and Payments transactions, in real time and in accordance with SWIFT, UCP, and ISO20022 standards.

Eximbills Enterprise Utility Workbench See EE Utility*.*

Eximbills Services Platform (ESP) A shared service system that is mainly used for SWIFT MT Message Management and SWIFT C2B (Corporate to Bank) service. It facilitates the transmission of SWIFT messages from bank to bank, from corporate customers to banks (C2B) or from banks to customers (B2C). Messages between EE and ESP may either be exchanged directly, or through an independent MQ depending on configurations made.

***Expression *** A combination of values, constants, variables, operators, and/or functions that is interpreted to produce a value or result according to the rules of the associated programming language.

F

***Factoring *** The type of financial transaction in which a business sells its accounts receivables (invoices) to a third party (factor) at a discount.

***Field *** The smallest unit that can hold data.

Field Conversion The EE Utility function that is used for defining the values of Interpreter fields (i.e., fields with a set of possible values).

Float A float is a variable that has a decimal or a fractional value. Unlike an integer, which is used for whole numbers, a float usually expresses numbers that are less than one.

Form See Document.

Form Rule The group of settings that define the properties of a Form output. A Form rule is configured through the Form Set function of the EE Utility. It is later attached to a specific transaction function that is used to generate form or document output.

Function A unified set of elements, operations, and configurations that produce a target setting, process, and/or output. This typically refers to an EE Utility function or a transaction function.

Function Group A grouping of EE browser-side functions that is organized based on the common usage and purpose of the functions. A function group is set up in the EE Utility.

G

***GAPI *** Stands for Generic Application Programming Interface. This is the mechanism that facilitates the integration between EE and other systems for data exchange, data transfer, and data inquiry.

GAPI Components Components that are used for interfacing with other bank systems.

***GAPI Rule *** Also referred to as GAPI mapping rule. This is the setting that enables the mapping of data between EE and an outward system. A GAPI mapping rule is later attached to a transaction function that is used for sending data to, or receiving data from, another system.

GAPI Worksheet A worksheet in GAPI that is used to view the XML content of a GAPI file.

Get CUBK Rule The group of settings that allow values to be automatically populated onto fields in the transaction JSP screen or table.

Get DATA The EE Utility function used for defining the settings that allow the passing of data to records in a data object.

Global Administrator EE browser-side users with security rights to maintain Global Operator user profiles; assign business units to Global Operators; and assign global function groups to Global Operators. This type of user, which is created by a Super Security Officer, has access to all bank-country groups in the system.

Global Operator EE browser-side users with transaction processing rights to certain global functions. This type of user, which is created by a Global Administrator, has access to all assigned process centers and branches.

H

***Handwriting Editor *** The EE Utility function that is used to manually define parameters for temporary use and set the content of the XML files of these parameters.

Holiday Maintenance The function group in the Standing Data module used for defining the holidays that are associated to a bank-country group. These defined settings are applied in the date requirements during transaction processing.

***HTTP *** Stands for HyperText Transfer Protocol. It is the primary protocol used by the World Wide Web.

***HTTPS *** Stands for Hyper Text Transfer Protocol with Secure Sockets Layer. It is a combination of HTTP and SSL/TLS protocol. The SSL/TLS protocol provides the encrypted communication and secure identification of a network web server.

I

***WebSphere Application Server *** The application server service by IBM WebSphere that facilitates the operation and maintenance of the application processes of systems such as EE.

Incoming SWIFT SWIFT messages that are sent by an outward system to EE.

***Interpreter Fields *** Fields that allow the user to select an option – the field value – from a dropdown list.

***Invoice *** A list of goods sent or services provided, stating the sum due for these; a bill.

***IP Address *** Stands for Internet Protocol address. This is the numerical identification of a device (e.g., computer, printer) belonging to a computer network that uses the Internet Protocol for communication.

J

***Java Class *** A set of Java methods and variables of structured programming used to create objects.

JavaScript A scripting language that can interact with HTML source codes and has dynamic content.

***JBoss Enterprise Application *** The application server service by Jboss (now a division of Red Hat) that facilitates the operation and maintenance of the application processes of systems such as EE.

***JNDI *** Stands for Java Naming and Directory Interface. This enables Java platform-based applications, such as user-created portable applications, to access multiple naming and directory services.

***JSP *** Stands for Java Server Pages. This technology enables the creation of dynamic web content and development of web-based applications that are server- and platform- independent. Transaction screens, which are the actual web pages displayed when running a function in the EE browser, are saved as JSP files.

K

Keystore File A key database file that contains public keys that are stored as signer certificates and private keys that are stored in personal certificates.

KP function A function that retains a pending record in pending (P) status after modifications are performed.

L

LDAP Stands for Lightweight Directory Access Protocol. It is an industry standard protocol used for accessing and managing common information (or directories) over a network.

LMTS Also referred to as Limit Management Module. This is an EE subsystem used for managing and controlling the credit risks and credit limits set on bank customers and correspondent banks.

Localhost Pertains to the currently used computer (‘this computer’). If the information required is the name of the machine that is presently being used, localhost may be used instead of the actual name of the computer.

M

Macromedia Dreamweaver See Dreamweaver.

***Mail Rule *** The group of e-mail settings that allow a document output to be sent out as an e-mail attachment. A Mail rule is associated with a transaction function that generates the document output.

Mail Template Template containing the body and message of the mail.

***Master Table *** The base table that stores a unique record and contains the updated status for each record. A module can only have one master table.

Message Broker One of the two pre-defined task managers that initializes – on a defined schedule following defined conditions – batch tasks for receiving messages from message queues, defined file paths and folders, or FTP servers.

***Message Broker function *** The EE browser-side function that monitors and retrieves messages from message queues, defined file paths and folders, or from FTP servers.

Message Driven Bean (MDB) The enterprise bean that allows Java EE applications to process messages asynchronously. This is used in EE for receiving the notification in the event that the GAPI sending or receiving process is unsuccessful.

Meta Data Parameter data that are set in the EE Utility.

Module A group of functions that perform interrelated processes and operate under a general principle or objective (e.g., a system module, which is essential to system processes; a business or transaction module, which pertains to a bank service or product).

MT700 This is a SWIFT message that includes the terms and conditions of a documentary credit issued by the bank.

MT701 This SWIFT message is an extension of the MT700 message and contains any additionals information on the terms of the issued documentary credit. See also MT700.

Multi-Entity Environment An environment that involves a bank group consisting of several business units, which may be located in different countries. These business units use parameters that are shared by a domain. This structure allows the maximum reuse of business components as well as sharing of system and transaction parameters among business units, and enables these entities to implement business processes specific to a particular bank group.

***Multi-Language Functionality *** The EE functionality that allows end-users to transact in their preferred language. The elements and messages in the transaction screens are translated into their preferred language.

O

One-to-Many Data Model A model in which the system relates an entity to several or many occurrences in another entity.

***Operator *** The type of EE Utility user with parameter and transaction module configuration rights.

Outgoing SWIFT SWIFT messages that are generated from a transaction function and are sent by the EE system to a bank or a business unit through the SWIFT network.

Output Device Function The EE Utility function that is used to define parameters and rules that instructs the system on how the transaction output are to be handled once they are generated for the transaction, using the devices that are utilized by the EE system.

P

***Parameter *** Any user-controlled configuration that defines a factor or logic within a set of interrelated operations; performs a specific action in a group of processes; or produces a categorical result or setting.

Parameter Drive The location of the EE parameter files, one of the two main folders of an EE environment. Its path is defined in the GEN_XML_ROOTPATH system parameter.

***Parent Data Object Template *** Also referred to as parent DO template, parent template, or parent DO. A parent data object template is the main template used in creating a Data Object Entity.

Payment APIs These are APIs that are to set, define and manipulate the data in the Payment component.

Performance Log The log type that records the invocation and return time within EE, whenever the WEB or AP controllers are accessed.

***Primary Key *** Constraints that make a transaction record unique among records across tables.

Process Center Administrator EE browser-side users with security rights to maintain Process Center Operators Branch Administrator, and Branch Operator user profiles; and assign the function groups of these users. This type of user, which is created by a Super Security Officer, has access to only one process center and its assigned branches.

Process Center Operator EE browser-side users with transaction processing rights to certain local functions. This type of user is restricted only to the branches of the process center to which the Process Administrator that created him belongs.

***Processing Center *** Also referred to as parent unit. This type of business unit pertains to business units that function as main processing units or centers. This unit type possesses the highest level of authorization rights among all business units.

R

***Reference Number *** The unique sequential number that identifies a specific record. It pertains to the transaction or main reference number of a transaction.

Release Business Unit function The function in the Security Manager that is used for releasing or approving the assigned function groups to a business unit. This approval is required in order for the changes to take effect.

Release Process The process of reviewing the details of a pending transaction and approving it. This process is performed through a Release function, which changes a transaction’s status from pending (P) to master (M).

Report Template The report templates configured in BIRT. These are later associated with EE report templates, which are configured through the Report Template function of the EE Utility.

***RMA *** Stands for Relationship Management Application. Incorporated in the RMI Web Service, this functionality enables EE to facilitate the verification of the SWIFT message types that may be generated and sent from the system to specific banks during transaction processing.

RMI Web Service The combination of the SWIFTProcess, RMA, and BICPlusIBAN functionalities that are incorporated EE thru the RMIWebservice.war file.

S

+———————————–+———————————–+ | Say Total function | The EE Utility function that is | | | used for associating numbers to | | | their text format and default | | | currencies. | +===================================+===================================+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***Schema *** | The structure and layout of | | | objects within the database. In | | | Oracle, a schema is associated | | | with a specific database user and | | | is comprised of database objects | | | such as tables and views. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***Screen *** | A function’s transaction screen. | | | This is the actual webpage that | | | is displayed when running a | | | function in the EE browser. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***Screen Rules *** | The group of settings that point | | | to the actual JSP file (s) to be | | | used by a transaction function. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Security Log | A type of log that records the | | | security operations performed by | | | the security manager. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Security Manager (SECU) | This is the EE module used for | | | the administration and | | | maintenance of security data such | | | as profiles, user functions, | | | business units, and business unit | | | functions. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Security Module | See Security Manager (SECU). | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Security Parameters | Global system parameters which | | | settings are applied throughout | | | the EE system. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Security Parameters | The EE Utility function for | | Function | defining security parameters. | | | This function can only be | | | accessed by a Super Administrator | | | user. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Server Function | The EE Utility function used for | | | defining the location of the | | | application servers used in EE. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Server Side JS Function | The EE Utility function that is | | | used for creating server side | | | JavaScript rules to be invoked by | | | a transaction function during | | | transaction initialization, | | | processing, or confirmation. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Service Level Agreement | A service level agreement, or | | | SLA, is generally a section of a | | | standard service contract where a | | | service details are formally | | | defined. The fundamentals of the | | | service (e.g., scope, quality, | | | priorities) are agreed between | | | the service provider and the | | | service user. | | | | | | The SLA functionality of EE | | | pertains to a group of settings | | | that control the flow of | | | transaction steps and processes. | | | See EE SLA. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Signed Documents Maintenance | This function is used to view or | | function | confirm signed or unsigned | | | documents. Once signed documents | | | are processed through this | | | function, the generated documents | | | contain the appended barcode. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Snippets | A tool in the Dreamweaver | | | application that allows the user | | | to save and reuse often used web | | | elements such as fields, field | | | properties, and codes. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | SQL | Stands for Structured Query | | | Language. This is a standard | | | interactive and programming | | | language for retrieving and | | | updating data in the database. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | SQL Log | The log type that records all SQL | | | statements and database access | | | exceptions. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Standing Data Module (STAN) | Also simply referred to as | | | Standing Module. This is the EE | | | module for maintaining the | | | different types of standing data | | | used by the system. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Start of Day | The EE browser-side function that | | | is run at the beginning of each | | | business day to instruct the | | | system to set the business date, | | | to grant users access to the | | | functions within the EE system, | | | and to initialize the daily | | | files. No operation may be run | | | until this function is executed | | | at the start of the business day. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***STP *** | Stands for Straight-Through | | | Processing. It is the automated | | | processing and routing of | | | transactions to reduce manual | | | intervention to an absolute | | | minimum. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | STP Log | The type of log that records all | | | STP log and error information. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Subtask | Also referred to as sub-batch | | | tasks. These are the actual tasks | | | performed when the related task | | | manager is run; thus, a subtask | | | may only be defined as a part of | | | the task manager. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***Super Administrator *** | The type of EE Utility user with | | | rights to administrative tasks | | | such as configuring business | | | units; defining data sources; and | | | creating Super Administrator and | | | Administrator user profiles. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***Super Security Officer *** | The highest type of EE user with | | | access to the Security Manager. | | | This user has security rights to | | | maintaining Super Security | | | Officer, Global Administrator, | | | and Process Center Administrator | | | user profiles; assigning security | | | functions to Global Administrator | | | and Processing Center | | | Administrator users; and | | | assigning transaction function | | | groups to processing center | | | units. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Supervisor Release Function | An EE browser-side function for | | | processing the release of | | | transaction records that require | | | a one-step release. Records of | | | this type may not be used in | | | other transaction operations | | | until after this release process. | | | See also Release Process. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Supply Chain Financing | The EE Baseline solution that | | (SCF) | provides these accounts | | | receivable services: Export | | | Factoring, Import Factoring, | | | Domestic Factoring, Reverse | | | Factoring, Invoice Discounting, | | | and Bank Payment Obligation. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***SWIFT *** | Stands for Society for Worldwide | | | Interbank Financial | | | Telecommunication. It is a | | | cooperative that provides a | | | platform and a centralized | | | database that allow financial | | | institutions to exchange messages | | | securely. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | SWIFT Java Class | Project-based Java class that is | | | used to reformat the outgoing | | | SWIFT message content according | | | to the project’s requirement. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | SWIFT Message | Messages exchanged between banks | | | through the SWIFT network. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***SWIFT Message Rule *** | The rule pertaining to the | | | setting that associates a module | | | with a specific SWIFT template. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***SWIFT Tags *** | Tags containing field values that | | | correspond to specific | | | information in a SWIFT message. | | | These tags make up a SWIFT | | | template. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***SWIFT Templates *** | A set of Tags that correspond to | | | a SWIFT message type and are to | | | contain the values of EE | | | transaction fields. These field | | | values are reflected in the | | | generated SWIFT document at | | | runtime. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***Syndication *** | The venture whereby a bank may | | | sell a portion or all of a risk | | | to one or more parties to reduce | | | exposure. This is typically used | | | by larger banks in loan | | | transactions where a main bank | | | undertakes the large percentage | | | of a loan and syndicates the | | | smaller portions to participating | | | banks. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | System Batch | The type of batch tasks that | | | pertain to the batch manager | | | component. A system batch task | | | runs system task managers and | | | their subtasks. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | System Date | The date of the server in which | | | the EE application is installed. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | System Methods | Predefined EE methods that are | | | available for use in any level of | | | calculation. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***System Parameter *** | The references or values that are | | | defined to control the behavior | | | of EE during transaction | | | processing on the browser and in | | | the EE Utility. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | System Parameter function | The EE Utility function used for | | | defining the EE system | | | parameters. | +———————————–+———————————–+

T

***Telex *** A network of teleprinters that are used for sending text-based messages.

Transfer To Rule The rule, or group of settings, used for updating data within the same module table or across different module tables as a result of changes made to a record during transaction processing. Data from the records of one module can be used to update a record for the same module or another module.

***TSU *** Stands for SWIFTNet Trade Services Utility. It is a centralized matching and workflow engine that compares commercial data submitted by the banks and reports the results to the concerned parties. A TSU transaction makes use of SWIFT XML messages (or MX messages) that are compared for data consistency.

U

User Authority Function The EE Utility function that is used for identifying the transaction modules that require the user to have a specific authorization level (user class). A user class rule is assigned to a transaction field within a transaction module.

User Batch One of the two types of batch tasks that pertains to the batch manager component that runs user-defined jobs or batch tasks.

User Class Function The EE Utility function that is used for setting the default number of authorization levels, as well as the corresponding amounts, that can be defined for the business units of a bank-country group.

Utility Workbench System Parameters System parameters that are used by or run in the EE Utility.

UUID Stands for Universal Unique Identifier. It is used to uniquely identify an object or entity on the internet.

W

***Web Server *** The server that receives data from the client (i.e., JSP and JS information), converts it to XML format, passes it to the application server for processing, and passes the processed info from the application server to the client.

Web Server System Parameters System parameters that are used by or run in the EE web server.

Weblogic A Java 2 Platform Enterprise Edition (Java EE) application server that provides a complete set of services for standardized and modular components and serves as a platform for developing and deploying multi-tier enterprise applications. By creating connection pools and data sources to set up the interface between the WebLogic console and Eximbills Enterprise, WebLogic is able to completely administer the EE application.

Widget A small application that can be installed and run within a web page by an end-user. See Dashboard Widget.

X

XML Stands for Extensible Markup Language. This is the format used by EE for the communication between the client (browser) and the server.

***XML Generator function *** The EE Utility function that is used to generate the corresponding XML files for a specific parameter setting.

***XPath *** The language used by BIRT to locate and subsequently process items in an XML document. This language uses an addressing syntax that is based on a path in a document's logical structure or hierarchy.
